Electrify your career and help build a brighter tomorrow.

Every generation has a challenge that defines them. At OPG, we are calling on all innovators, disruptors, thought leaders and change-makers. Join us to electrify life in one generation and build a sustainable future powered by our electricity, our ideas, and our people. Join OPG and make history.

Whether you work in the skilled trades or are a business professional, a career at OPG is an opportunity to electrify your life on - and off - the job.

JOB OVERVIEW

Ontario Power Generation (OPG) is looking for a dynamic, strategic and results-driven professional to join our team in the role of Senior Business Data Analyst.
Reporting to the Senior Manager Finance Digital Initiatives, the Senior Business Data Analyst is passionate about data, envisions its strategic impact on decision-making, operational efficiency, and overall outcomes. Proficient in communication, the successful candidate seamlessly adapts to diverse stakeholder needs across all organizational levels. Operating with a flexible and collaborative working style, the role shares expertise within teams and independently addresses complex problems. Detail-oriented and skilled in eliciting requirements, the Senior Business Data Analyst adeptly extracts, manipulates, and leverages data from various sources. Creating impactful reports, datasets, visualizations, and analytics using diverse datasets, showcasing a keen curiosity, analytical mindset, and a passion for solving complex problems. The role will receive direct daily leadership from Finance and technical oversight and guidance from the centralized IT function.

This is an exciting opportunity to work in an environment where you will contribute to OPGs public outreach, engagement and education efforts as part of the companys commitment to growing its social license.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Identify, analyze and document requirements and use-cases related to data, visualization/reporting and analytics by engaging with staff at all levels of the business using strong business and technical acumen to assess business problems and translate them to data/analytics problems.
Contribute to establishing OPG best practices for solution delivery cycle (elicitation, documentation, development, testing, launch, training, maintenance)
Oversee a solution roadmap & prioritization framework for Finance i.e. backlog mgmt.)
Lead solution acceptance, roll out and stakeholder education to effectively use new solutions.
Use of tools to develop, test, extract and transform data to meet use case requirements.
Collaborate with IT-led technical team to ensure solution requirements are met.
Create unique/ ad hoc retrospective and prospective analysis to support decision making.
Create executive-level presentations to synthesize findings and/or provide recommendations.
Provide input to project plans, status updates, and estimates.
Identify, document and mitigate or escalate project risks.
Continuous learning in advanced methods and best practices.
Sharing expertise, mentoring and motivating other team members.

EDUCATION

4-year university degree plus 1 year of concentrated study in Business

QUALIFICATIONS

Ability to work effectively and efficiently in a flexible hybrid office environment
A minimum of 8 years of relevant experience to manage large meetings with stakeholders and senior executives, to challenge and ask difficult questions, work independently, face complex multi-system challenges, understand macro strategy and to apply at micro-level use cases. Duties may also include aspects of project management to see through aspects of a business problem that requires coordination/sequencing of input and work from others.
Expertise in advanced requirements elicitation methods, such as: Document Analysis; Focus Groups; Interface Analysis; Usage / Work-flow Observation; Value Stream Mapping; Data Profiling and Data Architecture Analysis.
Have led or been involved in data or technology related projects of various sizes and scopes ranging from ADHOC analysis to large scale solution implementations.
Expertise in advanced documentation techniques, such as: Unified Modeling Language (UML); Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN); data-flow diagrams (DFD); control flow diagrams (CFD); A3 (or other lean methodologies); Gantt etc Proven skill accessing and manipulating data from diverse data sources** using SQL, Power Pivot, Power Query, Power BI, Purview or other common querying tools. Familiarity with other data modeling (relational, OLTP, OLAP, multi-dimensional, hierarchical) sufficient for data profiling and data quality assessment. ** Diverse data sources include relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle), flat files, proprietary text or binary file formats, hierarchical databases, unstructured text sources, etc. Have strong competencies in areas such as: listening, learning, written communication, group facilitation, teamwork, and personal initiative and accountability. Proven working knowledge of data governance concepts and how they are applied.

The successful candidate will exhibit uncompromising integrity and commitment to upholding corporate values, and the OPG Code of Business Conduct.

What Makes a Career at OPG Different?

As Ontarios largest clean energy generator, were building, expanding, and innovating the equipment and technology that keeps Ontario powered with clean, reliable energy.
At OPG, our values are our strengths. They are fundamental truths about our organization that dont change:
Safety  its our business

Here's why OPG might just be the ideal workplace for you:

Our promise to you:
We care about the safety and the well-being of our employees. It is our utmost priority.
A supportive work environment where you can be your best every day.
Opportunities to stretch and develop.
Offer different ways for you to give back to communities where we operate.
Partner with Indigenous communities and support local businesses.
We support employment equity, diversity and inclusion.

Are you ready to start a career that has the power to electrify life on and off the job? Apply now.

Description:
Permanent Full Time

We are hiring an Analyst, Data & Analytics.

Our Global Strategy and Planning team is a strategic partner in our business  with an ambition to be a forward-thinking, agile technology organization delivering secure, resilient and leading solutions that support Canada Life and the well-being of millions of Canadians.

We are looking for an Analyst, Data & Analytics to create and deliver trusted metrics and dashboard reporting from our project and portfolio management tool to help teams and leaders improve technology delivery to meet business needs.

Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be in the following head office locations: London, Toronto, or Winnipeg. This is a fulltime permanent position.

What you wil do

Business Problem Analysis
Identify and understand business problems and requirements related to project portfolio management (PPM), including portfolio health status, financial summaries, resource management, etc.
Develop solutions, recommendations and plans to solve these problems with data analysis, metrics in dashboards, and reporting based on the data from our Broadcom Clarity PPM tool
Data Analysis
Complete data analysis and discovery
Build insights, better understand the data and the story it is telling to drive actionable results
Collect, interpret, and analyze complex data sets
Influence data quality through adherence to best practices in data collection and management; through collaboration with delivery teams to improve data collection processes
Design, build and maintain user-friendly, interactive data visualizations and dashboards using complex datasets in Power BI for operational and management decision making
Develop and implement metrics and performance indicators
Apply and implement best practices to ensure dashboard design consistency, accuracy, and efficiency for the best user experience
Design, write, debug, test, and fix analytics assets
Communication and Collaboration
Collaborate daily with the core metrics, reporting and analytics team and delivery teams
Share learnings with others across the company, including leadership, delivery teams and community of practice participation

What you will bring
3-5+ years of applied data management experience (Data modeling & analytics education an asset)
Expertise in PowerBI, SharePoint, SQL
Experience developing project portfolio management dashboards, preferably leveraging the Broadcom Clarity PPM data model
Highly proficient in the core Microsoft Office applications
Excellent communication and presentation skills and strong organization skills
Proven learning ability and ability to manage multiple priorities in a challenging work environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Agile, practical, customer service-oriented mindset
Generally curious and excited to learn new things
What will set you apart
Experience working with and customizing Rego Consultings Power BI reports
Experience developing Jaspersoft reports
Experience developing portlets in Clarity PPM
Experience with statistical analysis, and ability to write up written reports and summaries based on dashboards and analytics
The base salary for this position is between $51,400 - -$95,200 annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today!

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. Youre part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. Youll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, youll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. Its our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company thats trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, were one of Canadas leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Canada Life policies. Position Objective: The primary purpose of this position is to analyze Customer Pricing Contracts and product files, initiate contract renewals and provide suggested pricing for new business opportunities. This role will impact the decisions made when determining profitability and managing customers.
KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze and suggest pricing, make recommendations for margin mix on new and existing customer pricing contracts and product files
Analyze pricing trends, obtain customer, market and competitive information from National Accounts Managers and Business Managers to be used in pricing analysis and suggested pricing
Provide pricing analysis on changes to product files
Within the Proposal process work closely with business opportunity owner in pricing strategies on product file
Within the Implementation process work with opportunity owner in developing contract model and make recommendations on margin mix
Initiate pricing files for upcoming contract expiries; follow up with NAMs, BMs, PRG and Charge Back to secure expected contract renewals
Make recommendations to Business Managers, National Account Mangers, Directors and General Managers during pricing strategy discussions as necessary
Provide ad hoc analysis on specific National Accounts as needed
Work closely with National Accounts Sales, Proposals and Business Support teams
Provide other assistance, as required, to the overall National Accounts Team
Job Requirements:
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Post Secondary Education in Business and applied Arts
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
Experience with Excel and SAP required
PowerBI and SQL experience nice to have
Strong organizational, analytical and problem solving skills
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Proven time management and prioritization skills; ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional business acumen and professional attitude
Excellent team player
Proven strong customer focus and sales orientation
Well-rounded safety and industrial product knowledge acquired through prior experience or education
Must demonstrate initiative and the ability to work with minimal supervision
Rewards and Benefits:
Our programs provide choice and flexibility to meet your individual needs. Check out some of the benefits available to you with Grainger (may vary based on hours worked):
Medical, dental, vision and prescription drug coverage
Paid time off (PTO) and up to 12 company holidays per year (dependent on home province)
Life insurance coverage, including spousal and dependent life insurance
Employee Family Assistance Program to help team members with physical, emotional, mental, financial and other concerns
Registered Retirement Savings Plan & Defined Contribution Pension Plan to help you save for your financial future
Educational & Professional Membership Fee Assistance program
Employee discounts, team member perks and more!
DEI Statement
We encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't perfectly match this job post as you may still be the right candidate for this role or others. We aspire to create a culture where everyone is comfortable being who they are, can learn and grow to realize their full potential, and is recognized and rewarded for their impact.
Pre-employment background checks are required for all external candidates. Internal candidates undergo a background check when they move from a non-driving role to a driving role or to a director+ position.
Grainger is an Equal Opportunity Workplace. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or disability. Accommodations are available on request.

Summary

Posted: 12 Mar 2024

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish! The people here at Apple dont just craft products - they build the kind of wonder thats revolutionized entire industries. Its the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Our diverse and innovative community is dedicated to leaving the world better than we found it! As a Data Insights and Reporting Analyst in Apple's Sales organization, you'll play a crucial role in supporting our mission. Collaborating with Sales Professionals, Finance, Operations and Senior Leadership, you will deliver operational excellence by providing data insights, reporting, analytics, and tools to advance our strategic vision. We are searching for a student who can be flexible in the face of business ambiguity and eager to analyze/break down sophisticated datasets to derive clear decisions for our various business partners. This opportunity is for a limited term (May through August 2023) and is located in Toronto with a work hybrid model of 3 days in office and 2 days remote each week.

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications


Solid experience using Excel Functions, Pivot Tables and Pivot Charts to derive business insights, decisions, modeling, and finance (VBA is a plus)
Proven interpersonal critical to working across multiple teams / functions.
Flexibility to juggle multiple responsibilities
Quick to learn new skills and quick to ask questions where necessary to further understanding.
Understanding of fundamental SQL, data principles, iterative computing, and logic: GROUP BY, JOIN, IF/AND/OR/ELSE, FOR/WHILE Loops.
Exposure to data manipulation tools such as Python, Pandas, KNIME, Alteryx, Tableau Prep, R, STATA, MATLAB, APIs PUSH PULLS, GCP, AWS or Azure a plus
Experience with data visualization such as Tableau, Power BI, Google Data Studios, Looker, MATPLOTLIB, PLOTLY.


Description

Description

This program offers mentorship and development to elevate your business acumen and give visibility to a wide spectrum of business functions at Apple. In this role, you will: - Partner with our sales team and finance professional to deliver data, insights, analytics, and reporting in different forms to drive business decisions. - Analyze and derive different business success measurements across areas of the business from the consumer retailer and carrier space to enterprise sales and training. - Capture, distill, and synthesize business requirements to help develop new analytics products and deliverables for the organization. - Design and develop ETL data flows to help build out our data infrastructure of data sources and automation initiatives. - Maintain and build data automation flows to support business reporting. - Support the end-to-end development of Analytics Visualization tools using cutting edge tools.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

Undergraduate or Graduate studies in the fields (or related): Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Sciences, Data Science, Business Analytics, Commerce, Engineering, Economics or Finance.

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements

Don't miss this opportunity to play a key role in the development of financial strategic policies that have an impact across the province! We are seeking experienced, creative, team-oriented Policy Analysts to join the Municipal Finance Strategic Policy & Research Unit in the Ministry of Finance.

About the Division/Branch

The Provincial Local Finance Division provides advice to the Ministry of Finance on policies, legislation and operational initiatives related to Ontario's property tax system, municipal funding policy and the province's overall financial relationship with municipalities.

The Municipal Funding Policy Branch is responsible for providing oversight and advice on fiscal arrangements with municipalities.
OPS Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Anti-Racism:
We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.

We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.

Visit the OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.

We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's Human Rights Code. Refer to the "How to apply" section if you require a disability-related accommodation.
What can I expect to do in this role?
In this role, you will:
provide qualitative and quantitative analysis and advice on a wide range of provincial-municipal finance issues related to municipal funding and property tax policy
assist senior staff in the preparation of briefing materials for the Minister and other senior management
conduct research and data analysis relating to the government's municipal strategies and policy priorities
develop and maintain a network of key partners and stakeholders across all levels of government
represent the branch on intra/inter-ministerial committees

How do I qualify?
Analytical and Research Skills:
You can analyze issues and provide strategic policy advice
You have experience acquiring data and information from a variety of sources and integrating information from different sources

Technical Expertise:
You understand economic objectives and policy development and decision-making processes
You understand municipal funding or municipal and/or public finance processes
You have knowledge of economic theories, quantitative analysis and financial management

Communication and Relationship Building Skills:
You have experience preparing briefing materials for senior management
You are able to manage relationships and liaise with stakeholders

Problem Solving Skills:
You are able to synthesize information and turn data into information
You have experience finding data trends from large amounts of data
You have experience identifying data problems and providing creative solutions

Computer Skills:
You have knowledge of spreadsheets and other data modelling tools and techniques
You have experience using databases or statistical software for complex financial, economic or other quantitative analysis

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether youve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or youre looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

Duties & responsibilities
The Sustainability Data Analyst role will join JLLs Sustainability Data and Reporting team to support our data management, platform, compliance and reporting functions. The role will work across our global client portfolio delivering data management services, reporting and advice in a high performance, outcomes driven team. This is a remote and/or hybrid role that can be located anywhere in Canada.

The position is required to work collaboratively across internal global business lines including JLLs Client Account, Technology and Operations teams to help manage stakeholder expectations and maintain high quality service delivery.
The candidate will have experience in delivering multiple programs of works in parallel. The role will be responsible for several tasks including:
Assist in delivery of client projects by assisting them to meet their sustainability reporting objectives e.g. DJSI, GRESB, Modern Slavery, TCFD, GRI, RE100, NGER, SASB, CDP and other reporting frameworks.
Develop a detailed understanding of JLLs sustainability reporting application, Canopy, and how we support our clients in measuring their sustainability performance.
Participate in new client transition and delivery activities as required, to ensure projects are delivered on time and to a high standard.
Work with client delivery and development teams to ensure program milestones are being met.
Develop a detailed understanding of data structures within clients data.

Performance objectives
The role requires the ability to actively manage concurrent projects and a strong talent for project coordination.
Regularly communicate in a clear and non-technical way to internal JLL and client users.
Be an integral part of the data and reporting team, contributing to the efficient monitoring and management of support requests, following internal processes and on-going performance improvement of the team.
Contribute the successful migration of existing client base to new application within agreed timelines.
Identify areas of the platform for improvement to enhance user experience.
Identify support, training and management processes that can be improved to increase scalability and efficiency.

Key skills
The ability to manage multiple deliverables with inter-related dependencies
Strong organisational skills and process-driven, with an orientation toward continuous process improvement
Strong emotional intelligence and capacity to deliver an excellent client experience.
Strong ability to clearly identify issues with data and raise them to the appropriate JLL team member.
Ability to work to a defined milestone dates and raise any concerns early and often.

Candidate specification
1-3 years experience in similar analyst role.
Basic understanding of HVAC and building energy systems and/or Green House Gas Emission calculations.
Familiarity with sustainability related certification and benchmarking tool
High proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data management.
Proficient in using MS Excel, Access and SQL to combine and analyze data from various sources, and generate reports and graphics. Must be able to combine large volumes of data for consolidated reporting.
Ability to perform data analysis and identify the gaps and trends in data.
Excellent communication skills including the ability to identify and describe data anomalies and provide solutions accordingly.
Lateral thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to multi-task and manage priorities to meet deadlines.
A strong desire to deliver a quality outcome for the client and end users.
Experience and understanding of sustainability and carbon emissions reporting will be a strong advantage.
Project management experience would be an advantage.
This role requires a high attention to detail and a strong process-driven approach.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you dont meet all of the requirements below. Were interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.

About JLL 

Were JLLa leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. Thats why were committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. Were using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and were honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where were headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

Overview:
At KPMG, youll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Our Audit Risk Management group is looking for a dynamic individual to join our team as an Analyst. The Audit Risk Management team helps ensure KPMG (the Firm) and its personnel are in compliance with Professional, Regulatory and Firm risk management policies and procedures. The Analyst role will primarily focus on compliance with the application of risk management policies and processes for the Audit practice, with a primary focus on maintaining and enhancing controls related to the annual Quality Performance Review (QPR) program and involvement in other audit risk management initiatives.

What you will do:
Provide support to the Manager, Audit Risk Management in ensuring the effective planning, execution and reporting of results associated with the Firms QPR program. This includes the planning and scheduling of annual engagement reviews for partners and other leaders in the Audit practice, analyzing and reporting of findings to senior leadership and the Global Audit Quality Monitoring Group and collaborating with the Department of Professional Practice in the determination of remedial actions for function-wide issues.
Work collaboratively with a dynamic team to maintain internal compliance systems and execute on general audit risk management projects.
Respond independently to queries relating to the Audit QPR program that may be raised by QPR review and engagement teams and escalate complex queries in accordance with the applicable reporting lines and in a timely manner.
As part of the Audit QPR team, maintain high quality documentation and support control operators in executing a series of QPR controls that are part of the Firms System of Quality Management (SoQM), in order to ensure they continue to operate effectively.
Support the Risk Compliance team in the testing of various controls in the Firms SoQM.
As part of a team, perform Root Cause Analysis on audit quality issues identified through regulatory reviews, QPR and other monitoring programs and activities of the Firm.
Assist in preparing risk management guidance and training materials for system end-users and as part of the annual QPR program.
Run reports from QPR systems and apply various data analysis techniques in analyzing and presenting the data for use in risk management projects and processes.
Draft, edit, and send a variety of communications to regional professional practice leaders and QPR review and engagement teams with a high level of accuracy and professionalism.
What you bring to this role:
Post-secondary education, preferably in a business-related field.
Minimum 2 years relevant experience is required. Experience in audit or audit risk management, is an asset.
High aptitude to learning new systems/technology and equipped with advanced Microsoft Office and other data analysis skills, including Excel, PowerPoint, PowerBI, Power Query, Power Pivot and DAX (VLOOKUP, pivot table etc.)
Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills with an ability to prioritize while managing competing priorities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, the ability to generate high quality deliverables, respond to inquiries with professionalism and maintain high level of confidentiality.
Must be very organized and possess the ability to perform at a high level both individually and as part of a team.

Job Description:
Reporting to the Strategy and Analytics team within Sun Life Group Investments (SLGI), the Data Analyst is responsible for reviewing large quantities of data and transforming the data into models to help generate value for a variety of functions. In this role, the Data Analyst will have the opportunity to formulate, plan, and execute advanced statistical modeling for the purpose of both analysis and testing.
The Data Analyst will also work to develop enhanced and personalized reporting as well as apply advanced statistical knowledge for various business partners within SLGI and will perform ongoing and periodic testing and analysis of the block of business. The ideal candidate will not only have a strong grasp of statistical theory, but will also possess a strong business acumen to apply this theoretical knowledge in the context of a financial business.
What will you do?
Analyze large quantities of data and help create value throughout the organization (Sales, Marketing, Finance, Operations, Actuarial, Product, etc.) using descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive methods
Design and implement advanced metrics evaluating a variety of different aspects of the business
Utilize AWS to develop and implement advanced statistical models for the purposes of descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive application
Create data tools and optimize data pipelines using AWS ETL technologies
Improve efficiency of existing business processes through application of procedural automation methods using VBA
What do you need to succeed?
University degree in Mathematics / Statistics, Economics / Econometrics, Business, Computer Science or another analytics-related discipline
Proven track record of working with data and deriving analytical insights within practical or academic settings
Experience with machine learning including supervised and unsupervised models
Experience with development and application of advanced metrics for the purposes of evaluating business performance
Experience with data analysis and visualization platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, and Microsoft, with a proven track record of creating informative and interactive dashboards

Senior Business Analyst (HCM Implementation)
Youll feel great about a career with March of Dimes Canada
At March of Dimes Canada, our collective work matters. As a leading national charity backed by a history of more than 70 years of impact, were dedicated to being Canadas leading service provider, resource, and advocate, empowering people with disabilities to live and thrive in communities nationwide. Youll be joining a team made up of more than 2,000 professionals thats dedicated to solving big challenges and creating real change for people with disabilities in communities across our country. Theyre at the center of all we do, and we make a real difference in their lives every day. It matters to us because the need is urgent  and its growing.
More than six million people with disabilities in Canada experience challenges like poverty, discrimination, indignity, and isolation. These are the barriers that youll help tear down. Together, with your vital contributions, well keep moving the dial on the challenges people with disabilities face. Our work is deep and wide  and youll always find it deeply rewarding  which is why we pull together to make change happen. Our collective efforts are rooted in our Purpose, Vision, and Mission, which inform how we drive all our work forward:
Purpose: Champion equity. Empower ability.

Mission: To be Canadas leading service provider, resource, and advocate, empowering people with disabilities to live and thrive in communities nationwide.

Roles and responsibilities
Lead the planning and execution of all business analysis activities throughout the HCM implementation project such as current state and gap analysis, requirements gathering and solution design sessions, etc.
Collaborate with key stakeholders and implementation partners understand business needs and translate them into detailed requirements and user stories for development.
Support development activities including demonstration of completed functionality to stakeholders.
Monitor and report progress, identify risks, and proactively raise and address issues as they arise throughout the project implementation process.
Work closely with technical teams to ensure smooth data migration from the legacy system to the new HCM platform.
Own the creation and updating of business analysis and select project management artifacts.
Support testing and quality assurance activities include review of test strategy and cases; some test execution may be required.
Plan, coordinate, and execute on the UAT strategy, including supporting testers, managing defects, and reporting progress.
Working with Communications and Training team members, create communications and training materials and conduct training sessions for end-users.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders, project team, and external partners.
Provide post-implementation warranty support and change management process activities.
Qualifications and experience
Experience as a Senior Business Analyst or similar role within a major software migration and/or implementation project, preferably of HCM software or other organization-wide platforms.
Experience with all phases of project delivery in a Senior BA capacity from initial planning stages through to post-implementation transition to operationalization.
Experience as a project manager or holding project management responsibilities within a software implementation project.
Experience working within a variety of project delivery and software development approaches such as Agile, waterfall, and hybrid approaches.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences and tailor content to various audience types.
Strong business acumen and strategic thinking skills
Working knowledge of project management and delivery tools such as Jira, Asana, and MS Project.
Familiarity with user experience design and digital accessibility standards are considered an asset.
Knowledge of HR and Payroll operations and systems is considered an asset.

JOB OVERVIEW

Ontario Power Generation (OPG) is looking for a dynamic, strategic and results-driven professional to join our team in the role of Markets Analyst.
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Settlements, this position is responsible for supporting senior staff by participating actively in IESO or ISO stakeholder forums as related to billing and settlement functions, advocating for OPG concerns and providing regular two-way communication with supervisor, peers and OPG staff in general. Conduct after-the-fact analysis of OPG's activities in the IESO and/or ISO markets and communicate to stakeholders as necessary. Support the supervisor or Manager by performing various studies, analyses and reports. Make valued contributions towards the development of methodologies, metrics and indices. Take on a more active and initiating role in settlement processes e.g. The Notice of Disagreement process.

This is an exciting opportunity to work in an environment where you will contribute to OPGs engagement and education efforts as part of the companys commitment to growing its social license.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Provide comprehensive support to OPG's representatives to forums such as the Commercial Reconciliation Standing Committee, EDACP Settlements Working Group, Market Pricing Working Group, Technical Panel, OEB Rate Submission Panel.
Maintain an in-depth knowledge of the Market Rules and relevant Market Manuals and relationship to settlement process for IESO and external ISO.
Support OPG subsidiaries (i.e.. OPGET, etc.) per Services contract provisions or per partnership agreement.
Occasionally represent OPG at IESO or external ISO stakeholder forums such as the Commercial Reconciliation Standing Committee.
Actively participate to influence the advice the IESO or external ISO takes back from these forums. Report back to OPG on the key developments. Apply the insights gained at these forums to improve OPG's effectiveness.
Analyze market results to identify opportunities for challenging IESO or ISO revenue/billing calculations for OPG. Work in collaboration with other Departments within Energy Markets to achieve improvements.
Advance the state of understanding of IESO and other ISO market rules that will enable the provision of answers to questions, enable the provision of relevant/analyzed information and allow for the provision of training to others within Energy Markets and other organizations within OPG.
Use expert level of settlements market rule knowledge to provide a central and ongoing source of wholesale market rules expertise, for the Ontario IESO and external ISO markets, to staff in OPG. Such information would be used to assist OPG staff in operations, planning or OEB rate submission exercises.
Assist the Supervisor/Manager in advising senior OPG advisory committee staff on issues tabled at; IESO Board, OPA, OEB, or Ministry of Energy. This advice will assist the individual in quickly understanding issues from the IESO or external ISO markets by identifying the impact, pros and cons and strategies regarding the issues.
Monitor and analyze market results and advise Energy Markets staff on issues resolutions that could impact/have bearing on their strategies, both in a proactive way (self reporting) and in a reactive way (issues brought up by others). Provide guidance to Energy Markets and other OPG staff to influence adherence to market rules and market manuals.
Develop methodologies to monitor, analyze and evaluate possible gaming or abuse situations by OPG or other participants.
Create reports and provide relevant analysis for internal management or external stakeholders re: Ontario and/or external ISO markets.
Provide contract and/or market rules perspectives in day-to-day reconciliation/verification activities and monthly invoicing/billing activities.
Provide advice, guidance, recommendations and assistance to line management on settlements and in the evaluation and explanation of significant variations between forecasts and actual revenues.
Take an active role in the development of business processes for the settlement and billing functions.
Develop a strong understanding of IESO and external ISO Market Rules and any other pertinent contracts with OPG counterparts.

EDUCATION

4- Year University Degree in Business, Engineering, Mathematics, or Computer Science

QUALIFICATIONS

Ability to work in a flexible hybrid environment
Requires experience to be familiar with: The operation and economics of the power system, nuclear/thermal/hydroelectric generation and transmission; The IESO market including the market rules, market manuals, reports, regulatory environment; Other external ISO market rules (ie. NYISO, PJM, MISO, NEISO), power trading, including physical trading with other markets
Developing complex computer based reports; Data analysis, synopsis and developing positions; Developing analytics using Excel, Access, etc. to process large amounts of data is essential for this job.
Requires experience to be familiar with data sources within and outside the organization and in developing and implementing business processes and procedures.
A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience is needed for this position

The successful candidate will exhibit uncompromising integrity and commitment to upholding corporate values, and the OPG Code of Business Conduct.

What Makes a Career at OPG Different?

As Ontarios largest clean energy generator, were building, expanding, and innovating the equipment and technology that keeps Ontario powered with clean, reliable energy.

Your Moneris Career - The Opportunity
The Business Data Analyst translates business requirements into technical specifications and also does business data analysis to ensure implementation of appropriate and practical technical solutions that satisfy our needs. You will work closely with the business and project managers to assess business needs, software development teams to gain insight on the data and data engineers and architects to ensure they understand the designed solution.
Location: You will be based in our Toronto office and will work in a Hybrid model.
Reporting Relationship : You will report to Director, Data Science and Development.
Your Moneris Career - What you'll do
Review project related business requirement documents to assess needs, perform impact analysis on existing processes, and design effective solutions to business problem.
Develop queries to be used for data analysis and generation of sample data extracts.
Acts as the liaison between the business and technology teams to elicit detailed requirements and gain better understanding of the business needs as well as relaying the technical confines back to the business.
Collaborate with Data and business teams to enable translation of requirements into audience appropriate documents ranging from design/functional specifications, technical specifications for developers to build the solution, data mapping/definitions documents.
Engage knowledge experts and business teams to enable translation of requirements into audience appropriate documents ranging from business design/functional specifications, technical specifications for developers to build the solution, data mapping/definitions documents.
Provide data mapping, document logic and criteria, perform gap analysis and comparison of existing and new data sets.
Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
Participate in quality assurance activities; develop test cases/scenarios, coordinate with appropriate groups to ensure test data readiness, develop high-level testing plan based on documented requirements, validate the output against the business requirements and identify defects.
Work closely with Data teams to determine overall data needs in order to design reusable data solutions.
Your Moneris Career - What you bring
Bachelor's degree required in Data Analytics, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience in a Technology or business environment.
Minimum of 4 - 5 years of experience in Data Analysis or Data Business Analysis
Solid MS-SQL experience, along with SSRS, SSIS, Stored Procedures
Power BI, Tableau, experience in Snowflake Tool
Worked in Cloud Environment (Azure is considered an asset)
Git, Active Batch
Exposure to Python, Py Spark
Proficient in programming languages specific to environments and coding experience.
Excellent ability to design and engineer solutions.
Knowledge of data management, governance, data design and database architecture. Can access and understand data within a variety of databases and file structures.
Knowledge of business analytics and performance management principles including KPI and KRI management is considered an asset.
Proficient in leading projects or project steps and communicating progress/approach with technical and non-technical peers/clients.
Your Moneris Career - What you get
Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits plans starting from Day 1
RRSP matching & defined contribution pension plan.
Learning & development programs and resources including unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning, Coursera and an Educational Assistance Program
Holistic approach to your well-being, with an Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, monthly wellness events and a supportive workplace culture
Company-wide paid year-end closure & personal time off (including religious, personal, and volunteer days)
Find out more about the work perks and benefits you get as a Moneris employee at Moneris.com/careers

Job Description:
At Fiera Capital
We invest in creating a culture of purpose that makes our people feel valued, cared for, seen, and heard. Our approach to employee experience is tailored to your needs and ambitions:
Your Inclusive Experience: We are committed to cultivating an inclusive, safe, and trusting work environment.
Your Growth & Empowerment: We have ambitious growth goals for our firm, which makes us a great place to advance your career.
Your Rewards & Recognition: We deeply value our people and their contributions and thats reflected in our competitive compensation and benefits packages and our collaborative culture.
Your Wellness Your Way: We strive to create a healthy work environment and we offer programs designed to support our employees wellbeing.
What we are looking for:
The analyst will be an integral part of the Global Data Management team that ensures the accuracy and timeliness of our core investment data. The core focus of this role will be to manage enterprise data in such a way as to drive its accuracy, reliability, scalability, and sustainability, while collaborating with the business and technology team to identify and promote best practices and implementation execution.
Your responsibilities:
Ensure timely and accurate valuation of assets under management
Responsible for data quality and for ensuring high business confidence in the data
Collect and ensure receipt of prices from various vendors of public market securities
Review and validate daily key quality control reports in support of pricing using various tools and applications
Support daily processes by solving for any exceptions/rejections in a timely manner
Vetting data comparisons between the accounting system and the order management system to ensure accuracy
Complete daily and monthly tasks related to pricing and validation of securities across systems
Drive data quality by highlighting process improvement, formulate recommendations to resolve, and work as part of team to re-engineer current workflows
Partner with other functional Operational Teams to solve issues and improve processes
Learn multiple functions at an accelerated pace and quickly adapt to different roles and management styles
Document workflows and procedures as needed
Must have requirements to be successful in this role:
High attention to detail, and accuracy, within a high-volume work environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills in order to identify issues or unusual activity
Self-motivated with continuous process improvement mindset
Team player, results-oriented and passion for excellence
Effective communication skills at all levels of the organization
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel a plus
Language requirements: If your location is Montreal, fluency in French, both written and spoken, as well as solid proficiency in English, given our presence in offices around the world, is a must. If your location is Toronto, excellent communication skills in English only, spoken and written, are required.
Preferred technical skills to succeed in this role:
Strong working knowledge various security types including equities, currency forwards, loans, bonds, interest rate swaps, credit default swaps, synthetic notes, OTC securities, futures, etc.
Experience working within an operations team of an investment management firm
Knowledge of data entities such as securities, pricing, positions, transactions, indices, performance, and clients
Experience with different external data vendors used across the industry such as Bloomberg, IDC, Reuters, Rimes, etc.
Additional Information:
Fiera Capital adheres to a hybrid working environment with 3 days in-office per week
If you are interested in a career at Fiera Capital and you meet 70% or more of the requirements, do not hesitate to submit your application!
#LI-Hybrid
For all positions in Quebec (Montreal and Laval), proficiency in French, both spoken and written, is mandatory. Working English proficiency is also required in order to serve our offices and clients around the world.

Hydro One is proud to be the largest electricity transmission and distribution provider in Ontario, serving nearly 1.4 million customers. We have a long history in the industry with our roots dating back over 110 years to 1906. Since then, we have worked to grow and evolve to meet the changing needs of our customers and communities across Ontario. Today, were focused on providing exceptional customer service and ensuring we are building safe communities where we live, work and play.
Its an exciting time to join the team at Hydro One!

The successful candidate will join the Sustainability and Indigenous Procurement team within Hydro Ones Supply Chain. The objective of the group is to help ensure that Hydro One meets its social sustainability commitments towards economic reconciliation with Indigenous businesses and communities as part of the 2015 Truth and Reconciliation Commission of Canada: Calls to Action. The team also holds accountability for other ESG/Sustainability initiatives in Supply Chain.

Job Description:
Perform assigned work under the direction of Supply Chain Management to assist in developing, evaluating, and executing Supply Chain procurement, RFx strategy, policies, procedures, and management systems in the context of Indigenous and Sustainable Procurement
Assist in process execution and maintenance of the Indigenous Procurement Procedure.
Responsibilities include:
Participate in the development and maintenance of Supply Chain policies and procedures including data analysis, interaction with stakeholders, recommendation, documentation, education/training, and implementation.
Coordinate/execute/track internal and external communications to connect businesses with sourcing opportunities.
Maintain/update various databases
Assist in activities related to spend forecasting, budgeting, verification, and reporting.
Assist in Supplier Performance duties as required.
Lead by example to minimize supplier risk to the enterprise including reputational, financial and safety.
Participate in Supply Chain related project type work as initiatives are identified. Depending on the complexity, the individual may be a team member or a leader of the initiative.
Supervise staff on a limited basis including assigning and checking work. Provide advice, guidance and instruction, as required.
May involve attending conferences and events.
Perform other duties as required.

Selection Criteria/Essential Competencies
Requires undergraduate degree or equivalent business experience (4-6 years) with experience in such fields as Business Administration, Data Management, Marketing and Communications, Supply Chain, Sustainability, Indigenous or Community Relations
Strong organizational and analytical skills
Demonstrated business acumen and professionalism
Exceptional written and oral communication and comprehension skills with experience managing sensitive issues in an often highly charged/political environment.
Ideally has a working knowledge of service and material categories associated with electric utility sector.
Practical knowledge of commercial practices, procurement policies and procedures.
Knowledge of various software packages such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint to create, modify and review reports, proposals, and presentations.
Knowledge and experience in SAP to navigate Purchase Requisitions, Purchase Orders, Outline Agreements, and reporting
Ideally has experience working with Ariba sourcing and Contract Management tools
Ideally a working knowledge of Category Management tools and strategies, as well as knowledge of financial concepts, principles and related disciplines including purchasing, internal control, information management technology associated with the development of business support and evaluation policies and techniques relative to Supply Chain.
Ability to work independently and on a team

Youll feel great about a career with March of Dimes Canada

Experience with all phases of project delivery in a Senior BA capacity from initial planning stages through to post-implementation transition to operationalization.
Experience as a project manager or holding project management responsibilities within a software implementation project.
Experience working within a variety of project delivery and software development approaches such as Agile, waterfall, and hybrid approaches.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences and tailor content to various audience types.
Strong business acumen and strategic thinking skills

Familiarity with user experience design and digital accessibility standards are considered an asset.

Business Analysis Knowledge

you have demonstrated experience scheduling and monitoring deliverables

Primary Objectives:
This position will be primarily responsible for delivering management reporting and analysis. As part of the reporting scope, you will proactively develop and manage Power BI dashboards to facilitate the consistent sharing of data and reports with all stakeholders. You will leverage data engineering and visualization to enable the translation of data into actionable insights to drive new business opportunities and optimize operations.
Reporting to the Director, Underwriting, and as part of the Corporate Underwriting Team, you will have exposure to both personal and commercial property lines and contribute to business-driven Data Projects with valuable career development potential.
This role is located at our Head Office in Downtown Toronto and is a 12 month contract. It is ideal for an innovative thinker with a growth mindset, who is eager to learn and develop.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for the delivery of reporting services, leveraging both automation techniques and manual reporting.
Understand and deliver complex, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc report analytics requests leveraging analytics expertise.
Deep subject matter expertise in data engineering, visualization and related functional domains to deliver robust analysis and generate and support insights and analysis to Management.
Measure, track and monitor new and existing product performance. Analyze market changes and emerging trends affecting product profitability and make recommendations to management to ensure sustainable profitable revenue growth.
Collaborate with Data and Analytics Team to automate standard reporting and develop the reporting landscape.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Treaty, Regional Offices, Digital Distribution and New Solution Development to support their needs for data reporting and analysis across all products.

Qualifications:
University Degree in Applied Data Science, Data and Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Computer Science.
5-7 years of experience in delivering functional reporting solutions with the ability to compile, analyze, present and translate findings from analytics to concrete suggestions for business opportunities and to facilitate decision-making.
P&C experience and a deep understanding of earned and written premium, incurred and occurred claims, loss development and deriving loss costs is required.
Advanced programming knowledge and data processing abilities (using tools MS Office, advanced Excel, Power BI and languages such as VBA, and SQL), deep knowledge of databases, analytics tools and experience with data cubes is required.
Strong analytical, storytelling and problem-solving skills and looking for efficient, automated solutions.
Strong organizational and time management skills to prioritize workloads and multiple projects and meet time-sensitive deadlines with a high degree of accuracy.
Strong team player and ability to effectively collaborate within a team as well as in cross-functional areas.
Strong written and oral communication skills, as well as attention to detail is essential for this role.

About Faire
Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local  independent retailers around the globe are doing more revenue than Walmart and Amazon combined. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favorite boutique in town  we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. With the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses everywhere can compete with these big box and e-commerce giants.
By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We're looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.
About this role
Faire's Risk team is seeking a highly motivated Underwriting Analyst to help us empower small businesses by providing them with credit limits that enable them to grow. The underwriters at Faire conduct due diligence and credit risk analysis to determine appropriate credit limit amounts for retailers.
What you'll do
Evaluate creditworthiness of retail businesses and adjust credit limits based on a review of the business's credit application, banking data, payment performance on Faire, and publicly available information
Perform due diligence on businesses to prevent fraud
Propose and implement improvements to risk management policies, procedures, and tools
Identify issues and gaps, and develop data-driven recommendations to enhance our underwriting operations
Work cross-functionally with teams such as Data Science, Engineering, and Product in order to drive product improvements, new feature releases, and efficiency improvements
Work with Sales and Support teams to streamline communication, improve efficiencies, and provide a world-class customer experience
Qualifications
3-6 years of experience in financial services, tech, or related industry, with minimum 1+ years of experience in small business commercial credit underwriting
Experienced in conducting comprehensive analysis of business banking data and financial statements to evaluate revenue, liquidity, leverage, and cash flow trends
Ability to spot patterns from discrete and vague data points (e.g. social media, financial data, Faire transactional data)
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and financial evaluation skills
The capacity to make complex decisions under pressure in a fast-paced setting
Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to interact with customers in a clear and concise manner, primarily via email and phone
Strong customer focus and the ability to balance Risk mitigation alongside a positive customer experience
Passionate, relentless resourcefulness and the ability to thrive at a fast-paced startup
- you're willing to do what needs to be done for the success of your team and you are comfortable with change

Faire's flexible work model aims to meet the needs of our diverse employee community by making work more flexible, connected, and inclusive. Depending on the role and needs of the team, Faire employees have the flexibility to choose how they workwhether that's mainly in the office, remotely, or a mix of both.
Roles that list only a country in the location are eligible for fully remote work in that country or in- office work at a Faire office in that country, provided employees are located in the registered country/province/state. Roles with only a city location are eligible for in-office or hybrid office work in that city. Our talent team will work with candidates to determine what locations and roles are eligible for each option.
Applications for this position will be accepted for a minimum of 30 days from the posting date.
Why you'll love working at Faire
We are entrepreneurs: Faire is being built for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. We believe entrepreneurship is a calling and our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. Every member of our team is taking part in the founding process.
We are using technology and data to level the playing field: We are leveraging the power of product innovation and machine learning to connect brands and boutiques from all over the world, building a growing community of more than 350,000 small business owners.
We build products our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to grow the pie - not steal a piece from it. Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy.
We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality.
Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. We're backed by some of the top investors in retail and tech including: Y Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Forerunner Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Founders Fund, and DST Global. We have headquarters in San Francisco and Kitchener-Waterloo, and a global employee presence across offices in Salt Lake City, Atlanta, Toronto, London, New York, LA, and Sao Paulo. Underwriting Analyst

We care for humankind  and that starts with our people
Our greatest strength lies not in what we do  but how we do it. Its the unique individual behind every piece of work who matters the most. Our people make Munich Re a global success. Working at Munich Re gives us access to the depth, breadth, and mindset we want in order to develop our full potential. Thats why a career at Munich Re is much more than just a job. Overview
Are you someone with strong leadership capabilities? Do you enjoy building relationships and working collaboratively in a team environment with both internal, external and global stakeholders? Do you possess strong analytical and investigative competencies? As someone with excellent communication skills and business acumen, you will utilize exceptional interpersonal and influencing skills across all levels of the organization.

Were looking for our next Underwriting Analyst. Could It Be You?
You have your Post-secondary education as well as your Chartered Insurance Professional (CIP) designation or progression towards the designation is an asset. In addition, you ideally have some finance or insurance experience or alternatively, have strong MS Office skills, particularly working with large data sets in Excel.
Your primary responsibility will be to perform a variety of technical, administrative, and accounting duties necessary for the efficient operation of MR F&C in Canada.

Need more details? Keep reading
You will assist underwriters in preparing and organizing data for entry into single risk pricing tools for rating purposes.
You will clear, review and enter new business endorsements and renewals for the underwriters within the established standards.
You will review the underwriters and peers system entries to ensure accuracy of the information (four eye principle). Discrepancies are to be brought to the appropriate parties attention for correction.
You will be responsible for issuing various insurance documents including FAC certificates and insurance policies for underwriters to sign.
You will also review and clear incoming mail and emails in the single risk system for both new and existing business, match up with appropriate file(s) and distribute accordingly within the established standards.
You will correspond with clients for account information and follow up for missing information.
You will generate status reports as required.
You will also be responsible for the preparation of renewals and the production of correspondence to emails to clients.
You will submit billing and payment information to accounting unit for client invoicing, reconcile billing and payment discrepancies to support the accounting unit; you will also file policy correspondence on a daily basis into the Electronic Filing System.
You will be responsible for analyzing data sets for the purpose of evaluating new and existing business submissions.
You will engage with MR F&C underwriters and leadership team
You have the ability to suggest process improvements to drive efficiency for underwriting group, and provide coaching and training to peers as needed
You may participate in global or local projects as assigned
You may be required to travel nationally and internationally, up to 5%

So are YOU our next Underwriting Analyst? You are if
You have a college/university degree with emphasis in insurance, business or accounting preferred.
You ideally have two years of prior insurance or finance experience, as well of knowledge of and experience with relevant legislation and regulation; ideally your background features an emphasis on regulatory, re/insurance, corporate, or transactional experience.
You have good communication, organizational, and time management skills with a demonstrated attention to detail and an eye for accuracy.
You have exceptional computer skills including Microsoft Office, particularly, strong Excel skillset specifically working with large data sets.
You have exceptional analytical and investigative competencies as well as a high degree of drive, self-motivation, continuing development and proven ability to work independently.
You have the ability to work on a small team and build strong relationships with your colleagues.
You have a high degree of flexibility and adaptability to changing environment with an ability to work independently and function well under pressure
You have demonstrated fluency in English; fluency in French (oral and written) is an asset.
Working knowledge of primary and/or reinsurance underwriting process and coverage is preferred.
Working knowledge of pricing models, insurance policies and reinsurance contracts for property/casualty is preferred.

In addition to an exciting job opportunity, we offer the following
You will be exposed to challenging projects and development opportunities to grow your skills and career with both local and global colleagues and partners.
A comprehensive total rewards financial program which includes extensive flexible benefits and pension.
A hybrid work environment in an inspiring physical workplace setting.
Educational Assistance Programs that continue to recognize your on-going success.

Data Product Analyst
Based in Toronto the Data Product Analyst will report to the Senior Manager, Data Products, ED&A. You will play a pivotal role in providing strategic and tactical analysis of our data products to various stakeholders across the organization. Working closely with teams spanning data product, engineering, analytics, science, intelligence, and BI, you will facilitate the collection of design inputs and measure the success of data products. Your contributions will shape product strategy, drive decision-making processes, and propel the organization forward.
As a Data Product Analyst, You Will:
Facilitate user interviews and workshops to gather data product requirements and design inputs from users, encompassing complex business logic, Excel Power Query, or SQL.
Translate collected requirements into technical specifications for Data Engineers, Analytics Engineers, and Data Scientists.
Liaise efforts of various teams within the Data organization while coordinating collaboration with other business functions and teams to ensure continuous delivery.
Conduct deep-dive quantitative analyses, presenting findings in a readily usable format to diverse stakeholders, including executives, product managers, and engineering managers.
Proactively identify opportunities to enhance analytics frameworks and methodologies, guiding stakeholders in their adoption.
Analyze user behavior to inform product strategy and business decisions, leveraging insights from data product success metrics.
Take ownership of complex analytical assignments, navigating ambiguity with confidence and delivering impactful results

Your Background:
5+ years of progressive experience in building data-as-product, data products, APIs, Data Platform as a Technical Business Analyst, Product Analyst, and/or Product Manager.
Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to engage technical team members of various roles (Software Engineer, UX/UI Designer, Data Engineer, Analytics Engineer, Data Scientists) business stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Demonstrated proficiency in agile project management methodologies, with a focus on facilitating the collaboration and coordination of cross-functional teams
Skilled in creating and maintaining project plans, sprint backlogs, and other Agile artifacts to track progress and manage priorities.
Proficient with SQL in technical data analytics, including working with diverse types and large amounts of data (e.g., timeseries, spatial, events) at various levels of aggregation
Familiarity with web/digital analytics metrics such as Daily Active Users, Retention, and Churn.
In-depth familiarity with data visualization and analytical tools, such as PowerBI and Apache Superset.
Strong understanding of data infrastructure and architecture to contribute to data product design approaches is a plus.
Experience contributing to building GenAI or Geo-Spatial Analytics Platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of basic statistical concepts (e.g., confidence intervals, normal distribution, correlation, linear regression, multivariate testing).
Experience with Python is beneficial, or a willingness to learn.

A named leader by Forrester in the sales performance management space, Varicent was founded in 2005 when we pioneered sales performance management software. Evolving quickly to become the fastest growing software company in North America according to Deloittes Fast 50 in 2010, Varicent was acquired by IBM in 2012 and has since been re-founded as an independent global business serving mid-size and enterprise clients with our full suite of solutions to assist in smarter territory and quota planning, efficient lead to revenue operations, and the fastest and most flexible way to pay sellers accurately and on-time. We are looking for talented, driven people that can make an impact across our organization.

The Data Operations Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and integrity of our data systems. You will play a key role in ensuring data quality control, data cleansing, and lead data integration activities. In collaboration with our internal teams and data engineers, you will identify opportunities for process optimization and generate data-driven insights around Customer Journeys, for Leadership to make informed decisions. This position is ideal for someone who has a strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and a passion for working with data.
What You'll Do:
Data Analysis & Optimization
Work with Data Engineering and Systems team to review, maintain and optimize the business processes around internal apps (HubSpot, SalesLoft, Salesforce, etc) and data-warehouse (Snowflake), ensuring accurate data models are being exposed for reporting;
Conduct monthly reviews of Company KPIs & reporting, summarizing the month over month changes in trends and opportunities for the Executive team;
Continuously assess and refine revenue operations processes to adapt to changing business needs and market conditions, and perform ad-hoc results analysis when required;
Identify opportunities for process automation within the full Customer Journey (Acquisition, Leads, New Sales, Renewals, Implementation, Invoicing);
Data Documentation
Active involvement in gathering business users requirements and defining the data models for reports and dashboards, track all Company-level KPIs;
Maintain high quality documentation for internal business process workflows
Collaboration and Communication
Be a key member of the Data Governance and Analytics team, along with other members of the Data Strategy organization, taking ownership of all data processes and analysis, which includes the monitoring of end-user reporting;
Collaborate with the Revenue Operations, Sales, Professional Services and Finance to implement process flows for key areas of the business, revolving around the existence, completeness and accuracy of data and in all output reports
Develop and lead the internal program promoting data literacy, enabling Varicent internal users on available data models and self-serve reporting
What You'll Bring:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (Master's degree is a plus).
3+ years proven experience in data operations, data quality, and data integration.
Proficiency in data management tools and technologies, such as SQL, ETL tools, data cleansing tools, and data visualization tools (PowerBi, Tableau, Sigma, Looker)
Highly adaptable and driven to take ownership of deliverables
Proficiency in CRM systems (Salesforce experience is an asset) and Excel
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Excellent attention to detail and a passion for data accuracy.
A self-starter who can take charge of tasks with minimal direction
Proficiency in data management tools and technologies, such as SQL, ETL tools, data cleansing tools, and data visualization tools
Knowledge of data governance and compliance with data privacy regulations
Experience in summarizing findings and insights using visuals ("telling stories using data")
Hands-on experience with requirements gathering and solutions design
Success Factors:
1-3 Months
Learn and get familiar with our systems end-to-end, our tech stack and business strategic initiatives.
Help the team with small changes and backlog review and prioritization
4-6 Months
Work and collaborate on a specific business strategic initiative, focusing on bringing clarity to the requirements, including providing a blueprint/roadmap, and determining relevant data points to gather and analyze.
Deliver required artifacts per program for execution.
Help with change management process and execution, collaborating on backlog grooming and alignment with key business priorities.
Measure success of a program, following delivery
7 Months & Beyond
Work on multiple programs concurrently, with a consistent approach, based on what has been learned, implemented, and applied to-date, including:
Providing initial blueprint/roadmap per program
Analyzing data to gauge success throughout the program
Delivering key common artifacts and training of changes to help with enablement/adoption.
Regularly monitoring the business operations teams program backlog and provide inputs into sprint planning and execution.
