Job Description:
Position title: Marketing Planning Analyst
Department: Business Insights
Position band: Specialist
Reports to: Business Insights Consultant
Type of position: Full-time, Permanent
The Opportunity:
We have a position available in the Toronto office for a Marketing Planning Analyst, supporting specifically Marketing and Category performance. In this position, the candidate will be providing objective, fact-based analytics support for Business Insights Consultants. The successful candidate will also at times work closely with the Marketing Planning and Execution teams, collaboratively providing recommendations on our calendar optimization and integration of advanced insights into category planning. This position is an excellent match for someone who is very comfortable with working with data, building dashboards, and strong analytical skills. A background in marketing mix modeling and strong experience influencing peers and category strategy are also key success factors.
Our Business Insights team is dedicated to uncover and articulate meaningful insights that inspire great advertising, great food and award-winning promotional programs. We strive to improve the guest experience with the goal of redefining McDonalds brand perception. Sometimes we adapt methodology from our global markets, but just as often or more, we need to design our own solutions. We are on a journey to become one of the strongest, most dynamic business insights teams in Canada as well as in the McDonalds system.
Who You Are
You are an objective and fact-based individual, with keen attention to detail, with a growth mindset. You are analytical by nature and can build strong relationships and work collaboratively in a team environment to support internal and external parties. You work effectively in a fast paced, agile, and sometimes high-pressure environment. If you like to explore, invent and inspire - we need someone who wants to find and develop better, sharper, more innovative ways to solve business problems.
Whats in it for you?
This is an unparalleled opportunity to join a winning organization during an exciting time of transformational change. You will gain exposure across all levels of the organization, from your team members to the Executives and Franchisees. You are looking for a company with a winning culture where you can grow in depth and breadth while making a tangible impact on strategic initiatives.
Job Responsibilities: In addition to following McDonalds policies and procedures, principle accountabilities include, but are not limited to:
Business Planning
Work alongside Marketing Analytics Consultants to understand and optimize impact of proposed marketing calendar activities across multiple categories
Work with external vendors and global teams with respect to marketing performance & best practices
Marketing Co-operation
Collaborate with category leads and other cross-functional partners to plan and execute marketing activities
Forecast, test, and assess business performance for national initiatives and regional activations where necessary
Analysis & Reporting
Pull product and customer-level data from Redshift database using SQL
Build dashboards using Tableau and other data visualization tools
Support BI Consultants in modelling financial projections of marketing campaigns and measuring performance
Qualifications:
Experience: Two to five years experience in an analytics role in an insights, finance, marketing, research or other related department
Intermediate to advanced skills in Tableau and/or other similar dashboarding tools
Advanced skills in data analysis and reporting, as related to marketing planning & strategy
Technical skills: Knowledge of SQL is necessary; Intermediate to advanced skills in Tableau and/or other similar dashboarding tools; and Advanced skills in data analysis and reporting, as related to marketing planning & strategy
Experience working with analytics vendors
Communication skills: Strong communication and presentation delivery skills, with comfort advocating at all levels of the organization.
Education: An undergraduate degree with a focus on Business Administration, Finance, Statistics, Economics, or related ; MBA, or related further education would be an asset
Additional Information:
McDonalds Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

OVERVIEW
The Business Systems Analyst, in partnership with other members of the Information technology team, is responsible for system maintenance, project implementations and end user support within the
Electronic Health Record for applications including patient registration and scheduling, clinical documentation (Physician, Nursing and Allied), order entry and results reporting.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. User Support
- Provide end-user support - working with members of the Information Technology team as well as vendors to identify and resolve issues and provide system enhancements in relation to application software. Maintain communication with all parties until a satisfactory resolution is reached
Responsible for ongoing support and application availability, including liaison with internal and external support
Set up and modification of user accounts and profiles
Possess the ability to assess system and application problems quickly and provide solutions in a timely manner.
Actively working with the rest of the department in meeting service level agreement targets and reporting requirements
Provides proactive support to users of Cerner including but not limited to training/education in order to ensure appropriate, effective usage and understanding of the application.
Provide after-hours Clinician support on a rotational basis
Assist in educating and communicating with internal and external clients regarding the change of processes and policies
2. Application build, maintenance, upgrades and change management
Design, build and test enhancements and solutions, as required for safety, quality, workflow, performance and usability as aligned with the Information Management strategic plan.
Maintain and enhance system e.g. order catalog, system access and view preferences .
Monitor and maintain data integrity, including analysis and trouble-shooting for problems that are detected.
Define security views for the various occupations.
Coordinate the processing, documentation and follow-up of required fixes, enhancements, testing and problem resolution
Function as a principal communication coordinator between end users, IT administrators, vendors and Directors in order to identify system needs, modifications and/or issues.
Possess knowledge and understanding of all relevant applications and interfaces
Configure non-production and production environments with the implementation new software, upgrades and installations
Create and execute test plans when implementing new systems to ensure safety, quality and reliability of applications in various test scenarios
Build databases, assist with programming interfaces, format screens and views and assist with the conversion of existing data where appropriate
Comply with departmental change control procedures
Assist in developing system policies and procedures
Maintain system documentation as required
Support the development of a system/upgrade rollout strategy as required.
3. Project implementations & Process Improvements Opportunities
Identify business requirements in collaboration with users, modeling work processes and information flows to meet in-scope requirements
Analyze current processes, utilizing systems methodology and building on any existing current state analysis documentation.
Evaluate available options, liaising with clients and vendors to complete milestones and resolve issues
Identify and highlight risks to patient safety, quality, resources, project timelines. Modify work processes to mitigate risks
Work in partnership with project manager to develop achievable milestones and timelines; monitor and ensure project timelines and goals are met
Work with end-users to determine reporting and auditing needs and develop tools to meet those needs
Actively participate in benefits measurements and quality assurance audit activities including assisting managers to develop measurement tools and reporting results to applicable groups
Acts as a change agent by identifying process improvement opportunities supporting patient focused care and optimum productivity.
Assess clinical area technology and information requirements.
Maintain a detailed understanding and working knowledge of Electronic Health Record systems, their functions and integration to other health based information systems
EDUCATION
University degree in IT, Engineering or a related field
5 years of relevant experience preferably within a Hospital environment; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 5 years experience in an IT related job with technical experience in problem solving and client technical support, directly related to software, preferably in a healthcare setting.
Demonstrated computer proficiency in Microsoft Office products including good working knowledge of MS Access, Excel and Visio.
Knowledge and experience of Hospital Information Systems; experience with Cerner preferred.
Demonstrated troubleshooting, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Flexible, organized and self-directed within scope of responsibility; has initiative and independent judgment.
Resourceful with demonstrated skills in facilitation, team work, leadership and process redesign.
Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills including the ability to express technical ideas in plain language.
Strong people skills, self-starter, motivated individual able to work with minimal supervision
Working knowledge and hands-on experience with relational databases.
Understanding of clinical and corporate data needs in a hospital setting.
Ability to interact with IS and hospital staff, outside suppliers and consultants as necessary.
Knowledge on data modelling techniques.
Provide evidence of ongoing education (e.g. workshops, seminars, etc.) and upgrading of technical skills and knowledge.
Ability to deal with stressful situations in a professional and courteous manner.
Good work attendance record required.
Must be available for on-call shifts.
All employees of Michael Garron Hospital (MGH), a division of Toronto East Health Network (TEHN) [formerly Toronto East General Hospital (TEGH)] agree to work within the legislated practices of the Occupational Health and Safety Act of Ontario.
All employees of MGH are responsible to contribute to a transparent culture of patient and staff safety by adhering to and abiding by patient and staff safety policies and procedures set by MGH.

Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

Job Description:
Sr. Technical Business Analyst
Req ID: 53294
Location: Toronto, CA
Title  Senior Technical Analyst
Location - Remote
Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) empowers the financial sector, with a focus on , to transform and become digital, innovative, and agile. Backed by 40 years of industry expertise, Sapiens offers a complete platform, with pre-integrated, solutions and a cloud-first approach that accelerates customers digital transformation. Serving more than 600 customers in 30 countries, Sapiens offers insurers across & Casualty,  Compensation and Life markets the most comprehensive set of solutions, from core to complementary, including , Financial & Compliance, Data & Analytics, Digital, and Decision Management. Sapiens team of more than 5,000 employees operates through our offices in North America, the UK, EMEA and Asia Pacific.

Job Description:
The Sr. Technical Analyst operates under limited supervision, conducts business process analysis, needs assessments, and preliminary cost/benefits analysis to align technology solutions with business initiatives. Develops business specifications for technical personnel. Conducts analysis of business goals, objectives, and needs of the business environment. Makes recommendations to improve business processes. Utilize systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective manner. May provide financial or operational business analysis and research to support business goals.

The Sr. Technical Analyst is accountable for understanding the business environment and processes to be able to derive practical business-system solutions as related to the specific goals of the project. The Technical Analyst must ensure that all aspects of the business need or problem are correctly reflected in the solution developed by the solutions team. The development and quality assurance teams will rely on the judgment and expertise of the Technical Analyst for all business process-related questions arising from the development work and subsequent testing.

Professional Responsibilities:
Uses sound judgment and experience to solve moderately complex business process problems or to propose solutions for these problems to Sapiens management and to clients
Applies industry knowledge and expertise to guide client in business and process decisions
Provide technical analysis to clients, third-parties, and various bureaus/external vendors.
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to the core system
Conduct initial and on-going set-ups of technical configurations
Map billing to client GL accounts and document required configurations to financials
Leads business process analysis, needs assessments and preliminary cost/benefits analysis to align IT solutions with business initiatives
Provide advice to internal and external software development personnel.
Defines and documents clear and concise business requirements that describe business scenarios and processes in language understandable to both technical and domain stakeholders
Assist clients with running, configuring, and troubleshooting batch issues and respond to clients on functionality and technical details.
Works with development and quality assurance teams to ensure a technically sound solution.
Provides input to and review of estimates at each phase of a project
Produces output documentation and provides guidance to users as appropriate
Performs analyst work related to more technical items such as interfaces and batch
Able to write simple database queries and update scripts to assist with more complex configuration, issue analysis and troubleshooting
Works as the liaison between client stakeholders, project team members, software engineers and quality assurance personnel
Facilitates or participates in periodic sales support: demonstrations, preparation of RFP response, gap analysis studies
Perform other duties as required.

Years of Experience:
3-5 years of business and/or technical analysis experience in the Workers Compensation industry and/or equivalent experience with other policy, claims or billing applications.

Skills and Knowledge:
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written and presentation skills
Ability to set, drive and achieve deliverables
Strong facilitation skills
Strong domain expertise in functional areas and lines of business relevant to Sapiens strategy such as workers comp claims and underwriting is desired.
Strong knowledge of Use Case modelling
A strong knowledge of the Workers Compensation insurance industry is desired.
Working knowledge of business modelling, requirements and analysis & design disciplines of overall iterative software development life cycle
Must demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate business concepts to both technical and end users
Must demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, MS Project, Visio)
Experience with relational databases (SQL Server and/or DB2)
Experience with XML for data presentation and communication.

Education/Certification/Training:
Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, computer science and/or related field; related work experience can be substituted for educational requirement

Career Opportunity
Role Title
Actuarial Analyst, BQR - 18 month contract
Purpose of role
Reporting to the Manager, Business Quality Review, this position is responsible for supporting the management of Business Quality Review process for Foresters Financial to proactively identify areas of improvement to increase the overall quality of our business and practices. The responsibilities of this role will range from administrative support, which includes communication with customer and distribution partner inquiries, planning and coordinating projects, reporting and metrics communications, to analyzing and synthesizing data from various sources to identify agents/advisors who may pose potential financial and/or reputational risk. The position will coordinate and execute the agreed upon mandate and escalation protocols of the Business Quality Review Process.
Job Description
Key responsibilities/accountabilities:
Respond promptly to customers and distribution partners emails, calls and inquiries, prioritizing urgency.
Attending meetings and taking minutes and follow up on action items.
Track, update and communicate regular and ad-hoc reporting and metrics.
Thoroughly manage investigation processes, collaborating with the SIU team, internal and external parties
Analyze and synthesize data from multiple red flags reporting, identifying poor business practices and potential inappropriate behavior.
Coordinate information related to potentially inappropriate agent behavior, including complaints, investigations, suspicious activity, and sales practices.
Analyze monthly business quality metrics to pinpoint areas requiring improvement.
Manage front-end guards and processes to proactively identify potential business quality concerns.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to expand the database, enhancing quality monitoring.
Support continuous improvements for the department, including but not limited to determining new business quality measures for different products, supporting post-launch monitoring, ensuring effective communication to the right stakeholders.
Key qualifications/competencies:
University degree in Actuarial Science, Math, Business, or related discipline.
1-3 years experience in an insurance/financial services organization.
Strong knowledge of the financial services industry, including financial products: life insurance, annuities, segregated funds, mutual funds.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel. VBA programming would be an asset.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience with data analysis is preferred.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills and high degree of independence and initiative.
Effective verbal and report writing communication skills.
Ability to work effectively with multiple stakeholders and influence without direct authority.
Actively pursuing actuarial designation and writing actuarial exams

Formed in 1997, the Travel Industry Council of Ontario (TICO) regulates Ontarios travel agencies, booking websites, and tour operators. TICO administers the Travel Industry Act, 2002 on behalf of the Ontario government.
As a consumer protection organization, TICO facilitates a consumer complaints process and administers the Ontario Travel Industry Compensation Fund. By booking travel with a TICO registered company, consumers have access to added protection.
At TICO, we are an organization that embraces inclusion and fairness. We are committed to fostering a culture of inclusivity, equity, and accessibility for all. As a team, we celebrate diversity in all its forms, while encouraging individual growth and innovation, because we feel it makes for an inspiring workplace where people are empowered and engaged.
This is a full-time position. TICO offers a hybrid working environment. The current expectation would be for the successful candidate to work onsite at TICOs office in Mississauga 1 or 2 days per week and offsite from home for the remainder of the week. TICOs typical working hours are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., though this role is flexible.
Job purpose
We are seeking a talented individual to join our team in the role of a Senior Data Analyst with expertise in process mapping. As part of this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing data pipelines, analyzing, and interpreting data, and mapping business processes to drive organizational efficiency and performance. This position offers a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of data engineering, analytics, and business process optimization.
The primary purpose of this position is to design, construct, maintain, and optimize the data pipelines and infrastructure necessary for data generation, storage, and processing. The position will be responsible for building and maintaining the architecture that allows for the ingestion, transformation, and secure storage of large volumes of data in various formats. Also, interpreting data to uncover insights and trends that can guide business decisions.
Key Competencies and Qualifications
The ideal candidate will be energetic, innovative, hard-working, and highly knowledgeable in Office 365 and other office applications such as Adobe Pro.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience (5 years) working as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Strong understanding of data architecture, database management, and data modeling principles.
Experience with data analysis tools and techniques, including SQL, Python, R, or MATLAB.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Knowledge of process mapping methodologies such as Six Sigma.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically with great attention to detail.
Strong communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Duties and responsibilities
The main responsibilities and duties may include but are not limited to:
Data Engineering:
Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from various sources into data lakes or warehouses.
Design and maintain data models that are optimized for performance, scalability, and flexibility.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security throughout the pipeline by implementing validation and error-handling mechanisms.
Data Analysis and Visualization:
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from multiple sources to extract insights and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and relationships in the data.
Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio to communicate findings effectively.
Translate data findings into actionable insights to support decision-making and business strategy.
Collect and organize data from internal and external sources, including databases, spreadsheets, APIs, and other data repositories.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency, resolving any discrepancies or errors in the data.
Data Interpretation and Insights:
Translate data findings into actionable insights and recommendations to support decision-making and business strategy.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders through written reports, presentations, or data storytelling sessions.
Continuously monitor and analyze data trends to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
Reporting, Dashboarding and Quality Assurance:
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics.
Automate data reporting processes using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and customize dashboards to meet their needs.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and reliability by implementing data quality checks and validation procedures.
Identify and address data quality issues, anomalies, and outliers to maintain data consistency and reliability.
Data Integration and APIs:
Develop APIs and data integration solutions to facilitate seamless data exchange between different systems and applications.
Security and Compliance:
Implement security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.
Establish and enforce data governance policies and procedures to maintain data privacy, integrity, and confidentiality.
Process Mapping and Optimization:
Document and map end-to-end business processes, workflows, and procedures within the organization.
Identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and opportunities for improvement in existing processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze process maps, gather requirements, and recommend solutions for process optimization.
Drive process improvement initiatives by implementing changes, monitoring performance, and measuring outcomes.
Collaboration and Communication:
Work closely with business stakeholders, and IT teams to understand data requirements and business objectives.
Communicate technical concepts and findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with team members to prioritize tasks, manage workload, and ensure timely delivery of projects.
Training and Documentation:
Maintain comprehensive documentation of all data design and configurations, customizations, and development processes.
Create user guides and training materials to support end-users.
Develop training materials and conduct training sessions for end-users on reports and dashboards.
Desired Skills:
Experience with machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Knowledge of database systems and data warehousing concepts.
Certification in relevant technologies or methodologies (e.g., Tableau Desktop Specialist, Google Analytics Individual Qualification
Working conditions
While the physical demands of the role are minimal for an office environment, the employee must be able to demonstrate and/or accept the following:
Sitting for extended periods.
Considerable amount of time spent at the computer.
Adhere to TICOs policies and the code of conduct.
The working conditions also encompass the overall corporate culture, which includes company values, management style, and the overall atmosphere in the workplace.
To apply
Please email your cover letter and resume to taramouni@tico.ca

Job Summary
Gather disparate data from various data sources, analyzes and normalizes the data to ensure quality of data for analysis. Responsible for providing consistent, relevant and accurate data as well as guidance/knowledge of the data and definitions that are available for analysis. A pricing analyst is responsible for analyzing competitor pricing matched with market expectations to determine the ideal target price for products of the business. Duties include providing thorough analytical breakdowns of pricing structures and sales funnels of similar competitor products and services and identifying specific strategies used in pricing models of the same. Report to evaluate the findings and to propose the results to the relevant departments for effect. A bachelor's degree in business or a related field is often required to be a pricing analyst. Specialization and experience in the field, it is typical that pricing analysts possess strong working experience in the industry as a pricing analyst or in another relevant position dealing with competitor pricing and sales.
Major Tasks, Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities
Forecasting revenue and market share based on market trends, production costs, profit margins, and sales volumes.
Serves as a resource to assigned client in area of expertise.
Gathers and compiles raw data; conducts research for industry trends and benchmarks; and normalizes data to be incorporated into a centralized data format.
Identify ideal pricing structures and sales funnels
Analyzes, reports, makes comparisons to industry/company benchmarks, determines trends, and prepares cost analyses.
Defines data definitions and documents data limitations.
Tracking customer engagement to develop effective pricing strategies for products and offerings.
Scope out opportunities based on market trends and industry condition
Applying statistical modeling methods to determine the potential impact of pricing strategies on profitability.
Prepares spreadsheets for data analysis; prepare reports with charts and graphs, mailing lists, maps and ad hoc requests. May make presentations.
Provides recommendations based on findings and analysis; provides input on policies and procedures.
Analyzing competitor pricing and market trends to increase market share and profitability.
Assessing data from a variety of sources to gain insights into pricing strategies and market trends.
Keeping informed on pricing analysis methods and industry trends.
Nature and Scope
Demonstrates skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data.
Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual, complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by a supervisor and/or direct customers of the process.
May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support or professional personnel.
Work Environment
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.
Education and Experience
Typically requires BS/BA in a related discipline. Generally 5-8 years of experience in a related field OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in a related field. Certification is required in some areas
Proficiency in business intelligence (BI) software, such as Sisense and InetSoft Style Intelligence.
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
Extensive experience in analyzing pricing strategies and forecasting revenue and market share.
Experience in collaborating on pricing strategies with sales and marketing departments.
Ability to keep abreast of industry trends and develop dynamic pricing tools.
Advanced ability to present pricing analysis reports to relevant stakeholders.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.

POSITION OVERVIEW
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Real Estate Business Analyst to join our Real Estate Team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for mapping, analyzing socioeconomic and demographic data, and providing strategic insights to assist in locating optimal store placements for our retail business.

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategic decision-making and thrive in a collaborative team environment, we encourage you to apply for the Real Estate Business Analyst position. This role offers the opportunity to make a measurable impact on our retail expansion efforts and contribute to the overall success of our Team.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze market trends, socioeconomic data, and demographic information to assist in identifying potential locations for retail stores.
Conduct feasibility studies and site evaluations to determinate viability and suitability of potential store locations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Sales, HR, Finance and Wholesale to develop comprehensive business strategies to ensure successful store openings (i.e. securing of staff).
Utilize GIS software and other mapping tools to visualize data and generate reports for decision-making purposes.
Conduct competitive analysis to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities in the retail landscape.
Support the further development of site selection criteria and scoring models to prioritize potential locations based on strategic objectives.
Assist in the development of financial models and business cases to evaluate the estimated profitability of potential store openings.
Monitor industry trends and stay abreast of market developments to assist in providing recommendations for optimizing store networks.
Assist in preparing presentations and reports to communicate findings and recommendations to senior management.
Take on ad-hoc responsibilities and assist with other areas of real estate operations, such as leasing activities, project management tasks, and property portfolio management as needed. This may include supporting lease negotiations, coordinating with external vendors and contractors, and contributing to the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the Real Estate Team.
Other duties as assigned to fulfill business objectives and the requirements of the role.
Position Requirements

Education:

University/College Degree in Business Administration, Real Estate, Geography or a related field.


Previous Experience

3-5 years of experience in mapping and data analysis, preferably in a real estate or retail setting.


Required Skills
Proficiency in GIS Software and mapping tools like ArcGIS, Easy Territory and Maptitude, as well as Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw actionable insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical information clear and concisely
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data analysis and reporting
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Quick learner and flexible with the ability to adapt to change
Understanding real estate principles and market dynamics is highly desirable

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether youve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or youre looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

The Energy Analyst will join JLLs Sustainable Operation team, to support the delivery of energy and sustainability products and services to a range of clients. The primary focus of this position is to support clients' annual reporting of carbon emissions and projects related to carbon savings. These include:
Reporting generate portfolio reports using the JLL sustainability technology tool and landlord consumption data. The reports may address respective issues regarding energy trends, data quality control, savings progress, and portfolio-wide summaries
Provide support for energy/sustainability projects development
Communicating directly with facility managers and landlords to verify the data
Maintain completeness and accuracy of utility data, property data, etc. in databases to ensure consistency and accuracy of reporting

WHAT YOULL BE DOING/WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU/WHAT YOULL DO

Supporting data analysis and reporting to produce energy, environmental, and sustainability reports for both internal and external stakeholders.
Energy Analysis analyze properties within the portfolio for trends and anomalies in energy consumption
Identifying anomalies and performing a gap analysis of the energy & sustainability data and working with clients to include corrective actions, including measures that improve the efficiency of data capture.
Undertaking data analysis to identify trends and opportunities for operational improvement and potential cost reduction.
Liaising with a team both internally and externally to support client Energy and Sustainability objectives
Resolve utility account issues by working with utility companies and bill processing firms
Participate in energy team process improvement projects and energy training sessions
Assists support for applications for incentives and grant programs, as required, for the projects.
Assists prepare audit reports that include the results of the energy analysis or suggestions regarding energy cost savings

WHAT YOU BRING/ WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE TABLE/WHAT WERE LOOKING FOR
University Degree (Science, engineering, math or related fields)
Proficient in using MS Excel, Tableau, and Smartsheet to combine and analyze data from various sources and generate reports and graphics. Must be able to combine large volumes of data for consolidated reporting.
Ability to perform data analysis and identify the gaps and trends in data
Detail-oriented with excellent time management and follow-through.
Ability to communicate effectively and provide a detailed or brief explanation of the data analysis results
Basic understanding of HVAC, HVAC control, and building energy systems
Familiar with Energy Audits and Recommissioning
Basic understanding of Green House Gas Emission calculations
Familiarity with sustainability-related certification and benchmarking tools
Bilingual -English and Spanish is a great asset but not mandatory

What you can expect from us

Youll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together  across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits, and pay. Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sight and imagine where JLL can take you.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you dont meet all of the requirements below. Were interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.

About JLL 

Were JLLa leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. Thats why were committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. Were using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and were honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where were headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

Position Title: Bilingual Supply Chain Replenishment Analyst
Requisition ID: 37274
Career Group (ADSP): Distribution Center
Division: Supply Chain (80190525)
Department: Logistics and Distribution
Work Location: METRO ON - 5559 DUNDAS STREET W (#A-DUND)
Province: Canada : Ontario
Position Type: Permanent

Joining our team has its advantages:
Telecommuting in hybrid mode
Group insurance from the first day
Very competitive pension plan
Generous holiday policy
Personal days
Employee Assistance Program
Free parking
Opportunity for professional development

Are you passionate about hunting for the best solution? Do you have an eye for spotting trends and opportunities? Are you looking to develop your career and skills in a position where you are challenged to produce tangible results and make a difference? At Metro, we are growing every day! Join us as we embark on a transformational journey and be part of the pioneer team leading our supply chain modernization.

Its a great time to join our team! You'll have the unique opportunity to:
Work with a variety of systems and across multiple disciplines.
Experience and deploy cutting-edge technologiesincluding digital solutions, advanced analytics, artificial intelligence
Join a dynamic team on the path to forging and initiating the best supply chain integrated solution for our business

SUMMARY:
As part of the Metro Supply Chain Modernization initiative, the replenishment analyst stands at the crossroad between Merchandising, Store Operations, Replenishment and Distribution Centres teams. This is a crucial cross-functional role responsible for managing, optimizing and execution of the replenishment strategy for store fulfillment.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:
Release, complement and monitor system-generated purchase orders for stores, using the SAP sales forecast tool
Ensure healthy store inventory levels and forecasts, reflecting proper seasonality /promotions / cannibalizations / halo effects
Collaborate with and provide replenishment expertise to cross-functional teams, merchandising, store operations and logistics
Act as primary contact for store operations regarding inventory, ordering and product flow
Be at the centre stage of forecasts, flows, targets and the link connecting the dots between our Transport, Distribution Centres, Replenishment and Store Operations teams
Use your inquisitive and analytic mind to showcase opportunities for improvement to various levels of the organization, including senior management

QUALIFICATIONS:
1-3 years of analytical experience (ideally in a Grocery Retail Environment) with emphasis on inventory management
University Degree in Business/Engineering/Marketing/Economics
Intermediate or advanced proficiency in Excel and/or SQL Server/Postgre SQL
Good analytical skills and an eye for pointing trends, areas of improvement, and recommendations out of various data sources.
Good communication and collaboration skills
Strong customer focus, business acumen and a result-oriented attitude
Ability to work with limited supervision and a talent for managing competing and shifting priorities
Bilingual in French/English is a must
SAP knowledge would be an asset
Python knowledge would be an asset
Rotating weekend/holiday schedule as necessary
Occasional travel within the Ontario or Quebec provinces to stores/warehouses/head office

Job Summary
Analyzes information technology (IT) requirements in business processes, through requirements elicitation, solutions identification, risk analysis and collaboration across (IT) teams. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.
Job Description
Key Skills Required
Relevant Business Systems Analyst experience in a large-scale banking context (6 or more years of relevant experience in this role).
Strong Market Risk management knowledge (CFA/ FRM/ PRMIA certified)
should have executed projects in Market Risk Management business functions.
Must have strong understanding of banking products (wholesale and retail) and risk. Essential (especially Fixed Income, Money Market and Equities)
Analysis, data mapping and reporting
Must have SQL skills (ability to read and write queries for data handling, differences in joins, etc.)
Analytical thinking skills
Ability to gather functional business process requirements and contribute to translating user requests into technical specifications.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience in Agile working teams
Key Roles and Responsibility
Conduct user story workshops and prioritize user stories based on business value and feasibility.
Work closely with the development, vendor, and Test Manager team to conduct frequent testing and quality assurance activities during each sprint.
Prioritize and manage changes to the product backlog based on business value and impact.
Support Architects and Dev teams in designing and implementing technical solutions
Support PMs, Product Owners and Scrum Masters in planning and executing projects
Continuously analyze and document requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria in a product backlog
Collaborate with developers to write user stories and acceptance criteria in a clear and concise manner.

Provide training and support to end-users during each sprint as new features are released.

About Us
We are looking for a Consultant Marketing Analytics & Insights to join our Marketing Analytics and Insights team for a period of 15 months. This role will provide campaign and consulting services to serve marketing lines of business (LOB) and other functional areas achieve their business objectives including acquisition, retention, sales, customer engagement. We regret that those without SAS and SQL experience will not be considered for the role.
Who we are
As Canada's largest automobile association, we are passionate about keeping our Members safe- whether they are on the road, at home, or travelling abroad. Meeting the diverse needs of our two-million Members requires high performing, forward thinking, and innovative people who work collaboratively to keep propelling our business forward. Life at CAA Club Group is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development- and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. CAA Club Group (CCG) is known for providing stellar emergency roadside assistance to our motoring Members and non-Members. We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it.
Position Details
What you will do:
Maintain the Marketing Analytics Datamart including data daily refresh and monthly rollups. Ensure data accuracy and data integrity.
Identify data/process issues, notify the impacts to both internal team members and external clients in a timely manner and assist problem solving.
Develop and maintain robust and user-friendly Power BI reports/dashboards for marketing data performance tracking.
Participate in User Acceptance Test and data QA. On behalf of Marketing, act as the Subject Matter Expert in data, system and platform new launch and/or upgrade.
Ensure all campaign data transfers follow the standards. Identify opportunities of streamlining and automating data transfers to improve efficiency.
Assist the Unit Manager of Marketing Data & Analytics in data exploration, preparation, interpretation and integration of both internal and external data to meet ever-growing business needs.
Facilitate marketing LOBs in the adoption and implementation of customer segmentation, marketing predictive models and analytical tools built by the team. Being an advocator and facilitator of the member-centric strategy.
Assist the Unit Manager to partner with various analytics teams across the organization and stay abreast of latest data trends.
Who You Are :
Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Engineering or Commerce.
5+ years of analytics experience in database marketing, marketing data governance, campaign management, hypothesis testing and experimental design.
5+ years of marketing analytics experience in retail, travel, insurance, CRM or loyalty.
SAS Certified Advanced Programmer (SAS 9).
5+ years of SAS/SQL programming with large database.
Highly collaborative with excellent communication and story-telling skills  a true bridge between data and business.
5+ years of BI reporting and visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau.
Knowledge of predictive modeling is an asset.
Our Commitment
We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). CAA CCG will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Pricing Analyst (Full Time) - Brampton, ON
24000331

Linde is a leading global industrial gases and engineering company with 2022 sales of $33 billion. We live our mission of making our world more productive every day by providing high-quality solutions, technologies and services which are making our customers more successful and helping to sustain and protect our planet.
The company serves a variety of end markets including chemicals & refining, food & beverage, electronics, healthcare, manufacturing and primary metals. Linde's industrial gases are used in countless applications, from life-saving oxygen for hospitals to high-purity & specialty gases for electronics manufacturing, hydrogen for clean fuels and much more. Linde also delivers state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support customer expansion, efficiency improvements and emissions reductions.
For more information about the company and its products and services, please visit www.linde.com.
At Linde, every day is an opportunity: an opportunity to learn, to grow, to share success and to contribute to one of the worlds leading industrial gas and engineering companies. Seize the opportunity: take your next step with us and join our team.
Pricing Analyst (Full Time) - Brampton, ON
The Pricing Analyst will be a member of the Pricing & Data Maintenance team within Corporate Finance, working closely with key stakeholders from within the business. In this role, the Pricing Analyst will be responsible to identify, develop, maintain and support best in class solutions that optimize operating profits.

Key Accountabilities:
Manage national and local price actions. This includes communication, file preparation, consolidation, and implementation into JD Edwards.
Map existing work processes to identify pricing opportunities.
Participate in the technical design and development of existing and new applications to improve the pricing process efficiency.
Generate analytics on performance, identifying problems, and initiating process improvement suggestions.
Deliver monthly reporting to track and report on KPIs, providing insight on change.
Comply with all Linde standards, policies, and procedures.
The successful candidate will be exposed to multiple functions within Canada. The candidate must have strong communication skills, business acumen, and be comfortable working with senior regional management, sales directors, logistics/operations, and product management. This person must be capable of performing P&L variance analysis, as well as understanding product distribution and logistics. The candidate should be comfortable reading contracts, using Linde data systems, and developing spreadsheets and business intelligence tools.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, Computer Engineering, or related field.
Knowledge and understanding of accounting and finance principles.
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, SharePoint, MS Access, SQL, Python, R, and aptitude to learn other apps.
Passion and enthusiasm for new technologies.
Strong problem solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to build rapport, communicate, and partner with internal business colleagues.
Superior verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills.
Able to travel up to 25%.
Experience working in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
SQL and Python knowledge.
Microsoft Power Platform experience.
Advanced MS Access skills.

Who we are:

Geotab  is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified Great Place to Work. We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotabs open platform and Geotab Marketplace , offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and were looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what its like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

Who you are:

We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Lead People Data Analyst who will be responsible for advanced HR data analysis, providing strategic insights through reports and tools to optimize our workforce, enable data-driven HR strategies and elevate business decisions.


What youll do:

In this role you will manage the design, development, and maintenance of on-going measurement systems, metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to steer key business decisions. As a Lead, you will provide technical leadership and mentorship to our Data & Analytics team within People Operations, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and utilizing advanced analytical techniques to extract actionable insights.
How youll make an impact:
Guide and mentor people analysts, through coaching, technical expertise, and helping them develop advanced analytical skills and a deep understanding of HR practices
Oversee the design and delivery of measurement systems, reports, tools and insights, analyzing workforce metrics.
Lead the collection, analysis, and interpretation of complex HR data, including comprehensive workforce analytics, and in-depth studies to support strategic decision-making.
Provide senior management with high-level insights into HR trends, patterns, influencing workforce planning, organizational development, and overall business strategies
Responsible for data analysis and interpretation by conducting advanced data analysis using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights, trends, and prepare recommendations through data-driven storytelling for key stakeholders.
Running recurring HR reports and performing strong validations to make sure accurate data is being provided. Reports include but not limited to the following:
Monthly Board Reporting requirements
Statistics Canada and other government reports
Demographic reports
Talent Acquisition data and reporting
Running quality analysis reports to ensure the data entry is entered accurately in the HR system
Lead special analytical projects that contribute to HR's strategic goals and enhance our understanding of workforce dynamics
Lead the refinement and elaboration of data processes, ensuring the availability of accurate and reliable HR data to empower informed decision-making
Act as the definitive subject matter expert for technical matters, data integrity inquiries, and methodologies, providing insightful guidance for People Analysts and stakeholders.
What youll bring to this role:
8- 10 years of technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and process automation
8- 10 years of experience using analytics tools and software (Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, Google Big Query, Superset, etc.)
8- 10 years of experience as a Senior People/HR Analyst, Senior Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or a similar role. Experience working within a technical or engineering organization, with knowledge of the high-technology industry is an asset
Human Resources Management degree, certification or diploma(asset)
Equivalent combination of education and/or work experience in related field may be substituted
Proficiency coding in SQL, GBQ and AppScript/JavaScript, familiarity with Python an asset
Deep understanding of data mining, data pipelines, and the Google Cloud Platform
Strong and compelling storytelling abilities to communicate complex findings/data to a diverse audience
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics
Strong problem solving abilities and attention to detail with accuracy
Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
Strong project management skills; able to identify needs, develop effective solutions, and manage projects through to completion
Must stay relevant to technology and should have the flexibility to adapt to the growing technology and market demands
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to problem solve well-judged decisions
Strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the business
Strong organizational skills and ability to work simultaneously on several projects
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

At Geotab, we have adopted a flexible first working model in that we have systems, functions, programs and policies in place to support both in-person and virtual work. However, you are welcomed and encouraged to come into our beautiful, safe, clean offices as often as you like. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!

Join the Renewed Seneca, The Next Seneca.
Guided by The Next - A Strategic Plan for Seneca Polytechnic , we offer a working environment that is innovative, flexible and encourages risk-taking. Joining Seneca Polytechnic brings opportunities for professional development and career growth. We focus on health and wellbeing in all its forms to provide a great employee experience.
Position Summary
Provides Seneca Polytechnics (ITS, administration, and faculty) with analysis and profile information related to technology and organizational landscape that involves trends, performance improvement, and data analysis.
Responsible for the design and implementation of database structures, policies and procedures. Manages business intelligence resources and services and ensures data quality. Supporting client needs, builds extract, transform and load tools to design, develop and implement data repositories and subsets of production setups.
Responsibilities
Development

Conduct analysis and planning for business application requirements and user needs. Design, architect, and develop Business Intelligence repositories.
Design and develop the analytical cube, analysis measures and KPIs.
Extract data from multiple internal and external sources. Builds databases and data marts according to the project needs. Develops associated table relationships, queries and cubes.
Developed solutions are extensively tested and validated.
Based on design requirements, build metrics and measurement tools such as scorecards, dashboards, reports and drill downs.
Guide intermediate BI Analyst on report development, problem solving and instructions on the ETL process.
Support
Lead BI initiatives from planning to deployment and provides support throughout the products lifecycle.
Troubleshoots BI related issues, performance tuning as needed.
Conduct database services and data integrity analysis, data quality assessment reporting.
Lead training sessions with the user clients.
Strategy, Planning & Projects
BI Analyst will design software solutions and systems involved with internal and external data sources based on business needs designed by the client.
Designs the process of collecting artifacts using methods such as questionnaires, interviews, or observations, designing content specific reports and database structures.
Evaluates database, data warehouse, data mart components that may include relational DB systems, ETL services, metadata, and DB designs related to BI requirements.
Works with Project Manager leader to ensure data is effectively collected and tagged.
Install service pack updates, system upgrades and applies required custom changes.
Qualifications
Education
Minimum (3) three-year Diploma/Degree in Computer Science, Business Technology Management, Information Technology, Data Base and Knowledge Management, or related field.

Experience

Minimum 5 years of business intelligence and data warehouse experience as a Systems Analyst in a complex integrated enterprise systems environment.
Strong experience with business intelligence and data warehouse design principles and industry best practices.
System enhancement, upgrade, release planning and execution experience.
Experience in data mining techniques and procedures.
Experience with Tableau, PeopleSoft, SQL and ETL tools (such as Alteryx) is preferred.
Understanding of machine learning concepts a preference.
Skills
Leadership skills
Proficiency in understanding and interpreting data, as well as in analysis, manipulating data, visualizing data and building predictive models.
Proven analytical, organizational and interpretive skills
Project lifecycle management abilities
Strong communication skills including presentation, written and oral

Supply Chain Analyst
Date: Mar 7, 2024
Location: Toronto, Canada, Ontario, M1B2K9
Company: Teva Pharmaceuticals
Job Id: 54123
Who we are
Together, were on a mission to make good health more affordable and accessible, to help millions around the world enjoy healthier lives. Its a mission that bonds our people across nearly 60 countries and a rich, diverse variety of nationalities and backgrounds. Working here means working with the worlds leading manufacturer of generic medicines, and the proud producer of many of the products on the World Health Organizations Essential Medicines List. Today, at least 200 million people around the world take one of our medicines every single day. An amazing number, but were always looking for new ways to continue making a difference, and new people to make a difference with.
The opportunity
The Supply Chain Analyst III is responsible for the CDN Supply Plan supplied by affiliates and vendors within the product portfolio. This position will work closely with the various countries, site, regional and global functional groups of Sales, Marketing, Quality, Regulatory, Finance and Procurement to ensure effectiveness of the Supply Chain Processes in meeting overall service, inventory and cost objectives.
How youll spend your day
Execute the monthly development of the CDN Finished Goods and bulk supply plan to exceed customer service and inventory metrics targets.
Work collaboratively with both Demand Planning and Suppliers to manage changes in either demand or supply developing clear and effective communications
Manage ERP system relative to Planning, Inventory and Purchasing parameters as well as Purchase orders
Accountable for reporting on defined performance metrics and resolved root causes and or mitigation strategies
Liaise with cross functional teams to coordinate bulk deliveries from internal and external supply sites for packaging to support customer service and inventory metrics for CA.
Managing inventory levels to maintain desired Commercial customer service levels needs for existing and new products
Actively participate in new product introduction, bids/tenders, and product transfer teams to ensure supply plans are developed, communicated and executed in support of the project timelines.
Maintains inventory at optimum levels via routine review of planning parameters.
Actively confirm suppliers delivery on purchase orders.
Review MRP exception messages & alerts daily and take action as required.
Escalate issues to Supply Chain Manager as appropriate.
Drives long-term supply chain strategy development and implementation in alignment with Teva Global Operations (TGO), business, and functional strategy goals.
Drive to meet critical targets for AOP, Customer Service Level (CSL)/ On Time in Full (OTIF), Inventory, Short-Date, and Backorder/OOS.
Follows Teva Safety, Health, and Environmental policies and procedures.
Other projects and duties as required/assigned
Your experience and qualifications
Bachelors Degree from an accredited University or College; APICS or equivalent certification preferred
3+ years of Supply Chain Planning experience with a demonstrated knowledge of Supply Chain concepts and "Best Practices" is required
Preferred experience: Experience with SAP ECC/ SAP APO/ SAP BI.
Specific experience in the areas of Supply Planning, Materials Management, Inventory Management, Demand Planning and Sales / Operations Planning.
Experience in implementing Supply Chain Planning Execution Systems and Processes within an ERP environment, including design and implementation.
Possesses strong interpersonal skills and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Experience in office package : Word, Power point, and specially Excel: Pivot tables, filters, formulas, data modeling required
Strategic and financial mindset, fast learner, curious and interested in growing and develop career to the next level

You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site
The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.

Requisition ID: 194099
Tangerine is Canadas leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. Its important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

The Manager, Business Intelligence will be accountable for delivery of business intelligence and data analytics at Tangerine. Using analytics tools such as GCP Big Query, SQL, VBA, SSRS, SAS, Python, Google Analytics 4 and Looker/Google Data Studio this role will access a wide range of sophisticated data sources to uncover insights and support various business initiatives. The incumbent will work collaboratively with various business partners to drive objectives including profitable portfolio growth, increase of primary customer base and other related bank strategies.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

Accountability 1  Data Analytics and Visualization

Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (eg. GCP BQ, SQL, Python) to access Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and other platforms
Perform complex analysis and reporting, including interactive dashboards, regular reports and ad-hoc requests as required
Lead the adoption of visualization tool such as Looker/Google Data Studio or SSRS as the primary delivery method to enable user interaction and data exploration
Provide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in Marketing, Product, Channels, CX, and external stakeholders for compliance
Provide strategic analysis that will assist the business to optimize existing accounts and product mix from various channels, grow primary customer
Effectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and possible external partners.

Accountability 2  Processes Improvement

Design and create new data cubes and interactive dashboards that support distributed analytics model
Manage, update and maintain of internal data cubes for consumption of internal analytics peers
Document existing processes and work flows, and look for opportunities to optimize and automate work stream
Collaborate with partners and stakeholders to consolidate, streamline and improve existing reports to new standards, migrate reports and dashboards
Collaborate with analytics peers and data infrastructure groups across the bank on data initiatives such as platform migration and new data source ingestion
Coach and provide knowledge transfer to new team members
Onboard to potential new data platforms and receptive to other analytics tools such as Python, Vertex AI, Google Analytics 4, etc.

Accountability 3  Business Impact

Support the development and implementation of long-term data and analytics strategy that move towards high degree of automation
Act as the advocate of Tangerine to showcase analytics solutions and dashboards that helps business partners to gain insight, build business cases
Acquire and enhance knowledge in technical areas, product strategies, competitive practices, market insights to continuously improve analytics value
Act as a data stakeholder and participate in project requirements gathering and in data governance activities to ensure high data quality standards

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? Wed love to work with you if you have experience with some of all of the following:

5+ years of analytical / BI experience required
2+ years of experience in financial industry
Demonstrated expertise in one or more of following GCP, Big Query, Looker, SQL, VBA, SAS, Python, GA4
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, Finance or Business
Strong in prioritizing, planning, requirement gathering, data analyzing and presentation skill
Strong communication skills and relationship building skills with internal partners
Experienced with Excel pivot table and MS Office
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, Finance or Business
Demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
Proven ability to work independently and with other groups in a professional and productive manner

Supply Chain Analyst
Date: Mar 7, 2024
Location: Toronto, Canada, Ontario, M1B2K9
Company: Teva Pharmaceuticals
Job Id: 54123
Who we are
Together, were on a mission to make good health more affordable and accessible, to help millions around the world enjoy healthier lives. Its a mission that bonds our people across nearly 60 countries and a rich, diverse variety of nationalities and backgrounds. Working here means working with the worlds leading manufacturer of generic medicines, and the proud producer of many of the products on the World Health Organizations Essential Medicines List. Today, at least 200 million people around the world take one of our medicines every single day. An amazing number, but were always looking for new ways to continue making a difference, and new people to make a difference with.
The opportunity
The Supply Chain Analyst III is responsible for the CDN Supply Plan supplied by affiliates and vendors within the product portfolio. This position will work closely with the various countries, site, regional and global functional groups of Sales, Marketing, Quality, Regulatory, Finance and Procurement to ensure effectiveness of the Supply Chain Processes in meeting overall service, inventory and cost objectives.
How youll spend your day
Execute the monthly development of the CDN Finished Goods and bulk supply plan to exceed customer service and inventory metrics targets.
Work collaboratively with both Demand Planning and Suppliers to manage changes in either demand or supply developing clear and effective communications
Manage ERP system relative to Planning, Inventory and Purchasing parameters as well as Purchase orders
Accountable for reporting on defined performance metrics and resolved root causes and or mitigation strategies
Liaise with cross functional teams to coordinate bulk deliveries from internal and external supply sites for packaging to support customer service and inventory metrics for CA.
Managing inventory levels to maintain desired Commercial customer service levels needs for existing and new products
Actively participate in new product introduction, bids/tenders, and product transfer teams to ensure supply plans are developed, communicated and executed in support of the project timelines.
Maintains inventory at optimum levels via routine review of planning parameters.
Actively confirm suppliers delivery on purchase orders.
Review MRP exception messages & alerts daily and take action as required.
Escalate issues to Supply Chain Manager as appropriate.
Drives long-term supply chain strategy development and implementation in alignment with Teva Global Operations (TGO), business, and functional strategy goals.
Drive to meet critical targets for AOP, Customer Service Level (CSL)/ On Time in Full (OTIF), Inventory, Short-Date, and Backorder/OOS.
Follows Teva Safety, Health, and Environmental policies and procedures.
Other projects and duties as required/assigned
Your experience and qualifications
Bachelors Degree from an accredited University or College; APICS or equivalent certification preferred
3+ years of Supply Chain Planning experience with a demonstrated knowledge of Supply Chain concepts and "Best Practices" is required
Preferred experience: Experience with SAP ECC/ SAP APO/ SAP BI.
Specific experience in the areas of Supply Planning, Materials Management, Inventory Management, Demand Planning and Sales / Operations Planning.
Experience in implementing Supply Chain Planning Execution Systems and Processes within an ERP environment, including design and implementation.
Possesses strong interpersonal skills and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Experience in office package : Word, Power point, and specially Excel: Pivot tables, filters, formulas, data modeling required
Strategic and financial mindset, fast learner, curious and interested in growing and develop career to the next level
