About the role
The Performance Measures Analyst supports the Branch Management Team with operational processes required for the Branchs overall effectiveness and efficiency for ongoing operational performance in accordance with MNOs strategic goals. This position will provide support to branches and regions responsible for the management of the budgets to ensure the contract objectives are met as it relates to performance measurements, quality control and reporting. The Performance Measures Analyst will monitor program financials, program administrative data, and reporting consistent with the funder expectations and MNO standards. This position will work directly with the Branch Director and management team to identify and mitigate performance risk, identify service and spending trends, and create plans to adapt, as necessary, to protect the interest of the MNO and its programs and best utilize its funding. In addition, this position is accountable for the management of key stakeholder files and invoices.
What you will be doing
Support the definition and oversight of performance measures and/or accountability frameworks to ensure the funding directives are met in accordance with funding agreements and MNO standards.
Contribute to project planning, budgeting and forecasting in compliance with funding contracts, and overall Branch operational plans.
Analyze key funding activities and interpret the program data and financial spending to identify trends and make recommendations for future services, programs, and systems improvements.
Generate comprehensive reports using program qualitative and quantitative data for both internals and external use.
Complete program evaluation with the support of the Management and provide recommendations for improvement and/or insights to optimize performance.
Participate in the development and implementation of operational policies and procedures.
Maintain accurate records, including financial, contracts deliverables, reporting, and adhere to funding deadlines.
Provide operational support such as liaising with stakeholders, setting up service agreements, tracking timelines, etc.
Maintain project contracts and financials, ensuring complete and proper backup/audit documentation.
Analyze, manage and assist in the coordination and delivery complex multifaceted special projects or events within the Branch.
Assist with managing/monitoring special project budget(s) including the creation and maintenance of financial spreadsheets.
Assist with the creation and implementation of onboarding materials for new hires.
Provide support to the Director and Program Managers as needed.
Other duties as reasonably assigned.
Qualifications
Strong desire to act in the service of the Mtis Citizens, to advance and uphold rights and culture
A post-secondary degree or certification in a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience
A high degree of technology literacy and proficiency in MS Office applications and standard office equipment
Advanced communication skills, both written and verbal
Superior organization skills and time/priority management, managing others, including the design and implementation of project work plans
Elevated levels of problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to motivate, lead and work effectively with others in a supervisory capacity
Demonstrated understanding of policies, processes, practices, and documentation used to deliver program services or the Branch mandate
Post-secondary education in Business or a related field (equivalent combination of experience and education may be considered).
3-5 years experience in monitoring, tracking, and reporting on financial performance measures.
Extensive knowledge of budget creation, analysis, and forecasting.
General knowledge of fund accounting.
Knowledge of performance measures, financial modelling, and data analysis methods.
Demonstrated analytical and evaluative skills to assess compliance and accountability.
Demonstrated analytical, research and problem-solving skills to identify, analyze and recommend solutions to complex or contentious program issues.
Strong skills in Microsoft Suite  particularly Excel.
Strong communication skills  verbal and written.
Preferred
Knowledge of Mtis-specific and broader Indigenous key challenges and programs and services available to address them.
A post-secondary degree, certification or courses in business, accounting or statistics.
Previous 5-7 years or more experience in a similar/comparable role
Bilingualism is an asset
Business or Accounting designation achieved or in progress is an asset

Who we are:

Geotab  is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified Great Place to Work. We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotabs open platform and Geotab Marketplace , offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and were looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what its like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

Who you are:

We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Senior Data Analyst, ITS who will create compelling and original content (blogs, white papers, articles, presentations, etc.) for Geotabs Intelligent Transportations Systems (ITS) division. If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader  we would love to hear from you!

What you'll do:

The Senior Data Analyst, ITS uncover trends, patterns, and insights that will focus peoples attention on the key value of Geotab ITS data. This person will be a crucial component to drive Geotabs thought leadership related to smart cities and intelligent transportation. To be successful in this role you will be a self-starter and problem solver with strong written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to quickly understand complex, technical concepts.
How youll make an impact:
Examine large data sets to identify trends, develop charts, and create visual presentations to help businesses make more strategic decisions.
Apply statistical methods toward data validation of Geotab aggregate traffic-related data against third-party data sources
Utilize statistical tools to interpret data sets and prepare reports and technical papers that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions based on relevant findings.
Write SQL queries to find answers to complex business questions.
Identify any data quality issues and partialities in data acquisition.
Coordinate with engineering teams to gather incremental new data.
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis.
Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop customer segmentation.
Work with data scientists and leverage machine learning models that have been developed against Geotabs big data environment.
What youll bring to this role:
Post-secondary Degree/Diploma specialization in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
5-8 years experience as a Data Analyst or a similar role.
5-8 years experience with SQL.
5-8 years experience with data science tools (e.g. Python, Pandas, NumPy) as well as BI tools such as Superset/Redash/PowerBI or tableau.
Experience working with big data and an understanding of techniques used to extract value out of very large datasets.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts is an asset.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem solve well-judged decisions.
Strategic mindset, with a keen sense of priorities, along with an ability to pivot as the landscape changes.
Strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the organization.
Technical competence using software programs, including but not limited to, Google Suite for business (Sheets, Docs, Slides).
Strong communications and creativity skills with the ability to link data insights to marketing initiatives and use data to tell a story.
Knowledge and experience with smart cities, transportation analytics.
Proven experience in data cleaning, with the ability to identify, analyze, and interpret inconsistencies or inaccuracies in data.
Strong critical thinking abilities, with experience leveraging data to make well-informed recommendations and decisions.
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

OVERVIEW
The Business Systems Analyst, in partnership with other members of the Information technology team, is responsible for system maintenance, project implementations and end user support within the
Electronic Health Record for applications including patient registration and scheduling, clinical documentation (Physician, Nursing and Allied), order entry and results reporting.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. User Support
- Provide end-user support - working with members of the Information Technology team as well as vendors to identify and resolve issues and provide system enhancements in relation to application software. Maintain communication with all parties until a satisfactory resolution is reached
Responsible for ongoing support and application availability, including liaison with internal and external support
Set up and modification of user accounts and profiles
Possess the ability to assess system and application problems quickly and provide solutions in a timely manner.
Actively working with the rest of the department in meeting service level agreement targets and reporting requirements
Provides proactive support to users of Cerner including but not limited to training/education in order to ensure appropriate, effective usage and understanding of the application.
Provide after-hours Clinician support on a rotational basis
Assist in educating and communicating with internal and external clients regarding the change of processes and policies
2. Application build, maintenance, upgrades and change management
Design, build and test enhancements and solutions, as required for safety, quality, workflow, performance and usability as aligned with the Information Management strategic plan.
Maintain and enhance system e.g. order catalog, system access and view preferences .
Monitor and maintain data integrity, including analysis and trouble-shooting for problems that are detected.
Define security views for the various occupations.
Coordinate the processing, documentation and follow-up of required fixes, enhancements, testing and problem resolution
Function as a principal communication coordinator between end users, IT administrators, vendors and Directors in order to identify system needs, modifications and/or issues.
Possess knowledge and understanding of all relevant applications and interfaces
Configure non-production and production environments with the implementation new software, upgrades and installations
Create and execute test plans when implementing new systems to ensure safety, quality and reliability of applications in various test scenarios
Build databases, assist with programming interfaces, format screens and views and assist with the conversion of existing data where appropriate
Comply with departmental change control procedures
Assist in developing system policies and procedures
Maintain system documentation as required
Support the development of a system/upgrade rollout strategy as required.
3. Project implementations & Process Improvements Opportunities
Identify business requirements in collaboration with users, modeling work processes and information flows to meet in-scope requirements
Analyze current processes, utilizing systems methodology and building on any existing current state analysis documentation.
Evaluate available options, liaising with clients and vendors to complete milestones and resolve issues
Identify and highlight risks to patient safety, quality, resources, project timelines. Modify work processes to mitigate risks
Work in partnership with project manager to develop achievable milestones and timelines; monitor and ensure project timelines and goals are met
Work with end-users to determine reporting and auditing needs and develop tools to meet those needs
Actively participate in benefits measurements and quality assurance audit activities including assisting managers to develop measurement tools and reporting results to applicable groups
Acts as a change agent by identifying process improvement opportunities supporting patient focused care and optimum productivity.
Assess clinical area technology and information requirements.
Maintain a detailed understanding and working knowledge of Electronic Health Record systems, their functions and integration to other health based information systems
EDUCATION
University degree in IT, Engineering or a related field
5 years of relevant experience preferably within a Hospital environment; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 5 years experience in an IT related job with technical experience in problem solving and client technical support, directly related to software, preferably in a healthcare setting.
Demonstrated computer proficiency in Microsoft Office products including good working knowledge of MS Access, Excel and Visio.
Knowledge and experience of Hospital Information Systems; experience with Cerner preferred.
Demonstrated troubleshooting, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Flexible, organized and self-directed within scope of responsibility; has initiative and independent judgment.
Resourceful with demonstrated skills in facilitation, team work, leadership and process redesign.
Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills including the ability to express technical ideas in plain language.
Strong people skills, self-starter, motivated individual able to work with minimal supervision
Working knowledge and hands-on experience with relational databases.
Understanding of clinical and corporate data needs in a hospital setting.
Ability to interact with IS and hospital staff, outside suppliers and consultants as necessary.
Knowledge on data modelling techniques.
Provide evidence of ongoing education (e.g. workshops, seminars, etc.) and upgrading of technical skills and knowledge.
Ability to deal with stressful situations in a professional and courteous manner.
Good work attendance record required.
Must be available for on-call shifts.
All employees of Michael Garron Hospital (MGH), a division of Toronto East Health Network (TEHN) [formerly Toronto East General Hospital (TEGH)] agree to work within the legislated practices of the Occupational Health and Safety Act of Ontario.
All employees of MGH are responsible to contribute to a transparent culture of patient and staff safety by adhering to and abiding by patient and staff safety policies and procedures set by MGH.

We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Lead People Data Analyst who will be responsible for advanced HR data analysis, providing strategic insights through reports and tools to optimize our workforce, enable data-driven HR strategies and elevate business decisions.


What youll do:

In this role you will manage the design, development, and maintenance of on-going measurement systems, metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to steer key business decisions. As a Lead, you will provide technical leadership and mentorship to our Data & Analytics team within People Operations, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and utilizing advanced analytical techniques to extract actionable insights.
How youll make an impact:
Guide and mentor people analysts, through coaching, technical expertise, and helping them develop advanced analytical skills and a deep understanding of HR practices
Oversee the design and delivery of measurement systems, reports, tools and insights, analyzing workforce metrics.
Lead the collection, analysis, and interpretation of complex HR data, including comprehensive workforce analytics, and in-depth studies to support strategic decision-making.
Provide senior management with high-level insights into HR trends, patterns, influencing workforce planning, organizational development, and overall business strategies
Responsible for data analysis and interpretation by conducting advanced data analysis using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights, trends, and prepare recommendations through data-driven storytelling for key stakeholders.
Running recurring HR reports and performing strong validations to make sure accurate data is being provided. Reports include but not limited to the following:
Monthly Board Reporting requirements
Statistics Canada and other government reports
Demographic reports
Talent Acquisition data and reporting
Running quality analysis reports to ensure the data entry is entered accurately in the HR system
Lead special analytical projects that contribute to HR's strategic goals and enhance our understanding of workforce dynamics
Lead the refinement and elaboration of data processes, ensuring the availability of accurate and reliable HR data to empower informed decision-making
Act as the definitive subject matter expert for technical matters, data integrity inquiries, and methodologies, providing insightful guidance for People Analysts and stakeholders.
What youll bring to this role:
8- 10 years of technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and process automation
8- 10 years of experience using analytics tools and software (Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, Google Big Query, Superset, etc.)
8- 10 years of experience as a Senior People/HR Analyst, Senior Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or a similar role. Experience working within a technical or engineering organization, with knowledge of the high-technology industry is an asset
Human Resources Management degree, certification or diploma(asset)
Equivalent combination of education and/or work experience in related field may be substituted
Proficiency coding in SQL, GBQ and AppScript/JavaScript, familiarity with Python an asset
Deep understanding of data mining, data pipelines, and the Google Cloud Platform
Strong and compelling storytelling abilities to communicate complex findings/data to a diverse audience
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics
Strong problem solving abilities and attention to detail with accuracy
Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
Strong project management skills; able to identify needs, develop effective solutions, and manage projects through to completion
Must stay relevant to technology and should have the flexibility to adapt to the growing technology and market demands
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to problem solve well-judged decisions
Strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the business
Strong organizational skills and ability to work simultaneously on several projects

Job Responsibilities :-

Collaborating with developers for testing of applications.
The Associate Professional Transportation works on the complete life cycle from business needs definition, through process design, build or system configuration, testing, training, end user and technical documentation, delivery for process enactment, final diagnosis, and on-going support.
The Associate Professional plays a significant role in re-engineering global Supply Chain processes and solutions which are global in nature, integrated with other process areas, scalable, flexible are customer focused and follows industry best practices.
Process improvements may range from reduced keystrokes, reduced handoffs, centralized data, reduced delays, freeing resources faster, or combing similar activities.

Participate in cross-functional projects with focus on process/change management to ensure all teams are tracking to project Milestones, Deliverables, KPI/Service Level Agreements, Process Improvement Measurements, and Sustainable Control Plan for Monitoring post project implementation.
Lead implementation of systemic process change by working closely with Transportation process owners, internal and external Partner Operations Managers, BPI Managers, Project Managers, etc.
Drive best practices sharing through centralized repository of knowledge management, including process maps, business requirement documentation, test cases, etc.
Knowledge on EDI Interchange issues.
Coordinates a collaborative testing process between the business and IS team members.

Bachelors degree in business administration, Information Management Systems, Engineering (Industrial/Mechanical) or equivalent work experience required.
3-5 years in Logistics/Transportation, analytic work on Transportation studies, and familiarity with transportation management systems
Excellent communications skills both written and oral.
Financial acumen, analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
Experience with any one or more industry leading Transportation Management Systems (TMS) like Blue Yonder (JDA), Oracle, etc.
Demonstrated use of analytical tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Access/ SQL, Excel.
Knowledge of lean, six sigma methodologies.

Job Description:
Eatons Electrical sector is currently hiring a Senior Supply Chain Analyst (12-month contract) to join our team. This position is based at our Burlington, ON head office and offers benefits from Day 1.
What youll do:
For a term of up to 12 months, the Senior Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for working with the SCM leadership team to identify performance gaps and implement strategies that positively impact the overall Canadian SCM results. In this role, you will be responsible for developing process improvements and e-tools to yield savings, as well as support manufacturing, materials, logistics and supply chain initiatives.

In this role, you will:
Lead Supply Chain and Operational Excellence projects at manufacturing facilities, distribution centers and headquarters operations in support of Supply Chain and SIOP initiatives.
Perform a variety of data analytics and develop control measures.
Conduct on-going analysis of Supply Chain reporting in Power BI or Excel to identify defective trends, continuous process improvements, program compliance gaps and automation opportunities.
Interpret data around supply chain trends, optimization, and forecasting related to performance metrics, and develop potential recommendations.
Coordinate the design, development and implementation of analytical tools, technology and business solutions that improve business decisions to drive operational efficiency.
Support Lean implementation and project integration related to Supply Chain.
Support cost-out initiatives at various operations.
Support leadership team in on-going materials management functions.
Perform audits of Global Vista product registration and maintenance to ensure alignment with Oracle.
Work with Supply Chain Managers, Marketing, and Customer Service to analyze, evaluate, and solve for opportunities that improve KPIs.
Maintain monthly supply chain scorecards with collaboration from team leaders to monitor service performance, on time delivery and high 5 metrics.
Lead the development and business deployment of tools and processes aimed at aligning all business units towards business excellence and SIOP.
Participate in project management activities, program development efforts, process enhancement initiatives, and compliance management efforts intended to facilitate the Canada-wide achievement of objectives.
Define, plan and coordinate activities of cross-functional teams by leading through influence to ensure project timelines and goals are met.
Qualifications:
Basic Required Qualifications:
College Diploma in Business, Engineering, Economics, Supply Chain or Data Analytics.
Minimum of two (2) years of practical experience in operations, supply chain or industrial engineering.
Experience with Microsoft Power BI, SQL, Visual Basic for (VBA), and HTML coding.
Experience with Business Intelligence platforms, data sets, and visualized analytics.

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in a relevant Technical Discipline from an accredited institution.
Experience in project management.
Proficiency in Oracle, Global Vista order management, Forecast Pro software and Mentor.
Experience in building Power BI dashboards and automating end-to-end Power BI reporting.
Certified Supply Chain Professional (APICS)
Skills:
Must be able to communicate effectively with a variety of different organizational levels.
Must possess strong analytical skills.

Job Summary
Gather disparate data from various data sources, analyzes and normalizes the data to ensure quality of data for analysis. Responsible for providing consistent, relevant and accurate data as well as guidance/knowledge of the data and definitions that are available for analysis. A pricing analyst is responsible for analyzing competitor pricing matched with market expectations to determine the ideal target price for products of the business. Duties include providing thorough analytical breakdowns of pricing structures and sales funnels of similar competitor products and services and identifying specific strategies used in pricing models of the same. Report to evaluate the findings and to propose the results to the relevant departments for effect. A bachelor's degree in business or a related field is often required to be a pricing analyst. Specialization and experience in the field, it is typical that pricing analysts possess strong working experience in the industry as a pricing analyst or in another relevant position dealing with competitor pricing and sales.
Major Tasks, Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities
Forecasting revenue and market share based on market trends, production costs, profit margins, and sales volumes.
Serves as a resource to assigned client in area of expertise.
Gathers and compiles raw data; conducts research for industry trends and benchmarks; and normalizes data to be incorporated into a centralized data format.
Identify ideal pricing structures and sales funnels
Analyzes, reports, makes comparisons to industry/company benchmarks, determines trends, and prepares cost analyses.
Defines data definitions and documents data limitations.
Tracking customer engagement to develop effective pricing strategies for products and offerings.
Scope out opportunities based on market trends and industry condition
Applying statistical modeling methods to determine the potential impact of pricing strategies on profitability.
Prepares spreadsheets for data analysis; prepare reports with charts and graphs, mailing lists, maps and ad hoc requests. May make presentations.
Provides recommendations based on findings and analysis; provides input on policies and procedures.
Analyzing competitor pricing and market trends to increase market share and profitability.
Assessing data from a variety of sources to gain insights into pricing strategies and market trends.
Keeping informed on pricing analysis methods and industry trends.
Nature and Scope
Demonstrates skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data.
Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual, complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by a supervisor and/or direct customers of the process.
May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support or professional personnel.
Work Environment
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.
Education and Experience
Typically requires BS/BA in a related discipline. Generally 5-8 years of experience in a related field OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in a related field. Certification is required in some areas
Proficiency in business intelligence (BI) software, such as Sisense and InetSoft Style Intelligence.
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
Extensive experience in analyzing pricing strategies and forecasting revenue and market share.
Experience in collaborating on pricing strategies with sales and marketing departments.
Ability to keep abreast of industry trends and develop dynamic pricing tools.
Advanced ability to present pricing analysis reports to relevant stakeholders.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
.

Canadas National Ballet School is currently inviting applications for the full-time, permanent position of Business Systems
Analyst.

We invite you to join the vibrant staff community of Canada's National Ballet School (NBS). NBS has 300+ employees
supporting programs ranging from professional ballet training, recreational and community dance programs, and
groundbreaking health initiatives.

We are looking for a dynamic individual with the talent, innovative-thinking and passion to help NBS continue to share the
transformative power of dance with people of all ages, abilities, and aspirations. As an organization, NBS is continually
evolving and we are looking for a professional with unique, new ideas to complement the Schools collaborative work
culture.

Reporting to the IT Manager, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for improving organizational efficiency by leading
the integration of platforms and web-based applications in use across the organization; and contributing to user
competency and confidence. This position functions within a fast-paced office environment and encompasses a wide range
of assigned duties. This position offers a hybrid schedule, with the option of working remotely two days per week;
working hours are typically Monday  Friday, 9 AM  5PM, with occasional early mornings/late evenings and/or
weekends.

The ideal candidate will have the ability to provide a high-level of proactive thought leadership in maximizing software
solutions across NBS; be a solutions-focused, detail-oriented professional with a background in IT or related field;
demonstrated experience with Blackbaud products and platform integration; and a strong communicator who enjoys
empowering others to leverage technology.

Major Duties and Responsibilities

Specific Systems and Technical Contributions

Responsible for the overall administration of NBS CRM, SIS, and Fund Accounting Software. Blackbaud is NBS
current critical software solution
Provide support and direction, as needed, for all of NBS Blackbaud solutions, including Raisers Edge NXT, Financial
Edge NXT, Education Management K-12 (EMS, SIS, LIS, Billing Management) and Merchant Services, and escalate
complex or unresolved issues to Blackbaud Support
Manage My School App (MSA) access for employees and board members, and assist with access issues for all MSA
users, including students and parents
Assist with and/or perform global changes, imports/exports and record deletion in NBS Blackbaud solutions.
Assist platform-specific power users in the implementation and maintenance of access rules and procedures to
ensure data integrity and security
Provide backup and support for various platforms and applications in use at NBS

Oversight and Leadership Contributions
Evaluate and optimize platforms and apps to meet organizational business needs
Lead software training strategies/plans with the objective of increasing user competency across NBS and other
objectives outlined in NBS Strategic Plan
Collaborate with NBS managers to deliver training and empower staff to maximize their use of existing software
platforms and web-based applications
Lead strategies for and support integrations between platforms and web-based applications, including the
implementation of new integrations and data flows, the maintenance and troubleshooting of existing integrations,
and auditing data for accuracy and completeness
Supervise the Integration Associate, Platforms and Applications
Support the effective management of IT operating budget and capital expenditures
Contribute to the creation/maintenance of training materials and support documentation
Keep up to date on knowledge regarding the capabilities of database software used by NBS and stay informed of
technology trends, including new platforms and products that may benefit NBS
Proactively maintain a comprehensive understanding of the organizations business databases and web-based
applications
Implement and maintain access rules and procedures around data integrity and security
Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications/Skills/Experience
A minimum of 5 years of experience in a related position; a degree or diploma in information technology, computer
science, or a related field
Experience with Blackbaud (e.g. Raisers Edge NXT, Fiunancial Edge NXT and K-12 School Management Solutions) is
preferred
Knowledge of other systems, and/or other CRM databases (e.g. Google Workspace for Education, ActiveNet, Amilia
Smart Rec, NCR Counterpoint, Shopify, Jane)
Experience with APIs, data integration techniques, and web services.
Understanding of Power Apps, Power BI, Crystal Reports and/or other report template systems
Familiarity with SQL and the Microsoft Office suite of software
Experience managing people, projects and processes
Self-motivated with a focus on driving results and strong sense of accountability
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities to troubleshoot/resolve technical issues
Strong planning, prioritization, multi-tasking and time-management skills
Strong verbal/written communication skills
Able to work both independently and as part of a team
Successful candidates must supply Canadas National Ballet School with a Police Reference Check in accordance with the
Schools Child Abuse/Sexual Abuse Prevention Policy; this will be coordinated through the Human Resources Department of
NBS.

Apply now! Please email your resume and cover letter with salary expectations, to careers@nbs-enb.ca and indicate
Business Systems Analyst 2024 in the subject line.

About NBS

NBS is the largest dance training organization in Canada. At NBS, excellence, access and inclusion fuel our belief in sharing
the transformative power of dance to change lives for the better. For 60+ years, NBS has been Canadas leader for Olympic-
calibre ballet training, with a track record for driving systemic, progressive change; evolving dance education significantly
over time. Our pursuit of dynamic inclusion constantly reveals the life-changing impact of the power of dance. This is what
drives our commitment to making dance a part of all Canadians lives. NBS continues its focus on excellence in ballet
training, while leveraging its artistic core to expand NBS program offerings to engage more people than ever before.

To realize its mission, NBS strives to:
Increase the relevance of the art of ballet in the lives of all Canadians
Reflect a vision of leadership that touches more communities, more partners and greater breadth and depth of
talent than ever before
Address the need to bring new faces to ballet  as prospective professional students and as future enthusiasts for
the art form  embracing and nurturing a more diverse spectrum of children and youth to participate in dance and
explore training at the highest level
Deliver the broadest range of impactful, evidence-informed community dance programs of any ballet school in the
world

NBS is committed to the goal of being an equity-informed school. We invest heavily in work and practices that foster
positive change internally while driving a progressive evolution in the wider sector. We recognize our responsibility as
Canadas largest arts training organization and one of its oldest, to address anti-Black racism, reconciliation with Indigenous
peoples and systemic oppression in Canadian society. Building an inclusive sense of belonging at NBS for every dancer and
employee is the Schools primary imperative.
At NBS, we can offer you the chance to build a rewarding and fulfilling career. This is a place where you can realize and
achieve your professional goals within a supportive and respectful environment. Collaborating with talented artists and
colleagues on deeply satisfying and rewarding work, every employee has the opportunity to make a profound impact on
our organization and on society.
At NBS we are committed to making our organization stronger by engaging individuals with a wide range of experiences,
backgrounds and abilities. When you join us, you will be a part of an organization built on respect, creativity and a shared
sense of purpose.
NBS is committed to building a remarkable and talented workforce that is reflective of the diversity in the City of Toronto. We
strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, especially welcoming those with diverse intersectional identities
who can provide different perspectives and contribute to the further diversification of ideas.
We are committed to inclusive and accessible employment practices. Should you require accommodation at any stage of the
recruitment process, we ask you to please make your needs/requirements known.

As a Human Resources Consultant (Analyst), Workforce Reporting you will be part of a project team leading the foundational work that will transform the Citys enterprise HR analytics, reporting and insights service.

As the project kicks off, your work will focus on helping to analyze and understand current challenges with HR reporting and how data is transformed; throughout the project youll work in collaboration with our Technology Services (IT) partners (business intelligence developers, data architects, and integrators) to help define business requirements and identify approaches that best respond to current and future HR analytics needs of the organization. Representing the HR business, youll participate in feedback sessions, validation and testing to make sure solutions hit the mark as we continue the evolution of our services and tools.

To succeed in this role, youll bring a strong foundation in data analysis and statistics, a curiosity for all things data and analytics, and youll also have well developed communications skills to help act as a bridge between business users and technical teams.

Major Responsibilities:
Consults with HR analytics SMEs and clients to understand the Citys current data, analytics, and reporting landscape, as well as their needs and pain points.
Analyzes and documents the HR data transformation process, including calculation methods, with a focus on current state tools such as MS Access and MS Excel
Documents issues / challenges e.g., related to data quality, conducts research as required, and develops recommendations for the project team.
Contributes to the development of business requirements and works with IT partners to translate them into functional requirements and specifications for technology solutions.
Collaborates with project team members to find innovative and user-centred approaches to advance the Citys HR analytics objectives, including taking part in ideation sessions, prototyping and testing.
Key Qualifications:
Experience consulting with and preparing information for stakeholders at all levels to understand and best respond to their business needs.
Considerable experience programming, designing, and developing reports using database tools such as Microsoft Access and Microsoft Excel
Considerable experience developing reporting tools that will assist with analyzing and interpreting workforce data and providing meaningful insights.
Experience working in the HR domain or with HR Information Systems reporting, specifically with SAP or SAP SuccessFactors is an asset.
Excellent problem-solving skills to manage complex requests and provide alternate, innovative strategies in response to client workforce data needs.
Strong oral and written communications skills.
Ability to successfully plan, organize and manage work both in a team environment and independently, as required.
Sound judgement and ability to handle matters of a confidential/sensitive nature; knowledge of and experience with the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act a strong asset.
Knowledge of relevant human resources policies, procedures, collective agreement provisions and legislative compliance would be an asset.

General information
All posting locations: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
Job Function: 11 - Logistics
Date Published: 08-Feb-2024

Description & Requirements
This is a role for someone who craves a global challenge balanced by the desire to be accountable for delivering against the model in the largest business unit for Kraft Heinz. It is both a strategic and a tactical position. Those that do not want to get their hands dirty or build out a function against a blank slate without buying pre-packaged solutions should not apply. Focuses on data analysis that delivers supply chain business results, identifies and actions inefficiencies, builds relationships with customers and internal stakeholders, and monitors the movement of products through the supply chain cycle in both internal and customers processes.
Responsibilities
Deliver key customers and internal supply chain targets
Conduct data analysis using both internal and customer data to identify and action inefficiencies
Drive out unnecessary costs, while creating efficiencies and process improvements
Strategically manage key orders and delivery performance to resolve potential production delays/problems and other supply risks at item-level and trouble-shoot either no shows or past due orders to maximize service and minimize fines
Prepares standardized and/or ad hoc reports to support business analysis
Provides customers with order status reports and coordinates ship method
Manage master data with customers item master and order master
Conduct analyses on forecast/order to bring insights to improve forecast accuracy (both internal and external)
Analyst level / Customer Collaboration on Supply Chain Systems Settings

Requirements
Bachelors degree preferred
3-7 years experience in related field
Proficient Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint)
Ability to be comfortable in a fast-paced, stressful environment
Preferred understanding of SAP
Technology experience not necessary but preferred (e.g., Tableau Prep, SQL, Alteryx or Python, etc.)
Results oriented and detail-oriented
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent communication/facilitation skills and good negotiation skills
Statistical modelling or forecasting experience not necessary but preferred
About Us
Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. Were on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.
Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. Were proud of where weve been  and even more thrilled about where were headed  as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.
Why Us
We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures  as we work together to lead the future of food.
Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and were growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.
Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. Meet Gorgias, the customer service platform designed for ecommerce merchants, and built to provide amazing experience to shoppers at scale on Shopify, BigCommerce, and Magento. Our product empowers merchants to manage all their customer service in one place over email, live chat, voice, Facebook, Instagram, and SMS.
Everything we do is for our customers, and were currently serving over 12,000+ ecommerce merchants, including : Steve Madden, Timbuk2, Decathlon, and Sports Illustrated. They love us for our innovative product, our focus on their ecommerce needs, and, of course, our lightning-fast customer service response time.
We raised $25 million in our Series B round in December 2020 and -$30 million in our Series C round in 2022. We more than doubled in size in every meaningful way: annual recurring revenue, the size of our customer base, and the size of our Gorgias team, for starters.
Were still growing fast and looking for new teammates who want to grow with us.
About the Team
Revenue Operations (RevOps) aligns the sales, marketing, partnerships, and customer success teams to optimize the customer journey. RevOps is focused on ensuring every part of the go-to-market organization is working towards common revenue goals, eliminating silos and fostering a cohesive, data-driven decision making. As we introduce new product lines to our customers the RevOps team plays a critical role in ensuring every GTM team is set up for success.
About the Role
In this role, youll be the third S&P Ops team member, responsible for developing process, data models, and automations. This will help provide data enrichment, key visualization, and critical workflow improvements to the entire Sales & Partnerships team. Each quarter, you will have strategy conversations with the various team managers within Sales and Partnerships, including the VP of Sales & Partnerships, and execute on the core objectives that you help to define.
What Youll Do
As a Revenue Operations Analyst, you will work closely with enablement, analytics, sales, marketing, customer success, and finance teams to measure the effectiveness of our GTM funnel
You will be instrumental in the maintenance and optimization of the full tech stack for Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success teams, ensuring each team is equipped with the necessary tools to succeed.
Participate in the creation of a quarterly RevOps roadmap, focusing on addressing key quantitative and qualitative challenges, and communicating ongoing progress to relevant stakeholders.
Collaborate with the Analytics team to measure, track, and enhance key performance metrics, enabling data-driven decision-making and fostering an environment of continuous improvement.
Implement and uphold data quality controls to guarantee the relevance, accuracy, and reliability of data across the organization.
Engage with Product Marketing, Data Analytics, and Enablement teams to assess the success of new products, contributing to rapid iteration and improvement on gaps identified across the Revenue funnel.
Who You Are
1-2 years of experience working with Sales, Customer Experience (CX), and Marketing systems within a B2B environment.
Demonstrated proficiency in core Go-To-Market (GTM) systems such as HubSpot, Gong, and Vitally with a keen understanding of how to leverage these tools to support and optimize sales and customer experience efforts.
Past experience implementing and rolling out new software to front-line teams
Adept at establishing and tracking key performance metrics and benchmarks, with a keen eye for data analysis to measure the effectiveness of GTM teams and identify areas for continuous improvement.
Experience in contributing to cross-functional projects, demonstrating the ability to work collaboratively with teams across the organization to achieve shared objectives.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate insights and recommendations clearly to a range of stakeholders.
Perks and Benefits
5-week vacation (We follow each country's appropriate PTO Laws)
Paid sick leave
Paid parental leave (16 weeks)
MacBook Pro
Personal credit card to buy lunches (youll have your own Gorgias credit card)
We provide private health insurance and retirement pension
Get up to CAD 900 to set up your workstation at home (working from home should feel breezy)
Get up to CAD 2600 of learning material and wellness support per year! This includes CAD 1950 for learning material (such as books, courses, and individual coaching sessions) directly linked to your job scope, as well as a CAD 650 wellness budget. Take advantage of these resources to grow in your role and prioritize your personal development and wellness.
Every quarter, we organize an online company-wide summit to discuss where were going and strengthen social bonds. Once per year we organize offsite team retreats and company retreats!
This role is Hybrid reporting to our Toronto Office.
Why join us?
We're among the fastest-growing startups in the eCommerce ecosystem
We've built an extremely efficient go-to-market engine
Work with a talented team you'll learn a lot from
Join a company where automation and good & clean data are core beliefs shared by all
Here is an interview with one of our team members experiences from our most recent company retreat to Cancun!

Raised our Series C for $30M in 2022: TechCrunch Article

We have a 4.7 rating on Glassdoor & 4.7 Comparably culture score

Job Description:
Requisition ID: 275225
Relocation Authorized: None
Telework Type: Full-Time Office/Project
Work Location: Toronto, ON
Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place.

Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers objectives to create a lasting positive impact. We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations.

Core to Bechtel is our values  ethics, safety, quality, people, culture, relationships, innovation and sustainability, and our covenants  integrity, respect, collaboration, trust, and delivery. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver.

Project Overview:
Bechtel / Bantrel / Comtech is seeking a driven team player with a passion for project controls, data and reporting on complex infrastructure mega-projects.

Bechtel, along with its sub-vendors Bantrel and Comtech, has been appointed as the Delivery Partner (DP) for the Ontario Line (OL) Project in Toronto, Canada. The OL is a brand-new metro line serving some of Torontos busiest districts and brings much needed additional connectivity and capacity to the citys public transport network. The project scope includes the design, build, operation and maintenance of all infrastructure and rail systems associated with 15 stations and over 15km of new underground, surface and elevated track. The OL project is being delivered through various Public-Private-Partnership (P3), progressive design-build (PDBs) and traditional procurement contracts. The OL is slated to open for passenger service in 2031. The DP, the customer Metrolinx and the Technical Advisor (TA) are working together as the Integrated Project Team (IPT) to manage the delivery of the project.

Position Summary:
The Pape Tunnel and Underground Stations (PTUS) package is one of the major contracts for the OL. The PTUS scope includes three kilometers of twin tunnels underneath Pape Avenue between the Gerrard portal and the Don Valley bridge, underpinning of the existing TTC Pape Station, two underground stations (Pape and Cosburn), two portals, and emergency exit buildings/emergency services buildings. The PTUS project is being delivered using a Progressive Design-Build (PDB) model. Key features of a PDB model include the opportunity for greater collaboration between the project owner, the successful bidder, project partners, and communities.

The PTUS Project Controls Analyst is responsible for the timely collection, analysis, summary and issuing of progress reports and other data and information for the North Civil contracts.

The PTUS Project Controls Analyst reports functionally to the Ontario Line Reporting Manager and takes day-to-day direction from the PTUS project controls manager.

Responsibilities:
Executing the IPT reporting process for the contract: Sourcing data from the IPT team and the contractors, assembling required reports, coordinating reviews and approvals by the IPT management and timely submission within required deadlines and quality requirements
Coordinating the review by the IPT team of contractor reports: Collating feedback on conformance with contract requirements, validity and accuracy and reviewing with the IPT team and coordinating timely responses with document control as required.
Analysing data and providing feedback to the relevant IPT team members on non-conformance with contract requirements, trends and outliers.
Contributing to the development of digital dashboards through definition of dashboard output specs, collaboration with PowerBI specialists, and championing the use of digital dashboards in the team
Supporting the data needs for key meetings of the team and the program, including but not limited to control boards, and Ontario Line 3 levels of control related meetings
Identifying opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of reporting and data mana

Qualifications and Skills:
Basic Qualifications
Relevant bachelors degree from an accredited university.
Relevant experience guideline: 7 years.

Additional Qualifications:
Construction, project management or project controls related qualifications is desirable.
Engineering, construction, business or finance degree is desirable.
Previously held position(s) with responsibility for planning, estimating, data analysis or reporting on infrastructure projects of similar scope, size and complexity to an urban metro project.
A general understanding of engineering and construction procedures, principles, and concepts.
Experience working with teams and stakeholders in the development and delivery of large infrastructure projects. Ability to communicate across different technical disciplines (e.g. engineering, construction, testing & commissioning).
Strong communication skills (verbal and written).
Fluent in using Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Working knowledge of Microsoft Power Apps, Power BI and Microsoft Forms is desirable.
LI-NP1

Req ID: 24801
Vacancy Type: Temporary - up to 2 years
Number of Positions: 1
Closing Date: 03/29/2024
Job Summary
The Business Analyst will participate in the design, development, testing and implementation of innovative technology solutions including providing support for existing applications. This position is responsible for eliciting, organizing, designing and analyzing both technical and functional business-related deliverables and issues, designing and leading testing and training, and moving projects to implementation all in accordance with recognized best practices (BABOK, PMBOK, etc.).
Duties and Responsibilities
Under the direction of the Program Manager, SAP HCM / Payroll Business Support, the successful candidate will:
Support and lead key project deliverables from idea inception to project closure including go-live operational readiness in accordance with recognized best practices (BABOK, PMBOK, and PMSO) and project methodologies (eg. Agile, Waterfall methodologies).
Collaborate with project sponsors, business users, subject matter experts, and SAP functional consultants, ABAP developers and be responsible for:
Analyzing requirements and translating business needs into detailed documented functional and technical designs and specifications. Developing current (as-is) and future (to-be) business process flows.
Defining reporting and alerting requirements with the required layout of the information.
Developing and executing quality assurance plans including testing the solutions to ensure it meets the business needs as defined.
Designing, documenting, and maintaining system processes.
Serve as a critical liaison between the Information Technology division and other business groups to ensure the successful delivery, implementation, and operation of high-quality functioning enterprise applications.
Refine Business Cases with an IT component, research and evaluate options, propose alternatives to clients and to senior management, benchmark, identify synergies with existing IT solutions, and provide IT-related financial estimates, according to corporate and departmental guidelines and finance-driven due dates.
Review and provide responses for Budget Requests and Capital Requests using knowledge of IT systems and their in-depth understanding of their clients business processes.
Investigate and resolve business issues, determine best solutions, research options, advise on changes to business processes, analyse data/provide reports.
Provide 2nd and 3rd tier support for incidents that require more specific knowledge of technical/functional issues and IT systems and/or deeper knowledge of business processes and policies.
Provide support and knowledge transfer to IT teams (examples: preparing training materials, knowledge base articles, transition to operations document).
Lead discussions, and deliver presentations, reports, research and recommendations to a diverse group consisting of executives, managers, IT teams, business clients, and external business partners.
Continually monitor and manage changes that arise from internal and external stakeholders, work teams, bylaws, and legislation at the beginning of projects, during projects, and during implementation.
Assist clients in the identification of business needs and alignment to strategic plans and IT Road Maps.
Provide analytical support for the future directional strategy and multi-year strategic plans.
Provides support for the teams annual IT Work Plan.
Support the strategic initiatives of the corporation to realize LEAN improvements and promote good project management practices by reviewing business and system processes for continuous improvement adhering to LEAN best practices and methodology.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Skills and Qualifications
3-5 years progressive work experience in an Information Technology environment with a proven track record as a Business Analyst in requirements facilitation, process mapping, detailed specification development, and development and execution of quality assurance testing plans is required.
Post-secondary education with a degree/diploma in computer science or related discipline or Business Administration accompanied with education/experience in IT.
Sound understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), software development, IT architecture, and IT hardware.
Strong interpersonal, research, analytical, critical thinking, and negotiating skills with problem-solving ability supported by project management experience, team leadership and facilitation capabilities.
Strong communication skills with the ability to understand and interpret the meaning, purpose and importance of verbal and non-verbal messages.
Experience with SAP Human Capital Management including Payroll and/or SuccessFactors Employee Central and Employee Central Payroll is strongly preferred.
Recommended certifications related to Business Analysis, such as Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), Professional Business Analyst (PBA), Certified Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA), Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Scrum Master (CSM), etc. preferred.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Business Systems Analysts role is to support the planning, design, development, and launch of efficient business systems in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This includes eliciting, analyzing, specifying, validating and implementing technology solutions to meet business requirements through interviewing stakeholders to understand the technology solutions they need. Gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, requests for proposal and systems requirements. The Business Systems Analyst is also responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues to maximize the benefit of IT system investments.
While providing support to your HR and Payroll clients, you will be responsible for:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Application Support
Work with the business & internal support teams to resolve production issues for assigned applications. Use your experience to effectively identify and mitigate technical issues.
Write SQL scripts and/or resolve technical issues to address gaps in functionality and/or performance of applications as necessary
Support the migration of new software programs across different phases of the project (DEV to UAT)
Conduct functional testing efforts for enhancements, fixes and upgrades when a QA resource is not assigned.
Liaise within the team for efficient implementation of software fixes, new software products or systems and for resolution of any issues
Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines
Generate statistics and write reports for customers and/or team members
Create Process Efficiencies and Project Support
Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures to identify process improvements
Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of business requirements, and specifications on a project-by-project basis. Document, develop and implement, either independently or with a team, the technical solution required to support those requirements
Create systems models, specifications, and diagrams to assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible technical options.
Conduct interviews/client meetings to gather user requirements via workshops, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Assist in design sessions and prototyping new solutions
Develop an understanding of existing business processes and recommend changes that leverage best usage of the application
Design and monitor software tests on new and existing programs when a QA resource is not assigned
Maintain appropriate Change Management processes for Production changes.
Assist in research sessions in prototyping new solutions to enhance business processes, operations, and information process flow.
Support managing and tracking the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle.
Support the purchase and implementation of Cloud-based and/or vendor solutions by assisting in defining specifications, preparing Request for Proposal (RFP), solution evaluation and selection.
Planning
Assist in defining project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation
Be willing to engage in life-long learning with respect to professional development, training and courses of study

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or other technically relevant degree
Minimum 4  7 years of Analysis experience providing project implementation and support in a structured systems development environment. At least 1 of those years MUST be in a Systems Analysis capacity.
3 - 5 years working experience with an enterprise HCM, preferably PeopleSoft Core HCM.
PeopleSoft North America Payroll and Time & Labor experience is an asset
Prior past development experience is an asset.
Experience supporting the development and implementation of web-based software solutions, specifically on both functional and technical levels, as well as system interfaces to vendor and/or Cloud-based solutions.
SQL and/or other Query language knowledge
Familiarity with data quality and governance issues and requirements
Experience in requirements analysis, system design proposals, cost/benefit analysis and testing in support of solution development.
Ability to work with clients, end-users and other IT professionals, specifically in building relationships and managing expectations.
Experience in the operation and analysis of database hardware, software, and standards, as well as data retrieval methodologies.
Project management skills.
Experience in defining, implementing and/or enhancing requirements gathering processes and templates.
EHR and Health informatics experience is an asset.

SKILLS/ COMPETENCIES:
Ability to conduct research into production issues
Exceptional attention to detail with proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong customer service skills
Working knowledge of ITSM/ITIL process analysis and improvement (Service Catalogue, Change Incident, Request, Problems etc.)
Highly motivated with the ability to produce quality work with minimal supervision.
Flexible and adaptable in learning and understanding new technologies & processes
Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to work in a team oriented, collaborative environment
Ability to work flexible hours

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. Amazon Canada Fulfillment Services is hiring a Data Analyst to support the Inventory Control / Quality Assurance (ICQA) team. The Data Analyst assigned to ICQA will work closely with the ICQA and operations teams in Inbound and Outbound to provide data and analytical support for ACES initiatives, root cause investigation of defects, and will provide support to ensure compliance to ICQA-related SoX requirements. The Data Analyst will own the insights, set up analysis, and create automated dashboards and reporting. They will be responsible for identifying data sources (internal / external) to invent and simplify mechanisms and create custom reporting and analytics automation tools. Operating in a fast-moving and sometimes ambiguous environment, you will be required to work autonomously, taking full control and responsibility for achieving business objectives. This role provides real opportunity to develop original ideas, approaches and solutions in an ever-changing and competitive business climate.

Key job responsibilities

Development of data collection processes and data management systems
Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
Designing of queries, compiling of data, and generation of reports in MS Excel
Charting and graphing of data for reporting purposes
In depth research of defect trends
Data collection and entry as needed
Data mining and problem solving
Back up for Process Assistant duties

Bolton, ON, CAN

Experience with end-to-end project management

Meet Gorgias, the customer service platform designed for ecommerce merchants, and built to provide amazing experience to shoppers at scale on Shopify, BigCommerce, and Magento. Our product empowers merchants to manage all their customer service in one place over email, live chat, voice, Facebook, Instagram, and SMS.
Everything we do is for our customers, and were currently serving over 12,000+ ecommerce merchants, including : Steve Madden, Timbuk2, Decathlon, and Sports Illustrated. They love us for our innovative product, our focus on their ecommerce needs, and, of course, our lightning-fast customer service response time.
We raised $25 million in our Series B round in December 2020 and -$30 million in our Series C round in 2022. We more than doubled in size in every meaningful way: annual recurring revenue, the size of our customer base, and the size of our Gorgias team, for starters.
Were still growing fast and looking for new teammates who want to grow with us.
About the Team
Revenue Operations (RevOps) aligns the sales, marketing, partnerships, and customer success teams to optimize the customer journey. RevOps is focused on ensuring every part of the go-to-market organization is working towards common revenue goals, eliminating silos and fostering a cohesive, data-driven decision making. As we introduce new product lines to our customers the RevOps team plays a critical role in ensuring every GTM team is set up for success.
About the Role
In this role, youll be the third S&P Ops team member, responsible for developing process, data models, and automations. This will help provide data enrichment, key visualization, and critical workflow improvements to the entire Sales & Partnerships team. Each quarter, you will have strategy conversations with the various team managers within Sales and Partnerships, including the VP of Sales & Partnerships, and execute on the core objectives that you help to define.
What Youll Do
As a Revenue Operations Analyst, you will work closely with enablement, analytics, sales, marketing, customer success, and finance teams to measure the effectiveness of our GTM funnel
You will be instrumental in the maintenance and optimization of the full tech stack for Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success teams, ensuring each team is equipped with the necessary tools to succeed.
Participate in the creation of a quarterly RevOps roadmap, focusing on addressing key quantitative and qualitative challenges, and communicating ongoing progress to relevant stakeholders.
Collaborate with the Analytics team to measure, track, and enhance key performance metrics, enabling data-driven decision-making and fostering an environment of continuous improvement.
Implement and uphold data quality controls to guarantee the relevance, accuracy, and reliability of data across the organization.
Engage with Product Marketing, Data Analytics, and Enablement teams to assess the success of new products, contributing to rapid iteration and improvement on gaps identified across the Revenue funnel.
Who You Are
1-2 years of experience working with Sales, Customer Experience (CX), and Marketing systems within a B2B environment.
Demonstrated proficiency in core Go-To-Market (GTM) systems such as HubSpot, Gong, and Vitally with a keen understanding of how to leverage these tools to support and optimize sales and customer experience efforts.
Past experience implementing and rolling out new software to front-line teams
Adept at establishing and tracking key performance metrics and benchmarks, with a keen eye for data analysis to measure the effectiveness of GTM teams and identify areas for continuous improvement.
Experience in contributing to cross-functional projects, demonstrating the ability to work collaboratively with teams across the organization to achieve shared objectives.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate insights and recommendations clearly to a range of stakeholders.
Perks and Benefits
5-week vacation (We follow each country's appropriate PTO Laws)
Paid sick leave
Paid parental leave (16 weeks)
MacBook Pro
Personal credit card to buy lunches (youll have your own Gorgias credit card)
We provide private health insurance and retirement pension
Get up to CAD 900 to set up your workstation at home (working from home should feel breezy)
Get up to CAD 2600 of learning material and wellness support per year! This includes CAD 1950 for learning material (such as books, courses, and individual coaching sessions) directly linked to your job scope, as well as a CAD 650 wellness budget. Take advantage of these resources to grow in your role and prioritize your personal development and wellness.
Every quarter, we organize an online company-wide summit to discuss where were going and strengthen social bonds. Once per year we organize offsite team retreats and company retreats!
This role is Hybrid reporting to our Toronto Office.

We're among the fastest-growing startups in the eCommerce ecosystem
We've built an extremely efficient go-to-market engine
Work with a talented team you'll learn a lot from
Join a company where automation and good & clean data are core beliefs shared by all

Job Description:
Referred applicants should not apply directly to this role.
All referred applicants must first be submitted through Workday by a current Loblaw Colleague.
Come make your difference in communities across Canada, where authenticity, trust and making connections is valued  as we shape the future of Canadian retail, together. Our unique position as one of the countrys largest employers, coupled with our commitment to positively impact the lives of all Canadians, provides our colleagues a range of opportunities and experiences to help Canadians Live Life Well.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.
Does working with some of Canadas most talented minds in innovation supporting retail, digital consumer solutions and analytical platforms excite you? Loblaw Technology powers some of Canadas most game-changing retail solutions, giving our customers the ability to live their lives well.
Come work with a team that values diverse ideas, fosters a culture of inclusion and develops our talent from within. Loblaw Technology gives you the chance to excel, and helps you to strive for success in a big way. Keep reading to learn more!
This role will be located at our Brampton office 1 Presidents Choice Circle and we require this person to be onsite 3 days a week.
The Impact Youll Make
As a Senior Analyst in the Business & Customer Insights team, you will be focused on working with our business partners to enhance the impact of our Marketing efforts by building and integrating comprehensive data and reporting solutions. These solutions will be focused on optimizing expenditure, improving operational efficiency, maximizing return on investment and ultimately embedding a culture of data and analytics throughout the organization.
What Youll Do:
Utilize your analytical expertise to develop and pioneer the refinement and innovation of Marketing insights and data products
Design and develop BI reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, looker or Qlik Sense
Lead conversations with business stakeholders from Merchandising, Marketing, Technology and Analytics, to gather requirements and transform strategic and tactical requests into projects that deliver innovative and scalable solutions to business objectives
Ensure the accuracy, reliability, and integrity of BI solutions by implementing thorough testing and validation procedures throughout the development, and production deployment process
What you Bring:
Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Business or other relevant field of study
Proven experience in building dashboards and reporting using business intelligence and data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, Qlik, or MicroStrategy
Demonstrated experience working with cross functional teams to gather business requirements, outline key metrics, and capture technical requirements to support the design, development and implementation of enterprise reporting and visual dashboards
Advanced skills in SQL and/or BigQuery, including data manipulation and understanding of SQL procedures/functions
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Experience with Marketing and Media Analytics is an asset
What Loblaw Offers You
We offer flexibility and balance, and an environment that sets you up for success no matter where your workspace is located.
Here, you will find a great team to help you achieve your goals as you help us achieve ours! Work in our fast-paced, exciting Technology environment, helping our stores, colleagues and customers every day.
Loblaw colleagues also enjoy:
Work Perks Program
On-site GoodLife Fitness, Basketball & Volleyball courts, Ice Rink, Groceries delivered to work via PC Express, Dry Cleaning services (1PCC Office)
Tuition Reimbursement & Online Learning
Pension & Benefits
Paid Vacation
