Job Description:
Job Summary
Do you totally geek out over the latest technologies and trends in digital? Are you passionate about digital customer experiences? Do you Google everything that makes you curious? Do you dive so deep into the weeds that you need SCUBA gear? Do you have a toolbox full of techniques, knowledge, and experience? Then RBC Bank may just be the right place for you.

RBC Bank is hiring a Digital Business Analyst  Unsecured Lending who will elicit, analyze and communicate requirements related to credit decisioning, integrating into core banking systems, customer facing channels, and back-office channels. If you enjoy working in a collaborative environment with other business and technology pros who believe in creating inventive solutions to problems, have a space for you in our innovation lab!
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
Our goal is to make every RBC Bank customer and advisor touchpoint consistently outstanding. Whether through web, native app, or IVR, the Business Analyst  Unsecured Lending is responsible for analysis planning, deep dive requirements gathering, and writing user stories that champion the needs of the business. Were looking for someone who obsesses about the digital experience and instinctively knows that good enough is not good enough. Its a task thatll be made easier by collaborating with a top-notch team of product managers, product owners, UI/UX experts, strategists, marketers, writers, and developers following a shared vision. These are professionals that value your insight, encourage you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.
What will you do?
Serve as customer-proxy on the development team, responsible for creating initial Epics and user stories that clearly describe the functional and non-functional requirements
Responsible for analyzing and documenting functional system requirements to accompany user stories
Facilitate requirements-gathering sessions with SMEs from the functional units using standard techniques such one-on-one or group interviews
Partner with designers and developers on the UI and UX design of new features, including process and screen flow diagrams, as well as wire framing
Responsible for maintenance and production support of all features developed, including incident management and defect triage/prioritization
Lead demo's for stakeholders
Partner with operational groups during the deployment planning for new systems, including prep for training, communication, marketing, production validation, and benefits realization
Create acceptance criteria for all users stories
Develop other business analysis artifacts such as business rules or process flows to clarify requirements
Attend all Agile ceremonies, including Daily Standups, Sprint Planning, Grooming and Retrospectives
Confirm development and QA sprint team members have a clear understanding of the business vision and need during sprint ceremonies
Proxy for business by answering business questions and resolving related issues
Demo completed code to business customers to confirm business need was satisfied
Create and review documentation required for production release and support
What you'll bring:
A breadth and depth of knowledge and experience one (or more) of the essential digital channels  online account opening, mobile banking, online banking and IVR
A passion for exceptional customer experiences
Experience with COTS (commercial off the shelf), new development, and enhancements/support
High level of intellectual curiosity to understand current state, identify issues and provide solutions, while advising on potential positive and negative implications of decisions
A champion for the business (we will provide the cape)
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
4 year degree or equivalent experience
3+ years experience in an Information Technology type role
3+ years experience in a business analysis type role with increasing levels of responsibility
Experience with Agile Scrum methodologies and working collaboratively with a scrum team
In-depth knowledge of credit decisioning, systems integration, online account opening, mobile banking, online banking, or IVR
Exceptional business analysis skills
Strong understanding of the business and stakeholder needs
Proven experience in translating strategy into tactical execution
Experience developing ToBe processes, documenting identified policy and procedure gaps and a plan to implement the future state
Experience in establishing and scaling the War Room approach for all in-scope Journeys
Expert communication skills, able to indirectly influence others, and collaborates in insightful problem solving
Demonstrated performance working with multiple vendors to launch new product
Nice-to-have:
Agile certification
HFI certification or equivalent
Mad customer journey mapping skills
Job Skills
Agile Methodology, Business Acumen, Business Data Analysis, Business Process Modeling, Communication, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Interpersonal Relationship Management, Problem Solving, Requirements Analysis

Job Description
We are currently looking for a Senior BI Business Analyst who will work collaboratively with the business and technology teams to gather and document detailed requirements and being responsible for the analysis stages for all the BI projects. The focus is to:
Requirements Gathering and Analysis
BI Projects support
Coach and mentor intermediate team members.
This opportunity is based fully onsite at our Mississauga, ON office location and reports to Manager, Analytics.
WHEN YOU JOIN US YOU WILL;
Requirements Gathering and Analysis
Create detailed solution design and reviews across relevant stakeholders to ensure alignment to the overall business needs including architecture overview and detailed solution architecture.
Work with the business owners, BI developers, BI architect, PMs, and other BAs to break down the designed solutions into detailed business requirements.
Conduct workshops and meetings to gather requirements.
Conduct process mapping.
Document business processes and rules from a user perspective and identify the gaps and be responsible for recommendation of process optimization.
Own capturing the data flow mapping across various business and system processes and interpret the value offerings and validations.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements for new projects or enhancements to existing processes. Document current business processes using tools such as flowcharts or diagrams to identify all areas.
Create and maintain documentation related to business requirements, process flows and system configurations.
Own the creation and maintenance of Business Requirements Documents (BRD).
Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization to gather requirements, provide updates, and facilitate decision-making processes.
Work closely with business and IT stakeholders. Understands the business requirements, application systems, limitations and constraints, companys policies.
BI Projects Support
Support business case development and presentation for steering meetings.
Contribute to high-level technical solutions discussions.
Support organization change management, training, and related document creation.
Build and review test plans and ensure test strategies.
Ensure test cases align to document business and solution requirements.
Ensure BI projects are aligned to business requirements.
Provide support to defect review and resolution.
Participate and monitor QA activities, SIT activities.
Lead UAT sessions with stakeholders.
Coaching and Monitoring

Job Description:
The opportunity
The Business Analyst, Talent Systems at Ontario Teachers Pension Plan will play a pivotal role in managing and optimizing our Talent technology portfolio, with a primary focus on relationship management with program owners within the Talent Centre of Expertise (CoE). Reporting directly to the Director, People Operations, this role will drive the strategic alignment of Talent technology solutions, including key platforms such as Workday (Talent, Recruitment, Succession, Learning), Degreed, Beamery, SuccessFinder and HireVue.
Who you'll work with
The Business Analyst, Talent Systems will partner with Program owners to make decisions on requirements and enhancements to make in Talent Technology portfolio.
What you'll do
1. Relationship Management
Collaborate closely with program owners in the Talent CoE to understand their technology needs and challenges
Build and maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholders, ensuring their requirements and expectations are met
Serve as the primary liaison between the HRIS team and program owners
2. Talent Technology Strategy and Roadmap
In partnership with Talent leadership, develop and implement a strategic roadmap for existing Talent technology
Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies to recommend innovative solutions that drive Talent process improvements with a key focus on integrating AI and D&A to elevate technology offerings
3. System Optimization
Partner with the HRIS team to deliver requirements to enhance talent technology systems
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security within Talent systems
4. Project Management
Lead and participate in Talent Technology projects, from requirements gathering and vendor selection to implementation and post-implementation upgrades and related support
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery on time and within budget
5. Vendor Management
Partner with Talent CoE to manage relationships with Talent Technology vendors, negotiating contracts and supporting system upgrades
6. User Support and Training
Provide user support and initial training to program owners and Talent teams to maximize the utilization of Talent Technology solutions
What you'll need
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, or a related field (Master's degree preferred)
5+ years of experience in Talent Technology, with a strong focus on key technologies like Workday, Degreed, Beamery, SuccessFinder and HireVue
Proven experience in project management and vendor management
Talent Technology certifications (e.g., Workday, Degreed) are a plus
Comprehensive understanding of talent programs and processes, including Talent Acquisition, Learning, Leadership Development, DEI and Talent
Strong service orientation focused on delivery pragmatic value to stakeholders efficiently
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills
Ability to analyze data and make data-driven decisions

Competitive compensation
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development
A flexible/hybrid work environment combining in office collaboration and remote working
Our Flexible Travel Program gives you the option to work abroad in another region/country for up to a month each year
Employee discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis

The is an 18-month maternity leave contract, this individual will ensure the sales team takes full advantage of sales metrics and reporting, including setting up processes, training uses, and ensuring decision makers have the information they need. These supporting efforts will increase efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations and processes in order to make our sales force more impactful and help drive revenue growth. Primary Duties and Responsibilities
a) Support Team with ad hoc reports as required and monthly reporting requirements  i.e. Buying Group Sales, Defective Percentages.
b) Prepare monthly Channel Performance vs. Economic Data analysis  i.e. New Construction vs. Housing Starts, Traditional Retail vs. Existing Home Sales
c) Manage pre-sales estimate process, identify major changes in monthly updates.
d) Create & maintain Key Customer Guide
e) Responsible for sales team processes i.e.  new rep setup, account assignment changes, maintain customer data/mapping integrity.
f) Prepare monthly customer sales reports for rebate purposes.
g) Update and maintain SG (Sales Guide) letters and customer commercial agreements.
h) Support National Account Managers with trade show logistics, customer meeting preparation, new product listings, maintenance & creation of planograms.
i) Investigate Regional/Territory analytics for Area Sales Managers  help analyze regions/territories using MapPoint.
j) Provide sales forecast and performance reporting for the channels.
k) Develop and maintain a key customer POS and inventory trend tracking mechanism.
l) Act as liaison between and among field sales, marketing, supply chain, and other functional units.
m) Track and monitor monthly budgets and update accordingly.
n) Coordinate and assist in market level and key distributor level strategic planning.
o) Other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience
a) Secondary education in Business or a related field (Statistics, Mathematics, etc.).
b) Minimum of five years of experience in sales operations.
Required Qualifications
a) Business acumen and basic finance skills
b) Strong computer skills in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
c) Excellent presentation and negotiating abilities
d) Strong leadership skills, including emotional intelligence and professional maturity
e) Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively with people at all levels of the organization
Preferred Qualifications
a) A bachelor's degree, preferably in Business
b) Direct experience in sales or marketing
c) A background including data mining / data management.
Environmental Conditions
Typical office environment. Hybrid office with expectations to be in office 3 days per week.

Job Description
We are currently looking for a BI Solution Architect who will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining BI projects through the entire lifecycle, from source data analysis, Extract Transform Load (ETL) design, through to Analytics and Reporting implementation. The focus is to:
Design and build Business Intelligence and Analytics solutions.
Design, develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models.
Coach and mentor intermediate team members.
This opportunity is based fully onsite at our Mississauga, ON office location and report to Manager, Analytics.
WHATS IN IT FOR YOU?
Competitive compensation/pay package
Dental/Vision/Medical benefits
Life Insurance
Health Spending Account
Employee Support and Mental Wellness
Competitive matched retirement savings program  RRSP
Be part of a long standing and stable industry leader
WHEN YOU JOIN US YOU WILL;
Business Intelligence and Analytics
Create detailed solution design and reviews across relevant stakeholders to ensure alignment to the overall business needs including architecture overview and detailed solution architecture.
Analyze, document, and optimize the overall BI solution architecture by developing design standards, design reviews, and design brainstorming sessions.
Support the delivery of the BI solution by providing insights to the development teams and project managers that plan and execute project activities.
Create solution architecture documents that explain BI solutions and benefits.
Promote BI architect concepts and solutions to IT, and business team members.
Collaborate, support, and guide other IT departments and business partners on BI/Analytics initiatives/requests.
Research/Review new BI technologies and solutions.
Lead the implementation of solutions as part of the BI team while following best practice methodologies and clarifying architectural designs through documentation.
Work as part of the BI team as required to implement Proof of Concept (POC) solutions and provide senior level support while following best practice methodologies.
BI representative in the Architecture Review Board (ARB).
Work closely with business and IT stakeholders. Understands the business requirements, application systems, limitations and constraints, companys policies.
Data Modeling
Design, develop, and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models based on business requirements and Data Modeling best practices.
Collaborate with business stakeholders, other architects, and developers to understand data needs.
Evaluate existing data models and recommend optimizations for improved performance and scalability.
Define data standards and convention to ensure consistency and integrity across databases and applications.
Coaching and Monitoring
Manage and work with Business Intelligence developers to build standard development processes and reusable components.
Collaborate closely with the other members of the Business Intelligence and Analytics team and ensures effective implementation of all Business Intelligence and Analytics projects to achieve all clients objectives playing the role of the most senior technical position on the team.
Establish credibility and building impactful relationships with other IT teams and business team members.
Provide Business Intelligence and Analytics training to the business users and IT teams.
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE;
Minimum of 10 years of overall IT experience in hands-on Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Warehouse related projects.
Ten or more years of experience in at least three disciplines, such as business, information, solution or technical architecture, application development, middleware, information analysis, database management or operations in a multitier environment.
Hands on experience with SQL, Power BI, ETL of ELT (SSIS, Azure Data Factory, etc.)
Strong knowledge of Data Warehouse methodologies, Conceptual/Logical/Physical data modeling, data engineering design and development, and Business Intelligence and Analytics visualization solution design and development.
Knowledge of Big Data Concepts, Cloud Solutions such as Azure, AWS or GCP.
Bachelors degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study, or equivalent experience.
Experience in designing and implementing large BI projects with attention to security, scalability, and high performance.
Working experience with Azure data services such as Data Factory, Data Lake, SQL Database, SQL
Experience working with the manufacturing and/or building industries is desired.
Understanding of existing, new, and emerging technologies, and processing environments.
Excellent analytical, planning, and organizational skills.
Excellent written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills with the ability to articulate new ideas and concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences.
Organizationally savvy, with situational and contextual intelligence of the political climate of the enterprise and how to navigate obstacles and politics.
Rapidly comprehends the functions and capabilities of modern technologies.

Job Description:
Sr. PMO Analyst
Req ID: 53076
Location: Toronto, CA
Job Title: Sr. PMO Analyst
Location: Remote

About Sapiens:
Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) empowers the financial sector, with a focus on insurance, to transform and become digital, innovative, and agile. Backed by 40 years of industry expertise, Sapiens offers a complete insurance platform, with pre-integrated, low-code solutions and a cloud-first approach that accelerates customers digital transformation. Serving more than 600 customers in 30 countries, Sapiens offers insurers across Property & Casualty, Workers Compensation and Life markets the most comprehensive set of solutions, from core to complementary, including Reinsurance, Financial & Compliance, Data & Analytics, Digital, and Decision Management. Sapiens team of more than 5,000 employees operates through our offices in North America, the UK, EMEA and Asia Pacific.

Position Summary (Overall purpose and objective of the position):
The Sr. PMO Analyst supports the Project Management teams in assuring projects meet organizational goals and requirements according to standardized processes. This role entails tracking and reporting on progress, team allocations, contract service level agreements, and financials. This position requires excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and must be proficient with all MS Office applications.

Responsibilities:
(List major job responsibilities that an employee must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation.)
Collaborate with different departments, managers, and other PMO Analysts to establish and maintain current, detailed and accurate divisional capacity plans
Responsible for preparing consolidated resources allocation for product group
Projects scheduling and planning
Develop solutions (e.g. reports, dashboards, etc.) to represent data in new and useful ways, working with users, stakeholders, user groups, and others, as appropriate.
Data collection and tracking the progress of projects, presenting the project status/dashboard for the management of the organization.
Preparations of financial forecasts and plan vs actuals
Prepare and distribute month end closure reports including invoicing
Promote efficiency, cost saving and improvement to processes
Responsible for identifying needs and allocating the appropriate resources in order to meet project deadlines.
Maintain functional relationships with both internal and external business partners to ensure that recommendations and results are comprehensible to management.
Participate in departmental strategic and budgetary planning processes; prepares and administers work unit operating budget; provides recommendations on policies and goals desired; and implements new/revised programs according to established guidelines
Prepare and maintain operational reports based on plans, raw data (Defects DB etc.) and resourcing, capacity planning and utilization and work progress.
Provides standard and ad hoc financial reporting.
Assist with tracking of maintenance and license renewals.
Actively participate in PMO related engagements
Provide business unit with support of various operational tools.

Job Requirements, Education/Certification/License/Training:
5+ years of experience in PMO or project management activities such as planning, control, financial reporting, and budget tracking.
Strong Financial Analysis Skills (i.e. POC, Revenue Recognition, SaaS, gross margins).
Experience working with large multi-year program development teams.
Excellent MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word skills
Excellent analytical, problem solving, planning, organizing skills.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to create and deliver presentations.
Previous involvement with the creation of work plans, project scopes and capacity planning
Personal skills: independent worker, thinks outside the box, presentable, excellent interpersonal skills and leadership capabilities.
Strong ownership and accountability for assigned tasks.
Must be detailed oriented.
Strong knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle
Experience with Enterprise Operational and Financial Systems (for example: SAP, Sciforma, OnePlan, DocuSign)  Advantage
PMP/PMI certification  a plus

At Sapiens, we are dedicated to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment. We believe that diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences make us stronger and more innovative. We are committed to creating a culture where every individual is valued and can thrive regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.

Sapiens is an E-Verified & Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V.

About Us

We are AMS. AMS is a global total workforce solutions firm founded in 1996. We enable organizations to thrive in an age of constant change by building, reshaping, and optimizing workforces. We do this through talent acquisition and contingent workforce management, internal mobility and skills development, and talent and technology advisory services. Our solutions are delivered by our 4500+ experts who live our passionate, bold, and authentic values. The ultimate aim is to help clients around the world, including 100+ blue-chip companies, create workforces that are fluid, resilient, diverse, and differentiated. We call this true workforce dexterityand were here to help you achieve it.
The Role

The role of the Customer Success Analyst is to support the delivery of technology implementation projects by providing documentation, analysis, test strategies, and subject matter expertise. Acting as a trusted advisor, the Customer Success Analyst, Hourly will engage with clients, technology partners, and internal stakeholders. Additionally, this role will be responsible for delivering on-going customer support that will assist in the retention and expansion of existing customers. The Customer Success Analyst, Hourly will report to the Customer Success Director, Hourly.

Key Accountabilities

Support the delivery of one or more active technology implementations by providing business analysis, process and technology design, business requirement documentation, test plans, training plans and customer support.
Present and validate design with key customer stakeholders and technology vendor partners.
Produce clear and concise design requirements, testing, and training documentation.
Develop test strategy and the creation of test scenarios and scripts in partnership with the technology partner(s) and customer.
Develop weekly project updates when supporting projects; contribute to weekly project updates when supporting a workstream as part of a larger transformation.
Owns the hypercare and stabilization activity for customer implementations.
Assist with account configuration for new and existing customers.
Provide input to the customer on system training and enablement
Lead the creation of Quarterly Business Review documentation for customers.
Collaborate and actively influence senior project stakeholders (manager level or above), customer SMEs, technology partner stakeholders, and internal AMS team members across COEs.
Collaborate with customers, peers, managers, and technology partners on new innovation, ways of working, and continuous improvement.
Provide demonstrable contribution to internal engagement through improvement, learning, collaboration, and engagement efforts within the team.
Skills & Experience

Working knowledge of HR and/or Talent Acquisition
Experience working in a project environment and autonomously managing end-to-end projects.
Ability to work independently and drive projects and activities without direct supervision.
Proven ability of successfully managing stakeholder relationships
Experience creating or contributing to project plans, test scripts, configuration and integration of business requirements.
Ability to work to tight deadlines, supporting multiple deliverables and activities.
Experience in Agile project delivery methodologies.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data analysis and problem solving.
Working knowledge of the full-recruitment lifecycle is preferred.
Experience documenting business requirements and test plans is a plus.
Experience in preparing and delivering presentations is preferred.
Ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications is advantageous.
What youll get in return

Here at AMS, you have the opportunity to work on projects that integrate across our practice areas, supporting and innovating delivery for our clients. Youll be part of a team with global capabilities and setting a new direction for us in terms of how we creatively solve our clients most pressing talent-related challenges. You can innovate, disrupt and influence with organizations that want to transform their operations and win the war for talent.

What we offer
Stretching, challenging work
A vibrant, diverse and collaborative culture
Flexible working  home working available
A competitive reward and benefits package.

At AMS, different is not just good, its valuable. As a global organization, we recognize the value of different perspectives and experiences in prompting innovation, sparking creativity, and solving problems. As an equal employment opportunity organization, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, Aboriginal peoples, members of visible minorities, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, persons with disabilities and all other categories protected by law.

FSRA is committed to attracting and retaining exceptional people who bring energy, expertise, and experience. This includes providing a comprehensive total rewards package that looks beyond compensation and takes into consideration those things that are important to employees:
High employee engagement scores with opportunity for growth, learning and development
Flexibility with a hybrid work model in an office designed for collaboration
Competitive benefits plan, including a Defined Benefit pension plan
Promoting wellness and fostering an inclusive environment where all employees feel valued and respected
Culture of giving back to our communities through charitable activities
Job Description:
PURPOSE OF POSITION
Accountable for the development of risk models and conducting detailed risk analyses, assessments and for leading change in departmental processes and systems in support of overall regulatory risk management and Risk Assessment strategies.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Supports the development of risk assessment, monitoring and stress testing tools and methodologies.
Conducts comprehensive risk analysis of business intelligence, market data, financial and other regulatory information requested from / submitted by credit unions, to assess each institutions overall performance in such risk areas as: credit, market, structural, liquidity, operational and strategic.
Maintains risk assessment profiles for each institution based on detailed analysis of prescribed factors and identifies the impact of emerging risks as trends as well as providing an action plan for further monitoring and follow up.
Supports the preparation and analysis of sector and peer related information and data trends  including published data on the FSRA website
Supports the development and maintenance of data collection and reporting systems in collaboration with IT
Develops and maintains business relationships across the Credit Union and Insurance Prudential Function (in conjunction with other Supervisory Teams) to provide risk analysis expertise, collaboration and services in support of decision making and other initiatives.
Ensures institution risk profiles and related documentation remain current and accurate to support decision making regarding supervisory actions and insurance premium amounts.
Provides analytical support and recommendations to inform decision-making regarding regulatory requests and approvals (e.g, request for new subsidiary, capital issuance, significant investments, new business etc).
Prepares qualitative and quantitative reports to support supervisory reviews, assessments, and decision making activities (e.g. policy changes, Guidance Notes, Industry Advisories etc) including regular and ad hoc sector trend analysis.
Develops, produces and supports standardized internal reports and reporting templates
Supports internal and external ad hoc data requests and quantitative reporting
Leads assigned Risk Assessment business process review initiatives from concept through to change management implementation and post implementation reviews aimed at developing and/or improving the effectiveness of existing data collection, analysis and reporting methods and supporting Risk Assessment.
Ensures documented processes are in place to effectively execute all required risk assessment activities.
QUALIFICATIONS
Education and Experience
Degree in finance, business, accounting, or related field combined with a C.A, CPA or CFA designation
3  5 years experience in risk analysis and assessment within a financial or business environment
Knowledge of risk analysis and assessment methodologies and techniques.
Demonstrated knowledge of business process methods and techniques and expertise in leading business process reviews and change management initiatives through to implementation.

Knowledge and Skills
Experience in data analytics and risk modeling skills, with Python, R or other tools.
Intermediate/advance excel and VBA skills.
Risk, financial and business analysis skills to analyze complex financial institutions.
Familiarity with Regulatory rating models such as CAMEL, CAMELSC or alternatives.
Strong analytical and data management skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amount of information
Working knowledge of legislation and ability to interpret and apply legislation and regulations in a regulatory environment.
High level skills in PowerBI or other data visualization solutions is considered a strong asset
Oral communication and interpersonal skills to provide risk analysis expertise, customer services and lead/ support change initiatives with multiple stakeholders.
Written communication skills to prepare comprehensive risk analysis and assessment reports as well as change management projects.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with and report to the Director of Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC), Senior Care. Your primary responsibility will be to collect and analyze data to support departmental metrics, strategic initiatives and track trends, as well as refine security tools, data and processes to enhance their efficiency and maximize their value. You will play a key role in reviewing, editing, and organizing technical documents to transform them into clear, concise, and professionally formatted materials.

Success in this role will require strong analytical, writing and communication skills, a solid grasp of security domains and concepts, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Youll also need to be highly collaborative in your work and communicate effectively with colleagues at all levels of the organization.
This role is pivotal in ensuring effective data analytics, communication, project coordination, tool utilization within the Security and Trust department, and ultimately contributing to the achievement of our security and program management objectives.
Key Responsibility
Develop and maintain cybersecurity metrics, KPIs and reports, including tracking security program progress, aligning with standards and organizational objectives, and identifying trends for decision-making.
Create data-driven presentations and reports to communicate strategies, including collaborating with partners to develop new dashboards, metrics, KPIs to maintain a repository of data sources and owners.
Contribute to onboarding and configuring departmental tools to optimize functionality and utilization, and extract maximum value.
Automate security tool analysis, processes and reporting to improve efficiency. This includes attaining subject matter expertise in tools' underlying data and developing domain understanding in specific security-focused tools.
Coordinate and provide project management support, including but not limited to project planning, scheduling, minutes, requirement analysis and risk identification.
Translate intricate technical and department-specific content into easily understandable content, making complex information accessible to a broad audience in a lay person terms.
Qualification and Skills
Minimum 3 years of experience related to data analytics, data modeling risk management, governance, and metrics reporting.
Demonstrated experience in creating technical communications, reports, presentations and dashboards using data visualization tools.
Familiarity with databases (e.g., SQL), programming languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript), and ETL frameworks.
Project management experience along with a knowledge and conceptual understanding of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Knowledge of Azure Security Center, Wiz, Microsoft Cloud App Security, and other relevant security tools, CrowdStrike.
Proficient in data modeling, database design, and data mining techniques.
Proficiency in Jira/Confluence, Power BI, MS-Suites, particularly in MS Excel and PowerPoint.
Ability to create dashboards and deliver audience-relevant technical presentations.
Exposure to monitoring and event management tools.
3+ years of experience in information security or related technology experience required experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Ability to meet deadlines, work with tight schedules and manage multiple priorities with minimal supervision.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills; in particular, experience in translating technical complex concepts into easily understandable format.

Panasonic Canada Inc.
For over 100 years, Panasonic has been committed to enhancing the well-being of people, communities, and society. Our technologies and solutions have been developed with one aim in mind: to enrich our lives and make life better  simpler, healthier, safer, more enjoyable, and more sustainable. Panasonic Canada Inc. (PCI) is a leading technology provider to businesses, government agencies and consumers across the region. The company leverages its strengths in Living Spaces, Immersive Entertainment, Sustainable Energy, Automated Supply Chains and Connected Solutions to provide lifestyle solutions to consumers as well as secure and resilient integrated solutions for B2B and B2G customers. We are proud to be recognized as one of Greater Torontos Top Employers for 2020, 2021 and 2022. Come join our journey.
What Panasonic Canada Inc. Offers

Panasonic Retirement Pension Plan (RPP/DCPP)
Group Retirement Savings Plan (RSP)

Panasonic Canada Inc. Hybrid Work Model
Panasonic Canada Inc. supports a hybrid work model. We understand that flexibility is essential for employees to do their best work while also balancing personal and life needs. Employees can expect to be in the office for a variable number of days per week based on the needs of the business unit, while having the ability to also work remote.

Supply Chain Analyst
Develops, evaluates, communicates, recommends, and implements changes to the demand forecast. Processes orders, executes, and communicates with collaborative customer(s). Reviews sales, market, and non-routine information, analyzes trends, sell-thru, and new product data and makes recommendations. Communicates with all levels of sales and marketing staff, prepares reports, and participates in consensus. Participates in support activities in the event of absence of department staff. Builds and maintains business relationships with sales, marketing, MIS, and key customers.
Please note this is a full-time opportunity.
Responsibilities:
Monitors and releases orders for collaborative partner(s). Closely monitors inventory levels to ensure orders are processed in a timely manner. Key liaison with collaborative partner(s) providing information regarding shipments, forecasts, order status, product availability, timing of shipments both inbound and outbound.
Provides ad hoc reports as required to support order management for specified customer(s). Processes return authorizations and credit notes based on pre-determined criteria, including refused shipments, price adjustments and defective product returns.
Develops a demand plan through the demand planning process. Supports continuous improvement initiatives and recommends and implements changes to the demand planning process when appropriate. Develops a consensus forecast that indicates forecasted demand for an eight-month period based on history and POS data.
Provides solutions to exceptions and alerts created by IBP and makes recommendations or adjustments for non-routine items or issues. Participates in consensus meetings by providing analysis, recommendations, and expertise. Consolidates the demand plan upon consensus. Communicates the approved plan to stakeholders.
Reviews forecast accuracy, research, and analyzes deviations from target, and makes recommendations to improve accuracy. Participates in team resolution of issues.
Liaises with sales and marketing departments to determine non-routine or extra-ordinary items, and adjusts the forecast, makes recommendations, and on approval makes changes. Prepares reports, conducts research, seeks to improve forecasting accuracy, and communicates expertise.
Releases inventory held based on demand plan or sales contracts when it is apparent that the inventory will go unsold, where necessary obtains approval. Evaluates the effectiveness of actions and makes improvements. Communicates with management problem, issues, or errors.
Processes and distributes sell-through data as provided by partner(s). Some validation is required to ensure information received is accurate.
The Successful Candidate Will Have:
College Diploma, Logistics and Supply Chain Managements. APICS certification with a minimum of 2-3 years work-related experience.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office including, Word, Excel, and Outlook. A high-level understanding of SAP and specifically the APO, Business Warehouse, and R/3 modules of SAP.
Requires significant problems solving skills to resolve demand planning issues when dealing with APO statistical forecasts, product lifecycle factors, customer sell-thru, and new product introductions to develop accurate demand plans.
Development of plan based on demand theory with no trends to back up decisions. Also, when releasing inventory that is reserved in the demand planning process, as it requires the knowledge of sales that are upcoming or postponed, specifically negotiated contracts, and back-order situations.
Majority of work involves working in teams to reach consensus on the forecast, facilitating and or participating in meetings, establishing, and maintaining rapport and business relations to effectively gather and give information that influences consensus.
Establishes and maintains rapport with sales, marketing, MIS, and department staff in order to ensure the information provided for the demand planning process is relevant and timely.
Works independently researching customer profiles and sell through trends. Communicates, and accepts the communication of bad news.
How to Apply
Please include a PDF copy of your current resume.

The Financial Crimes Unit (FCU) brings together our Cybersecurity, Fraud, Physical Security and Resilience Planning capabilities to address the ever-growing and increasingly complex global security environment. It is a highly collaborative effort that greatly enhances BMOs ability to rapidly prevent, detect, respond to, and recover from all security & crisis threats. This position offers a unique experience to learn from experienced leaders in the industry, join a team building the 21st century model for security and helping grow the good by protecting our customers and communities.
24/7 operations, 3 different shifts available (Day, Evening, Overnight) schedule may include weekends and statutory holidays shifts.
Banking or credit card experience  preferred
Fraud experience - Asset
Hybrid role (either Toronto, ON or Barrie, ON)
Conducts investigations to identify, assess, decision and report on activity that indicates an exposure to financial crimes. Ensures potential threats and investigations are evaluated, documented, managed and escalated by following standard operating procedures. Provides subject matter expertise and oversight of criminal risk by following a disciplined and intelligence-based approach to detection and research of activities and events in alignment with criminal risk frameworks and standards to ensure compliance as well as support trending, analysis and insights generation.
Provides input and develops recommendations for process and customer service improvements.
Stays abreast of financial crimes risk trends, relevant regulations and compliance standards.
Monitors and analyzes various information provided through detection systems, tools, reports, or manually to evaluate, investigate and determine required actions.
Supports the collection of evidence and information to be used for multiple purposes including incident reports/filings, loss prevention, litigation and criminal prosecution, management information and statistics, and process improvements.
Documents actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files.
Develops and maintains an understanding of the financial crime management processes, frameworks and techniques.
Gathers and formats data into regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Executes routine tasks such as service requests, transactions, queries etc. within relevant service level agreements.
Provides notification, information and instructions to internal/external stakeholders related to incidents as necessary.
Completes complex & diverse tasks within given rules/limits and may include handling escalations from other employees.
Analyzes issues and determines next steps.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Knowledge of risk and regulatory requirements as they apply to financial crimes is an asset.
Knowledge of banking products, services, processes, and organization is an asset.
Specialized knowledge.
Verbal & written communication skills - Good.
Organization skills - Good.
Collaboration & team skills - Good.
Analytical and problem solving skills - Good.

TELUS Health and LifeWorks have recently come together to leverage the power of technology and our caring cultures to further progress our shared goal of building a healthier and friendlier future for all. As a global-leading health and well-being provider  encompassing physical, mental and financial health  TELUS Health is improving health outcomes for consumers, patients, healthcare professionals, employers and employees.
We are currently seeking a motivated individual that is able to combine both a strong technical background and business acumen to contribute to the organization's understanding of the global health and wellbeing market, support decision-making processes, and help drive business growth.

Heres the impact youll make and what well accomplish together

As a member of the TELUS Health Employer Sales Enablement team, you will collaborate with key business partners to transform our global health and wellbeing sales strategy. As an analyst supporting a global sales team, your role would involve conducting research and analysis to support decision-making and strategy to enhance sales growth.
What you will do
Market Research: Conduct comprehensive research on market trends, competitors, customer behavior, and industry dynamics to identify opportunities and risks.
Data Analysis: Analyze market data, including sales figures, market share, and customer feedback, to derive insights and make data-driven recommendations.
Market Segmentation: Identify and segment target markets based on demographics, psychographics, and buying behavior to develop targeted marketing strategies.
Territory Management, supporting account exchanges between segments, regions, account creation and the impact it carries on targets.
Competitive Analysis: Monitor and analyze competitor activities, pricing strategies, product offerings, and market positioning to identify competitive advantages and areas for improvement.
Forecasting and Planning: Develop sales forecasts and projections based on historical data, market trends, and regional insights to support strategic planning and resource allocation.
Reporting and Presentations: Prepare and present reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate market insights and performance metrics at the VP+ level and at the director, manager and account executive level.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, product, operations and finance, to align strategies and ensure effective execution.
Execution: Ensure the Premier Sales Organization (PSO) framework is executed as designed to meet TELUS Healths business objectives.

What you bring
Strategic Thinking: Ability to think strategically and translate market insights into actionable strategies and recommendations.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively present findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders.
Problem-solving: Strong problem-solving skills to identify and address market challenges and opportunities.
Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability of market analysis and reports, as well as Well-balanced time management skills
Technology Skills: Proficiency in using market research tools, Salesforce CRM, and Microsoft Office Suite.
Project Management: Strong project management skills to help deliver results in a complex and ambiguous environment
Grit: Confidence to adapt to and manage changing (and occasionally conflicting) priorities and naturally curious and determined to work around obstacles

Required Knowledge
Advanced MS Excel expertise (working with large datasets, advanced formulas, vlookups, pivot tables etc.)
Advanced knowledge in Salesforce CRM with the ability to create reports, dashboards and make recommendations for process improvements.
Use of graphical data interfaces (e.g. Tableau, Einstein), and/or programming (SQL, Python, SAS) is an asset.
Understanding of B2B sales models, measures and metrics, Sales Industry experience.
Ability to produce database-driven reports as requested by stakeholders.
Required Experience
Post-secondary degree in Business, Computer Science, and/or Engineering.
7-10 years of experience in business analytics and intelligence.
Bilingual French & English a strong asset.
Where permitted by law, company employees must be fully immunized to access a TELUS Health office or customer premises.

Job Summary
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
In this role, you will be responsible for providing business insights within the Avion Rewards Portfolio Analytics team. You will serve as a dedicated analytics partner that frames the output of analytical reports to inform strategic and tactical decision making. You will have the opportunity to facilitate the design and development of analytical products & roadmaps, and working closely with the partnership team, support partner relationships with data related requests.
What will you do?
Act as the dedicated insight partner and subject matter expertise supporting senior leadership and the partnership team (e.g. data visualization, storytelling)
Monitor ongoing performance of partner offers and the competitive landscape to identify trends and actionable insights. Recommend initiatives and tactics to take advantage and respond to both internal and market changes
Design highly effective analytical products such as market share shift, churn analysis, member profiles deep dives, etc. that will enable the business to set strategic direction on client profiles
Prepare and present presentations to internal stakeholders.
What do you need to succeed?
Must have:
Proven analytics and problem-solving skills
A good understanding of SQL and data analysis techniques.
Strong Business acumen and ability to transform data into actionable insights and business recommendations
Leadership skills with ability to lead, collaborate, motivate, challenge and influence cross functional teams to deliver superior results
Communication skills (oral and written) with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of the company.
3-5 years of related work experience
University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analysis
Nice to have:
Previous work experience within Merchant Partnerships or Loyalty experience.
Experience in working with Jupyter notebooks & GitHub.
Experience working with Power BI or Tableau
Experience with a 2-sided marketplace, for example merchants and consumers
Whats in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work

Big Data Management, Cloud Computing, Database Development, Data Mining, Data Warehousing (DW), ETL Processing, Project Management, Quality Management, Requirements Analysis, Software Product Management

Notre passion pour l'innovation est le moteur de notre croissance dans le secteur, grce au dveloppement de nouvelles applications, et d'outils Ad Tech puissants. Mistplay is the #1 Loyalty Program for mobile gamers - with over 20 million users worldwide. Millions of gamers use our platform to discover games, connect with friends, and earn awesome rewards. L'analyste de donnes senior I, analyse commerciale au sein du service de donnes de Mistplay, jouera un rle cl dans la gnration d'informations qui amlioreront la performance commerciale de Mistplay. Tu seras rattache  la gestionnaire principale de l'analyse commerciale. Tu travailleras en partenariat avec nos formidables quipes Commerciales, Produits et AdOps pour rpondre  des questions stratgiques prioritaires. Voici quelques exemples : Quels jeux mobiles ont un fort potentiel de performance sur notre plateforme ? Comment pouvons-nous maximiser les performances de nos clients existants ?

The Senior Data Analyst I, Commercial Analytics within Mistplays Data department, will play a key role in generating insights that will improve Mistplays business performance. You will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Commercial Analytics. You will partner with our awesome Commercial, Product and AdOps teams to answer high-priority strategic questions. Here's a few examples: Which mobile games have a high potential of performing well on our platform? How can we maximize performance for our existing clients?
Tes missions chez Mistplay (English Below):
Diriger des projets d'analyse de bout en bout, y compris des analyses approfondies de la performance des produits AdTech, de la performance et de l'optimisation des campagnes, de la conception et de l'excution d'expriences, ainsi que du dveloppement et du dploiement de modles de dcision.
Dfinir des ICP pour l'entreprise et crer des tableaux de bord, des rapports et des modles automatiss pour permettre aux quipes de Mistplay de prendre de meilleures dcisions.
Trouver des informations stratgiques exploitables par le biais d'entonnoirs, d'analyses de cohortes, de segmentation des utilisateurs, de modles de rgression, etc.
Raliser des expriences multivaries sur les produits pour nous aider  stimuler la croissance, amliorer les fonctionnalits existantes et identifier de nouveaux domaines d'opportunits.
Identifier de manire proactive les opportunits commerciales pour lesquelles les techniques d'analyse et de modlisation peuvent tre utilises comme un avantage concurrentiel, et influencer les parties prenantes dans l'adoption des solutions proposes.
Collaborer avec les parties prenantes pour dfinir les problmes commerciaux, dfinir la porte des projets, identifier les risques et les dpendances, et crer des plans d'excution.
Encadrer et guider les membres de l'quipe dbutants en matire de techniques d'analyse et d'exprimentation, de mthodes de modlisation et de gestion des parties prenantes et des projets.
Profil recherch (English Below):
Baccalaurat en informatique, mathmatiques, conomie, statistiques ou autres domaines quantitatifs.
Plus de 4 ans d'exprience dans l'analyse quantitative (de prfrence dans l'industrie technologique) et une exprience prouve de l'impact sur les dcisions relatives  l'entreprise ou au produit.
Capacit  synthtiser et  communiquer des concepts et des analyses complexes de manire simple et facile  comprendre.
Une solide matrise des mthodes et applications statistiques courantes (tests A/B, probabilits, rgression) ainsi qu'une bonne dose de scepticisme.
Matrise du langage SQL. Vaste exprience de l'extraction de donnes complexes et hautement dimensionnelles, ainsi que de la modlisation de scnarios et de l'analyse de sensibilit  l'aide d'Excel.
Exprience de la programmation Python
Exprience en modlisation statistique
Familiarit avec Tableau ou tout autre outil de BI
Une attitude positive et une bonne dose de curiosit naturelle. Il faut rpondre aux questions et nos donnes ne vont pas s'analyser toutes seules. (Nous y travaillons.)
Un atout si tu as (English below) :
Passion pour les jeux et familiarit avec l'industrie du jeu.
Comprhension de l'apprentissage automatique, de la science des donnes et/ou d'au moins un logiciel de statistiques (SciPy, Matlab, Stata, SAS).
Exprience de dveloppement en utilisant des langages de programmation tels que R, Python ou Scala.
Exprience du travail avec de trs grands ensembles de donnes et de l'informatique distribue (Hive/Hadoop)
Familiarit avec des technologies telles que AWS Athena, AWS Data Pipeline, TensorFlow et/ou Google BigQuery pour construire et optimiser des pipelines de donnes de production.
What youll do at Misplay:
Lead end-to-end analytics projects, including deep dives into AdTech product performance, campaign performance and optimization, experiment design and execution, and the development and deployment of decision models.
Define KPIs for the company and build automated dashboards, reports, and models to enable teams at Mistplay to make better decisions.
Find actionable strategic insights through funnels, cohort analyses, user segmentation, regression models and more.
Own and run multivariate product experiments to help us drive growth, improve existing features, and identify new areas of opportunity.
Proactively identify business opportunities where analytics and modeling techniques can be used as a competitive advantage, and influence stakeholders in adopting proposed solutions.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define business problems, scope out projects, identify risks and dependencies, and create execution plans.
Coach and mentor junior team members in analytics and experimentation techniques, modeling methods, and stakeholder and project management.
What you'll bring to Mistplay:
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields.
4+ years of work experience doing quantitative analysis (preferably in the tech industry) and a proven track record of impacting a business or product decisions.
Pro-level ability to synthesize and communicate complex concepts and analyses in simple, easy-to-understand ways.
A solid grasp of common statistical methods and applications (A/B testing, probability, regression) along with a healthy dose of skepticism.
Fluency in SQL. Extensive experience pulling highly dimensional and complex data, as well as modeling scenarios and sensitivity analysis using Excel.
Experience with Python programming.
Experience in statistical modeling.
Familiarity with Tableau or any BI tool.
Positive attitude and a healthy dose of natural curiosity. Questions have to be answered and our data isn't just going to analyze itself. (We're working on that.)
Bonus if you have:
A love of gaming and familiarity with the games industry.
Understanding of machine learning, data science and/or at least one statistics package (i.e. SciPy, Matlab, Stata, SAS).
Development experience using programming languages such as R, Python or Scala.
Experience working with very large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)
Familiarity with technologies such as AWS Athena, AWS Data Pipeline, TensorFlow and/or Google BigQuery to build and optimize production data pipelines.

Pourquoi choisir Mistplay ?

Nous faisons tout pour rendre notre environnement de travail aussi accueillant et plaisant que possible ! Un poste chez Mistplay saccompagne de toute une srie d'avantages que nous proposons en mode virtuel ou prsentiel : djeuners d'quipe, soires jeux, vnements  l'chelle de l'entreprise, et bien plus encore.
Notre culture est profondment ancre dans la croissance et soutenue par une quipe de personnes intelligentes, dynamiques et enthousiastes. Nous utilisons les donnes pour apprendre, amliorer et adapter en permanence. Nous favorisons un environnement dans lequel chacun est encourag  partager ses ides,  repousser les limites,  prendre des risques calculs et  voir ses visions se concrtiser.

Why Mistplay?

We strive to make our work environment as inviting and fun as possible! Working at Mistplay is coupled with a whole array of perks that we've adopted virtually and in-person: Team Lunches, game nights, company-wide events, and so much more. Our culture is deeply rooted in growth and upheld by a team of smart, dynamic, and enthusiastic people. We utilize data to constantly learn, improve, and adapt. We foster an environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas, push boundaries, take calculated risks, and witness their visions come to life.

Position Description:
At Elanco, data is crucial in our decision-making process. The Tableau Certified Data Analyst role is critical to ensure the right information is made available at the right time to help interpret and advance Elanco's business insights and analytic support for the Canadian affiliate.
The primary function of the Tableau Certified Data Analyst is to drive business excellence through the design, planning and implementation of commercial processes, projects, data analytics, and initiative to maximize top and bottom-line results.
This position is responsible for partnering with commercial teams (such as sales, marketing, finance, supply chain, global commercial analytics) to ensure that Tableau reporting, and data analytics continue to enable business insight.
The primary accountabilities for this position include:
50% Analysis and Design Definition - Responsible for requirements gathering, supporting the Commercial business to identify functional and technical needs utilizing Tableau and other applications. Closely partnering with stakeholders to ensure clear reporting solutions and data analysis is delivered to the agreed specifications and business benefit. You are a valued member of the team.
25% Business Analysis Planning - Operates at a functional level in assessing and defining the business need and area for improvement. Proactively seeks opportunities to enhance and improve desired outcomes, proposing potential solutions through research & analysis. Selects the appropriate method depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints, and dependencies.
25% Stakeholder Management - Effectively collaborates with stakeholders and maintains relationships by demonstrating business knowledge, analytical prowess, and influence without authority. Contributes to communicate plans, data analysis and change management requirements for stakeholders.
The primary responsibilities for this position include:
Work closely with Business Transformation team and contributes to the future roadmap and strategic direction of Tableau development and other applications in the business insight space.
Problem Solving:
o Identify, assess, and solve business issues where analysis requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
o Demonstrate a strategic approach to achieve business objectives by asking questions, aligning resources, developing action plans, and evaluating plan results.
Support Elanco commercial Sales planning processes, Sales target setting, analysis focused on customers, brands, and markets by understanding Marketing strategy and tactics.
Ensure clear communication with all stakeholders involved in the solution.
Develop and ensure proactive sustainability for commercial analytics platforms across the Elanco affiliate.
Hands-on daily operational support to ensure systems are performing as expected.
Help coordinate vendors and contractors, guiding them to deliver each commitment.
Maintain current knowledge of data-related technologies including CRM, SFE, Veeva/Salesforce and Reporting / Data Visualization Tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Maintain a functional business understanding of Elanco Animal Health brands for key markets.
Minimum Qualification (education, experience and/or training, required certifications):
Tableau Desktop Specialist / Tableau Certified Data experience required.
Python certified proficiency at the intermediate level
SQL, R, SAS, C/C++
Problem solving and analytical skills with high learning agility and ability to see and leverage constraints as an opportunity.
Proficient at analyzing and interpreting various data to drive greater insight capability within Elanco.
Proactive and highly motivated to take ownership of business challenges.
Hold a masters or undergraduate degree in Business, Computer Science, Informatics or have gained similar expertise through practical work experience.
2-3+ years of working experience in Commercial Animal Health / Life Sciences experience preferred
Excellent project management capability.
Strong and effective presentation skills.
Strong knowledge of database management, data governance, and root cause data analysis.
Experience with designing, building, and data integration for processing enterprise-scale data.
Strong knowledge of data governance and data quality design.

Purpose:
Advancement at York leads and inspires meaningful engagement and philanthropic support from alumni and friends to advance the University's mission. We are also deeply committed to building the reputation of York University as a leading, progressive, research-intensive University uniquely positioned for the betterment of society in the 21st century.
Our division is comprised of four departments:
Advancement Services & Operations is the administrative and technology support unit for all Advancement activities.
Alumni Engagement provides programs, services, and engagement to over 360,000 York alumni worldwide.
Development leads efforts to promote and secure philanthropic support from alumni, donors, friends, corporations, and foundations.
Advancement Communications & Marketing works to promote and communicate alumni and donor messages along with direct marketing services for alumni and donor engagement.
Our mission is to inspire and cultivate meaningful engagement and philanthropic support within our diverse communities to advance York University's excellence in education, research, and community service. We accomplish our mission through our values of accountability, collaboration, and entrepreneurship.
In support of this mission, the Director, Application Services and Business Intelligence role directs and leads the implementation of strategies to drive Advancement effectiveness through innovative use of software applications, data architecture, and business intelligence. The role plays a key leadership role in supporting and advancing the strategic priorities of Advancement by aligning efficient and innovative business application, data integration, data governance and business intelligence technologies and resources to meet those priorities.
The role is responsible for understanding Advancement's mission, business model, strategy, and goals, as well as the requisite business applications and architectures to meet Advancement's needs for fundraising, alumni engagement, and administrative operations. The role designs, implements, and evolves process, data, application, and technology architectures to meet current and future needs of the Advancement Division.
The role is responsible for ensuring a secure and robust technology ecosystem appropriate to Advancement's requirements and actively facilitates and enables the integration of data from University business applications for alumni engagement, fundraising, and administrative activities.
The role is responsible for Advancement's enterprise architectural planning, management, effective delivery of application, data, and business intelligence services in a technology ecosystem with a high level of complexity.
The role leads and works collaboratively with senior leaders and administrators across the Division of Advancement in the design and implementation of a full spectrum of business intelligence research and analytics capabilities.
The role works collaboratively with their team, leaders from across UIT, and campus colleagues to foster a client focused culture of quality, inclusion, and continuous improvement, and represents Advancement within the University regarding enterprise architecture, application technology and data standards, policies, and planning. Their efforts, combined with those of their team, will have a direct positive impact on the alumni and donor experience and position Advancement as a leader in application, data, and business intelligence architecture renewal and innovation within the University.

Job Description:
Job Summary
Financial Resource Optimization (FRO) is responsible for management of capital resources in support of RBCs key strategic objectives. FROs mandate includes measurement, monitoring and forecasting of risk-weighted assets, leverage, and capital metrics. FRO works jointly with Businesses, Strategy, and Group Risk Management and other groups in Finance to measure and deploy capital in support of RBCs growth and financial objectives, and adherence to regulatory requirements.

As a Data & Product Analyst student, youll work in the FRO Data, Systems and Business Solutions team supporting the Product Owners with both the existing infrastructure platform and the build-out/upgrades to the platform due to key Regulatory Initiative and/or major initiatives implemented due to the banks key business strategies and objectives.
Job Description
Youll support the Product team by contributing and leading:
Analytics & Metrics. You will help our team make data-driven decisions.
Work alongside a product owner(s) and be responsible for analyzing key data sets and data elements related to Capital Measurement and Reporting.
Development of agile metrics (Sprint velocity, burndown, etc.) to contribute to oversight of BAU (business as usual) team oversight, and increase agile maturity.
Participate on a team where data, measurement, and analysis is integral to smart decision making and ensuring accurate and complete measurement of Capital.
Prototype, test, and operationalize dashboards, KPIs and visualizations.
Assist with Backlog Management and Prioritization.
Root Cause Problem Solving. You will help improve key business processes.
Following the data and metrics extracted above, investigate a business process, engage others in the organization, analyze systems, document as appropriate, and figure out why something is not working/stalling.
Communicate findings concisely and succinctly.
Work with FRO team members to devise, weigh and implement solutions.
Special Projects.
We have a broad mandate within the team, and are always looking for ways to apply creativity and special skills as it helps us to improve our product and user experience.

What do you need to succeed?
Currently enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus on Business, Finance, Data Science & Data Analytics.
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written).
Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast paced environment.
Leadership acumen and a passion to apply it in a dynamic business environment.
Capability to manage multiple priorities across a number of assignments and prioritize effectively.
Experience applying an agile mindset.
Nice-to-have
Knowledge of and experience in capital and risk management.
Knowledge or experience with business analysis process (requirements gathering, documentation, use cases).
Expressed interest or previous experience in the financial industry or FinTech.
Experience with agile or design thinking methodologies or frameworks.
Demonstrated blend of technical and business skills.

Whats in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Opportunities to building close relationships with counterparts across the Bank

At Saputo, our best comes from our people. Were a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, weve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matterfrom our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.
Overview of the Role:
As an Analyst in the Integrated Business Planning (IBP) team, you will support the IBP Manager in tasks related to the execution of Saputo Canadas IBP process.
How you will make contributions that matter:
Assist and support the monthly Integrated Business Planning (IBP) process by preparing reports, presentations and analyses
Support demand planning, supply planning, capacity planning and demand-supply reconciliation decisions for the business
Design, maintain and update data management tools, reports and dashboards on a regular basis
Track, report and analyze key metrics (KPIs) for the company
Maintain master data, aggregate, and disaggregate data for appropriate use ranging from detailed analysis to executive dashboards
Effectively gather datasets from multiple sources and interpret data into actionable insights by leveraging advanced statistical models and connecting data with business factors
Prepare what-if analysis to create alternate scenarios for reconciling demand, supply and financial plans
Support continuous improvement initiatives and challenges with the process
Maintain helpful and positive communication style working with cross functional teams within Saputo
You are best suited for the role if you have the following qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Business, Operations Management, Analytics or related quantitative degree
Minimum of 3 years of work experience in Retail, Manufacturing, CPG or Food Service environments required
Advanced working knowledge of Excel, Powerpoint, database management, data visualization and software such as RStudio and PowerBI required
Strong Analytical skills with the ability to manipulate and analyze large data sets
Certification in SCM or Analytics considered an asset
Experience working in the Sales & Operations Planning or IBP environment would be an asset
Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt; maintain focus and a high degree of accuracy while working with complex data and strict deadlines.
Strong communication skills as well as meeting facilitation and presentation skills a must.
Bilingual English / French is considered an asset.

Competitive salaries
Advantageous corporate agreements
Full range of group insurance benefits
Group retirement pension plan with employer contribution
Purchase option of company stocks
Group RRSP
Health and wellness program in the workplace
Assistance program for employees and their families
Saputo products at a discounted price

Our story began in Canada in 1954, when the Saputo family's hard work and dedication created a thriving dairy business. More than 65 years later, our roots in this country remain strong with our Corporate Headquarters in Montral. Today, we are a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada with well-loved brands, such as Saputo, Alexis de Portneuf, Armstrong, Baxter, Dairyland, Joyya, Milk2Go, Milk2Go Sport, Neilson, Nutrilait, Scotsburn* and Woolwich Goat Dairy. Thanks to our national footprint, we're proud to bring our best to our customers and consumers, and have plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow in their own way. And we do it while also striving to build a healthier future for our people and the communities where we operate, guided by our values and the Saputo Promise.
Join the Saputo Dairy Products Canada team to make your contributions matter every day!
