The University Health Network, where above all else the needs of patients come first, encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute and the Michener Institute of Education. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of ground breaking firsts and a purpose of Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning, the University Health Network (UHN), Canadas largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.
Position Summary
An exciting opportunity is available to showcase your talents as a Senior Project Analyst within the Application and Infrastructure Upgrade Program. This position will deliver solutions that are patient-centric and data-driven, bring value to our stakeholders, and achieve UHNs business objectives. We are seeking a results-driven, innovative individual who can take initiative to help implement various types of digital projects that support patients, clinicians, researchers, educators in clinical and corporate areas. These initiatives include process redesign, software and hardware technology implementation, data analytics, and solution selection/design/implementation and evaluation.
Duties
Analyze business needs, problems, opportunities, and solution scope
Evaluate and validate solution value and benefits to the organization, supporting business case development and return on investment analysis
Facilitate process and design workshops with multidisciplinary groups to identify, validate, and document clinical, business and technical requirements
Conduct workflow review and process redesign, and support continuous improvement processes
Coordinate system design, build and testing
Design data collection processes, collect and analyze data, lead data reporting and data visualization activities
Apply rigorous project management techniques to assist in the management of project plans, schedules, status reports, and budgets
Apply sound change management techniques for effective stakeholder engagement and communications, training, and implementation support
Develop adequate level of knowledge of the subject matter and digital systems being implemented to effectively move projects forward
Lead simple to moderately complex projects of small to medium scope, including planning, and monitoring project progress through tracking project milestones, risks and issues to deliver project within the planned budget, schedule, and with a high level of quality?
Qualifications
Undergraduate Degree in Health Informatics or Administration, Technology, Science, Business, or related field required
Minimum 3 years of Project Management, Business Process/Analysis, and Data Analysis experience or equivalent required
Sound knowledge of project management standards (project planning, implementation, evaluation, risk assessment, benefits realization) required
Experience leading project workstreams or small projects independently, and either supervising or influencing project team members required
Experience in leading and conducting workflow analysis, value stream mapping, data mapping, and Plan-Do-Study-Act cycles required
Experience leading and performing application testing (e.g. unit, regression, acceptance testing) preferred
Experience in applying change management methodologies and tools an asset
Experience in delivering management-level presentations, training and/or end user support an asset
Experience with hardware and/or software vendor relations an asset
Project Management Professional (PMP) or Change Management certification an asset
Clinical training and experience with electronic patient record systems an asset
Familiarity with healthcare information systems, interfaces, HL7, ITIL, data centre, network infrastructure, and/or enterprise architecture an asset
Experience with Epic system an asset, including use, build and/or vendor certified
Meetings and Travel:
Office is in the Toronto Downtown area. Some travel throughout the GTA is required, dependent on project assignment.
Why join UHN?
In addition to working alongside some of the most talented and inspiring healthcare professionals in the world, UHN offers a wide range of benefits, programs and perks. It is the comprehensiveness of these offerings that makes it a differentiating factor, allowing you to find value where it matters most to you, now and throughout your career at UHN.

Job Summary
The Senior Configuration Analyst will be a main player on the IT Service Management (ITSM) team with the key role of managing the day to day activities for the Enterprise Configuration Management process. Objectives include setting up the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), expanding use of the CMDB into other IT processes, aid in establishing a Configuration Management process, and establishing relationships with Configuration Item (CI) owners to enforce the process.

This role will focus on Configuration Management but will also be involved in other aspects of the ITSM processes such as Asset, Change, Incident, Problem, Availability and Service Level Management. The primary responsibility will be setting up and maintaining the CMDB.
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
The Senior Configuration Analyst will be a main player on the IT Service Management (ITSM) team with the key role of managing the day to day activities for the Enterprise Configuration Management process. This role will focus on Configuration Management but will also be involved in other aspects of the ITSM processes such as Asset, Change, Incident, Problem, Availability and Service Level Management.
What will you do?
Support the Senior Manager, Configuration Management Process Owner in the implementation of the CMDB
Assist the Senior Manager, Configuration Management Process Owner with continual process improvement
Collaborate with IT & Process Owners, and Process Stakeholders to gather and analyze needs, translating these needs into requirements
Ensure the Configuration Management process is understood and adhered to
Reconcile the CMDB data when exceptions are noted between CMDB, discovery information, and other authoritative production data repositories
Resolve CI duplicates within the CMDB
Work with Discovery/CMDB administrator to enable Discovery services or implement scripts required to process data feeds to update the CMDB, establish and support controls and procedures to review, assess, prioritize, & track compliance to requirements incorporated into tool and process designs
Maintain process documentation, user guides and operational procedures
Develop reports for management on KPIs to improve the process effectiveness, efficiency, and data accuracy, perform CMDB audits to ensure data completeness and quality, enable process adherence through reporting and dashboards
What do you need to succeed?
Bachelors Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information System or related field along with 5 to 7 years Configuration Management experience
Experience in data analysis and management utilizing advanced Excel techniques
Familiarity with Agile and SCRUM methodologies
Experience in a large IT shared services organization with excellent interpersonal, communication, collaboration and documentation skills
Ability to interact effectively with geographically and culturally diverse teams
Understanding of Service Management processes
ITIL v4 Foundations Certified
Nice to Have
Familiar with CSDM
Experience with ServiceNow
Whats in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Description:
Location: Markham, Ontario
Job Description:
As a member of the Finance Business Technology group, the Senior Inventory Systems Analyst is responsible for supporting the financial and warehousing systems. This position uses their prior experience within a distribution centre environment to resolve issues, design and run queries, reports, and analytics in response to requests by end users and provide training on systems as required. This position is also responsible for representing finance on various information technology projects such as a new warehouse management system (WMS) as well as system upgrades.

This position will build and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with relevant stakeholders such as Information Technology, Finance & Accounting, Supply Chain, and other business teams as required.

Key Responsibilities
Perform inventory reconciliations between financial system (NAV) and WMS system (Manhattan)
Provide systems support to the finance team, particularly Inventory Accounting group, with inventory subsystems and related integrations into the financial management system and to the Distribution Centre team
Support the development of integrations between the new WMS systems and the Financial Management system including gathering end user requirements, collaboration with other Business Analysts on the design, writing test scripts and performing testing of the final solutions.
Troubleshoot, investigate, and solve operation system issues as they relate to financial transactions and information
Collaborate and build strong relationships with Business Partners and Cross-functional team members.
Understand Finance requirements from an inventory accounting, costing and control perspective to ensure these requirements are met on project initiatives and to ensure that overall business objectives are met.
Document processes and standard operating procedures and training users as required
Identify opportunities for process improvement and communicate recommendations to members of cross functional teams and management
Skills, Experience, Education, Certifications
CPA designation is strongly preferred
An accounting designation, degree in business, or a related field is required
A minimum of 4-5 years of experience in accounting roles with an emphasis on inventory processes, costing and accounting, preferably in supply chain
Experience with a warehouse management system is required
Experience or familiarity with technologies and best practices in a distribution centre environment
Experience in implementing, integrating, and working with Financial Management Systems for a mid-sized company (Microsoft Dynamics NAV, or related) is preferred
Experience in contributing to multiple project initiatives and delivering results in fast paced environment
Working knowledge of SQL, Tableau and Microsoft Access is preferred
Strong proficiency in standard end-user computing tools such as Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Visio or equivalent
Excel Power User in data analysis and detailed data summarization
Competencies
Good communicator with excellent written and verbal communication skills
Team player that works well with counterparts from various departments and can influence the work of the overall team.
Highly motivated individual with a strong sense of ownership, responsibility, attention to detail and demonstrated track record in managing multiple projects and tasks concurrently in tight timelines
Self-starter with the ability to work independently as well as with others to meet project goals and timelines
Creative thinker, able to identify areas for improvement and communicate recommendations to management
Critical/logical thinker, capable of identifying the root cause of problems, considering alternatives from a variety of perspectives, and assessing the best solution in the given situation
Able to evaluate process changes and document business requirements in a clear and concise manner for IT developers
Positive and helpful attitude, maintaining user confidence in the companys systems
Detail oriented, highly analytical, and inquisitive
Organized with strong time-management skills
Ability to work well under pressure
Undisputed integrity, personal, and business ethics

Posting #: 929275

The University Health Network, where above all else the needs of patients come first, encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute and the Michener Institute of Education. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of ground breaking firsts and a purpose of Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning, the University Health Network (UHN), Canadas largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.
Position Summary
An exciting opportunity is available to showcase your talents as a Senior Project Analyst within the Application and Infrastructure Upgrade Program. This position will deliver solutions that are patient-centric and data-driven, bring value to our stakeholders, and achieve UHNs business objectives. We are seeking a results-driven, innovative individual who can take initiative to help implement various types of digital projects that support patients, clinicians, researchers, educators in clinical and corporate areas. These initiatives include process redesign, software and hardware technology implementation, data analytics, and solution selection/design/implementation and evaluation.
Duties
Analyze business needs, problems, opportunities, and solution scope
Evaluate and validate solution value and benefits to the organization, supporting business case development and return on investment analysis
Facilitate process and design workshops with multidisciplinary groups to identify, validate, and document clinical, business and technical requirements
Conduct workflow review and process redesign, and support continuous improvement processes
Coordinate system design, build and testing
Design data collection processes, collect and analyze data, lead data reporting and data visualization activities
Apply rigorous project management techniques to assist in the management of project plans, schedules, status reports, and budgets
Apply sound change management techniques for effective stakeholder engagement and communications, training, and implementation support
Develop adequate level of knowledge of the subject matter and digital systems being implemented to effectively move projects forward
Lead simple to moderately complex projects of small to medium scope, including planning, and monitoring project progress through tracking project milestones, risks and issues to deliver project within the planned budget, schedule, and with a high level of quality?
Qualifications
Undergraduate Degree in Health Informatics or Administration, Technology, Science, Business, or related field required
Minimum 3 years of Project Management, Business Process/Analysis, and Data Analysis experience or equivalent required
Sound knowledge of project management standards (project planning, implementation, evaluation, risk assessment, benefits realization) required
Experience leading project workstreams or small projects independently, and either supervising or influencing project team members required
Experience in leading and conducting workflow analysis, value stream mapping, data mapping, and Plan-Do-Study-Act cycles required
Experience leading and performing application testing (e.g. unit, regression, acceptance testing) preferred
Experience in applying change management methodologies and tools an asset
Experience in delivering management-level presentations, training and/or end user support an asset
Experience with hardware and/or software vendor relations an asset
Project Management Professional (PMP) or Change Management certification an asset
Clinical training and experience with electronic patient record systems an asset
Familiarity with healthcare information systems, interfaces, HL7, ITIL, data centre, network infrastructure, and/or enterprise architecture an asset
Experience with Epic system an asset, including use, build and/or vendor certified
Meetings and Travel:
Office is in the Toronto Downtown area. Some travel throughout the GTA is required, dependent on project assignment.
Why join UHN?
In addition to working alongside some of the most talented and inspiring healthcare professionals in the world, UHN offers a wide range of benefits, programs and perks. It is the comprehensiveness of these offerings that makes it a differentiating factor, allowing you to find value where it matters most to you, now and throughout your career at UHN.
Competitive offer packages
Government organization and a member of the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP https://hoopp.com/)
Close access to Transit and UHN shuttle service
A flexible work environment
Opportunities for development and promotions within a large organization
Additional perks (multiple corporate discounts including: travel, restaurants, parking, phone plans, auto insurance discounts, on-site gyms, etc.)
Current UHN employees must have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, to be eligible for consideration.
Vaccines (COVID and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Were building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing whats right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit
CIBC.com
What Youll Be Doing
CIBCs Global Markets business focuses on delivering expert financial and economic analysis and savvy deal-making capabilities to clients in Canada and around the world. The Global Markets team supports fixed income, foreign exchange, commodities, derivatives, equities, and growth markets and is focused on building a strong, innovative relationship-oriented bank.
Within CIBC Global Markets, the Alternate Solutions Group (ASG) was launched in 2013 with a mandate to develop innovative and creative technology-driven capital markets solutions. This group is an unconventional capital markets organization that combines the innovative spirit and agility of a FinTech startup with the financial strength and strong governance protocol of a major financial institution. ASG has been recognized as a global leader in providing disruptive technological capital markets solutions in several product areas including Cross Border Payments, Dynamic Currency Conversion, Multi-currency pre-paid cards, Foreign Cash & Precious Metals Online and white labeling thereof. ASGs client base stretches from some of the largest banks in the world, to corporates to CIBCs retail clients.
We are hiring on the Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) team, a leading FX product in ASG. DCC is a service enabled on ATMs that enables foreign cardholders to pay for their cash withdrawal in their home currency. This optional service provides foreign cardholders with the transparency of knowing exactly how much they will be debited. Since its inception, the DCC product team has built partnerships with 30+ financial institutions to enable this white label solution on 100,000+ ATMs worldwide.
At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, youll be on-site full-time.
How Youll Succeed
We are looking for high-energy individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit, who will help us build our DCC business. You will operate in a fast-paced environment as part of a dynamic, hardworking, production-focused product team. Your key mandate will be to provide analytical and strategic support to the product team.
Leveraging Analytical Skills - Identify, analyze, and interpret patterns in complex data sets and provide recommendations on growth opportunities and business initiatives. Monitor, track and analyze client portfolio performance and economic factors, on an ongoing basis throughout the day, including routine reporting, to be able to respond to client requests and address anomalies. Conduct comprehensive research to assist in the identification and/or analysis of business trends and opportunities
Supporting our Client Relationships - Work with Associates and Directors to investigate, analyze and resolve issues impacting clients. Periodically present to clients (in English and Spanish) to review product performance, technical projects, and value-adding initiatives
Supporting our Sales Pipeline - Work closely with the distribution team to support sales cycle through the completion of client-facing presentations, analysis, and ad-hoc product expertise
Enhancing our Product and Processes - Seek concrete and practical ways to enhance our product and overall value-proposition to our clients. Understand and review our processes, identify areas for improvement, propose and execute productivity-enhancing solutions
Who You Are
You have completed an undergraduate university degree in business, STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) or related field with a demonstrated record of academic excellence (preferred minimum 3.6 GPA)
You have strong interest in capital markets, foreign exchange, payments, and financial technology
You demonstrate 0-3 years of professional and/or extracurricular experience with a record of accomplishment of achievement, teamwork, and execution
You have previous management consulting, capital markets, and product management experience in FX payments is an asset
You are able to work autonomously with limited direction while being team player
You are able to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced, high-pressure, results-oriented work environment
You are a strong communicator and fluent in English & Spanish. You are comfortable presenting analyses and recommendations to senior executives in both languages.
You put your client first. You are effective at creating client-facing material including RFPs, pitchbooks, presentation decks, etc. Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive compensation, a banking benefit*, wellbeing support and additional offers such as employee and family assistance programs and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
Subject to program terms and conditions

Who we are:

Geotab  is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified Great Place to Work. We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.

Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotabs open platform and Geotab Marketplace , offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.

Our team is growing and were looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what its like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

Who you are:

We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Government Security Operations Analyst who will work with DevOps, SRE and Data Platform teams as well as within Geotab Security to help us ensure our Geotab Government solution (GTP Gov) is as a secure cloud native and modern environment, while still achieving our rigorous security compliance goals. This position will work collaboratively with other members of the GovSecOps team in supporting the maintenance of the GTP Gov System Security Plan and associated documents, assisting with process and deliverables as part of our Continuous Monitoring program, as well as communicating with stakeholders to help guide them on Geotab security posture and programs. If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader  we would love to hear from you!

What youll do:

As a Government Security Operations Analyst your key area of responsibility will be to provide support to the Continuous Monitoring Program (cloud security vulnerability management, access control review, remediation of red teaming engagement reports results), ensuring required deliverables are produced and delivered, issues are resolved/mitigated and SLAs adhered to, performing follow-up and escalation as necessary. You will need to work closely with DevOps, SRE, and Data Platfrom Engineering to achieve these goals.

To be successful in this role you will be a self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to quickly understand complex, technical concepts. In addition, the successful candidate will need to be highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
How youll make an impact:
Triage incoming requests (security RFPs, security escalations, etc.) and questions to the GovSecOps team, addressing or escalating as appropriate
Develop a solid end-to-end understanding of Geotab's security programs and the FedRAMP architecture and supporting infrastructure and solutions.
Provide support to the Continuous Monitoring Program (cloud security vulnerability management, access control review, remediation of red teaming engagement reports results), ensuring required deliverables are produced and delivered, issues are resolved/mitigated and SLAs adhered to, performing follow-up and escalation as necessary.
Assist with facilitation of security compliance related discussions around solution requirements and architecture, and impact of changes on security control requirements.
Perform Security Impact Assessments (SIA), risk assessment of proposed and existing solutions for compliance with security controls and best practices, and assist with development and maintenance of documentation in accordance with both certification compliance and company standards.
What youll bring to this role:
Post-Secondary Diploma/Degree specialization in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Security or a related field.
2-3 years experience in Information Security and related technology & tooling such as any of the following: CSPM, Tenable.io, Aqua Security, Sysdig, CrowdStrike, Hashicorp Vault, Veracode.
2-3 years experience in Cloud environments (GCP preferred, AWS and Azure). Experienced with Cloud platform, networking fundamentals, Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)/Security Development Lifecycle (SDL) and related terminology
Experience with application development security using DevOps is highly valued
Knowledge of Security Compliance Frameworks such as CSA CCM, NIST 800-53 or ISO27001 and in particular FedRAMP. Is highly valued
Self-motivated and able to work in an independent manner
Exceptional organizational skills, and attention to detail.
Able to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, remote environment.
Highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem-solve to well-judged decisions.
A strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the organization.
Entrepreneurial mindset and comfortable in a flat organization.
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

At Geotab, we have adopted a flexible first working model in that we have systems, functions, programs and policies in place to support both in-person and virtual work. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!

Building the space between proven and possible, MDA Space (TSX:MDA) is a trusted mission partner to the global space industry. A robotics, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 55-year+ story of world firsts and more than 450 missions, MDA Space is a global leader in communications satellites, Earth and space observation, and space exploration and infrastructure. The MDA Space team of more than 3,000 space experts in Canada, the US and the UK has the knowledge and know-how to turn an audacious customer vision into an achievable mission  bringing to bear a one-of-a-kind mix of experience, engineering excellence and wide-eyed wonder thats been in our DNA since day one. For those who dream big and push boundaries on the ground and in the stars to change the world for the better, well take you there.
We are looking for a Systems Analyst for our Business Systems team at our Brampton or Montreal offices.
Supporting MDA's three business lines of geospatial intelligence, robotics and space operations, and satellite systems, our corporate team knows from experience that working in an environment hands-on learning allows us to collaborate across disciplines and get our work done. From HR and Finance to IT and Communications, we are all driven to reach new heights and advance humanity's place in the universe and on Earth.
Detail :
MDA is looking for a Systems Analyst to join the Business Systems team ; it supports the MDA community in the design, development, implementation and evaluation of new and existing systems hosted on-premises and in third-party IaaS/PaaS/SaaS clouds. Experience with Azure cloud platforms. Provide analyst support for all phases of assigned systems development and implementation projects, including hands-on application support. As a Systems Analyst , your role will include the following:
Responsibilities:
Serve as a liaison between IT and other stakeholders to design/implement the appropriate on-premises systems or cloud services to solve business problems
Work closely with managers and end users to define systems requirements and business objectives
Provide on-call support for production systems and supporting upgrades, hardware/software upgrade projects with end-to-end impact analysis, patching and testing
Provide operational support in the event of outages and interruptions
Research and implement new technologies by participating in the evaluation of technology tools, software and practices
Design/implement custom technology solutions and enhancements to existing systems
Perform cost-benefit analyzes for potential IT systems upgrades to support purchasing decisions
Participate in the deployment, customization and post-implementation fault diagnosis of new systems
Collaborate and work effectively with other IT teams to deliver the required solution and a positive customer experience
Respect release cycles and deliver bug fixes, change requests and enhancements on time
Diagnose software, computing, storage, and networking issues
Create and maintain requirements specifications
Design training programs, create documentation and user guides, and provide training to other team members
Qualifications required:
Bachelor's degree in computer engineering, computer science and data science or a related discipline
5+ years of experience in IT systems administration in a corporate environment and in cloud-based technologies
Strong communication, interpersonal, presentation and technical skills
Superior time management and multitasking skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks with minimal supervision
Critical thinking, strong problem solving and analytical skills
Highly motivated, enthusiastic and positive
Desired qualifications:
Experience in Azure platform administration
Experience with ERP, UKG, HR, Time and Attendance Systems, Project Online, SharePoint Online, Salesforce, Banking Systems.
Practical experience in Soap/Rest API/web service
Experience with relational databases (SQL Server)
Programming languages: C# and VB.Net
Reporting and Business Intelligence Platform: Power BI, IBM Cognos, Crystal reports, Microsoft BI (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS) are an asset or equivalent.

Job Description:
ISS-Corporate is growing! We are looking for an experienced Executive Compensation Analyst (working on the product side) to develop and execute on our B2B SaaS product roadmap. If you want to learn, climb, and shine at a company thats committed to you, then ISS-Corporate just might be the best move youll ever make.
As the Executive Compensation Business Analyst you will focus primarily on supporting and enhancing our cloud-based compensation products for the C-suite and HR departments of publicly traded companies, with the primary users being heads of HR / total rewards, directors of executive compensation programs, general counsels, corporate secretaries, and in some instances CEOs and members of the compensation committees and board of directors.
In this role, you will use your creativity and industry expertise to build solutions for ISS-Corporates industry leading products and services. The Executive Compensation Business Analyst is responsible for product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle, and for integrating various data sources and existing product platforms into a cohesive, compelling, and competitively superior set of services for our core markets. This includes gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision, and working closely with colleagues in Product and Project Management, Quantitative modeling and Research, Development, Client Advisors, Sales, and Marketing to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met.
You will play a crucial role in the company's growth, expected to make substantial contributions as an integral team member.
What you will bring to ISS-Corporate
2+ years of progressive experience in a compensation related field is required, including roles such as a compensation analyst, data analyst, and compensation consultant
Bachelors degree in Finance, Marketing, Management, Information Systems, or a related field
A proven track record of accomplishments and passion to make a difference
Decisive, logical and experienced analyst, and a curious learner who is willing to challenge the status quo
Ability to utilize user insights, data, and statistical analyses to inform decisions
An instinct for creating simple and intuitive user experiences
A strong work ethic and personal drive to achieve product and company goals
Strong leadership skills, and ability to work well in teams in a cross-functional, global, diverse and multi-cultural environment
Absolute personal and business integrity
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to develop inter-personal relationships
Strong problem-solving skills, ability to follow-through independently
Self-motivated and able to work independently under minimal supervision
Strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize tasks, and excellent project management and time-management skills
#LI-MK1 #Associate #ProductMgt #ICS

Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide

Reliability is one of the most important performances expected by our Customers and it needs a consistent monitoring program.
Upon introducing a new fleet into operations, the growth in Reliability needs to be driven to reach the expected targets in an as short as possible time.
Ultimately, feeding our Design teams and suppliers with Reliability data is paramount to ensure continuous improvements of Alstom products.
All along the lifetime of a fleet operation, Reliability is a top Engineering topic to monitor and drive.

You'll support the vehicle and system performance by defining reliability requirements allowing to enhance their capability to meet the expected reliability targets.

Day-to-day, youll work closely with teams across the business, coordinate the different reliability contributors working on the Project for the relevant scope (Train or Subsystem) and much more.

Youll specifically take care of applying the Alstom Transport/Engineering Reliability processes & instructions but also manage the Reliability activities and related deliverables in accordance with QCD (Quality, Cost & Delivery) commitments on the project/program. You'll not just bound on one project or site, position will required to manage different site/project as needed basis.


ACCOUNTABILITIES & AUTHORITIES

Key accountabilities:

During the operation and maintenance phase, the Reliability Co-ordinator validates field failure data collected by the Warranty team and supplies them to the RAM Return of Experience Leader of the Centre of Excellence.; issues the standardised 2-page RAM report.; supplies necessary inputs to RAM Key Performance Indicators KPI
In close coordination with the Quality function, he/she takes part in the reliability growth management process.
Supporting the other stakeholders (design, industrial, sourcing, validation etc..) in the definition of appropriate measures to meet the reliability actions.
Being the point of contact for Reliability, Availability & Maintainability (RAM) matters on the project/program for the corresponding scope (Train / Subsystem) in particular to the Customer (internal or external).
Consolidating the Reliability, Availability & Maintainability( RAM)contribution from the participating suppliers and units and external suppliers
Performing the reliability design reviews as per the project/program schedule
Analyzing issues identified in the field having a significant impact on the product Reliability performance and ensure the outcome of their resolution is capitalised in the relevant process/product documentation.
Be the point of contact for RAMs engineer for on-site communication and work with the team of technicians to gathered technichal info on the failure
Be able to work hands on when required to understnad the failure
Able to generate the Relaibiliity report and organize technichal meetings with customer and other stake holder

Qualification but not limited to :
Bachelor in data analysis, Enginerring
At least 2 years of professional experience in the field of data analysis and statistics.
Excellent command of the MS Excel (Advance)
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Maximo, GSI (CMMS) basic knowledge
Communication skills to obtain the collaboration of the parties involved in the project
Analytical, responsive, strategic, customer-oriented, communicative, challenging and winning attitude.
Zero tolerance for ethics and compliance.
Be very sensitive to safety.

Behavioural competencies:
Positive personality;
Rigorous and reliable;
Promote teamwork and communication;
Ability to work under pressure;
Assertiveness;
Good analytical & synthetical skills;
Strong interpersonal skills;
Self-motivated;
Ability to adapt and passion to learn new techniques in a changing environment.


Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrows mobility. Thats why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?

Equal opportunity statement:
Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

Audit Analyst - Inviting all First Nations, Mtis and Inuit candidates to apply!
Conducts audit engagements to critically assess management and internal control processes, approving the nature, extent and timing of the audit, its execution and the formulation of insightful audit reports. Reports on audits to provide clear, concise and memorable insights on issues and potential issues to assist management in fulfilling mandates. This work provides vital assurance to the Board of Directors and senior management on the quality of internal control systems and reduces the risk of loss and reputational damage to the Company. This work is instrumental in identifying unacceptable/high risk circumstances that could lead to material impact on profitability or reputation. Provides independent assurance on the quality and effectiveness of internal control, risk management, and governance systems and processes to support senior management and the Board in protecting BMO and its reputation.
Inviting all First Nations, Mtis and Inuit candidates to apply!
Conducts advisory engagements and other engagements as required.
Executes audits in full recognition of the risks of the group that encompass the inherent risks, control risks and internal/external environment and regulatory risks. This may encompass individual audits and broader capstone audits of Enterprise level functions/processes.
Conducts advisory engagements and other engagements as required.
Determines impact of changing strategies, tactics, risks and initiatives on audit, advisory and investigative services.
Identifies and evaluates the impact of new and emerging technology and technology risk on the organizations processes and control environment.
Utilizes data analytics in advisory engagements to improve quality and efficiencies.
Develops an awareness of business strategies, policies and standards providing meaningful insights based upon knowledge and research which will continue to improve the Enterprise management and control processes.
Maintains the independence of the audit practice and its personnel.
Develops insightful discussion points contributing to audit reports that provides fair and balanced assessment of governance, risk and control processes based on audit work performed. Deliverables must be objective, clear, concise and timely.
Identifies control deficiencies and provides a fair and balanced assessment of their magnitude.
Maintains working knowledge of the industry, regulatory, broad economic environment, and internal environment, as to the development of new strategies and plans, opportunities and risk, to obtain an understanding of the control environment.
Ensures that all audit procedures executed are conducted in accordance to Corporate Audit Methodology as confirmed by its Quality Assurance program and/or regulatory examination results.
Applies sound judgement in the execution of the assigned work and ensures open lines of communication.
Develops and maintains good working relations with key stakeholders.
Actively monitors change management initiatives and identifies potential risks.
Actively participates and supports Corporate Audit change initiatives.
Maintains and enhances professional audit qualifications in line with industry standards.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 2 - 4 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Professional designations or business designation such as CIA, CPA-Audit.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
Hybrid- 2 days in office

SaaS Operations Technical Analyst - Officer
Charles River Development is an award-winning provider of software and services to the Investments/Financial Services industry. Our client base includes many of the worlds largest investment and financial institutions. To better serve the growing demand for our Software as a Service managed service offerings.
This is a client-facing, business and technical staff position responsible for managing and supporting all aspects of production Charles River IMS systems for multiple clients as part of Charles River SaaS Operations and SaaS strategy.
Why this role is important to us
The team you will be joining is a part of Charles River Development (or CRD), which became a part of State Street in 2018. CRD helps create enterprise investment management software solutions for large institutions in the areas of institutional investment, wealth management, and hedge funds. Together we have created the first open front-to-back platform - State Street Alpha, which was launched in 2019.
Join us if delivering next-generation infrastructure, using emerging technologies like AI and Blockchain sounds like a challenge you are up for.

Purpose and Function:

Working as a member in the growing CRD Onboarding team to manage client applications , supporting and enhancing our clients operational use of the Charles River IMS (CR IMS) systems. The role requires strong technical skills, communication, and understanding of clients problems as well as hands-on client issue management, production support, understanding of DR and execute it, client relations, and an ability to learn on the job.
Responsibilities:
Understand new client Onboarding and implement the CRD system for new projects
Oversight of issue resolution and support clients during the project/Onboarding phase
Design new complex job schedule for clients BOD/EOD batch for business operations
Escalate issues to Senior Management using sound judgement
New client assimilation and transition
Troubleshooting and issue resolution
Monitoring of Client Open Issues Lists to ensure accuracy, completeness, timely, and proper progress on and resolution of issues
Periodic communications with Clients assigned to staff to monitor Client satisfaction and make improvements where appropriate during the Onboarding process
Accountable for ensuring defined processes are followed
Setup connectivity to third party vendors such as Bloomberg, Omgeo, Cassini etc
Identification of issues in existing processes and improve documentation
Occasional off hours / weekend support for client go live activity
Service Partner communications and coordination

Required Competencies:
Track record of working in a high-growth, mission critical software based operations and support environment.
Hands on capability to undertake basic investigative activities on RDBMS such as writing and running queries and data investigations, basic performance diagnosis, basic administration functions
Experience with automation using any scripting languages such as Python/PowerShell/Windows Batch etc.
Working knowledge of any industry standard complex job automation technologies and proven skill to code complex job schedule.
Experience in managing and installing mission critical production software application in a SaaS environment.
Understanding of Infrastructure as Service cloud providers such as Azure/AWS cloud is mandatory.
Bachelors degree
3+ years experience managing and supporting mission critical production software applications.

Ideal Competencies/Experience:
Experience with any of the following software is desired, in order of preference: 1) Charles River IMS, 2) Non-Charles River Trade Order Management software, 3) Middle or Back Office trading applications, or 4) Financial applications.
Experience or familiarity with servers and basic networks is preferred.
Experience with the following is beneficial: databases, server operating systems, servers, networks, job scheduling software, system monitoring software, clusters/high availability systems, Disaster Recovery/Business Continuity, FIX.
About State Street
What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, were making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, weve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.
Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. Youll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.
Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.
State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Position Summary:
You are responsible for the delivery and management of technical and integration interactions and will own the most challenging and interesting cases. As a customer facing support expert, you will be solution focused and service oriented to advocate for the customers when working or escalating high priority cases and issues. In this role, it is equally important to accurately communicate system behaviors and next steps internally and externally. We're looking for someone who understands SaaS environments, the impact of the work they do and how a system like PointClickCare is used. All cases assigned to you will be handled in a professional manner focusing on best customer experience being the goal. NOTE: This role provides both business user functional support and PC/Technical support.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop an in-depth understanding of the product and processes to identify trends impacting functionality, availability, capacity, user satisfaction and infrastructure performance.
As a member of the Customer Support Department, your main area of responsibility will be to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical and integration related issues over the phone or through other electronic interactions
Work cross-functionally in an effective and professional manner with other departments to manage escalations, communicate root cause, solution and resolve cases and issues
Document user problems as per SOP, to proactively contribute to the investigation of defects and other issues to prevent re-occurrence.
Stay abreast of new features, tools and functionalities to maintain product expertise and assist with upskilling of support peers.
Be available to work between the hours of 8am to 8pm EST weekdays, occasional weekends, and on-call as required.
Coordinate and execute internal and external meetings to resolve problems.
Contributing to and helping maintain knowledge base tool
Required Experience:
Post-secondary education preferably in Information Technology or related field, with 1-2 years of SaaS support experience
Aptitude for data analysis and interpretation or Quality Assurance experience.
Experience supporting APIs, Oauth, OpenID, SOAP, REST, JavaScript, SQL, HL7 and XML.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage customer expectations in an extremely fast paced and high demand environment.
Strong communication, relationship management, problem solving and documentation skills with attention to detail.
Experience with AppDynamics, Rhapsody Integration Engine, Laboratory/Radiology/Pharmacy Management Systems is a plus
Experience with performance monitoring technologies and diagnostic tools
Experience with Cloud infrastructure or scalable, high performance web applications
Prior experience using New Relic, DataDog, Sales Force/Service Cloud, Right Answers and PointClickCare is an asset
1 -2 years RDBMS experience, preference for SQL Server
Nice to have:
Experience with Sales Force/Service Cloud
Experience with PointClickCare system
Experience with Knowledge-Centre Support (KCS)
Workforce Management experience
Long-term care experience a plus
ITIL principles a plus

Job Description

The Payroll Analyst performs tasks to maintain employee/payroll records. Duties will include data entry, validation and auditing of work performed. This position will support general administrative tasks across the payroll team. Reporting to the Sr Payroll Manager, the Payroll Analyst is responsible for collection and processing of payroll information for the companys payrolls, while maintaining a high level of confidentiality.
General Duties and Responsibilities (list in order of importance and no more than 8):
Payroll Processing
Responsible for the preparation and processing of bi-weekly payroll for 100 Canada and 2,000 United States employees using UKG Pro software.
Review, analyze and reconcile payroll and other payroll data according to established timelines, standard and procedures to calculate retroactive data as required and identify any payment or data errors managing your time to mee their SLAs.
Monitor and maintain accuracy of employee deductions, garnishments and ensure timely 401K transactions are managed.
Maintain and update payroll policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with federal, provincial, and local laws, as well as company policies.
Conduct audits of payroll data, ensuring accuracy. Investigate data discrepancies/errors and resolve and/or escalate in a timely manner.
Support international payroll team with yearend activities through balancing of reports, communicating with vendors, submitting input requests for the processing of payroll tax returns and reporting.

Payroll Taxes
Administer the issuance of T4s, ROEs, T2200, W2s, and various payroll reports as requested. Also, the preparation of year end reports, and filing of all annual returns with federal/provincial governments.
Work with tax vendor UKG to ensure all taxes are paid timely.

Customer Service
Be the main point of contact for all payroll related inquiries and the subject expert for all Canadian related payroll items.
Provide best-in-class customer service by responding to all emails within 24 hours.
Provide guidance and support to employees and managers regarding payroll-related inquiries, issues, and policies.

Other Duties
Work with other team members to coordinate responsibilities, and prioritize tasks, ensuring all-important deadlines are met.
Coordinate with external auditors during payroll audits and ensure compliance with audit requirements.
Collaborate and build relationships with payroll team members, supporting an efficient and high-performing work environment.
Seeks opportunities to improve/enhance payroll and time processes, provide insights and recommendations.
Be the subject matter expert for all Canadian payroll items.

Qualifications
PCP (Payroll Compliance Practitioner) or working towards is an asset
Strong understanding of both Canada and United States federal, provincial, and local payroll regulations.
Strong understanding of internal controls and payroll best practices
Proficiency with UKG Pro, Kronos Dimensions, expert knowledge of Excel
3-7 years of experience working with Canada and United States payroll
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, problem-solving abilities
Must be able to work effectively in a team setting, a dedicated team player
Emphasis on attention to detail and strong numeracy skills
Strong data entry skills and attention to detail are required. Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word. Must be comfortable with spreadsheets and data analysis. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines. Must be able to communicate effectively with account managers, employees, and team members. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Must be able to work in a team environment.
Strong desire and eagerness to learn
Able to think fast outside the box and work in a fast-paced environment
Highly organized and strong attention to detail and accuracy
Experience processing multi-provincial and multi-cycle payroll
Self-motivated individual who works well independently and as part of a team
Effort and Working Conditions (List travel requirements, working Hours, dress code, and applicable Hazards, and physical requirements)
Passport required, travel to Fort Lauderdale minimum 1 time per year required.
Some travel with Canada may be require
Remote at first and then Hybrid work environment 4 days office, 1 day remote once Canada offices open
Business Casual

About us:
We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of 3.07 billion and around 7,500 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 270,894 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

Location: Markham, Ontario
Job Description:
Job Overview
A hands-on Senior Architect, Business Intelligence who thrives in a dynamic work environment, this role involves working across the entire BI lifecycle, from source data analysis, Extract Transform Load (ETL) development, through to Analysis and Reporting implementation. This role is accountable for the build out of Data and Analytics platform solutions and the implementation of tools needed to enable data discovery, predictive analytics and other features. This role will design, develop, implement and support solutions that empower the business with timely, actionable information. This role is passionate about new, modern BI technologies/solutions and proposes the solutions that keep Pet Valu BI solution as best in class. The Sr Architect BI acts as a mentor on best practices, both for the development team and for the business in their acceptance of new BI solutions, helping them become more mature in terms of the understanding and correct utilization of their departments data assets.
Essential Duties
Promote BI architect concepts and solutions to IT, and business team members. Collaborate, support other IT departments and business partners on BI/reporting initiatives/requests. Research/Review new BI technologies and solutions. Propose new BI technology to ensure BI platforms continue support business needs. Providing inputs to BI strategy, and the short term/long term BI roadmap. Design Pet Valu Business Intelligent data and data analytic platforms to enable self-service BI capability to different business units. Design and implement automated processes, tool sets to enable efficient self-service. Define/maintain enterprise-wide standards, best practices, policies on BI development, security, operation, availability. Provide Business Intelligence solutions including analytics, dashboards and reports to support Pet Valu in making informed decisions that increase the bottom line through improved quality and services. Apply software engineering concepts and best practices to design solutions that meets operational requirements, such as scalability, maintainability, extensibility, and flexibility. Rotated 24/7 Application on call support. Other tasks as assigned.

Skills, Experience, Education, Certifications
At least 7 years of professional software development experience.
5 years of BI architect experience.
Bachelors degree required, masters in computer science or equivalent preferred.
Experience proposing BI strategy, defining short term/long term BI roadmaps.
Experience with large scale systems involving reporting, transactional systems and integration with other enterprise systems.
Experience with modern BI data and visualization cloud bases platforms, Snowflake, Tableau, PowerBI, as example.
Deep understanding of modern data architecture, such as data mesh, data fabric, data lake.
Experience with ELT/ETL development and data integration.
Proficiency in system analysis and design
Collaborate with the Business Analysts in requirements gathering, prototyping and requirements validation. Analyze and verify technical requirements for completeness, consistency, feasibility, and testability.
Resolving technical issues through debugging & investigation.
Experience with multiple Source/Version control systems and understanding of code merging concepts.
Working with high performing technology teams.
Experience with Agile software development methodologies, source control, and automated testing and deployment.
Experience with ITIL framework.
Collaborate with the Business Analysts in requirements gathering, prototyping and requirements validation. Analyze and verify technical requirements for completeness, consistency, feasibility, and testability.
#CORPHIRE

We are seeking a highly skilled and knowledgeable business system analyst with expertise in land management and pipeline operations to join our team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in driving operational excellence and innovation within these sectors. As a domain expert, you will leverage your extensive experience to become a pivotal resource within the organization, providing insights, leading projects, and crafting solutions that enhance efficiency and compliance.
Key responsibilities:
Serve as a subject matter expert in land management and pipeline operations, applying your deep knowledge to guide strategic decisions.
Keep abreast of industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices to advise and influence internal strategies.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document requirements, ensuring solutions meet business needs.
Perform comprehensive business process analyses to identify inefficiencies, pain points, and opportunities for optimization.
Design scalable solutions to complex business challenges, enhancing operational efficiency and effectiveness.
Develop detailed business requirements, functional specifications, and architectural designs, working closely with cross-functional teams.
Conduct data analysis and visualization to support decision-making and provide actionable insights.
Create and manage reports, dashboards, and KPIs to monitor performance and identify areas for continuous improvement.
Foster strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including it teams, vendors, and regulatory bodies, to ensure cohesive and aligned efforts.
Lead and support project teams through the successful implementation of solutions, prioritizing initiatives to align with business objectives.
Ensure seamless collaboration between project managers, developers, and testers to achieve timely and high-quality deliverables.
Required Skills
Bachelors or masters degree in business administration, engineering, geosciences, or a related field.
8-10 years of relevant experience in business analysis, consulting, or a similar role, with a specific focus on land management and pipeline operations.
Comprehensive understanding of land acquisition, rights-of-way, permitting, environmental regulations, and the operational facets of land management and pipeline industries.
Demonstrated ability to deliver complex business analysis projects successfully within these sectors.
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, capable of translating business needs into practical solutions.
Strong communication, stakeholder management, and interpersonal abilities, with proven expertise in bridging gaps between teams and departments.
Proficiency in industry-specific software and tools, such as GIS (e.g., ArcGIS), land management systems, and pipeline management software.
Project management certification (e.g., PMP) and business analysis certification (e.g., CBAP are a plus.
Join us in this pivotal role where your expertise will lead the way in enhancing our operational landscapes. If you are driven by innovation, excellence, and the desire to contribute to sustainable and efficient land management and pipeline operations, we encourage you to apply.

Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better  great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawtons Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.
Ready to Make an impact?

Sobeys is full of exciting opportunities, and we are looking for top talent to join our team! We have a 24-month contract position for a Project Business Systems Analyst!
The Business Systems Analyst will play a vital role in the successful implementation of Dayforce Benefits. This specialist will bring a unique combination of technical expertise and subject matter knowledge in Total Rewards (Pensions/Benefits/Compensation) to support the deployment of the new technology. Collaborating with the Payroll project teams, they will ensure the system's seamless integration, gather business and system requirements, and promote the adoption of best practices in solution delivery and design.
Heres where youll be focusing:

1. Project Support: Work closely with the Director, Total Rewards Systems and the Implementation Lead to facilitate the smooth implementation of Ceridian Dayforce. Provide expert guidance on system capabilities, configurations, data infrastructure and integrations with existing systems. Understand industry best practices and apply this knowledge to optimize systems functionality
2. Business & System requirements: Collaborate with Total Rewards SMEs to gather and document comprehensive business and system requirements. Translate these requirements into actionable plans and solutions.
3. Technical expertise: Provide technical expertise to ensure Ceridian Dayforce meets the organization's needs. Troubleshoot technical issues, conduct system testing, and work with the Implementation team to ensure optimal system functionality.
4. Integrations: Work closely with IT project teams to manage effective integrations with third-party vendors (e.g. SEP, Manulife, Desjardins), as well as other internal systems. Ensure seamless data flow between Dayforce and other external/internal systems, maintaining data accuracy and system reliability.
5. Vendor Collaboration: Collaborate with Project SMEs and third-party vendors to understand their APIs, data structures, and integration requirements. Collaborate with Pensions and Benefits Directors to negotiate and manage vendor agreements, ensuring that integrations are executed effectively.
6. Data Mapping and Transformation: Create data maps and transformation processes to ensure data consistency and integrity when transferring information between the Dayforce and external systems. This includes data validation, cleansing, and enrichment as needed
7. System Testing: Collaborate with Total Rewards SMEs to develop test scripts, plans, scenarios and cases to ensure system functions correctly. Participate in system testing and provide feedback for necessary adjustments.
8. Issue Resolution: Act a primary point of contact for technical issues, integrations, and testing during each phase of the project. Troubleshoot problems, provide solutions and escalate complete issues when necessary
9. Change Management & Transition Planning: Partner with Project Leads to create transition plans for current and future work flows and integrations. Assist in developing change management activities before, during and after cutover.
Experience and knowledge of Ceridian software implementation is strongly preferred.
What you have to offer:

Undergraduate degree in related discipline
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience with HRIS implementation, configuration, and integrations.
Strong technical skills with HRIS software, data management, and integration. Experience and knowledge of Ceridian software implementation is strongly preferred.
Proven track record in gathering business and system requirements and translating them into effective solutions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work with cross-functional teams and diverse stakeholders.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Subject matter expertise in Total Rewards, HR processes and best practices.
Familiarity with relevant Total Rewards compliance and regulations.
Certification in HRIS or relevant technical certifications is a plus
Extensive experience in designing, implementing, and managing integrations between HRIS and third-party systems.
Strong understanding of APIs, data formats, and data transformation processes.
Familiarity with integration tools and platforms.
Proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve integration-related issues.
Knowledge of security and compliance considerations in data integration.
Change management and training experience is a plus.
Proficiency in data analysis and reporting.

This is an outstanding opportunity to join a leading Canadian company with a clear vision and focus. If you are a technically adept Business Systems Analyst with a proven track record in successfully integrating HRIS with third-party systems, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our HR technology landscape.

Physical Security Enablement Analyst
Job Summary
The Physical Security Enablement Analyst resolves moderate security projects, develops skills and expertise to resolve security enablement processes and adherence within the data center in a moderate scope.
Responsibilities
Business Systems
Provide physical security system support across AMER Equinix data center locations
Work cross-functionally to implement changes across all data centers to achieve and maintain a consistent physical security program
Contributes and maintains alignment with global, national, and regional partners in relation to security systems, policy, procedure, strategic direction, and future business objectives
Supports Operational security functions and business process system solutions, including specification standards, data integrity, and exception handling
Provide recommendations for improvement based on research including new tools, processes, and technologies
Contributes to collection, analyzing and reporting to management on operational metrics
Provide process and system guidance to Operations teams who install, troubleshoot, repair, and maintain the security systems for the organization
Maintains currency of knowledge with respect to relevant innovative technology, equipment, and/or systems, including lifecycle analysis
Recommends alterations to design, development, implementation, and analysis to improve the quality of products, new technologies, and/or procedures
Leads process improvement projects
Leads multiple tasks within multi-functional projects
Supports and provides input/guidance on design engineering and project planning for new data centers and the expansion of existing sites
Training
Identifies training needs and supports the development of training programs to educate personnel on various aspects of security, including but not limited to cybersecurity measures, emergency response protocols, physical security policies and procedures, and supporting system tools
Responsibilities will include creating training materials relevant to various collaborators across the enterprise, conducting workshops, and staying updated on the latest security threats and standard processes
Effective communication and the ability to tailor training to different audiences is crucial for this role
Ability to prepare and deliver engaging presentations and communicate information to diverse audiences
Lead training of newly deployed security systems for guarding and Security Operations functions
Project Management
Responsible for the coordination and completion of security projects, setting deadlines, assigning responsibilities, monitoring, and summarizing the progress of the project
Plans and coordinates project scheduling, budgeting, and administrative tasks
Facilitates projects by conducting meetings, recording meeting minutes/action items, and performing thorough follow-ups
Research and analyze data to evaluate operational difficulties and make recommendations to solve problems
Identifies, analyzes, and monitors issues that affect profitability, growth, and productivity
Manage lists, libraries, and related workflow
Process Engineering
Serves as a content contributor for the security systems standards, design guidelines and standard operating procedures (SOP's)
Collects recommendations/input from multi-functional groups to keep SOP's current
Authors a variety of technical security documentation including procedures, articles, reports, and/or user manuals
Adheres to publishing procedures to ensure all documentation is deployed according to established change control processes
Qualifications
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Data Center experience preferred
Comfortable speaking and presenting in front of large groups
In-depth knowledge of security system installation and operation required
Must be a highly organized, self-motivated, and positive teammate with a confirmed ability to provide effective oversight and systems management, development, and follow-up to prompt closure on security initiatives, plans, and solutions
Requires the ability to perform physical tasks as needed to complete special projects within a Data Center environment, such as access control and CCTV system installation surveys, including climbing ladders, and bending and stretching during site inspections
Work independently, make timely decisions, and lead multiple projects and priorities
Ability to work in a supervisory role and lead the team on various operational projects
Ability to read and interpret blueprints and schematics
Must have excellent written and verbal communications skills, and the ability use Microsoft Office Suite proficiently
Ability to travel as needed to various Equinix operating sites in the US, Canada, Central, and South America for up to a week at a time based on project needs
Bilingual Spanish speaking preferred
Education / Certifications / Experience
Bachelors degree from an accredited institution and a minimum of 3 years experience in physical security or data center training-related role (or 6 years experience in the aforementioned fields in lieu of a Bachelors degree)
Experience with a major security systems manufacturer, preferably AMAG Symmetry and or Salient CompleteView  certification a plus
PSP, CPP, or PMP a plus
