Job Description:
Olsen represents authentic, European fashion for self-assured women. With a rich history of over 50 years in fashion, our signature has been modern design and high-quality workmanship while always reflecting the current trends. Represented in more than 30 countries worldwide, we are committed to offering wardrobe solutions that inspire confidence in the modern woman.
ABOUT THE ROLE
Reporting to the Sr, Manager of Merchandise and Planning, the Merchandise Analyst plays a pivotal role in optimizing product allocation and inventory management. This position is responsible for ensuring efficient stock flow to stores while maintaining a keen focus on financial performance across all product categories. The Merchandise Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive sales, maximize margins, and uphold the integrity of the merchandise plan.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Responsible for replenishing and allocating inventory to stores, considering factors such as location, seasonality, and sales history.
Monitor inventory levels and make data-driven recommendations to optimize stock allocation (in-store and online).
Proactively plan, communicate, and take action to meet or exceed sales and margin targets.
Assist with the implementation and management of store assortments by partnering with the buying team to manage store assortments based on store clusters, enhancing full-price sell-through and turnover.
Analyze core item performance and inventory levels on a weekly basis, minimizing stockouts.
Provide quantitative analysis to support pre-season and in-season planning decisions.
Identify and assess the organizational impact of any product or policy changes.
Support stores and e-commerce teams with product and collection knowledge.
Conduct regular analysis of product performance, identifying fast and slow sellers.
Provide insights to support pre-season and in-season planning decisions.
Create and organize the distribution of collection preview/lookbooks for retail.
Create a best sellers sheet displaying seasonal data of sell-through information.
Generate weekly reporting for Olsen.ca & HBC
Create monthly feedback reports on recent deliveries, highlighting areas for improvement and successes.
Identifies fast-selling items and makes recommendations to continue the trend and the sales.
Ensures quantities purchased reflect the integrity of the collection for all stores and selects store buys through defined allocations, also meeting promotional requirements.
Ensure system pricing reflects markdown decisions
Enter all promotional and permanent markdowns in the POS system in a timely manner.
Follows up on daily special requests from stores.
Creates styles in the merchandising system.
Back up the process of entering retail orders into the system.
Under the direction of the Senior Manager, Merchandise & Planning, performs/completes other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by request.
REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in business, merchandising, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in merchandise allocation, planning, or a related role.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis tools.
Knowledge of NetSuite ERP system is a plus.
Knowledge of Canadian retail market trends is a plus.
COMPETENCIES
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (verbal and written).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Knowledge of Canadian retail market trends is a plus.
At Olsen, we are dedicated to ensuring that all applicants have an equal opportunity to demonstrate their skills and qualifications during the recruitment process. If you require accommodation at any stage o f the application process or have specific accommodation needs due to a disability or any other reason, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
We appreciate all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Description:
Who is Mother Parkers?
We are one of the largest tea and coffee manufacturers in North America, with a mission to create a better beverage experience for our customers. As a leading customer solutions provider to some of North Americas largest retailers and foodservice chains, we use state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation to help our customers grow their business and deliver superior products to their clientele. Our team of coffee and tea experts are deeply passionate about what we do, proud of our 100+ years of business success, and excited about building a future with endless possibilities. Come join our team and work among the best, collaborate with high performers, and contribute to challenging work every day!
The Role:
We have an opportunity for an experienced Inventory Analyst to join our team at our Mississauga Plant. In this role you will be responsible for overseeing production materials control, which includes maintaining the inventory system, conducting root cause analysis, and taking corrective action for bill of materials (BOM) issues. As well, you will create and maintain various reports, and contribute to the development and improvement of inventory procedures.
What you get to do:
Manage and maintain the required daily inventory levels to meet production needs.
Analyze inventory flow and make recommendations for improvement.
Examine materials inventory transactions for completeness and accuracy.
Work closely with the Production Planning team to plan packaging material requirements and coordinate production planning activities.
Review Open Shop orders and Production Transactions for accuracy and generate reports to assist in reducing adjustments.
Maintain bill of materials (BOM), routings, machine master, and item master data as it relates to production.
Work with Marketing, Planning, Purchasing, and Production to coordinate the new SKU startups and SKU changes.
Conduct monthly audit for existing item set ups, monitor and report on variances, and identify areas of opportunity for improvement of waste.
Identify areas of improvement for inventory control procedures.
Lead set up, troubleshooting, implementation, and design of all print on demand systems.
Schedule all Cycle Counts for Finished Goods, Material Racks and Production Lines with Material Handlers.
What you bring to the role:
4-5 years of experience in inventory management in the food & beverage, manufacturing or CPG industries.
Working knowledge of any Manufacturing, Production and Inventory control systems: Microsoft Dynamics AX/D365, Infor-APS, MIMI, Planet Together and Impromptu preferred.
High proficiency in MS Office: Excel, Word, Power Point, Access, and Sharepoint.
Excellent written and oral communications skills.
Proven ability to organize and collaborate within a multifunctional team environment.
Detail oriented with excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Able to prioritize and manage multiple requirements simultaneously.
What we offer you:
Competitive Total Rewards package  health benefits coverage on day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, optional Health or Wellness Spending Accounts.
Employee discount program on our coffee and tea products.
Dress for your day  come in your jeans, or a business suit if youre meeting with a client.
Tuition Assistance Program  we value continuous learning and self-development.

By providing your information to us, you understand and agree to Mother Parkers Tea & Coffees Privacy Policy: https://www.mother-parkers.com/privacy-policy/

While Mother Parkers welcomes all applications, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or search firms. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Summary
The BI Developer (BID) will design, develop, and maintain the organizations Business Intelligence solutions. The BID will use data analytics platforms, reporting tools, and visualization techniques to turn raw data into meaningful insights to support the organization in making informed decisions.
Roles & Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, functions, and jobs.
Develop, implement, and optimize Power BI reports and dashboards.
Analyze existing SQL queries for performance improvements.
Implements best practices in data management to ensure the integrity of the data, the quality of the data processes and delivers analyzable or analyzed data to a variety of stakeholders.
Identify data issues proactively and flag them to respective stakeholders.
Review and maintain data replication health.
Review and interpret ongoing business reporting requirements.
Troubleshoot database issues related to data and permissions.
Identify and communicate technical problems, processes, and solutions.
Assist in the development of logical and physical specifications.
Document the development procedure at every stage of the project.
Qualifications
Experience, Education and Designations:
Minimum of 5 years related work experience.
Post-Secondary Degree/Diploma in computer science, information technology, or related field considered an asset.
Experience using Microsoft Dynamics Navision, or Microsoft Dynamics Business Central considered an asset.
Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:
Excellent understanding of T-SQL programming and Microsoft SQL Server
Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services and SQL Server Analysis Services
Strong technical knowledge and experience with Power BI and information visualization techniques and strategies.
Familiarity with business operations, objectives, strategies, process, and information flow
Strong knowledge in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
Skilled in creating pivot tables, graphs, and charts using data tools.
Competencies:
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work independently and efficiently with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated sense of urgency
Strong analytical, organization and problem-solving skills
Continuous improvement and customer centric mindset
Strong written, verbal skills and presentation skills
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to coordinate across teams, working closely with peers to ensure the appropriate focus and sense of urgency is applied to all.
Communicate professionally, both verbally and in writing to coworkers and customers
The position may require work outside of normal business hours (including some weekends and holidays) in response to critical, business-impacting situations.
Benefits
Health benefits - including drug coverage, practitioner, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance.
Retirement savings (pension or other) are provided.
Perks - Company discounts (mobile phone, gym membership, etc.), training programs and opportunities for career advancement, group events, and more
If you feel we are a good fit for your career goals and skillset, we invite you to apply and look forward to reviewing your application. As part of the GMS Inc. family of companies, you can launch your career with a North American building materials distributor and discover opportunities for growth and advancement. We value our team members and believe them to be our greatest assets. As such, we invest in training and strive to provide a work-life balance.
We are an equal opportunity employer.

Dental care
Disability insurance
Life insurance
Vision care

Job Description:
Galbraith Family Law is a dynamic and innovative family law firm with offices in Barrie, Newmarket, Oakville, and St. Catharines. Were on the lookout for an experienced Marketing & CRM Data Analyst to join our team and help us grow.
Overview:
The ideal candidate will be passionate about both marketing strategies and leveraging data analytics from our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system, Zoho, to drive business growth and client engagement. This role offers an exciting opportunity to shape our firm's marketing initiatives while utilizing data-driven insights to enhance client relationships and optimize marketing campaigns.
Responsibilities:
Marketing Strategy Development: Collaborate with internal teams and external service providers to develop comprehensive marketing strategies aligned with the firm's goals and target audience in the family law sector.
Website Redevelopment and Maintenance: Manage a major update of the firms website and continued maintenance and updates to the website as required.
CRM Management: Oversee the management and utilization of the firm's CRM system to ensure accurate data collection, organization, and maintenance of client information.
Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyze CRM data to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to client behavior, preferences, and interactions. Generate regular reports and actionable recommendations to inform marketing strategies and improve client engagement.
Campaign Optimization: Monitor the performance of marketing campaigns across various channels (e.g., digital, social media, email) using CRM data analysis. Identify opportunities for optimization and implement data-driven adjustments to maximize campaign effectiveness and ROI.
Audience Segmentation: Utilize CRM data to segment the client database effectively. Develop targeted marketing campaigns and personalized communication strategies tailored to specific client segments.
Client Retention Strategies: Work closely with internal teams to develop client retention strategies based on CRM insights. Identify opportunities to enhance client satisfaction, loyalty, and lifetime value through proactive communication and personalized experiences.
Graphics and Branding: Assist and oversee in the creation of graphic, stationary and promotional items.
Competitive Analysis: Conduct research and analysis on competitors' marketing strategies and client engagement tactics within the family law industry. Use findings to benchmark performance and identify areas for differentiation and improvement.
Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with internal teams and external service providers to align marketing efforts with business objectives and ensure data integrity within the CRM system. Communicate insights and recommendations effectively to the firms Leadership Team.
Stay Updated: Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to marketing analytics, CRM systems, and data-driven marketing strategies. Proactively seek opportunities to innovate and optimize processes.
Qualifications:
Post secondary education in Marketing, Business Administration, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience (3+ years) in marketing strategy development and execution, preferably within the legal or professional services industry.
Strong proficiency in CRM systems (preferably Zoho) and data analysis tools (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics).
Why Join Galbraith Family Law?
1. We provide a hybrid work model, and this position has the flexibility to work out of either our Barrie or Newmarket office.
2. We provide competitive wages, bonus opportunities and other perks.
3. Were committed to providing high-quality service and going above and beyond for our clients.
4. We have a culture of respect, learning and promote a positive work-life balance.
5. We value family, community, and friendships; always enduring to treat others as you would like to be treated.
6. We offer opportunities for growth and development.
Ready to Apply?
If this position and Galbraith Family Law sound like the perfect fit for you, wed love to hear from you.
To apply, please submit the following to Sondra Yanchus, Sondra@GalbraithFamilyLaw.com:
1. Cover Letter;
2. Resume; and
3. A brief video introducing yourself and outlining your relevant experience and why you want to join our team.

Job Description:
ABOUT FANDUEL
FanDuel Group ("FanDuel") is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media.
FanDuel has a presence across all 50 states with approximately 17 million customers and 28 retail locations. FanDuel is based in New York with offices in New Jersey, Georgia, California, Oregon, Canada and Scotland.
Its networks FanDuel TV and FanDuel+ are broadly distributed on linear cable television and through its relationships with leading direct-to-consumer over-the-top platforms.
FanDuel is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment plc, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and a constituent of the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange.
THE ROSTER
At FanDuel, we give fans a new and innovative way to interact with their favorite games, sports and teams. We're dedicated to building a winning team and we pride ourselves on being able to make every moment mean more, especially when it comes to your career. So, what does "winning" look like at FanDuel? It's recognition for your hard-earned results, a culture that brings out your best workand a roster full of talented coworkers. Make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From creatives professionals to cutting edge technology innovators, FanDuel offers a wide range of career opportunities, best in class benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. At FanDuel, our principle of "We Are One Team" runs through all our offices across the globe, and you can expect to be a part of an exciting company with many opportunities to grow and be successful.
THE POSITION
Our roster has an opening with your name on it
We are looking for an Analyst to join our team. You will derive insights for group-wide and commercial teams in order to drive actionable insights about the business. You will work alongside a group of other analysts through various individual and team assignments to continually evolve the various tools, models, and data visualizations used to drive the FanDuel Group business.
THE GAME PLAN
Everyone on our team has a part to play
Work with other analysts to produce specific insights around customer behavior, year over year trends, and drivers of business performance
Create, modify and evolve models and data visualizations to better understand and explain the day to day performance of various commercial KPIs
Create and maintain automated reporting processes visible to the commercial and group-wide teams
Participate in presentations focused on using analysis to drive new business outcomes
Field and fulfill requests for various business inquires
THE STATS
What we're looking for in our next teammate
Minimum of 1 year of experience in an analytics role preferred
Bachelor's Degree in a highly numerate major (Math, Stats, Econ, etc.) or relevant experience in data and/or business analysis
Strong personal organizational and time management skills
Ability to work in a fast paced environment with a lot of ambiguity
Proficiency in SQL and Excel required; experience with Python or R desirable
Strong problem solving skills, allied with track record of transforming data into actionable business insight
Experience working in groups and leading smaller intra year projects
Experience collaboratively working with colleagues in other countries and time zones preferred
Interest in Fantasy Sports and/or Sports Gaming preferred
PLAYER BENEFITS
We treat our team right
From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give. Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:
An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
Mentorship and professional development resources to help you refine your game
Be well, save well and live well - with FanDuel Total Rewards your benefits are one highlight reel after another
FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principal states, "We Are One Team!" We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, Veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included. We want our team to include diverse individuals because diversity of thought, diversity of perspectives, and diversity of experiences leads to better performance. Having a diverse and inclusive workforce is a core value that we believe makes FanDuel stronger and more competitive as One Team!

Tiger Analytics Inc.
About Us:
Tiger Analytics is advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI. Our business value and leadership have been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner.
We are looking for someone with a good blend of business consulting skills and a data analytics background.
Business Address:
Tiger Analytics Inc.
200 Bay St, North Tower, Suite 1200, PO Box 96, Toronto, ON- M5J 2J2 408-508-4430
www.tigeranalytics.com
Job Title: Data Engineering Analyst
Job Description:
Analyze and Design data analytics solutions for business problems :-
 Analyze sample data sets given by the client to understand the size and type of data (structured or unstructured, text, image, video). Then provide options on the suitable big data frameworks and databases to use.
 Survey business users and IT teams to identify, analyze, collect, transform, and document data sets that can be used to drive business insights. Extract, transform and organize the data into datasets using tools like SQL
 Design the data pipelines so data can be used for Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Operational Research techniques. Drive personalization, real-time decision-making, causal inference and predictive analytics capabilities through the application of Machine Learning, Deep Learning, simulation and AI processes in an agile development framework.
Build quantitative programs using latest analytics tools:-
 Build large scale fault tolerant enterprise applications using Hadoop and Big Data open source solutions such as: MR, Hive, Pig, HBase, Spark
 Define and develop data pipelines and work on end to end holistic data solutions that include OLTP data stores (SQL data stores and others) , NoSQL data stores (Cassandra and others ), messaging and data movement products (such as Kafka, ActiveMQ, and others), search engine products (such as Elastic Search, and others), as well as OLAP data stores (such as Hadoop, HBase, Teradata, and others).
 Develop new data sources by analyzing similar use cases from the Tigers case studies and accelerator PoCs. Simulate market scenarios using Python or other programming tools to create and evaluate new additions to enhance data assets.
 Work with multi-functional teams to access data elements, understand the data being analyzed, and identify improvement opportunities for data ingestion process.
 Develop repeatable testing strategies for measuring results produced by analytics models.
 Test solution algorithms on real-time data processing systems and benchmark performance using R, Python, etc.
 Validate the results of the model by developing testing framework using Hadoop, Python, etc.
 Operationalizing an enterprise data governance strategy. Aligning policies and processes to support data strategy, data quality, regulations, and latency.
Support Data Analytics platforms :-
 Work with clients IT stakeholders to deploy the developed solution and make sure it can be implemented in production by the client engineering team
 Support all data collection, validation, and analysis activities including risk, spend, commodity and supplier information.
 Deliver datasets with the appropriate characteristics for the desired usage patterns and use cases.
 Benchmark the developed solution for data consistency, data latency, data quality and deploy them into production.
 Support & optimize the existing data analytics platforms using Big data tools
Education Qualification: Bachelor of Computer Science/CIS or closely related field. The concepts learned in the coursework in Bachelor of Computer Science/CIS, such as Design of Algorithms, Databases, Data Structures, Data Modeling, Mathematics, Statistics, etc. are required and directly relevant for this job.
Experience:3-5 years
Skills: Python, Hadoop, MR, Pig, NoSQL, SQL, ActiveMQ, HBase, hive, Kafka, OLAP, Spark, OLTP, Teradata
Language: English
Terms of employment: Full Time
Annual Compensation: CAD 110K-150K
Benefits: Health benefits, Dental plan, Disability benefits, Health care Plan, Vision care, Group Insurance, Life insurance, Pension plan
Contact information: canada.careers@tigeranalytics.com

Job Description:
Overview:
Are you looking for an opportunity to be one of the faces to our largest clients? Welcome to your next role! The Event Forecaster will serve as a key representative to our internal and external stakeholders across Supply Chain, Marketing and Business Insights.
This individual is expected to lead the creation of promotional forecasts in collaboration with internal and external partners and requires the ability to fully analyze and speak to the forecasting process and output. This role is also responsible for ensuring high forecast accuracy.

THIS IS A HYBRID ROLE GOING INTO THE OFFICE 2-3 TIMES A WEEK.
1 Concorde Gate
Toronto, ON
M3C 3N6
Responsibilities:
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Build sales forecasts individually and assist in creation of sales forecasts by our forecasting team
Analyze sales performance, data trends, quantify business drivers such as price and marketing initiatives, and create baseline models
Build and refine PowerPoint decks summarizing forecasting insights and results
Present and defend forecasts to the customer and address customer feedback and questions
Serve as the face to the customer, develop and maintain strong relationships to influence decision making and promote HAVIs role as thought leader
Lead communication of project status and reports to appropriate internal and external partners
Manage multiple deliverables timelines and scope in order to meet customer objectives and milestones
Ensure that the forecasting team is using best-in-class methods by keeping up-to-date with industry and business trends
Lead or participate on special project teams
Provide recommendations to demand planning, supply planning and enablement teams on process improvements, solving problems and accomplishing planning objectives based on holistic understanding of cross-functional roles in the overall supply planning process

ABOUT YOU
Education, Work Experience & Skills
Bachelors degree required or Masters preferred with emphasis on Business, Statistics/Informatics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Supply Chain & Logistics with equivalent professional experience
Minimum of 3+ years of data analysis, forecasting, demand planning, supply planning experience
Experience in managing client relationships and expectations in a B2B setting required
Experience in a team environment, with responsibility for end-results
Proficiency in MS Excel (pivot tables, macros), PowerPoint, and Word
Experience with statistical software packages (SAS, SQL, R, Python, etc.) is a plus
Experience with Marketing/Social Media analytics is a plus

Outstanding analytical and creative problem solving abilities
Ability to communicate complex processes in a clear way to large audiences in cross-functional calls
Ability to communicate maturely in client meetings and handle differences in opinion diplomatically
Ability to develop and maintain strong customer relationships
Excellent verbal & written communication and the ability to work with all levels within an organization
Ability to prioritize and be self-directed
Work independently as well as part of the Team
Business expertise in inter-relationships between forecasting, demand planning, and supply planning inputs and outputs

Job Description:
Position Overview:*
We are looking for Business Systems Analyst to join our growing team. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Systems Analysts, is responsible for working with various stakeholders to identify, understand and document business system requirements and processes, with the goal to recommend, build and support the delivery of quality systems solutions and/or enhancements to existing systems.
The Business Systems Analyst will aid in the resolution of reported defects within the scope of their projects and/or enhancements and will work with various functional areas to ensure new applications, features or functionality are well understood and effectively communicated.
Key responsibilities include:
Understand and translate project business requirements into IT system requirements. Includes meeting with various stakeholders to refine business, financial, and operational requirements, along with system goals. Conduct current state analysis, impact and/or gap analysis to identify system impacts, workflows, processes, solution architecture from the defined business requirements.
Develop clear, quality design documents that outline solution details including context diagrams, system workflows or processes, data schemas and/or interfaces that allow team members to clearly understand and follow for development, testing, support and training activities.
Collaborate and contribute in the planning, design, development, testing and deployment of solutions to new applications and/or enhancements to existing applications. Update and revise documentation through the Software Development Lifecycle ( SDLC).
Consult in the resolution of reported defects within the scope of projects and/or enhancements knowledge areas.
Prepare and deliver reports, presentations with recommendations or approaches to meet business requirements within project objectives.
Research system capabilities for optimal system solutions, currency and scalability.
Lead design sessions (ex. JAD) in prototyping new systems for the purpose of enhancing business processes, operations and information process flow.
Participate in pre and post deployment activities, including operational readiness testing, release planning, and post deployment planning and testing.
The ideal candidate will possess:

Based in Mississauga, Canada, and deployed globally, Invafresh is a leading technology company specializing in FreshologyTM software solutions for supermarket & boutique fresh food grocers around the world. In business since 1988, Invafresh continues to invest in its people and technology. Today, Invafresh is an organization of experienced and retail-savvy Freshologists equipped with industry specific solutions that supermarket chains can leverage to succeed in the field of fresh operations.

Our fresh food retail operations solutions are deployed collectively in over 25,000 grocery stores worldwide, actively supporting the in-store execution of fresh operations. POSITION DETAILS:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to guide business decisions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to gather, organize, and transform data into meaningful reports and visualizations that drive actionable insights.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Data Collection and Preparation:
Collaborate with various teams to identify data sources and collect relevant data.
Clean, transform, and preprocess data to ensure accuracy, consistency, and suitability for analysis.

Data Analysis:
Utilize statistical techniques to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful insights.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data to support business objectives.
Perform exploratory data analysis to discover hidden insights.

Reporting and Visualization:
Develop clear and informative dashboards, charts, and visualizations to present insights to stakeholders.
Create recurring reports and automate data visualization processes where possible.

Interpretation and Insight Generation:
Translate complex data into understandable insights that drive decision-making.
Collaborate with business teams to understand their needs and provide data-driven recommendations.

Data Quality and Integrity:
Monitor and ensure data quality and accuracy through regular audits and validation procedures.
Identify and address data discrepancies or anomalies.

Collaboration:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, managers, and data scientists, to understand requirements and provide analytical support.
Communicate findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Continuous Improvement:
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis.
Proactively suggest process improvements and ways to enhance data analysis efficiency

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Mathematics. A Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tool Power BI
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Attention to detail and a strong sense of data accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings in a clear and understandable manner. Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and data modeling is a plus.

WHY INVAFRESH?
Competitive compensation and flex hours and location
We take great pride in our first-class team and culture. Open-door approach at all levels.
Entrepreneurial and rapid growth.
The premium and most progressive product on the market. Focus on continuous innovation.
Work hard/Play hard mentality; we thrive on change and continuously strive for excellence.
Real-time coaching and feedback, growth opportunities, and a supportive and collaborative team

The Distribution Analyst main objective is to improve and support the growth of Air Canada Vacations distribution. The role has a critical function to ensure our distribution channels work efficiently and effectively to allow ACV products to be displayed, shopped, and booked.

The Distribution Analyst will maintain current process and will propose/implement new distribution channels and technologies. A fundamental part of the distribution infrastructure is the package price cache which holds millions of price points that are distributed to display our products for shopping on all travel agents/agencies booking systems, OTA websites and our ACV website. The package cache directly impacts sales and user experience. The Distribution analyst will analyze, propose improvements, establish, and manage all processes for cache efficiency, selection of OnDnD for last minute/promotional products and configure the systems for new launches.

As our business grows with more products and destinations, is imperative to improve and maximize cache utilization. A more efficient cache will reduce call centre calls and can improve B2B/B2B2C bookings on pre-pack products, removing less productive records in the cache will give space for new products.

The distribution analyst will also keep systems running efficiently to frequently update the cache including the related air cache, hotel cache and other systems that directly impact the performance and will find ways to automate processes and create reports to analyze data.

The Distribution Analyst will also participate in the analysis, planning and coordination of projects to improve the current systems or for new distribution channels.

The Distribution Analyst will also review daily stats and reports to quickly action corrective measures, document and follow up on technical issues and CR requests that affect the cache performance and distribution.

Additionally, responsibilities include:
Clear communication of status, issues and progress of projects to stakeholders.
Along with the Functional Area Managers, provide technical inputs and validation for projects.
Keep all documentation, meeting agendas, notes, and communications well organized and fully documented in an easy to search and retrieve format.
Maintain knowledge of the latest industry trends and techniques for product distribution.
Contribute to other RM/Distribution projects as required
Any other related tasks.
Qualifications & Skills

University degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent.
Minimum of (1) years Travel Industry experience.
Minimum of six (3) years experience in a similar analyst role.
Advanced computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Appropriate knowledge in the following areas: Travel product packaging, B2B/B2C distribution.
Analysis and synthesis abilities.
Ability to deal with ambiguity and see the big picture, good business sense, and recommendations with incomplete information.
Demonstrate initiative and creativity.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal/developed analytical skills.
Very developed organizational skills and ability to work under pressure.
Great ability to work in a team and a strong team player. Ability to work in a high-performance team.
Ability to quickly submit initiatives to problems encountered.
Ability to handle large-scale projects effectively and meet deadlines.
Results oriented.
Comfortable in a dynamic and fast working environment.

Abode is seeking a high-performing, energetic individual to join its team as a Business Systems Analyst. As a Business Systems Analyst, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. You will be responsible for analyzing business processes and identifying areas for improvement. This role requires a deep understanding of both business operations and technical systems, along with strong analytical and communication skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders across various departments.
You will work closely with all members of the Abode team and other key stakeholders to help grow the business. As a full-time employee, you will be eligible to participate in Abodes competitive employee benefits package.
Key Responsibilities:
Business Process Analysis: Evaluate existing business processes to identify inefficiencies, redundancies, and areas for improvement.
Requirement Gathering: Work closely with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
System Design and Development: Collaborate with IT teams to design and develop systems and applications that meet business requirements and address identified needs.
Data Analysis: Analyze data to extract insights and inform decision-making processes. Ensure data integrity and accuracy across systems.
System Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop test cases, conduct system testing, and coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure solutions meet business requirements and quality standards.
Change Management: Facilitate change management processes by communicating system changes, training users, and providing ongoing support and documentation.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to continuously improve business processes and systems.
Stakeholder Management: Build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels of the organization to understand their needs, priorities, and concerns.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
Proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Proficiency in business process modeling and documentation.
Knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).
Experience with data analysis tools and techniques.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Relevant certifications such as Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)
Experience with enterprise resource planning systems and business intelligence (BI) tools.
Familiarity with industry-specific regulations and compliance requirements.
If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for analyzing complex business processes and implementing effective solutions, we encourage you to apply for the position of Business Systems Analyst. Join our dynamic team and contribute to the success of our organization.

Job Description:
Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated to delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.
We are currently seeking competent individuals to fulfill the role of Power BI Reports Developer to join our dynamic team for our client, one of the major banks.
Location Address: three (3) days onsite and two (2) days remote
Contract Duration: 8 months
Possibility of extension: Possibly
SCOPE:
Provide planning, assessment, and development effort to complete the migration of approximately 270 operational reports from Courts legacy systems to new CDT solution.
Work with Project Manager and Business Areas to evaluate and modernize reports, where applicable.
Migrate report functionality to Power BI Desktop or Power BI Report Builder based on Project Team assessment
Work with project team to complete all relevant and required documentation, such as knowledge transfer, and communication, to support the completion of the project
DELIVERABLES:
Participate in reporting needs assessment to understand the functionality and design of the current operational reports in use
Perform assessment, and define approach in collaboration with project team and stakeholder to migrate operational reports to appropriate CDT solution standard reporting features or to a Power BI tool (i.e., Desktop or Report Builder)
Perform design and development activities to migrate operational reports to Power BI in alignment with OPS Standards and Guidelines (i.e., AODA, WCAG 2.0 Level AA)
Perform troubleshooting and apply corrective actions to resolve issues with migrated reports and dashboards discovered during pre-release testing
Work with project team to provide relevant and required documentation to support migration activities and knowledge transfer
Participate in knowledge transfer activities
MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS:
Demonstrated working knowledge of Power BI Desktop [At least 2 years of experience]
Demonstrated working knowledge of SQL query languages (T-SQL, PL-SQL) [At least 4 years of experience]
Demonstrated working knowledge of DAX programming (At least 2 years of experience)
SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:
Experience working in a business intelligence team/ environment, developing and delivering business intelligence and/or analytical reports and dashboards
Experience working with Power BI Desktop, and Power BI Report Builder to design and develop reports and dashboards and work with team members to explore options to redesign outdated reports
Experience writing and working with Microsoft Power BI DAX code to implement business logic within Power BI reports
Experience performing troubleshooting of SQL queries, business intelligence and analytical reports, as well as performing data analysis to complete data validation and ensure report accuracy.
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server
Knowledge of ETL tools, such as Azure Data Factory, Microsoft SSDT.

Overview:
Canada Marketplace Analytics Analyst is responsible for developing and handling multiple sales performance reports, Tableau and PowerBI Dashboards and ad hoc analysis. It is a client facing role adept at answering client questions and presenting analysis results. This role works directly with IT and Business teams to lead continuous process improvement. Additionally, this role will support the Canadian Food Forecasting team as needed through creation of forecasts, baseline modelling and other ad hoc analysis. This role also plays a critical role in ensuring best practices are shared and followed by the Global working teams.
Responsibilities:
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Develop and manage sales performance dashboards and reports in Tableau, PowerBI, Python and SAS for supply chain and business insights visibility
Analyze and communicate sales trends and factors driving the business such as price, marketing activity, weather, etc. to internal and external clients
Present sales reports on high profile marketing initiatives to large audiences and address customer feedback and questions
Serve as HAVI Analytics face to the customer, develop and maintain strong relationships to influence decision making and promote HAVIs role as Analytics thought leader
Gather customer requirements when developing new analytics products. Balance client requests and available resources to control scope creep
Manage multiple deliverables timelines and scope in order to meet customer objectives and milestones
Create close alignment with cross-functional business teams and stakeholders to ensure that reporting products and processes utilize best-in-class tools and methods to keep up-to-date with industry and business trends
Provide recommendations to event forecasting and data enablement teams on process improvements, solving problems and accomplishing planning objectives based on holistic understanding of cross-functional roles in the overall data management and Analytics delivery
Lead or participate on special project teams
Work together with forecasting team to create food forecasts as needed
Desired Skills & Experience:
ABOUT YOU
Bachelors degree required with emphasis on Business, Statistics/Informatics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, with equivalent professional experience
Minimum of 2+ years of data analysis, dashboard development, python reporting and modelling development
Advanced knowledge of Python
Tableau and Tableau Server super-user
Working knowledge of PowerBI
Extensive SQL and database knowledge. Experience with large datasets
Working knowledge of SAS
Proficiency in MS Excel (pivot tables, macros), PowerPoint, and Word
Experience in managing client relationships and expectations in a B2B setting required
Experience in a team environment, with responsibility for end-results
Experience with Marketing/Social Media analytics is a plus
Key Competencies
Outstanding analytical and creative problem solving abilities
Ability to communicate complex processes in a clear way to large audiences in cross-functional calls
Ability to communicate maturely in client meetings and handle differences in opinion diplomatically
Ability to develop and maintain strong customer relationships
Excellent verbal & written communication and the ability to work with all levels within an organization
Ability to prioritize and be self-directed
Work independently as well as part of the Team
Business expertise in inter-relationships between Analytics, forecasting, data management, enablement and IT

Benefits:
TOTAL REWARDS
Our total rewards philosophy integrates programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, corporate culture, corporate citizenship and work-life balance. While individual program components may differ by country, some things remain constant:
our commitment to rewarding results
opportunities to work with talented and driven individuals at every level of our company who respect each other, treat each other fairly and hold one another accountable for our customersand our companyssuccess
There's more ...
inclusive employee resource groups
generous medical, dental, vision and other great benefits
paid parental and medical leave programs
401(k) with a company match component and profit sharing
15 days of paid time off plus company holidays
Hybrid work model with flexibility
tuition reimbursement and student loan repayment assistance

Designated paid holidays

Job Description:
theScore, a wholly-owned subsidiary of PENN Entertainment , empowers millions of sports fans through its digital media and sports betting products. Its media app 'theScore' is one of the most popular in North America, delivering fans highly personalized live scores, news, stats, and betting information from their favorite teams, leagues, and players. theScore's sports betting app 'theScore Bet Sportsbook & Casino' delivers an immersive and holistic mobile sports betting and iCasino experience. theScore Bet is currently live in the Company's home province of Ontario. theScore also creates and distributes innovative digital content through its web, social and esports platforms.
About the role
We are looking to expand our Marketing Analytics function by bringing on an Insights Analyst, predominantly focused on the marketing efforts of Hollywood Casino and theScore Casino. As a Marketing Insights Analyst, you will work closely with the Casino Marketing Insights Manager and the Commercial Marketing Team to provide insightful and actionable analysis for the Casino marketing team to provide recommendations on commercial decisions, in areas such as acquisition, retention, CRM, promotional spend, cross-sell and other customer behaviours.
Typical Workday at theScore
Build and interpret the suite of daily, weekly and monthly dashboards to identify key areas for deeper dive analysis.
Deliver ad-hoc analyses on the success of promotional campaigns
Proactively identify gaps and opportunities and deliver clear and actionable insights based on performance data, with the ability to assess impact and effectively communicate these opportunities across the marketing team and organisation at large.
Provide accurate costing estimates for promotional campaigns
Utilise customer segmentation to improve the understanding of our customer base, and how best to optimise marketing efforts.
Implement a commercial and ROI-based approach to marketing insights and proposed activity.
Work cross-functionally with the product, analytics, finance, legal and compliance teams to ensure effective communication and workflow.
Regularly present findings to key stakeholders, and work closely with the Casino Marketing Director to come up with strategies that will drive performance across the business, including delivery of weekly and monthly performance reports & insights.
Other duties as required.
Ensure at all times the implementation of responsible gaming practices.
Other duties as required.
About You
Post-secondary degree in a relevant field, such as mathematics, business or other fields with analytical discipline, would be an advantage.
Data obsessed, not just data driven and with the ability to gather and interpret data.
Excellent mathematical, analytical, statistics and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment independently.
Exceptional communication skills, able to communicate findings to all areas of the business.
Must have experience with SQL, BI tooling and Excel at an advanced level.
Strong casino experience/knowledge is highly desired.
What We Offer
Competitive salary
Comprehensive Benefits package
Fun, relaxed work environment
Education and conference reimbursements

We are looking for a Client Operations Analyst to join our growing team. At Draiver Canada, we move vehicles with a white glove experience, adding value for our clients and creating opportunities for independent drivers. You will continuously have new and exciting challenges, changing the way companies carry out the logistics of their vehicles in the country. You must be able to juggle phone calls, emails, clients, contract drivers, data entry, generating reports, and other duties as assigned. This is a hybrid position.

Meet goal of ticket response time set by the Department Head
Escalates unresolved issues to management as appropriate.
Must be able to handle multiple duties at once in a calm and accurate manner.

2 years of operations, customer service, dispatch, or scheduling experience required
Strong ownership and self-guided problem solver
Excellent phone demeanor and customer service skills
Ability to work and think independently
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Excellent verbal, interpersonal, judgment, and problem-solving skills

Job Description:
At RONA, over 22,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.
We operate or service some 425 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our RONA+, RONA, Rno-Dpt, and Dicks Lumber banners are well equipped to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.
Youve got the talent? Weve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. Youll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.
So, if youre looking to do what you love, we could be a perfect match.

Our expectations:
Reporting to the Operational Efficiency Supervisor, and partnering with various departments, the Opeational Efficiency Analyst is responsible for creating the Distribution Center long-range plan, including understanding the risks related to the capacity of the building and recommending a labour plan to support projected volume. The Operational Efficiency Analyst is also responsible for developing the short-range direction that will enable us to execute the standards set by our Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).

Location: Milton Distribution Center
The role requires experience in the distribution, supply chain or transportation field, in a position including operations analysis.

Your role:
Create short-term inbound and outbound projections/reports utilizing historical and supply- chain data
Create labour and building utilization forecasts by analyzing historical data and sales forecasts
Partner with Operations to efficiently maximize building capacity by providing inbound/outbound forecasting, analyzing inventory levels and/or needs for external storage
Using supply-chain reports, model the labour plan by period and quarter
Partner with Operations to forecast hiring needs
Analyze forecast accuracy to provide input on misses and inaccuracies
Produce consolidated regional weekly operational metrics
Create ad-hoc reports
Collaborate with Continuous Improvement by providing and analyzing data to support the integration of improvement opportunities
Support optimal product flow (vendor solutions): vendor scorecards, master data, refining minimum order quantities
Partner with Supply Chain, Master Data Management, Merchandising, and Operations to ensure data integrity across systems

The qualifications we are looking for:
2-4 years of experience in a supply-chain-analyst role
Post-secondary education in supply-chain management, business, or equivalent experience
Experience with a warehouse management system (WMS) (a strong asset)
Experience with Distribution Center operations (mandatory)
Experience with SQL Server (an asset)
Experience with Power BI (an asset)
Advanced knowledge of software applications, including Excel and Access (mandatory)
Inventory experience within a distribution environment (an asset)
Analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify and creatively resolve complex problems
Successfully manage multiple tasks simultaneously while still being details-oriented
Customer service mindset
Ability to work independently as well as within a team
Strong communication and interpersonal skills

By joining the RONA family, youll enjoy many benefits, such as:
Exclusive employee discounts, plus a 10% discount on store merchandise (at all RONA inc. locations)
Benefits: group insurance, retirement savings plan, annual bonuses, student incentive program, etc.
Career growth opportunities within the company
An inclusive and safe working environment
Promotion of work-life balance
An employer thats involved in the community
And much more!

At Umbra, we're in search of a Business Analyst, Reporting & Analytics, who thrives on simplifying the complex. If you're passionate about turning intricate data into actionable insights and have a knack for designing solutions that make a difference, we want you on our team. Your role will be pivotal in understanding user requirements and working with technology to deliver solutions that drive our business forward.
What youll do to be successful in this role
Dive into complex data sources including SAP, customer POS and advertising spend. Designing solutions that streamline and simplify for impact.
Understand business needs and lead thoughtful design discussions through the engagement with several business units.
Evaluate business challenges to determine the most effective tools and resources for the job.
Support budgeting & forecasting process and process changes throughout the year.
Develop and apply a deep understanding of the data structure and general configuration for assigned systems to resolve business issues.
Hands-on architecture and implementation of solutions with a focus on complex business areas: direct to consumer, wholesale, marketing, and budgeting.
Document technical architecture, system design and taking full ownership of the architectural decisions.
Lead the charge in unit testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and the rollout of new solutions, including training and support for the business.
Manage relationships with external consultants, keeping them focused on important deliverables.
What youll bring
Technical Skills:
Solid knowledge of reporting and analytics systems.
Proven experience implementing solutions in SAP BW & BPC.
Solid understanding of data architecture / design in both legacy and current technologies.
Experience with any of the following is considered an asset: SAP BPC, Azure Data Factory, Snowflake, Power Automate and Power BI.
Organizational Abilities:
Understanding of business processes in areas such as product lifecycle, sales operations, supply chain, logistics and cost analysis.
Excellent time management and organization skills with a strong sense of urgency.
Mature analytical and evidence-based decision-making style.
Customer-centric team player with strong sense of integrity.
Entrepreneurial spirit with an appreciation for design, trends and housewares.
Work style: Reliable, logical thinker with the ability to self-direct and work independently in a fast-paced environment. Assertive with demonstrated ability to successfully manage relationships with partners including developers and consultants to achieve goals.
Preferred Experience: 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role in a medium-sized organization. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is an asset.
Suggested Education: University degree in Business, IT, Social Sciences or related field and strong mathematical skills.
Language/Communication Requirements: Good oral and fluent English communication skills are required.
Heres how we reward success 
Umbra is a place where innovative minds thrive on its fast pace and make things happen. We value our unique work space, our global mindset and our distinct design-centric culture.

Overall, a great place to work and build a career.
Were Umbra A leading global design company, inspired and driven to perform
We share a vision of creating original, modern, casual and affordable design for every room in the home. We are a privately owned, Canadian company with 40 years of industry experience. Led by one of our founders, our designs can be found in over 120 countries across five continents. Our global success is attributed to our entrepreneurial nature and a desire to push ourselves, and each other, beyond our limits.

Internal Title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Revenue Assurance
Status: Regular, Full Time (Hybrid)
Reports to: Sr. Manager, Revenue Assurance
Location: 8133 Warden Ave. Markham ON L6G 1B3
Our Mission
Through trustworthy expertise in submetering solutions, we empower our clients to make their buildings more marketable and residents to reduce their energy consumption.
Position Summary
The Business Intelligence analyst is accountable for the management, development and execution of the Business Intelligence (BI) & Revenue Assurance Program, Annual Rate Increases, operations dashboards, and reporting, and overall Gross Margin (GM) Integrity.
Key Responsibilities:
Extract, clean, and analyze large volumes of data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Conduct deep dive business intelligence analysis into operational areas within Operations to provide analysis and insight on the interplay between the various key performance indicators (e.g., workforce performance & management, Revenue Assurance, productivity, cost and quality drivers).
Effectively collaborate with stakeholders to develop insights and recommendations to enable strategic discussions among leadership.
Provided monthly management insight for performance opportunities, financial Rate and Volume variance analysis to help identify resource allocation opportunities
Accountable for understanding regulation changes and launching organizational projects to implement changes in all impacted areas in submetering (includes non-responsible departments)
Plans, develops and approves all operational policies in all functional areas, with standard operating procedures, and quality management systems for revenue assurance
Monitor daily performance against key metrics to identify opportunities and anomalies
Constantly review current operational processes and be a strategic partner in making recommendations for improvements
Work with all departmental owners to implement and ensure controls are in place to support the lead to cash process for all (billing model) revenue streams
Develop and champion revenue leakage issues across organization by engaging key stakeholders on activity and resource requirements necessary to drive revenue maximization
Stay updated on the latest trends in Business Intelligence, data analytics and emerging technologies
Evaluate and incorporate new tools or techniques that could enhance BI capabilities.
Qualifications:
Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Math, Economics, or other quantitative fields.
Preference to additional training with Data Analytics / IT
Preference for industry experience with Utilities, Telecommunications, or other large consumer base businesses within North American juristictions (250k+ customers)
3+ years of experience in Data Analytics, Operations, or relevant work experience at a fast-growing utility company is preferred.
High Proficiency in data modelling and analysis with demonstrated acumen using the following tools Excel, PowerBI, Python & SQL
Excellent collaboration skills to build strong working partnerships with stakeholders.
Understanding and experience working with statistical revenue and costing information to provide business insight and opportunities to reduce cost.
Strong technical skills to mine large volumes of data.
Ability to apply superior data knowledge & discovery skills into building effective analysis.
Ability to conduct basic statistical and correlation analysis to identify patterns and trends.
Industry or working experience with customer billing environments with large transaction volumes such as Utility or Telecommunications,
Attention to detail and quality, strong time management and project/work planning skills.
Proven ability to work with and deliver Industry Leading Best-in-Class reporting and analytical solutions.
Excellent interpersonal and customer interaction skills to include communications, presentation and conflict resolution skills.
About Metergy Solutions Inc. (Metergy)
As one of North Americas most experienced submetering providers, weve brought turnkey solutions to our clients for over 15 years. We help our customers effectively manage their utility consumption as we supply, install, and remotely read electricity, water and thermal submeters. Across all building types, retrofit or new construction, we have the knowledge, equipment, and staff to deliver a comprehensive solution from design to implementation to billing. We are focused on maintaining strong customer relationships and value team collaboration to achieve our goals. For more information about Metergy, please visit us online https://www.metergysolutions.com/
Metergy is a portfolio company of Brookfield Infrastructure. Brookfield is one of the worlds largest investors, owners, and operators of infrastructure assets across the utilities, transport, energy, data, and sustainable resources sectors. This sponsorship provides Metergy with access to large-scale capital, infrastructure investment expertise and global reach.
Metergys recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities. All accommodations will consider the applicants accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

Job Description:
About Johnvince Foods
Johnvince Foods is a proudly Canadian leading business with over 50 years of experience in processing, manufacturing, and distributing bulk and packaged food products across North America. We offer a wide range of nut products, confections, and other food items that include some of the most recognizable household brands, such as Planters Peanuts. Our commitment to excellence has earned us recognition as a Platinum member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies for over 10 years.

The Role
The Costing Analyst will directly assist with collecting, analyzing, and reviewing the costings of new and existing products. You will also be responsible for the general maintenance of various product databases.

Your Impact
Partner with Account Managers to manage request for product pricing.
Collaborate with Purchasing and Operations regularly to ensure product and labour cost information is accurate.
Generate internal product costing information and relevant reporting.
Maintain a database of new and existing products in the inventory control system.
Provide regular reporting on costs, material, and labour information.
About You
Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role.
Bachelors Degree or equivalent in Business, Finance, Statistics or Economics.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Genuine passion for continuous learning and development
Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills, along with the ability to think strategically, analyze data, and make data-driven decisions.
Heres why you should join the Johnvince Foods team:
Impact and growth. You will have the opportunity to develop your own career path with support from your manager and the HR team.
Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package for you and your family  offering medical, dental, vision and more.
Our great employees who truly transform our mission into a reality! We have been recognized as a Platinum member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies for over 10 years.
At Johnvince Foods, we are dedicated to fostering a workplace that values diversity, promotes inclusivity, and ensures equity for all employees. We are committed to providing a barrier-free recruitment and selection process for all candidates. Should you require accommodations due to a disability or medical condition at any point throughout the hiring process, please contact the Human Resources team by email: hrteam@johnvince.com or by phone: 416-636-6146 extension 5800 and we will work with you to meet your needs.

We thank all applicants for their interest; only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Were building the next generation of capital markets technology. Global capital markets are an ocean of fast-moving, interrelated and complex data. We are looking for passionate and enthusiastic problem-solvers with expertise in capital markets data to join us as we continue providing technology innovation and support to the worlds leading global capital markets companies.
What youll do
The Technical Business Analyst will be tasked with ensuring our software and data solutions meet the highest standards by ensuring the integrity and accuracy of data feed handlers
Work alongside the development team to gather client requirements and develop custom tools to analyze program logic and results
Create and maintain core documentation that defines requirements and records results in order to certify precision between business requirements and technical requirements
Work strategically and employ Python / Pandas to analyze large data sets
Collaborate with other team members to help foster a results-driven, team-oriented environment
Work qualifications
Prior experience with Exchange / Tick Data required
General knowledge of statistics and experience analyzing large data sets using Python / Pandas.
Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and ability to quickly become an SME on our unique platform and capabilities
A self-starter with at least 3+ years of relevant experience
Ability to thrive in a technically complex role, involving a multitude of stakeholders
Strong understanding of tick data delivery methods as well as data access methodologies, including general API terminologies and functions
Must have basic financial knowledge, including how order books are built, differences between an auction style and continuous trading market, and basic calculations such as VWAP or turnover.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with both software developers and customer operations staff
Bachelor's degree required
At the London Stock Exchange Group, we believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organization is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise of creating essential partnerships and open opportunities. Our open culture is central to how we deliver our purpose  driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth  in everything we do.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organization of 25,000 people across 70 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyones race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

JOB SUMMARY:
This role will support the team in a variety of exciting ways. The Supply Chain team works towards enabling better customer experience while remaining cost-efficient. Supply Chain objectives include cost optimization, inventory management, on-time shipping, and customer satisfaction.
As the Supply Chain Analyst, you have the energy, drive, and experience to support our daily operations and reporting needs. The ideal candidate will be able to develop reports and analyze sets of data, manage many moving parts, fix issues, and enjoy working with various individuals. You will play an integral part in ensuring our customers receive the best possible delivery experience.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITES:
Developing Inventory Forecasting Module
Participation in S&OP meetings to ensure Supply meets with Demand
Development of Key Metrics related to supply chain
Conduct Analytical inventory management report and present to management
Packaging material, parts and equipment inventory control and costing.
Create supply requisitions (Local Vendors and non-sellable inventory.
Warehouse spot checking & inventory auditing.
Creating SOPs for the supply chain management.
Ensuring accuracy of warehouse stocks level in the system. SOPs to develop.
Creating templates for production department to ensure all in-house manufacturing process being recorded accurately.
Imputing production reports in the ERP system to generate accurate inventory levels and costing.
Working closely with purchasing and the supply chain department to ensure adequate stock levels being maintained.
Costing Updates of inventory through Bill of Materials.
Vendor Purchasing Import (Local & International vendors and non-sellable inventory as well packaging material, Artwork & Machinery and Equipment inventory).
Control correspondences (Vendors and Non-Sellable inventory).
Inventory Control (Re-order Point)  Packaging materials.
Cost Calculation and Analysis.
To ensure effective, safe, accurate and timely stock management to include space allocation, stock transfer and dealing with non-conforming product.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree preferably in Supply Chain Management or Business Management.
2 to 3 years of experience in logistics and supply chain management within the Food industry.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office & ERP systems.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Effective communication and interpersonal abilities.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality.
Knowledge of regulatory compliance and industry best practices such GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices), HACCP & BRC Protocols.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent of this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position.
