Job Description:
Company Description

Publicis is an omni-channel communications agency with over 600 employees across our Canadian operations. The office is the largest in our industry in Canada and boasts talent across various disciplines of marketing and advertising expertise. Publicis carries a balanced split of Canadian, U.S. and Global clients for which we are Agency of Record. Publicis supports a range of D&I actions through our Driving Change team as well as giving back to the community through a long-standing participation in the Out of the Cold Program. With a strong, active and familial culture, Pub United is the agencys social club, hosting events as wide reaching as Curling, Trivia Nights and more.

Job Description

The Senior CRM Data Analyst is an active member of the Publicis Data & Insights Team.
The Senior CRM Data Analyst will be responsible for aggregating, analyzing and providing insights that help monitor, optimize and deliver data driven recommendations to our clients on a regular (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) and ad-hoc basis. This candidate must strive to ensure that the data used in the analytics process is accurate and robust. Candidates must also think strategically to identify issues that need to be optimized or resolved. The Senior CRM Data Analyst will always work proactively to prioritize resources in order to deliver on the tasks. In addition, it is important for the Senior CRM Analyst to have attention to detail and to validate data that is questionable for accuracy and to help address the why to support any recommendations to clients, in collaboration with the Director CRM Analytics Strategy. In this role, there will also be managing and/or mentoring other Analysts in the team.
As Senior CRM Analyst, you will:
Contribute to analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis.
Create and/or maintain dashboards within Data Studio and Power BI.
Contribute and complete to regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests) based on the needs of the client.
Create data models using to meet client ad hoc requests.
Drive industry leading insights and recommendation on email, SMS, and Push campaigns.
Assist with efforts to optimize the clients CRM business by providing strategic recommendations, based on the insights. You dont simply provide the numbers but tell a data-driven story and will be required to present to clients.
You are an ideal candidate for this role if you:
Think strategically in everything you do.
You are attention detailed in your analysis and will question numbers from the data source and take initiative to validate through internal resources.
Are intrinsically driven and celebrate every success.
Enjoy a variety of work.
Are a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skills.
Set high quality standards for yourself and aim to get every detail right.
Do what it takes to deliver on your commitments.
Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment.
Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback.
Are able to work within both traditional and agile methodologies/processes.
Thrive in a collaborative work environment that has an open door policy since we literally have no doors in our office.
Are able to maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teams.
Believe in continuous learning and improvement.

Qualifications

Candidate Experience:
CRM analytics, ideally within an agency setting.
Experience using insights to make recommendations to clients on how to optimize their business.
In writing industry leading insights based on marketing campaign results.
Experience with SQL and structured datasets.
Working with Marketo (being certified is a bonus).
Experience with structured datasets using SQL, or Python.
Working with Data Visualization tools such as Power BI, Google Studio or Tableau.
Knowledge A/B or multivariate testing and analysis for CRM campaigns.
Candidate Education:
Undergraduate Degree (Marketing, Business, Statistics, Analysis, or other related degrees considered an asset).

Additional Information

What we Offer:
Opportunity to build something new and different.
Platform to learn through action.
Competitive salary vs. industry benchmarks for experience level.
Medical/dental benefits.
Phone subsidies.
Hybrid working model.
Publicis personal days.
Exciting agency events.
You can bring your pet to work.
A fun and diverse team
Publicis Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of our community. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. If you require a specific accommodation please contact Human Resources at 416-925-7733 or by email at inquiries@publicisna.com

Job Type: Fulltime, Fixed term contract, Internship / Coop
Job Description:
Analyst Intern, Middle Office - Summer 2024

Albourne Partners (Canada) Limited
366 Adelaide Street W, Toronto, ON M5V 1R9
Open to: Undergraduate students
Overview:

Albourne is an investment consultant which was founded in 1994. Albourne advises over 300 investors, including institutional investors, financial intermediaries, and family offices, on over $700 billion in alternative investments across the liquidity spectrum. It specializes in Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Private Credit, Real Assets, Real Estate and Dynamic Beta.
Albourne strives to be a sustainable company with three main goals: 1) Aspiring to be a multi-generational firm with broad internal ownership and a Partnership structure; 2) Treating our employees and clients fairly; and 3) Advocating for positive change for its benefit and for the alternative investment industry best practices have always been a defining part of who we are.
Albournes 600+ employees are in 11 offices globally, including London, San Francisco, Connecticut, Munich, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo, Toronto, Nicosia, Bahrain, and Bermuda. Albourne is proud of its flat structure with over 115 Partners, over 75 of whom are either share or option holders.
The Team:
The Middle Office team produces one of Albournes core research reports Legal Document Diligence (LDD) which assesses risk as it relates to the legal terms of the agreement between investment managers and investors. The LDD report helps Albourne clients make an informed investment decision.
Middle Office performs an analysis of the funds governing documents, which outline hundreds of terms that investors will be bound to should they choose to invest. We translate the dense legal language into a readable summary for our clients, assess whether the terms represent market standard and best practice, and provide recommendations and strategies for negotiation in instances where we identify terms that could be improved.
After delivery of the LDD report, the Middle Office team also assists clients in the subsequent terms negotiation process with investment managers. When our clients move forward with an investment, we also assist in completing the additional set of legal documents necessary to subscribe to a fund.
The role is dynamic and involves frequent liaising with investment managers, fund counsel, fund administrators and Albournes diverse clients. We collaborate across the Middle Office team, which is comprised of 13 professionals globally, as well as other departments within Albourne.
Albournes Middle Office Internship Program is an exciting opportunity for undergraduate students to get a head start in their finance career by joining a global investment consultant while working in our Middle Office function. Students will spend their summer term gaining technical training with databases, acquiring hands-on alternative investment markets experience, and working alongside industry specialists. Our Middle Office summer internship will run from 6 May through to 30 August 2024.
Responsibilities:
Analyze data relating to operational consulting work performed by Albourne for our clients and create presentations that highlight key take-aways from this analysis.
Analyze data related to Albournes review of private market and hedge fund terms.
Use data to help determine market assessments in regard to alternative fund terms and to help determine recommendations to be used by clients to negotiate alternative fund terms.
Analyze outcomes from client negotiations in order to provide insight into future negotiations.
Participate in the development of a standardized database to collect terms going forward.
Assist in updating and improving multiple slide decks related to Albournes various Implementation Services.
Analyze data related to Albournes Process Review services.
Use data to create template process mapping for different Albourne client-type and to draft a white paper regarding best practices for Albourne client investment processes.
Perform other ad hoc tasks and projects from time to time upon request.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in business, data science, commerce, finance, or accounting-related disciplines to be completed after August 2024
Working towards or planning to pursue a relevant designation (CPA, CFA, CAIA, CMA) is an asset
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams)
Demonstrated ability to analyze data sets in Excel, with advanced knowledge of pivot tables and database functions being essential
Demonstrated ability to create compelling and clear presentations using PowerPoint
Keen interest in alternatives (i.e., hedge funds, private equity, real assets) and capital markets
Optimal interpersonal skills with a professional demeanor
Proactive self-starter proficient in time management and multi-tasking
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English
Previous internship experience is considered an asset
Albourne Offers:
A unique finance experience working for a global and established investment consultant in the alternative investment and operational due diligence space
A work culture that values continuous learning and professional development, sustainability, and diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging
Sponsored charity day events and volunteering opportunities
Company social hours and celebrations
A collegial work environment
Paid vacation days
Casual dress
Job Type: Full-time, Hybrid, Contract
Location: Toronto, Canada
Work authorization: Must be eligible to work in Canada.
Albourne is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce, encouraging applications from all qualified individuals.
Albourne Partners (Canada) Limited (APCA) is in full compliance with the AODA.
APCA will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact HR.
You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
Albourne thanks all applicants, but only successful candidates will be contacted.

About RFA
RFAs residential mortgage lending business is operated by RFA Mortgage Corporation and RFA Bank of Canada, a federally regulated Schedule I Bank. RFA Mortgage Corporation specializes in Prime lending (Insured, Insurable, Uninsurable), while RFA Bank of Canada is a balance sheet based Alternative mortgage lender (Alt-A and B lending). Combined, RFA offers mortgage brokers a one-stop shop with our full suite of competitive Prime and Alternative mortgages.
RFAs strategic vision is to be a long-term leader in the residential lending segment by offering a value proposition beyond just rate and compensation. Through building a competitive broker experience and solutions-oriented product suite, RFAs goal is to be recognized and recommended by our mortgage broker partners, mortgagors, and other strategic partners, for our financing solutions and broker/client experience.
The Opportunity
As a member of the RFA Mortgage Corporation (RFA MC) Treasury Operations team, the Analyst will support the companys mortgage funding (including investor management & reporting, premium settlement, and securitization) and treasury (including cash management and liquidity reporting) operations. Moving across operational functions, reporting on multiple business lines, and building strong partnerships with the various groups and stakeholders will be critical to the success of the role.

Mortgage Funding Operations
Funding Management and Loan Allocation to third party investors, including investor assignment, loan sale settlements, and ensuring timely and accurate flow of funds to closing agent.
Implement term sheets updates and periodic mortgage rate changes.
Identify opportunities to optimize product and portfolio P&L.
Ensure ongoing compliance with external investor requirements and loan criteria both pre- and post-closing.
Assist the Manager in operationalizing various reporting, investor onboarding, securitization, and funding initiatives.
Securitization administration, including MBS/CMB allocations and reporting.
Default insurance administration, pricing, and reporting.
Treasury Operations
Support the day-to-day cash management and operational activities of the Treasury Team
Develop or assist in operational, financial and treasury reporting.
Create, improve, and maintain effective treasury and reporting procedures and processes.
Minimize idle company cash balances by analyzing requirements, executing daily concentration of cash, and borrowing transactions, and initiating bank transfers through application of appropriate internal controls.
Responsible for day-to-day reporting and operations of securitization, whole loan sale and other credit facilities.
Work with Finance group to support Journal Entry and Financial Accounting processes and reporting.
Other
Monitor and quantify the impact of internal (product pricing, compensation, promotions, product/offer enhancements, etc.) and external (interest rate or regulatory changes) events that may impact the companys P&L.
Conduct mortgage data analysis for internal and external stakeholders.
Special projects and new product lines as assigned.
Maintain and foster relationships with internal and external stakeholders through daily reporting and communication.
What you can bring to RFA:
Bachelors degree or consideration of an equivalent combination of education and experience.
3-5 years of experience in mortgage finance company or regulated banking industries.
Knowledge of the mortgage origination, loan administration, and mortgage financing (CMB/MBS, conduit securitization) processes would be an asset.
Demonstrated competency relating to multiple tasks conducted within a Treasury and/or Finance department, i.e. Reconciliation, Reporting, Product Analysis, Forecasting, Cash Management, etc.
Proficiency using Microsoft Excel, SQL for data reporting and modelling.
Benefits of Working at RFA:
Health & Dental Care
Vision Care
RRSP Match
Vacation & Personal Days
Hybrid working environment
Are you the Right Candidate?
Strong proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Excellent math/analytical skills
Positive and enthusiastic attitude with willingness to learn
Strong communication, inter-personal and people skills
Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and meet deadlines required,
Ability to work independently with strong attention to detail.
Team player

Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

JOB PURPOSE

The Senior, ERP Business Analysts role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of stakeholders. This includes interviewing departmental units and gathering and compiling user requirements to understand the technical solutions they need. The candidate will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help the business make good technology decisions.

The analyst will have in-depth understanding of the different business processes and the ERP systems functional capabilities. In addition, the candidate will be required to write end-user facing reports, prepare process flows and/or build dashboards. The Senior, ERP Business Analyst will also be responsible for developing and documenting formal test strategies and test plans and will lead all testing activities relating to our ERP system.

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Business Requirements Process and Flow Mapping
Analyze business requirements and technical system capabilities to meet customer needs
Lead requirement, elicitation process and design sessions in prototyping new systems or requested changes
Compile all business requirements and processes/workflows and translate into ERP solution
Collaborate courteously with different internal units, external consultants and other stakeholders in designing and implementing solutions
Research, troubleshoot and mitigate transactional and other ERP project system related issues
Configure functions and workflow to facilitate ERP system usage and integration with other applications
Performing business systems and workflow analysis, and disseminating technical communications into a business context
Creating user guides, training curriculum, and other pertinent documentation for internal and external partners in support of operationalization
Participate in the development and execution of implementation/rollout plans
Maintain current knowledge and understanding of ERP and integrated applications
Support the continuous improvement of Business Analyst processes to support organizational evolution
Quality Assurance/Testing
Define, determine, and document testing methodologies and test strategies for the ERP project
Ensure all testing is planned, executed and delivered following best practices, and to our quality standards, while meeting tight deadline
Lead all testing efforts for our ERP system by utilizing Requirement Traceability Matrix to link the requirements to testing scenarios
Translate business, technical, and functional requirements into detailed test plans and test cases, and execute test scenarios that would guarantee maximum coverage
Be an integral part of the project core team in providing data, functional, integration, performance, and regression, testing
Proactively identify bugs, seek resolution and maintain testing schedule
Track quality assurance metrics such as defects, defect counts, test results, and test statuses
Ensure all identified risks from testing are escalated and mitigated appropriately
With hands-on testing, detect, isolate, reproduce, track defects, and verify fixes
Lead and set standards for business team members to achieve testing goals and quality work
Test ERP and Integrated software to ensure the system is meeting the corporate needs

Diversity & Inclusion
At Mevotech, diversity goes beyond demographics. We embrace unique perspectives and voices in our culture. We actively seek out different viewpoints and incorporate them into our organization.
Accessibility Accommodations
Mevotech provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. If you require accommodations, please let us know, and we'll work with you to meet your needs.

Role Business System Analyst (Upgrade Path)
Location Toronto - Hybrid
Client Cigniti Technologies / Laurentian Bank
Job Description:

Business Systems Analyst (Upgrade Path)
As a Business Systems Analyst (BSA) spearheading our applications and platforms refresh initiative, you will play a pivotal role in fortifying the resilience of our banking systems. This strategic project involves upgrading operating systems and databases, with a primary focus on enhancing system robustness and ensuring compatibility with existing applications.
Key Responsibilities:
Upgrade Planning:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan and execute the upgrade of operating systems and databases across various platforms.
Ensure a systematic and phased approach to minimize disruption while maximizing system resilience.
System Resilience Enhancement:
Evaluate current systems and identify opportunities to enhance their resilience, addressing vulnerabilities and implementing best practices for high availability and disaster recovery.
Database Upgrades:
Leverage your understanding of software engineering concepts to orchestrate seamless database upgrades, including the migration of tables and integration services.
Collaborate closely with technical teams to execute upgrades and ensure the integrity of data and system functionalities.
Compatibility Assurance:
Analyze the compatibility of existing applications with the upgraded platforms, mitigating any potential issues and ensuring a smooth transition.
Engage with technology teams to identify and resolve compatibility challenges, maintaining the efficiency of critical banking applications.
Risk Analysis and Mitigation:
Conduct thorough impact analysis to identify potential risks associated with the upgrade and refresh process.
Work proactively to mitigate risks, developing contingency plans and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure a resilient and secure environment.
Qualifications:
Strong technical background and solid understanding of software engineering concepts.
Working experience in supporting/driving upgrade paths for OS and DB within large scale platforms would be an asset.
Strong understanding of SQL/Database concepts.
Ability to analyze and document all the business and functional impacts/risks and work with DBA and/or application specialists to understand and coordinate the planning process.

Job Description

Lindt & Sprngli (North America) Inc. is building a new SAP team within its Information Technology group to support our current SAP implementation project and provide ongoing support beyond go-live. This role will be responsible for the design, implementation, delivery and support of SAP BW and SAP Bl solutions.

This position is located in Toronto, ON, Canada. It also includes travel to the US for work.

Essential Functions

Analyze, design, develop, and support initiatives to deliver SAP Bl solutions enabling end user reporting capabilities as well as advanced reporting development and data analysis by power users and Business Intelligence analysts.
Understand business needs and lead thoughtful design discussions around meeting those business needs in a standard manner, fully leveraging SAP product capabilities.
Hands-on development and implementation of BW/BI solutions with a focus on complex business units including Retail Store Operations, Product Distribution and Supply Chain, and Financials.
Assist the business in identifying KPls and defining reports and dashboards.
Define technical and functional standards and ensure delivered work meets technical, functional, performance and business requirements as well as best practices.
Provide daily operational support for application and Bl infrastructure.
Develop and document technical architecture, system design, and other technical aspects of the implementation.
Execute and lead testing process (unit and integration test).
Platform support, monitoring, capacity and utilization management, application security, end user support, training, and documentation.
Aid in the management of third-party vendors.
Provide support to management regarding strategy and roadmap planning in the BW/BI area.
Basic Qualifications

8+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence with emphasis on business requirements analysis, application design, development, testing, implementation, and maintenance.
Experience in ensuring the data architecture and reporting strategy supports the business requirements.
Strong experience with SAP BW and SAP Bl tools (Analysis for Office, Business Objects).
Exposure to new SAP technologies like SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, SAP BTP etc.
Ability to manage and lead big projects/strategic initiatives independently.
Experience that spans design to hands-on configuration and development of the solution. Experience in complex SAP environments.
BW on HANA and HANA native knowledge and SAP-Business Objects Lumira Designer.
Programming skills: ABAP, ABAP 00, CDS Views.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, Information Systems or Business.
Incisive analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge and experience of the consumer goods industry is highly preferred.
SAP certification(s)
Company Description

Lindt and Sprngli (North America) Inc. is the Supply Chain and Business Shared Services Company supporting the Lindt & Sprngli family of brands (Lindt USA, Ghirardelli Chocolates and Russell Stover Chocolates), headquartered in Kansas City, MO.

Employment by Lindt & Sprngli (North America) Inc. is contingent upon I-9 Employment Eligibility Verification, passing the urinalysis drug screen, and satisfactory employment and background checks.

Lindt & Sprngli (North America) Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, national origin, sex, marital status, sexual orientation and gender identity, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, or any other status protected by law. Principals only, please.

Position: Technical Business Analyst
Reporting To: Senior Director, Technology & Integration
Location: Mississauga, ON

Cedric Millar Integrated Solutions and Our Culture
We are ethical and hard-working professionals that are passionate about providing integrated supply chain management solutions (along with supporting services) to manufacturers and shippers across Canada and the US.

Each member of our team plays an important role in executing best-in-class supply chain solutions with the very best in people, process, suppliers, technology, and business intelligence. As a 4PL provider, we continue to develop collaborative cost-effective solutions that create flow, consistent service and eliminate waste in a customers supply chain.

We add value by providing a variety of services:
Strategic Supply Chain Management/Technology, Freight Logistics Services, Small Package Services, Dedicated/Fleet Management Solutions, Pro-Fit Placement Services, Freight, Audit, and Pay Services, and Consulting and Engineering Services.

The Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring the smooth integration and optimization of supply chain systems. This role requires a deep understanding of supply chain processes, excellent documentation and process mapping skills and proficiency in SQL.

The Technical Business Analyst will demonstrate the following experience/competence:
A bachelors degree or higher in Business, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst with a focus on supply chain processes, preferably within a 4PL environment.
Strong documentation skills with the ability to create clear and concise business requirements, functional specifications, process maps, and technical requirements.
Proficiency in SQL for data analysis and reporting.
Will have a combination of business acumen, technical proficiency, analytical thinking, communication skills, and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of Azure environment, EDI, and API integration.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and analyze supply chain requirements, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
Conduct thorough analysis and documentation of current supply chain processes, identifying areas for improvement and optimization.
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, process maps, and technical requirements.
Utilize SQL skills to query and analyze data, providing insights to support decision-making processes.
Work closely with development teams to ensure accurate and timely implementation of technical solutions that address business needs.
Leverage knowledge management techniques to capture, organize, and share information effectively across the organization.
Draft and communicate clear and detailed technical requirements to development teams, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Develop and execute test plans to validate that solutions meet specified technical requirements.
To provide training, support, and maintenance for the solutions and resolve any issues or defects that may arise.
Administer and customize SharePoint solutions to facilitate effective collaboration and information sharing.
Soft Skills
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Able to understand the impact of decisions on other disciplines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to details
A proactive, service-first attitude combined with ability to work independently on projects with tight deadlines and minimal supervision.

If you meet the above qualifications and are looking for an exciting opportunity to grow your career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply!

Our Commitment to You
An ethical and fair environment that is inclusive, high energy and best in class.
Training and a structured Onboarding to ensure you are set up to succeed.
Leadership, coaching and mentorship towards a rewarding carrier in Supply Chain.
The ability to participate in cross functional initiatives that will allow you to grow professionally and personally.
Competitive compensation package that includes paid time off, full benefits & bonuses.
An ongoing communication framework with senior leaders and company ownership.
A deep understanding of how your role supports the companys strategy, and how the companys strategy supports you.

While remaining alert and sensitive to the issue of fair and equitable treatment for all, Cedric Millar is committed to helping individuals with disabilities participate in the workplace and ensure equal opportunity to compete for jobs. If you require accommodation, please email us for further assistance. Please note this email address is intended for use only to request accommodation as part of the application process. Any other correspondence will not receive a response.

Company Overview:
At Vosyn, we explore the captivating world of Artificial Intelligence, creating innovations and launching groundbreaking projects across various domains. We are passionate about nurturing flexibility, continuous enhancement, and solution-driven strategies. Currently, we are on the cusp of a momentous IPO initiative, the birth of a true unicorn. Join us on this exciting journey and make your mark on AI's future.
About the Job:
We're on the hunt for a Business Development MBA Intern to bring a valuable contribution to our strategic initiatives and business development projects. As part of our team, you'll influence the future of AI with your work. Whether on-site, remote, or a hybrid model, you'll gain invaluable experience in a high-growth, dynamic environment, interfacing directly with senior management.
What You'll Do:
Participate in broker syndicate activities coordination, supporting documentation, and communication processes.
Contribute to the evolution of tools, processes, and strategies aimed at business development. Carry out insightful market research and analysis to identify potential strategic partners and investment opportunities.
Engage directly with potential investors, assisting in investor communications and presentations.
Support the development of comprehensive business plans for our upcoming $100 million capital markets funding round.
About the Term:
We have a scheduled placement for March 18, 2024, and it can be either full time or part time but must be a minimum of 520 hours per placement. We also have placements starting April 2024. We allow flexibility to avoid any conflicts with academic responsibilities. Please be sure to outline your ideal placement date or term and any constraints you may have. This is an ideal MBA or post grad placement that will truly amplify and accelerate your post grad development. This is a full-time & part-time but strong engagement is critical. Full time is most desired and part time is possible with responsible flexibility. Placement timing can also be aligned with academic commitments and MBA internship requirements outlined by your program.
About You:
Currently pursuing an MBA or a related degree, with a focus on business development, strategy, or entrepreneurship.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a talent for identifying market trends and evaluating business opportunities.
Proficient in effective communication and engagement with stakeholders and potential partners.
Self-driven and proactive, with a strong desire to contribute to the growth of a dynamic organization.
Mastery of Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Additional Perks:
Experience the exhilarating journey of a start-up transitioning to an IPO.
Engage directly with senior management.
Boost your CV with a plethora of experiences unique to AI Venture Lab.
Get priority consideration for full-time roles post-internship.
Duration and Compensation:
This is a full-time & part-time, paid internship with the following placement options:
1) Fall
2) Winter
3) Spring
4) Summer
Flexibility with timing and location should not deter you from applying. The compensation will be $32-35 CAD per hour, commensurate with experience and qualifications.
DEI and Workplace Safety
At Vosyn Inc., we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where every employee feels valued and supported. We believe that diversity of thought, background, and experience enriches our company culture and enhances innovation. We are an equal-opportunity employer and encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. As part of our commitment to creating a safe and healthy work environment, we prioritize workplace safety, adhering to all relevant regulations and promoting a culture of responsibility. We believe that a safe and inclusive workplace is essential for the well-being and success of our team members. Join us in building a workplace that values diversity, prioritizes equity, and ensures the safety and well-being of every individual.

Description:
NSK Canada is seeking a Jr. Business Analyst to apply analytical tools to drive improvements in pricing, inventory health, forecasting, and sales opportunity conversion. This position will identify and prioritize greatest opportunities to leverage NSK Americas data to drive business solutions. Collect and condition data from multiple sources and maintain databases. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and automation. Analyze data to identify patterns, trends and develop hypotheses. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to datasets. Build predictive forecasting models and monitor accuracy. Communicate findings and actionable insights to stakeholders
Support production planning by analyzing product demand and setting service level targets to achieve sales and inventory goals.

This position will work in a hybrid work model (2 days a week in office / 3 days WFH)
Responsibilities:
Analyzes aftermarket demand and develops plans for North America on A&B items.
Support demand planning in Central and South America.
Sets service level targets for inventory.
Monitors and adjusts forecasts to targets.
Liaises with BCD functions for suggested ordering.
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages, e.g. R, Python, SQL
Leads through curiosity and continuous improvements
Technical experience with Data Visualization Tools, e.g. Tableau, PowerBI
Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or a related field is desired
This job requires a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in a related field and 1-2 years of position-related experience;preferably 2 to 4 years of position-related experience.
Excellent team-player with ability to work independently
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (e.g. regression, probability distributions, statistical tests) and experience with applications
A drive to learn new techniques and technologies as needed to achieve business goals
Demonstrated experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent written and verbal communications skills, able to report and present findings
Benefits Offered:
Generous vacation and holidays
Medical, dental, vision insurance
Life insurance
Short-term and long-term disability
Flexible Spending Account
Generous retirement savings plan (RRSP)
Bonus Plan
Competitive Salary with Benefits
Hybrid work model (2 days a week in office / 3 days WFH)
Benefits:
Dental care
Disability insurance
Life insurance
Vision care

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for developing interactive visualizations and dashboards that provide actionable insights. As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work with cross-functional teams and leadership to identify requirements and produce visualizations. Primary responsibilities include ensuring quality data structures for the analysis of data, use of proper statistical analyses, and implementing visualization best practices in creating automated report views through Tableau.
The ideal candidate must also be able to guide and educate the business user with the goal of making sure the best solution is created. You must be willing to work in a highly collaborative environment, while managing multiple competing priorities and assignments. The candidate must have a strong technical background and be current on modern BI and reporting technologies.


Your Day-to-Day
Collaborate and educate with departments across the organization to aid in the development of their standard reports, shared dashboards, and ad-hoc analytical queries
Analyze currently available and potential future data sources for the business to align with the reporting and analytic data needs of the organization
Build and rollout reports and dashboards that provide the organization with self-serve access to solve and streamline their day-to-day data analytical needs
Document and maintain accessible data dictionaries, business definitions, and data specifications that enable the organization to fully interpret the data sources available
Research and define processes and solutions to perform integrity manipulations to our data including data cleansing, deduplication, and application of business rules so that it is ready for consumption and analysis by the organization
Contribute to the development of reporting solutions for various TouchBistro products and services
All About You
You have 3+ years data analytics experience
You have a Bachelor Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field required
You have experience working with BI and data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts and ideas to all levels of employees and management
You have experience with SQL-based technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server, Postgres, Oracle , Snowflake or Redshift
You have knowledge of Agile delivery methodologies
You have experience working in with a full data warehouse infrastructure a plus
You have experience working in a SaaS-based software company a plus
You have working knowledge of various ETL development tools such as SSIS, Informatica, AWS Glue and AWS Data Pipeline a plus
You have some familiarity with development using a modern programming language such as Python, JavaScript, Java, and/or C# a plus
What We Offer
At TouchBistro, we are a diverse group of restaurant-obsessed, tech-loving people brought together by a mission to support the passion and success of restaurateurs. You can feel confident joining a fun, vibrant, and rapidly growing environment. You will be working alongside driven individuals who are passionate, innovative, accountable, collaborative, and respectful.
The Perks:
Unlimited vacation
Health, dental, and vision benefits
Flexible health and wellness plan
Parental leave & top up
Employee Assistance Program
Career progression & professional development
Linkedin Learning membership
Volunteer program
Monthly lunches
Flexible work-from-home policy
Beautiful, brand new office space in the heart of downtown Toronto (our HQ)
About TouchBistro
TouchBistro is an all-in-one Point-of-Sale and restaurant management system that makes running a restaurant easier. We have powered more than 29,000 restaurants around the world, and we know that while passion is plenty in the restaurant industry, time and money usually aren't. Providing the most essential front of house, back of house and customer engagement solutions on one easy-to-use platform, TouchBistro helps restaurateurs streamline and simplify their operations, increase sales, drive revenue, and deliver a stellar guest experience.
TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.
Benefits:
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Vision care

Job Description:
About Flywheel

Flywheels suite of digital commerce solutions accelerate growth across all major digital marketplaces for the worlds leading brands. We give clients access to near real-time performance measurement and improve sales, share, and profit. With teams across the Americas, Europe and APAC, we offer a career with real impact, endless growth opportunities and the support you need to be the best you can be.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a BI Analyst to join our consulting team, working on the Amazon Marketing Cloud (AMC) business. As a BI Analyst on the team, you are passionate about turning data into insight, and insight into recommended actions and strategies for our customers.

You will be responsible for partnering with business and consulting teams in understanding clients questions and objectives to form a data analysis plan, create/execute queries, and build reporting. You work closely with these teams, providing guidance on interpreting data within their analysis and building self-service tools that best leverage the data available. This individual will act as a subject matter expert on both the data and reporting available.

What You'll Do:
Work with customer and internal teams to define and develop insights reporting tools using Flywheel, retailer, and customer datasets that can be scaled for the broader consulting organization
Interpret business questions and develop SQL to provide reporting to solve for client asks. Collaborate with your team members to design and implement solutions in an agile, iterative manner
Support client analysis including data cleansing, report customizations, and QA checks of presentation data and participate in client presentations.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in large complex data sets
Who You Are:
Working experience as a data analyst or business intelligence analyst, with a proven history of driving insights through data analysis and presenting findings
Expert skills in SQL and working with large datasets in a business environment. Adept at writing queries and report creation
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Effective communication skills, written and oral, with ability to turn data into compelling stories and insights, influencing both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong attention to detail
Knowledge of the digital retail industry, digital media, retailers' strategies and manufacturer/retailer ways of working (preferred)
Experience with retailer marketing cloud and data clean room environments (preferred)
Qualification or equivalent experience in data science, data engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management or Statistics

Flywheel is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices, actual salary will be determined based on geography & level of experience. The current range is calculated in USD, for other global locations please connect with your Recruiter.

Working at Flywheel

We are proud to offer all Flywheelers a competitive rewards package and unparalleled career growth opportunities and a supportive, fun and engaging culture.

We have office hubs across the globe where team members can go to feel productive, inspired, and connected to others
Flexible time off policy
Great learning and development opportunities
Generous Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance plans
401K Savings Incentive Plan & Flexible Spending Accounts
Volunteering opportunities
Learn more about us here: Life at Flywheel

The Interview Process:

Every role starts the same, an introductory call with someone from our Talent Acquisition team. We will be looking for company and values-fit as well as your professional experience; there may be some technical role-specific questions during this call.

Every role is different after the initial call, but you can expect to meet several people from the team 1:1 and there might be further skill assessments in the form of a Take Home Assignment/Case Study Presentation or Pair Programming/Live Coding exercise depending on the role. In your initial call, we will walk you through exactly what to expect the process to be.

Inclusive Workforce

At Flywheel, our goal is to create a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work. We want all Flywheel people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals.

Flywheel is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

If you have any accessibility requirements that would make you more comfortable during the application and interview process, please let us know at recruitment@flywheeldigital.com so that we can support you.

Please note, We do not accept unsolicited resumes.

IMPORTANT ALERT: Please beware of fraudulent job communications from individuals falsely claiming to be from Flywheel. We've identified fraudulent activity through social media and messaging services purporting to be from Flywheel requesting payments for job- and recruitment-related expenses. Flywheel never asks candidates for personal information such as bank account data or tax IDs nor payments via social media or chat-based applications. Report suspected fraud to local authorities immediately. To learn more, click here.
Benefits:
Dental care
Paid time off
Vision care

Job Description:
Summary
Quantum Lifecycle Partners LP is the leading and largest vertically integrated IT Asset Disposition & Recycling processor in Canada. We are committed to enabling safe and secure reuse of electronics, responsible recycling of electronics to divert from landfills, and recovery of natural resources from obsolete electronics.
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and mapping out business processes, creating and maintaining detailed technical and project documents, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with various stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:
Requirement Gathering and Business process mapping: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements for new projects or enhancements to existing processes. Document current business processes using tools such as flowcharts or diagrams to identify areas of inefficiency or duplication.
Change Management: Assist in developing and implementing change management plans to ensure smooth transitions for process improvements or system implementations.
Business technology enhancements: recommend and implement solutions utilizing technology to enhance existing processed and increase efficiency.
Project Management: Assist with project management tasks, maintenance of project trackers, project document creation, stakeholder follow ups and project status reporting.
Documentation: Create and maintain documentation related to business requirements, process flows, and system configurations.
Communication: Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization to gather requirements, provide updates, and facilitate decision-making processes.

Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels.
Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques, such as process mapping, data analysis, and requirement elicitation.
Experience with project management methodologies and tools.
Experience with Power BI, Microsoft Power Automate and Visio a plus.
Knowledge of industry best practices and standards related to business analysis.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities effectively.
Previous experience in application development projects would be an asset.
We offer:
Company paid Extended Health & Dental Benefits
Disability & Life Insurance
Company RRSP matched up to 3.5%
Employee Assistance Program
Education Reimbursement Program
Safety Shoes & glasses reimbursement
Employee Purchase Program (up to 20% off on Qnovum.ca)
Quantum is an equal opportunity employer. We promote excellence through diversity and encourage all qualified individuals to apply. We thank you for your interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Quantum offers a unique insight into the e-waste industry, with its rapidly and constantly changing environment! To learn more about us, visit: www.quantumlifecycle.com.
You must be authorized to work in Canada without a sponsorship, now or in the future. Quantum Lifecycle Partners LP does not offer sponsorships
Benefits:
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
Tuition reimbursement

Job Description:
Do you want to work for a fast growing, sparkling company? Keep on reading!

We are looking for a Sales Strategy Analyst to join our Strategic Insights team. You will play a pivotal role in driving revenue growth and optimizing sales performance through strategic analysis, market research, and data-driven insights. You will collaborate cross-functionally with sales, marketing, finance, and other key stakeholders to identify opportunities, develop actionable strategies, and monitor performance metrics. This role will identify new business opportunities, develop selling materials for prospective retailers, quantify the size of the prize.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITY & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze sales data, market trends, and customer insights to identify opportunities for revenue growth and market expansion.
Support the development of fact-based local selling stories: category, brand, retailer, and shopper.
Conduct in-depth competitive analysis and market research to identify emerging trends, competitive threats, and potential opportunities.
Provide strategic recommendations and actionable insights to senior management based on data analysis and market intelligence.
Support the development and implementation of sales strategies, initiatives, and promotional campaigns to drive revenue growth and market share.
Assists the organization by providing input into joint customer planning cycle based on knowledge of category and shopper trends, competitive issues, etc.
Evaluate the effectiveness of existing sales processes, programs, and initiatives, and recommend improvements to enhance efficiency and productivity.
Determine market needs, gaps, and create a strategy to capture new growth.
Stay informed about industry developments, best practices, and emerging technologies related to sales analytics and strategy.

Requirements:

Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Proven experience in sales analysis, business intelligence, or sales strategy development, preferably in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. (e.g. retail link, dunnhumby, IRI, etc.) & syndicated data (e.g. Nielsen / Circana / Environics).
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights and recommendations.
Strategic thinker with a keen understanding of market dynamics, competitive landscapes, and sales methodologies.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Benefits

Enjoy a competitive salary commensurate with the experience and responsibility requirements.
Excellent employee environment with a competitive benefits package including:
Bonus based on performance and eligibility
Potential for Annual Merit increase based on performance and eligibility
Healthcare
Dental + Vision
Voluntary benefits
Paid Time Off
Retirement Benefits + Company Match
Life Insurance
Disability
Learning & Development Benefits
Wellness Programs

Canada

Job Description:
About Equiton:
Founded in 2015, Equiton is a recognized leader in private equity investments with 1 billion CAD in Assets Under Management (AUM). Our exponential growth is a direct outcome of our leadership team understanding how the industry works and how to create long-term wealth through real estate investing. We have discovered that finding the right opportunities involves time, experience, and discipline. Our strategy is always forward-looking, anticipating trends and adapting our selection to strengthen our market position, capitalizing on value creation opportunities, and building the most robust portfolio possible for our investors. We attract exceptionally talented people and create an atmosphere that rewards initiative, independent thinking, and integrity.

About the Position:
Reporting to the Yardi Program Manager, the Systems Support Business Analyst assists the Finance and Operations teams with systems support, system implementation, automation of processes and security control support. The Systems Support Business Analyst will also work closely with the IT department to ensure a high level of security governance.

Key Functions and Responsibilities:
Provide support to Accounting, Finance and Operations Teams
Support for systems implementations and upgrades
Apply problem-solving skills to trouble shoot applications issues
Research, analyze and resolve software functionality
Perform data mapping, conversions and provide support when onboarding new Properties
Determine and document solutions and best practices to contribute to a solutions repository
Strong interpersonal skills and positive attitude to establish rapport with all departments involved
Evaluate security controls, access, and permissions
Provide end-user support, and training when required
Create new roles, groups and users based on new business requirements
Test all new application development for effectiveness and controls before implementation
Assist with creating customized reports for financial and operational review

Accounting Analyst
Job Status: Full-time
Reports To: Assistant Corporate Controller
SUMMARY
The Accounting Analyst is a vital member of TASs Finance Team. Key responsibilities include accounts receivable, accounts payable and data analysis. Our ideal candidate will bring ambition, enthusiasm, extraordinary attention to detail and accuracy to the role. We are looking for a self-starter who will jump in, learn, and grow together with our high-performing team. This is a great opportunity to gain hands-on accounting experience at a growing, fast paced and impact-driven real estate developer.
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Relevant post-secondary education in accounting or business administration
Three years of experience in a similar role, with a demonstrated understanding of accounting principles and practices
Exceptional computer skills including advanced Excel knowledge
Experience with Yardi or an equivalent accounting platform considered an asset
Rigorous attention to detail
A team player who can also work independently
Proactive with sound planning, prioritization, and execution skills
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
Curious, collaborative, and approachable
High level of integrity, ownership, and accountability with the ability to operate with a sense of urgency as required
Confident with an authentic and professional style
A demonstrated interest in real estate, city-building and/or social impact is considered an asset
RESPONSIBILITIES
Coordinate accounts receivable and accounts payable
Purchase order and invoice data entry
Cheque printing, approval, depositing and execution
EFT and wire transfers
Credit card payments
Credit card reconciliation
Vendor and trade relationships
Filing and record keeping
Analysis
Daily cash position and reporting
Periodic cashflow reports
Monthly creation of Property Management reports
Timely tracking of debt covenants
Contribute to ongoing process and control improvements
Respond to internal staff questions on YARDI
Support audit process and tax filings
Collaborate and coordinate with colleagues across TAS's functional teams
Deepen personal understanding of TASs strategy on an ongoing basis, embody and contribute to our culture
TAS is an unconventional impact company that leverages its real estate platform as a tool to drive profit and purpose. TAS is an industry leader in impact investing, development and management with an active pipeline and portfolio totaling seven million square feet across 21 properties throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area. TAS focuses on increasing affordability, tackling climate change and building social capital to create neighbourhoods  and ultimately cities  where people can thrive and belong.
We offer a competitive compensation package including a best-in-class employee experience, enhanced group health benefits and wellness programs. Candidates should email their resume and cover letter together in one PDF document to: careers@tasimpact.caquoting the position in the subject line.

Job Description:
Role: Business Intelligence Analyst, Revenue Assurance
Status: Regular, Full Time (Hybrid)
Reports to: Sr. Manager, Revenue Assurance
Location: 8133 Warden Ave. Markham ON L6G 1B3

About Metergy Solutions Inc. (Metergy)

As one of North Americas most experienced submetering providers, weve brought turnkey solutions to our clients for over 15 years. We help our customers effectively manage their utility consumption as we supply, install, and remotely read electricity, water and thermal submeters. Across all building types, retrofit or new construction, we have the knowledge, equipment, and staff to deliver a comprehensive solution from design to implementation to billing. We are focused on maintaining strong customer relationships and value team collaboration to achieve our goals. For more information about Metergy, please visit us online https://www.metergysolutions.com/

Metergy is a portfolio company of Brookfield Infrastructure. Brookfield is one of the worlds largest investors, owners, and operators of infrastructure assets across the utilities, transport, energy, data, and sustainable resources sectors. This sponsorship provides Metergy with access to large-scale capital, infrastructure investment expertise and global reach.

Our Mission
Through trustworthy expertise in submetering solutions, we empower our clients to make their buildings more marketable and residents to reduce their energy consumption.

Position Summary
The Business Intelligence analyst is accountable for the management, development and execution of the Business Intelligence (BI) & Revenue Assurance Program, Annual Rate Increases, operations dashboards, and reporting, and overall Gross Margin (GM) Integrity.

Key Responsibilities:
Extract, clean, and analyze large volumes of data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Conduct deep dive business intelligence analysis into operational areas within Operations to provide analysis and insight on the interplay between the various key performance indicators (e.g., workforce performance & management, Revenue Assurance, productivity, cost and quality drivers).
Effectively collaborate with stakeholders to develop insights and recommendations to enable strategic discussions among leadership.
Provided monthly management insight for performance opportunities, financial Rate and Volume variance analysis to help identify resource allocation opportunities
Accountable for understanding regulation changes and launching organizational projects to implement changes in all impacted areas in submetering (includes non-responsible departments)
Plans, develops and approves all operational policies in all functional areas, with standard operating procedures, and quality management systems for revenue assurance
Monitor daily performance against key metrics to identify opportunities and anomalies
Constantly review current operational processes and be a strategic partner in making recommendations for improvements
Work with all departmental owners to implement and ensure controls are in place to support the lead to cash process for all (billing model) revenue streams
Develop and champion revenue leakage issues across organization by engaging key stakeholders on activity and resource requirements necessary to drive revenue maximization
Stay updated on the latest trends in Business Intelligence, data analytics and emerging technologies
Evaluate and incorporate new tools or techniques that could enhance BI capabilities.
Qualifications:
Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Math, Economics, or other quantitative fields.
Preference to additional training with Data Analytics / IT
Preference for industry experience with Utilities, Telecommunications, or other large consumer base businesses within North American juristictions (250k+ customers)
3+ years of experience in Data Analytics, Operations, or relevant work experience at a fast-growing utility company is preferred.
High Proficiency in data modelling and analysis with demonstrated acumen using the following tools Excel, PowerBI, Python & SQL
Excellent collaboration skills to build strong working partnerships with stakeholders.
Understanding and experience working with statistical revenue and costing information to provide business insight and opportunities to reduce cost.
Strong technical skills to mine large volumes of data.
Ability to apply superior data knowledge & discovery skills into building effective analysis.
Ability to conduct basic statistical and correlation analysis to identify patterns and trends.
Industry or working experience with customer billing environments with large transaction volumes such as Utility or Telecommunications,
Attention to detail and quality, strong time management and project/work planning skills.
Proven ability to work with and deliver Industry Leading Best-in-Class reporting and analytical solutions.
Excellent interpersonal and customer interaction skills to include communications, presentation and conflict resolution skills.
Metergys recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities. All accommodations will consider the applicants accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

Meet Riverside. We are an organic, better for you snack company, manufacturing award-winning, nutritious, allergen-free snacks. Your kids know us as MadeGood, tasty school-safe snacks. Your buddies on the go grab our GOOD TO GO delicious and nutritious snacks. And your pup begs for a Cookie Pal treat, our human-grade, vegan dog treats.
At Riverside, we make delicious snacks that are good in every way. From our ingredients to our manufacturing practices, weve raised every bar on every aspect. We continue to grow and today are looking for a committed, talented, star to join our team as our Brand Marketing Analyst.
Position Summary/Objective:
The Marketing Analyst (Marketing) supports the Marketing team with reporting, pricing and analytics for total North American (NA) business for the MadeGood brand. This Pricing and Analyst role is accountable for supporting the marketing and business teams in working with RNF key stakeholders to provide insights on market, product segment, brand and sku rankings, as well as competitive products, formats, and pricing for the NA market to drive business growth. This role will be focused on the North American market, including responsibilities for the United States and Canada.

Primary Responsibilities:
Support pricing workstream by analyzing competitive pricing, elasticity trends, and formalizing pricing strategies across product segments
Lead competitive market intelligence across markets building dashboards and templates to uncover insights, including tableau templating, pricing analytics and competitive activity
Lead Marketing Quarterly business reviews providing and in depth analysis of brand, segment, sku level performance by market. Provide ongoing business assessments across key categories/segments tied to this workstream
Gathers and leads marketing quarterly KPI reporting framework and delivery including HHP metrics, Brand Health tracking, POS trends including baseline velocities
Supports marketing reporting data for the MadeGood brand, providing detailed analysis of actual performance versus plan
Consumption Reporting, aid with data/commentary
Tracking of Riverside Retail initiatives (e.g. National Programs, Innovation)
Support varying cuts of the data to get to root cause (ie DMA-Level Analysis of marketing impact)
Analysis of marketing programs impact in market
MadeGood and competitive pricing audits, strategies, compliance
Supports Innovation sell-in stories and support data
Conducts and presents competitive assessments
Work as a team player to support the Marketing team during the Business Planning and / Annual Planning processes
Proactively take ownership and uncover insights in the data we have available to identify market trends and areas of opportunity to address
Support special projects and other duties as assigned

Reporting Relationships
The Brand Marketing Analyst reports to the Sr Director of Marketing, MadeGood
No Direct Reports
Education / Qualifications Experience and Skills:
Bachelors degree
2-3+ years of work experience in related field
Excellent analytical skills: MS Excel advanced level and ability to confidently draw conclusions from data.
Exhibits strong understanding of multiple syndicated data sources and tools, including customer POS data tools and/or Nielsen/Spins/IRI; demonstrates a sophisticated knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and PowerPoint
Experience working with cross-functional teams
Ability to prioritize effectively and work on several deliverables simultaneously
Passion for Riverside Values
Skills and Abilities:
Intermediate Competency in Microsoft Applications, SAP and Tableau
Intermediate knowledge of SQL, Python and/or R
Immediate knowledge of data analytics, regression analysis and BI Tools. Ability to translate data into actionable insights and recommendations
Ability to think through immediate needs, analytics and implications of findings/next steps
Highly collaborative, analytical and strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Very comfortable with change and ambiguity, adaptable and flexible to work with different stakeholders
Positive Attitude and passion to persevere. Adept at working in an environment where you impact change / growth in process, tools and ways of working
Ability to work independently, anticipate and react to frequently changing business conditions with proven ability to perform under tight deadlines
Ability to excel in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment
Embraces, demonstrates, and upholds Riversides values of teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, grit and fun
What We Offer:
Immerse yourself in our comprehensive benefits program, with Riverside taking care of the costs!
RRSP matching or IRA matching for an empowered financial journey
Join Employee-Led Resource Groups (ERGs) championing mental health, sustainability, diversity, women, and LGBTQ+ rights
Develop your career further through our Riverside University program and with our Tuition Reimbursement Program
An open concept work environment that embodies our Values
How to Apply:
If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line Brand Marketing Analyst or click the apply button!
Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

TRADER Corporation is a trusted Canadian leader in online media, dealer and lender services. The company is comprised of AutoTrader.ca, AutoSync and Dealertrack Canada. AutoTrader.ca (AutoHebdo.net in Quebec) offers the largest inventory of new cars and used cars in Canada, receiving over 25 million monthly visits to its marketplace. With over 3,500 subscribers and counting, AutoSync is the largest and fastest growing dealer and OEM software provider in Canada. The platform's suite of connected automotive software solutions brings advertising, conversion and operational support together, synchronizing the entire retail process. AutoSync's diverse range of offerings includes: vAuto, EasyDeal, xtime, Motoinsight, Activix, TAdvantage and TRFFK. Dealertrack is Canadas largest automotive financing portal, enhancing efficiency and profitability for all major segments of the automotive, marine, recreational vehicle, motorcycle and powersport retail industries. Over 6.5 million credit applications are submitted via the Dealertrack Canada portal each year. Visit tradercorporation.com to learn more..

We are seeking a Business Analyst who will be instrumental in analyzing, validating, and drawing conclusions from automotive market data. Each month you will be responsible for working under tight deadlines to deliver data analysis to the largest automotive properties and manufacturers in Canada. Timeliness and accuracy are of utmost importance. You will be liaising with partners to ensure complete data accuracy and working with market data to provide competitive analysis for automotive manufacturers. We need someone with Salesforce and sales operations admin experience.

This highlights only a cross-section of the exposure you will get  well give you as many opportunities and responsibilities as you can handle.

What you'll need:
1+ year of experience in a Business Analyst or equivalent role
Strong Microsoft Excel proficiency
Strong knowledge & experience in Salesforce and Sales Operations
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to think outside the box
Impeccable attention to detail is an absolute must
Experience collaborating with software engineers and other virtual teams
Strong oral and written communication skills, you feel comfortable presenting conclusions to colleagues and clients
Self-starter that is comfortable working with minimal oversight and tight deadlines
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and high-pressure situations
Possess a Do Whatever it Takes attitude to get the job done
Ability to work among changing priorities and timelines
Whats in it for you
We understand that there is life at work and life outside of work. Here are a few benefits we all benefit from that support us to be our creative best.
Fitness and wellness
We provide discounts to nation-wide gyms, onsite gyms (when were in the office), an Employee and Family Assistance Program, as well as a virtual wellness program.
Benefits from Day 1
Gym discounts
Local in-office free gyms
Employee and Family Assistance program
Weekly virtual wellness events
In addition to in-house training, we provide an annual lifestyle allowance of $1500 so you can grow your skills.
Conferences & training budget
Regular internal training programs
Financial planning
Let us help you invest in your future with 3% matching towards your pension and multiple forms of income protection.
Competitive salary
Annual bonus structure
3% CPP matching

Greybrook Realty Partners
Greybrook Realty Partners is a Toronto-headquartered private equity real estate investment firm that invests and actively manages residential, commercial and mixed-use developments across North America. The firm offers investors the unique opportunity to partner alongside leading real estate developers in the development and construction of new real estate assets and value-add investments. Greybrook and its affiliates have invested in over 100 real estate projects in Canada and the United States with over $2 billion in equity deployed and an estimated gross development value of CAD -$30 billion.

Overview of Position
The Analyst will report to the VP, Asset Management, who manages a portfolio of large-scale low-rise development invesmtnets. The Analyst will support the Low-rise group within the Asset Management team in underwriting, due diligence, and financial modeling functions, and providing analytical support on multiple projects, market research and day-to-day team support in a fast-paced environment.

Greybrook Realty is seeking a qualified and talented individual with strong financial analysis, financial modelling skills, and some real estate industry experience to join its Asset Management team. The individual will work with a team of development and investment professionals in Asset Management.

Responsibilities:
Acquisitions
Support Associates in completing diligence - document reviews (e.g., review and summarize zoning, environmental, planning comments, legal documents)
Conduct required market research.
Prepare initial proforma and basic to intermediate financial modeling with support from Associates and VP eventually assisting in the creation of complex financial models for ground-up residential real estate development.
Gather and prepare data sets that support modeling assumptions (e.g., construction costs, development charges, building permit fees, look at other projects)
Assist Asset Management teams in preparing Investment Committee Memos
Assist Associates in preparing deal launch documents.
Support the team in conducting research, collecting and organizing data, and preparing offering documents and memos in connection with Greybrook investment offerings.
Work with Legal to provide all necessary inputs from investment documents and regulatory filings.

Semi-annual Financial Reforecasting and Reporting
Support the Asset Management teams in the preparation of financial reporting and analysis of results on a semi-annual basis.
Receive budgets from the developer partners and update Greybrooks proforma, verify, flag and escalate any concerns, plugging in trial balances, balance sheets, costs-to-date and preparing documentation received from the partners.
Support associates as needed during executive reporting in the update of the models.
Complete numerical verification for all investor reports as part of quality assurance process.
Upload, verify and manage financial projections and project data into Salesforce; map data from Excel to Salesforce.

Market Research
Gather, track, maintain, and disseminate up-to-date market data with commentary pertaining to the target real estate market with focus on residential development and multi-family by collecting and analyzing data from RealNet/Urbanation.
Create real estate market intelligence / data reports on specified local markets to support due-diligence, project underwriting and monitoring.
Regularly create real estate market intelligence reports on specified local markets based on both available market data, and information gathered first hand on the sales velocity, product, pricing, trends, challenges, and other real estate market characteristics that help form a complete and thorough assessment of the supply and demand in an area (i.e., city or neighbourhood).

Support Asset Management Team
Support the Asset Management team in completing annual Fair Market Value analysis.
Support process improvement, maintain up to date department documentation and information management.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications & Experience:
We are looking for well-rounded individuals with a track record of outstanding professional and academic achievement, proven analytical skills, a keen interest in residential real estate development and investment and a desire to build a deep understanding of the real estate development process.

Must have at least 2 years of relevant financial modeling experience in real estate investments, development, corporate finance, investment banking, or private equity.
Minimum of a bachelor's degree in business / finance, economics, engineering, or related field.
Advanced MS Office Suite skills are a requirement.
Pursuing CFA designation is an asset.

Key Attributes:
Ability to gather, synthesize and organize large datasets.
Highly resourceful problem solver and quick learner
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, ability to network with real estate brokers and other market participants to gather required market intelligence in a geographic submarket.
Ability to work in team and a self-starter working in a fast-paced environment.
Strong time management skills and experience managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Reliable, focused, and detail-oriented.
Responsive and acts with foresight.
