Do you want to work for a fast growing, sparkling company? Keep on reading!

We are looking for a Sales Strategy Analyst to join our Strategic Insights team. You will play a pivotal role in driving revenue growth and optimizing sales performance through strategic analysis, market research, and data-driven insights. You will collaborate cross-functionally with sales, marketing, finance, and other key stakeholders to identify opportunities, develop actionable strategies, and monitor performance metrics. This role will identify new business opportunities, develop selling materials for prospective retailers, quantify the size of the prize.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITY & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze sales data, market trends, and customer insights to identify opportunities for revenue growth and market expansion.
Support the development of fact-based local selling stories: category, brand, retailer, and shopper.
Conduct in-depth competitive analysis and market research to identify emerging trends, competitive threats, and potential opportunities.
Provide strategic recommendations and actionable insights to senior management based on data analysis and market intelligence.
Support the development and implementation of sales strategies, initiatives, and promotional campaigns to drive revenue growth and market share.
Assists the organization by providing input into joint customer planning cycle based on knowledge of category and shopper trends, competitive issues, etc.
Evaluate the effectiveness of existing sales processes, programs, and initiatives, and recommend improvements to enhance efficiency and productivity.
Determine market needs, gaps, and create a strategy to capture new growth.
Stay informed about industry developments, best practices, and emerging technologies related to sales analytics and strategy.

Requirements:

Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Proven experience in sales analysis, business intelligence, or sales strategy development, preferably in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques. (e.g. retail link, dunnhumby, IRI, etc.) & syndicated data (e.g. Nielsen / Circana / Environics).
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights and recommendations.
Strategic thinker with a keen understanding of market dynamics, competitive landscapes, and sales methodologies.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Benefits

Enjoy a competitive salary commensurate with the experience and responsibility requirements.
Excellent employee environment with a competitive benefits package including:
Bonus based on performance and eligibility
Potential for Annual Merit increase based on performance and eligibility
Healthcare
Dental + Vision
Voluntary benefits
Paid Time Off
Retirement Benefits + Company Match
Life Insurance
Disability
Learning & Development Benefits
Wellness Programs

Job Description:
Accounting Analyst
If you are in search of an exciting position in a challenging, fast-paced and entrepreneurial working environment, then we have the ideal opportunity for you. This is an excellent opportunity to join a dynamic, growing company with a broad footprint in Canada.

Capstone Infrastructure Corporation (Capstone) is an independent power producer focused on providing clean, renewable energy to homes and businesses across North America. Headquartered in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, Capstone currently develops, owns and operates thermal and renewable power generation facilities totalling over 824 MW of installed capacity across 31 facilities in Canada.

Capstone Infrastructure Corporation is seeking an Accounting Analyst, to work with the finance team. This role will report to the Manager, Finance. Finance undertakes the financial management and reporting for Capstone Infrastructure Corporation, and the various assets which this company manages. The Finance department consists of 21 people to support the business growth of Capstone. This position plays a key role to the success of the finance team.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

Ensure integrity and completeness of financial records for assigned operating and development power businesses, as well as corporate entities, by preparing reconciliations and documenting accounting conclusions.
Assist with preparation and review of quarterly and annual reports including financial statements, MD&A, supporting schedules and finance-related board papers.
Prepare variance analysis and other management reports.
Coordinate and prepare all associated partner and lender reporting.
Perform internal control testing for NI52-109 compliance.
Support treasury processes for cash management and forecasting for assigned entities.
Assist with preparation of annual legal entity financial statements.
Maintain tax records and coordinate and review tax calculations with tax VP.
Prepare, document and coordinate support for external auditors.
Assist Asset Managers with inputs for valuation models by ensuring accurate financial information for business planning and forecasting.
Assist with maintaining access to information systems or banking applications by working with service providers as requested.
Assist as needed with systems implementations, systems administrative support and banking relationships.
Assist with ad hoc projects as requested.

Qualifications & Background :

Minimum 3-5 years practical working experience in accounting required, in public accounting firm or private sector finance team, preferably working towards a CPA.

Interpersonal Skills :
Ability to communicate and work well in a collaborative team environment and to interact with all levels of staff, including senior management, Finance and personnel at operating businesses.
Ability to build constructive relationships with external parties (e.g. lenders, partners, auditors, suppliers).
Willing to take ownership and accountability for tasks and see them through to completion.
Accepts responsibility by holding the line on quality and meeting deadlines, take initiative, and appropriately elevates issues to superiors.
Strong customer service work ethic, subject to maintaining internal controls.
Ability to gain the support of the Finance team and operations colleagues.

Technical Skills :
Experience with capital-intensive businesses is an asset.
Experience in IFRS accounting, internal control, and general ledgers (GP Dynamics, Vena, concur experience is an asset).
Ability to review your own work and integrity to provide consistently high-quality deliverables to senior team members.
Ability to recognize issues that arise from own work; accurately assess the impact, make recommendations, and implement solutions.
Strong Microsoft Excel skills, including data analysis, manipulation, and problem solving.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Personality Characteristics :
High level of energy, commitment, and flexibility.
Ability to prioritize and work on multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Good attention to detail.
Ability to handle ongoing changes in business.
Strong planning and organization skills in approach to work.
Sets high standards for self and good role model for others.
Focussed on meeting deadlines while maintaining a calm demeanor.
Team player with effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to re-assess / re-engineer work processes.
Desire to follow tasks through to completion.
Comfortable with tackling new concepts.

What Capstone Offers:
Competitive compensation, bonus & benefits package.
Opportunities to grow and develop skills in multiple disciplines.
Innovative, fast-paced environment surrounded by a highly motivated team that will assist in developing your skills and enabling success in your career.
A team-oriented and fun group of professionals.

Capstone Infrastructure Corporation is strongly committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible, and rewarding work environment which highlights employees unique contributions to our companys success.

As an equal-opportunity employer, we accommodate individuals with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with applicable laws.

Please note that while we appreciate all applications and thank all candidates for their interest; only applicants selected to continue in the process will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

CanadaHelps is looking for a problem-solving, self-starting Senior Analyst, Marketing Analytics with a passion for social change to join our team. This is a unique opportunity to be part of a purpose-driven tech company at a time of critical importance for the work we do. CanadaHelps has been a leader in charitable giving in Canada for 23 years, and has grown rapidly in the last 5 years; it now generates and processes more than $400 million in charitable donations.

About the Role
As part of the Data & Analytics team, the Senior Analyst, Marketing Analytics will be a strong partner to cross-functional teams, in understanding new and existing product offerings, and recommend the right metrics to measure performance. We are looking for someone who loves to solve a problem and has a knack for performance optimization and translating analysis into actionable insights.

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Data & Analytics, your primary focus will be supporting the B2B Marketing Team. However, youll also collaborate with various teams across the organization. In this role, youll serve as the central point of contact for all data requests and insights related to B2B line of business, as well as their fundraising tools and products.

Key Responsibilities
Charity Data Expertise: Become a subject matter expert on how charity data is stored and structured across multiple systems.
Design, create and automate weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and reports as well as meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that feed into the monthly performance scorecards.
Single point of contact for all data requests & insights on B2B fundraising tools and products
Develop models for customer segmentation, Churn & Retention prediction.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Dev/Engineering, Charity Engagement, Product, Finance etc. to create data marts, automate data and report generation and troubleshoot data issues to ensure data quality.
Set up A/B testing of marketing initiatives and new product features  test, measure, make recommendations and report results of all efforts.
Manage all online analytics to report business performance, key changes, customer lifetime value metrics, and performance opportunities back into the Marketing or relevant teams within the organization.
Maintain and support web data integrity/validation. Be able to identify gaps in the current data capture strategy and collaboratively implement enhancements.
Partner internally and externally to ensure best practices in metrics and decision making are being maintained, and act proactively in analyzing user behavior using available data to influence changes on the website.
Deep dive into campaign performance data to identify and recommend opportunities for improvement.
Support team in ensuring marketing programs are executed with a data-driven philosophy and develop mechanisms to measure performance.
Participating in/ Membership of the Data guild for formulating internal policies for data related regulatory, innovation and design best practices.
Liaise with the Snr Manager, Data & Analytics in the technical solution design and development of new and ongoing projects using ML algorithms and statistical data modeling tools to develop data products.

Required Skills and Experience
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Math or another quantitative discipline; or College diploma with equivalent experience.
3+ years of hands-on experience in business and/or product analytics, working with large, multi-dimensional datasets, preferably at fast-growing tech companies.
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.
Skilled in extracting, transforming and manipulating data using query and programming languages such as SQL, Python etc.
2+ years of experience using data visualization using tools like Tableau, Looker etc.
Knowledge of using CRM tools such as Salesforce.
Knowledge of web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, and experimentation (A/B tests etc.) and basic statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing) required. Knowledge of commonly used analytic methods such as regression, decision trees and forecasting are highly preferred.
Experience in and ability to play trusted advisor to senior and executive leadership and help make change happen.

Here Is What We Have To Offer
A permanent position with a competitive salary, 100% employer-paid benefits, generous RRSP matching, generous time off, and flexible work policies.
A chance to make a difference and a unique opportunity to add major value as a key member of a growing team in a forward-thinking, technology-focused environment.
A get things done, open, collaborative and flexible environment.
Amazing co-workers with passion, intelligence, energy, and ideas.
A flexible schedule and work location policy.

What you can expect with our interview process:

We understand interviewing can be a daunting experience, and we are here to support you every step of the way. Here is a step by step guide on what interviewing with us looks like:
30 min get to know you interview with our People & Culture Team
60 min Meet the Hiring Manager technical interview with our Senior Manager, Data & Analytics
45 min Meet the COO

Accommodation: CanadaHelps is an equal opportunity employer, and welcomes and encourages applications from all persons including those with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process, please contact accessibility@canadahelps.org so that appropriate accommodations can be made.

About Flinks
Flinks is driven by the belief that data should belong to the consumers.
We enable the open, consent-based exchange of financial data while empowering businesses to connect their consumers with the services they want. Flinks connects to over 250 million financial accounts, and is trusted by hundreds of world-class companies. Flinks helps them to digitize their processes, improve their user experience, and reduce delinquency.
About the Team
Becoming a part of the Product Operations team at Flinks entails actively contributing to its ongoing transformation and directly influencing client outcomes. Reporting to the VP of Product Operations, this role places you within a dynamic and agile team, emphasizing the significance of collaboration as a core value.
What You'll Be Doing
Identify and collect comprehensive business requirements, ensuring effective communication of business needs.
Evaluate business opportunities presented by stakeholders to define and optimize the product portfolio. Conduct thorough analysis and understanding of targeted markets, customer business issues, and competitive landscapes.
Ensure alignment of solutions with Flinks business objectives and assess their anticipated impact on these objectives.
Collaborate with stakeholders to extract valuable insights, translating them into detailed business requirements for development teams to create innovative technical product offerings.
Develop strategic project plans aimed at addressing customer needs and/or expanding market share.
Gather and analyze feedback from project sponsors.
Actively contribute to the enhancement of Flinks efficiency by fostering collaboration with Product Engineering, Customer Management, Sales, and IT.
Take an active role in shaping and improving the Business Analysis function at Flinks through continuous improvement.
Who You Are
At least 5 years of experience working as a Business Analyst in a tech environment or with IT projects.
Demonstrated ability to analyze, synthesize information, and a quick grasp of new business processes.
Working knowledge of Agile processes and delivery methodologies.
Strong interpersonal skills; you excel at building relationships and are recognized as a natural leader
Knack for reading between the lines and focusing on the important stuff
It would be even better if you have
Working knowledge of BABOK
A certification in Business Analysis (ie CBAP, ECHA, CCBA, etc.)
The Interview Process
People Operations Generalist
VP of Product Operations
Case Assignment
Panel Interview & Case Presentation

Senior Business Systems Analyst, Workday
Location: Remote
Division: Information Technology
About The Salvation Army
For more than 130 years, The Salvation Army (TSA) has had the privilege of serving vulnerable people in communities across Canada and Bermuda. Last year, we helped over 2 million people, providing necessities of life such as food, clothing, and shelter. And our work goes well beyond that to including supporting people through unemployment, loneliness, finding church community, and responding to family challenges. We continually adapt to meet emerging needs.
These are exciting times at The Salvation Army as we launch a significant digital and business transformation. We are in the midst of revolutionizing our core capabilities to maximize service and mission outcomes. This will include an integrated platform for relationship and people management, learning, intranet and data warehouse. In order to achieve all this, we are now recruiting for a Senior Business Systems Analyst for our HR Technology Team.
As a Senior Business Systems Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our Workday system to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and compliance in the areas of Core HCM, Reporting and Security. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including HR, Finance, and IT, to analyze business processes, gather requirements, and implement solutions that align with organizational objectives.
What you will be doing:
Conduct in-depth analysis of existing Workday configurations related to Core HCM, Reporting and Security.
Identify opportunities for system enhancements, process improvements, and automation.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into clear and comprehensive requirements.
Document detailed functional and technical specifications for system modifications and enhancements.
Lead the design and implementation of Workday solutions for Core HCM, Reporting and Security.
Develop and execute test plans, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of system changes.
Provide training sessions to end-users on new system features and functionality.
Act as a point of contact for troubleshooting and resolving issues related to Core HCM, Reporting and Security modules.
Ensure Workday configurations comply with industry regulations and internal policies.
Collaborate with the security team to implement and maintain proper access controls.
Propose and implement continuous improvement initiatives to optimize Workday performance.
What you bring to the table
3-5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, with a strong focus on Workday in a complex enterprise environment.
In-depth knowledge of Workday modules, particularly Core HCM, Reporting and Security.
Deep experience providing project implementation and support for Workday
Proven experience in requirements analysis, system design proposals, cost/benefit analysis and testing in support of solution development.
Experience overseeing the development and/or implementation of web-based software and hardware solutions, on both functional and technical levels.
Proven ability to adapt to and function effectively within a changing organizational environment.
Ability to work independently while managing priorities and juggling multiple projects
Workday certifications are an asset.
What We Promise
Belonging to a creative, dynamic team of IT professionals where what you do will make a difference in your own backyard and across Canada & Bermuda
Work from home and flexible hours
Benefits
Continuous learning and growth through challenging work
The chance to be part of a leading digital and business transformation for over 100,000 employees and volunteers
An opportunity to launch and/or grow your career with a huge, stable, international not-for-profit organization
We live our Core Values as a faith & values-based organization, we hire and serve people of all backgrounds, faiths, and traditions  theres a place for everyone to belong here.
Compensation
The salary range for this position is $71,318 (min.) to -$106,976 (max). Placement in the salary range will be based on factors such as market conditions, internal equity, and candidate experience, skills, and qualifications relevant to the role.
How We Hire
We are committed to creating a workplace where people experience meaningful work, a sense of hope and optimism, an environment of trust, and inspired results. If this sounds like an environment in which you would like to work, apply here today!
We embrace equity, diversity, justice, inclusion and belonging and were committed to building a team that represents many backgrounds, perspectives and skills, representative of the communities we serve. The more inclusive we are, the better our work and workplace will be. The Salvation Army will provide reasonable accommodation upon request. Please let us know if you have a need for any accommodation.
We thank all applicants and will contact candidates selected for next steps.

Our mission is to Drive Business Performance. We use data to create personalized and connected experiences that deliver transformative business outcomes. We are entirely focused on delivering better business results through optimization, creation and analysis across all digital platforms. Our scope ranges from recommending how to use content more effectively to optimizing daily media channel performance and maximizing visibility in eCommerce platforms.

iProspect is looking for a Sr. Performance Media Analyst who has a desire to learn multiple digital media disciplines. This person will be managing a blend of Search Engine Marketing and Paid Social Media programs for top tier clients in Canada. The Sr. Performance Media Analyst will support the team in all aspects of operation, including ensuring the timely delivery of all client requirements, analyzing campaign performance, and performing optimizations, helping to create and deliver campaign performance reports, and providing regular input of ideas for best practices and process improvement. This opportunity requires someone with dedication, curiosity, motivation, and the desire to learn from the best in market!
Assist the team in strategy development of campaigns.

#LI-DM1

Established in 1959 and recognized as one of Canadas Best Managed Companies since 2008, ASL Distribution Services Limited (ASL) is a powerful distribution hub for leading North American companies, including Fortune 100 companies. ASL is a dynamic and passionate third party logistics service provider that offers its clients a diverse range of customized services, such as warehousing and distribution, e-commerce fulfillment, brokerage, asset-based transportation and final mile delivery. ASL offers competitive wages along with a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, vacation, company RRSP, work life balance and employee events throughout the year in an exciting work environment focused on training, open communication, and career advancement.
ASL is looking to add a talented and detail-oriented Pricing Analyst to lead the companys yield management related activities. This individual will have a mission to drive pricing excellence using market trends, industry benchmarks and competitor analysis. Tactically, this position is responsible for analyzing company cost structure, driving revenue growth and maximizing profit margins by ensuring assets are deployed to generate quality revenue. You will empower business leaders with informed decision-making, influence the companys pricing strategies & ensure sustained value for our customers while maintaining business profitability.
This is a permanent, full-time position with work hours from Monday-Friday.
Key Duties / responsibilities:
Support Sales team by pricing quotes on new business opportunities for warehousing, LTL, TL transportation and parcel deliveries.
Keep Customer Pricing and Tariffs up to date taking into account any business changes, Currency rates fluctuations, rate increases etc.
Lead the Pricing for all major RFPs: co-ordinate with Sales, Operations and BI teams as well as sister companies to consolidate the pricing response.
Participate in drafting solutions to large proposals that involves milk runs, hub and spoke, routes and network optimization.
Look for ways to improve current quote process/costing models by standardizing templates, eliminating manual work and automating workflows to avoid errors and improve accuracy.
Develop and maintain pricing models, tools and databases to support data driven pricing decisions.
Understand industry trends, economic indicators, competition, regulatory changes and external factors to assess its impact on pricing.
Analyze key cost drivers and identify areas for cost improvements and efficiency gains.
Develop and maintain pricing strategy to improve the win % on spot quotes, RFPs etc.
Assess profitability and contribution margin by terminal/warehouse, customer, lanes to assist business leaders make sound decisions.
Assist Customer Success Manager in customer segmentation by providing inputs on customer profitability which in turn becomes an input for upsell, rate increases, exits and overall customer portfolio management.
Use above customer segmentation to build unique/custom pricing models, easy to deploy and scale up to improve ASLs response time, accuracy and profitability.
Analyze data and report trends on volume, turns, margin, revenue/pallet, cost per mile, asset utilization etc.
Identify opportunities to improve labour productivity, increase assets utilization that will help ASL to lower its cost structure and improve margins.
Requirements:
2+ years of previous experience in a similar role with a deep understanding of Logistics/3PL/Supply Chain operations is a must.
Previous experience in pricing LTL, TL, Warehousing, Courier opportunities is essential.
Demonstrated skills in reading, evaluating, synthesizing, and formulating innovative solutions to complex RFPs to meet cost effectively meet customer needs is required.
Strong grasp on Excel, data analysis tools. Working knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Previous background in Procurement, Strategic Sourcing, Business/Data Analysis, Supply Chain/Network Optimization is strongly preferred.
Familiarity with warehouse and transportation management systems, routing applications, Labour Management Systems is a plus.
Previous Lean, Project Management and/or Six Sigma experience/certification preferred.
Strong interpersonal and written/oral communication skills
Strong attention to detail, analytical mindset & problem-solving abilities
Post-Secondary education in Business, Economics, Finance or Supply Chain field is preferred.

HM Note: This hybrid role is three (3) days in office.

Title: Supply Chain Analyst
Company Overview:
BTNX Inc. (BTNX) is a leading biotechnology company specializing in rapid, point-of-care diagnostics. As a pioneer in the field, we are dedicated to innovation, research, and the development of advanced in-vitro diagnostic (IVD) tests. Our operations extend across laboratories, clinics, hospitals, and physician offices, with our core business presence in Canada & USA as well as a global presence spanning dozens of countries. Headquartered in Pickering, ON, BTNX offers an exciting opportunity for a motivated individual to join our team.
Job Overview:
The Supply Chain Analyst will support our Director of Supply Chain by compiling information on current and historical inventory levels, sales data, product cost and provide reports for the Director to use in their decision-making process. You will assist the Director in sourcing products and materials and in organizing transportation logistics. This position offers the candidate a holistic view of the business, with direct participation in key decisions with senior management. A successful candidate will be someone with strong business acumen, excellent communication skills, analytical skills, and inquisitiveness. This role may perform other duties as assigned and will be reporting directly to the Director of Supply Chain.
Required Skills:
Minimum: College or University Degree Oral & Written fluency in English required and Mandarin is a strong asset. Experienced working with excel and spreadsheets. Preferred: Prior experience in purchasing / supply chain Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Well organized and comfortable with uncertainty and change in a dynamic work environment. Strong interpersonal communication and ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. Resourcefulness & ability to multitask. Passion for problem-solving, investigating issues, and finding solutions.
Application:
We are a company that values dedication, resourcefulness and results, and look to foster the entrepreneurial spirit in all our talent. If this is something that speaks to you, please provide your CV and cover letter today to careers@btnx.com !

Join a Challenger

Being a traditional bank just isnt our thing. We are big believers in innovating the banking experience because we believe Canadians deserve better options, and we challenge ourselves and our teams to creatively transform whats possible in banking. Our team is made up of inquisitive and agile minds that find smarter ways of doing things. If youre not afraid of taking on big challenges and redefining the future, you belong with us. Youll get to work with people who will encourage you to reach new heights. We like to keep things fun, ask questions and learn together.
We are a big (and growing!) family. Overall we serve more than 370,000 people across Canada through Equitable Bank, Canada's Challenger Bank, and have been around for more than 50 years. Equitable Bank's wholly-owned subsidiary, Concentra Bank, supports credit unions across Canada that serve more than 5 million members. Together we have over $100 billion in combined assets under management and administration, with a clear mandate to drive change in Canadian banking to enrich people's lives. Our EQ Bank platform (eqbank.ca) has been named the top Schedule I Bank in Canada on the Forbes World's Best Banks 2023, 2022, and 2021 lists.

The Fraud Analyst  Cards, will conduct investigative analysis to identify, assess, decision and report on activity that indicates an exposure to financial crimes. The incumbent will manage inbound calls and assist clients to ensure potential threats and investigations are evaluated, documented, managed and escalated by following standard operating procedures. They will provide subject matter expertise and oversight of criminal risk by following a disciplined and intelligence-based approach to detection and research of activities and events in alignment with EQ Banks fraud program and standards to ensure compliance as well as support trending, analysis and insights generation.
The Work !
Provides input and develops recommendations for process and customer service improvements.
Monitors inbound fraud queue and service our clients.
Monitors and analyzes various information provided through detection systems, tools, reports, or manually to evaluate, investigate and determine required actions.
Supports the collection of evidence and information to be used for multiple purposes including incident reports/filings, loss prevention, litigation and criminal prosecution, management information and statistics, and process improvements.
Documents actions and information found throughout the investigation to develop and maintain account/case files.

Job Description:
Business Intelligence Developer

Advantage Group International is seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our Technology team to help us manage, maintain, and improve our dashboards and reports platform which are at the core of our business.
Who We Are
Advantage believes that stronger collaboration leads to better business results in any market and any industry. Our relationship benchmarking capabilities have become the gold standard for measuring business-to-business engagement in over 40+ countries for over 30 years.
Who Were Seeking
We are looking for a versatile Business Intelligence (BI) Developer who can evolve with the Business Intelligence platform and the changing business climate. This individual will be responsible for design, development, and maintenance of syndicated visualizations, dashboards and reports, performance tuning and data synchronization. They would also integrate the dashboards into client-facing portals for a seamless user experience. The successful candidate will need to optimize the performance of these dashboards and reports by ensuring smooth data flow between applications and fast retrieval of complex results. The candidate will also be responsible for evaluating new BI tools and for evolving our processes.

In other words, we need someone who:
Three or more years experience in the Business Intelligence field.
Is an expert in developing reports and dashboards in Tableau or another BI tool.
Is great at analyzing data relationships.
Thrives in a small multi-disciplinary team environment.
Can assist in the design and implementation of data warehouses, data marts, and governance frameworks.
Can analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve complex performance and data integrity related issues.
Your Day-to-Day
Currently  in production  a variety of internal applications and external systems are used to create surveys, analyze responses, and report the results. We are maintaining current production systems and enhancing their functionality and performance. Your responsibilities will involve:
Design, develop, test, and maintain syndicated visualizations, dashboards and reports.
Review and optimize performance of visualizations, dashboards and reports.
Meet with stakeholders to gather requirements and follow up to ensure data needs are being met.
Create data models to visualize the database structure.
Read data from multiple data sources and transform, enrich, and aggregate data for an efficient presentation in an enterprise environment.
Provide input into the architecture, design, and implementation of the business intelligence solution.
Recommend improvements to streamline processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve data accuracy and usability.
Remain abreast of technology developments within fields relevant to current and future BI and Reporting initiatives.
Test the work of other team members.
Assist with production configuration and deployment, as necessary.
Your Skills
You must have knowledge of and experience with:
Hands on experience with Business intelligence and data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Looker.
Transform data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals.
Use coding languages like JavaScript to build visualization extensions to embed in existing BI Tools
Experience analyzing, troubleshooting, and resolving complex performance and data integrity related issues.
Can work in an Agile environment (be part of a team and manage your own time).
Knowledge and experience with the following is beneficial:
SQL query skills (views, stored procedures, multi-table joins, temp tables) with large data sets.
Programming skills (JavaScript, Python, Java) for integrating the dashboards into client-facing portals.
Importing file-based data into a relational database.
Use coding languages such as R to analyze data
You should understand:
Software architecture.
Database design and optimization.
Software development processes and methodologies.
Data security.
Your Characteristics
Fantastic written and verbal communication skills, organizational skills.
Discipline to be productive without a rigid methodology.
Desire to create and improve the status quo methodology.
Why Should You Work with Us?
The Advantage Group offers an excellent work-life balance, including the following:
Stable company, with an established client-base and a continual steady growth.
Excellent work-life balance: flexible hours, hybrid working and generous vacation policy.
Opportunities for growth and professional development.
Hybrid work environment with a location near Union station.
A paid day off on your birthday.
One volunteer day off per year.
Intelligent and passionate team members.
Unique business and technical problems, a new challenge around every corner.
Strong corporate culture: Monthly company-wide gatherings for global community-building.
Health benefits including counselling and mental health support.
Competitive compensation including Group RRSP.

Dont meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace; therefore, if youre excited about this role but your experience doesnt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles at Advantage.

Job Summary
We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Laboratory Analyst to join our team. As a Laboratory Analyst, you will be responsible for conducting various tests, analyzing data, and ensuring quality control within the laboratory. If you have a strong background in laboratory procedures, data collection and analysis we encourage you to apply.
Duties
- Perform asbestos, mould and fire tests according to standard operating procedures
- Collect and analyze data, ensuring accuracy and precision
- Prepare samples for testing and maintain proper documentation
- Operate and maintain laboratory equipment and instruments
- Follow safety protocols and maintain a clean and organized work environment
- Collaborate with team members to troubleshoot issues and improve processes
- Assist in quality control activities to ensure compliance with regulations
Requirements
- Bachelor's degree or college degree in a related field (Environmental Science, Chemistry, Biology, or similar)
- Knowledge of determination of visual percentage and optical properties of asbestos and non-asbestos materials
- Performance of QA/QC practices as per company QA/QC manual, procedures and policies, including logging in samples, writing and reviewing and releasing results to the customer
- Proven experience working in a laboratory setting
- Participated in the Proficiency Tests Programs for Asbestos (NVLAP), BAPAT program from the American Industrial Hygienist Association (AIHA), and for PCM (CALA).
- Knowledge of laboratory techniques and procedures
- Training and validation related to asbestos identification by Polarized Light Microscopy (PLM).
- Maintenance and troubleshooting of equipment such as microscopes (phase contrast and polarized light), stereoscope, biosafety/particulate/fume hoods, muffle furnace, controlled-temperature equipment, balances, and filtering units.
- Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
- Effective communication skills.
If you are passionate about science, have a keen eye for detail and enjoy working in a collaborative environment, we would like to hear from you. Apply today to join our team as a Laboratory Analyst.

Arthur Grand Technologies is currently seeking a highly motivated and skilled Business Intelligence Specialist  ETL-Senior for one of our clients.

Oracle Golden Gate

Oracle
Ability to present technical requirements to the business

Design Documentation and Analysis Skills (30 points)
Demonstrated experience in creating both Functional Design Documents (FDD) & Detailed Design Documents (DDD).

Experience in application mapping to populate data warehouse and dimensional data mart schemas

Experience building data ingestion and change data capture using Golden Gate
Assist in the development of the pre-defined and ad-hoc reports and meet the coding and accessibility requirements.

Proficient in SQL and Python

General Responsibilities

Understand the Tables and Relationships in the data model.
Create low level design documents and test cases for ETL development.
Create the workflows and pipeline design
Development and testing of data pipelines with Incremental and Full Load.
Develop high quality ETL mappings/scripts/notebooks

Perform unit testing
Ensure performance monitoring and improvement
Performance review, data consistency checks
Troubleshoot performance issues, ETL issues, log activity for each pipeline and transformation.
Review and optimize overall ETL performance.
End-to-end integrated testing for Full Load and Incremental Load
Plan for Go Live, Production Deployment.
Create production deployment steps.
Configure parameters, scripts for go live. Test and review the instructions.
Create release documents and help build and deploy code across servers.
Go Live Support and Review after Go Live.
Review existing ETL process, tools and provide recommendation on improving performance and reduce ETL timelines.
Review infrastructure and remediate issues for overall process improvement
Knowledge Transfer to Ministry staff, development of documentation on the work completed.
Document work and share the ETL end-to-end design, troubleshooting steps, configuration and scripts review.
Transfer documents, scripts and review of documents to Ministry.
Skills

Experience developing in an Agile environment
Understanding data warehouse architecture with a delta lake and dimensional model (must-have)
Ability to analyze, design, develop, test and document ETL pipelines from detailed and high-level specifications, and assist in troubleshooting.

Good knowledge of database performance optimization techniques

Work closely with Designers, Business Analysts and other Developers
Liaise with Project Managers, Quality Assurance Analysts and Business Intelligence Consultants

Established in 1959 and recognized as one of Canadas Best Managed Companies since 2008, ASL Distribution Services Limited (ASL) is a powerful distribution hub for leading North American companies, including Fortune 100 companies. ASL is a dynamic and passionate third party logistics service provider that offers its clients a diverse range of customized services, such as warehousing and distribution, e-commerce fulfillment, brokerage, asset-based transportation and final mile delivery. ASL offers competitive wages along with a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, vacation, company RRSP, work life balance and employee events throughout the year in an exciting work environment focused on training, open communication, and career advancement.
ASL is looking to add a talented and detail-oriented Pricing Analyst to lead the companys yield management related activities. This individual will have a mission to drive pricing excellence using market trends, industry benchmarks and competitor analysis. Tactically, this position is responsible for analyzing company cost structure, driving revenue growth and maximizing profit margins by ensuring assets are deployed to generate quality revenue. You will empower business leaders with informed decision-making, influence the companys pricing strategies & ensure sustained value for our customers while maintaining business profitability.
This is a permanent, full-time position with work hours from Monday-Friday.
Key Duties / responsibilities:
Support Sales team by pricing quotes on new business opportunities for warehousing, LTL, TL transportation and parcel deliveries.
Keep Customer Pricing and Tariffs up to date taking into account any business changes, Currency rates fluctuations, rate increases etc.
Lead the Pricing for all major RFPs: co-ordinate with Sales, Operations and BI teams as well as sister companies to consolidate the pricing response.
Participate in drafting solutions to large proposals that involves milk runs, hub and spoke, routes and network optimization.
Look for ways to improve current quote process/costing models by standardizing templates, eliminating manual work and automating workflows to avoid errors and improve accuracy.
Develop and maintain pricing models, tools and databases to support data driven pricing decisions.
Understand industry trends, economic indicators, competition, regulatory changes and external factors to assess its impact on pricing.
Analyze key cost drivers and identify areas for cost improvements and efficiency gains.
Develop and maintain pricing strategy to improve the win % on spot quotes, RFPs etc.
Assess profitability and contribution margin by terminal/warehouse, customer, lanes to assist business leaders make sound decisions.
Assist Customer Success Manager in customer segmentation by providing inputs on customer profitability which in turn becomes an input for upsell, rate increases, exits and overall customer portfolio management.
Use above customer segmentation to build unique/custom pricing models, easy to deploy and scale up to improve ASLs response time, accuracy and profitability.
Analyze data and report trends on volume, turns, margin, revenue/pallet, cost per mile, asset utilization etc.
Identify opportunities to improve labour productivity, increase assets utilization that will help ASL to lower its cost structure and improve margins.
Requirements:
2+ years of previous experience in a similar role with a deep understanding of Logistics/3PL/Supply Chain operations is a must.
Previous experience in pricing LTL, TL, Warehousing, Courier opportunities is essential.
Demonstrated skills in reading, evaluating, synthesizing, and formulating innovative solutions to complex RFPs to meet cost effectively meet customer needs is required.
Strong grasp on Excel, data analysis tools. Working knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Previous background in Procurement, Strategic Sourcing, Business/Data Analysis, Supply Chain/Network Optimization is strongly preferred.
Familiarity with warehouse and transportation management systems, routing applications, Labour Management Systems is a plus.
Previous Lean, Project Management and/or Six Sigma experience/certification preferred.
Strong interpersonal and written/oral communication skills
Strong attention to detail, analytical mindset & problem-solving abilities
Post-Secondary education in Business, Economics, Finance or Supply Chain field is preferred.

Amhil North America is a privately held Thermoforming Plastics Packaging company focused on delivering Best Value to our customers and partners. We provide smart, safe and sustainable packaging solutions for the consumer, industrial and foodservice industries in North America and Europe.
Over the past twenty years, Amhil has expanded its product offering to include drinking cups, portion cups and food packaging and now includes products that are 100% recyclable, produced with recycled content and available as carbon neutral.
Amhil North America is part of the Wentworth Technologies group of companies.
Overview
The Business Analyst is a new, full-time position at Amhil and will be crucial to providing the data analysis and insight necessary to optimize our operations in our journey to becoming a more data-driven organization.
This role will lead our efforts in extracting, analyzing, and interpreting data to enable informed decision-making and process optimization. Working closely with cross-functional teams, the BA will leverage data analytics tools and methodologies to provide insight to our leadership team for production, sales, quality, supply chain, and other areas of the organization.
Duties
The Business Analyst (BA) provides insight to the stakeholders for improving the overall performance of the company through doing a deep dive into the organization, operations, processes and providing analyses of operational data, and identifying opportunities across the organization.
Not just predictive modeling and statistical analysis, the BA will need to effectively communicate data findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.
Partner with a variety of sources to identify and gather relevant data.
Use analytics tools to conduct in-depth analysis of KPIs related to production, quality, and supply chain efficiency.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize trends, anomalies, and performance metrics.
Develop forecast demand, optimize inventory levels, and identify potential areas for improvements in the Manufacturing process, Sales, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain and Continuous Improvement.
Collaborate with stakeholders to implement data-driven predictive models for resource planning and align analytics efforts with strategic goals.
Work closely with IT team to ensure data integrity, implement data governance policies, and support the integration of data analytics solutions into existing systems.
Support sales and operations in determining costs for new products.
What were looking for
A Great Attitude!
Relevant post-secondary education in data science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or related field.
3+ years experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in food packaging manufacturing industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and modeling techniques and data tools relevant to business intelligence, including a working knowledge of relational databases.
Proficiency in data analytics tools such as Python, R, or SQL.
Business acumen, with good understanding of standard costing and financial measures.
Experience with data visualization tools e.g. Tableau, Power BI (DAX).
Analytical and decision-making skills.
Strong communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills.
Relationship building skills to work as part of a team.
Proven negotiation and problem-solving skills.
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Knowledge of food packaging manufacturing processes, quality control standards, and supply chain dynamics (strongly preferred).
Advanced Excel function for analysis.
Also nice to have
Familiar with Amhil products and plastic food packaging experience.
Reporting tools: Crystal reports, SSRS reports (an asset)
PMP certification.

This position is open to all applicants, legally authorized to work in Canada.
Amhil provides equal opportunities for all applicants and is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
We thank all applicants for their interest however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
If you're not viewing this on our website, be sure to visit www.amhil.com/careers for all our available opportunities!

We are looking for an Intermediate SCADA Analyst to join our growing team at Dexcent. If you enjoy resolving client issues with SCADA, communications, RTU and PLC, this could be the right career move for you!
About Dexcent
Founded in 2006, Dexcent Inc. (Dexcent) is an engineering consulting firm that provides a range of specialized solutions for clients in a variety of industries throughout the world. Our professionals have modernized IT and OT engineering methodologies into comprehensive solutions, specializing in information analytics, cyber-security, infrastructure, and control systems engineering. As such, we pride ourselves on truly transforming industrial operations to optimize business performance and deliver bottom-line results.
About the Candidate
Our ideal candidate has:
3-5 years of work experience with OASyS (AVEVA Enterprise) SCADA, including HMI, database, testing, commissioning, and applications, specifically Liquids Management System (LMS).
A Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Superior SCADA/control systems troubleshooting and technical skills.
Working knowledge of Windows, C, C++, Java, Perl, SQL and Visual Basic programming language. Competent with MS Office.
High level of comfort using interactive tools (Teams, Sharepoint, Outlook, Slack, One Drive, Remote Desktop, ticketing systems, APS systems).
Technical writing/documentation talents (end-user documentation, reports, flow diagrams, as-built drawings, etc.).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Strong customer service, organization and time management skills.
About the Role
The SCADA Analyst maintains and enhances live Client SCADA systems (OASyS) in support of control center operations and related business areas. They manage and resolve Client issues which include, but is not limited to SCADA, communications, hardware, RTU, and PLC.
Detailed duties and responsibilities include:
Provide consulting services for the maintenance, enhancement and integration of SCADA system functionality.
Learn and build expertise in Client systems, including SCADA and automation systems (OASyS), Liquids Management System (LMS) and related applications.
SCADA system implementation, integration, operation, support, and maintenance that includes data analysis, screen development, database updates, scripting, point to point checkout and documentation.
Play a key role in the maintenance of live Client SCADA production and development application environments by providing technical support, troubleshooting, problem diagnosis, application testing and configuration changes.
Work closely with Client Control Center Coordinators in the planning, organizing and delivering of support service to the Control Center.
Work closely with Client SCADA Operations and Integration teams to ensure changes in the SCADA System are communicated with SCADA Support.
Oversee the successful transition of applications and new instances of OASyS into SCADA Support.
Assist in SCADA system commissioning effort.
Provide support to SCADA projects in the role of Support Liaison.
Be part of the team that works on Problem Reports requested from Client.
Complete assigned weekly maintenance tasks and implement operational limit changes to various parts of the liquid systems under direction of engineering.
Coordinate with Client field employees to diagnose and resolve issues with flow meters and other field instrumentation.
Proactively engage with Client end users, field, various departments, management, etc.
Coordinate changes to networking, firewalls, domains, arrange for the work and obtain approvals.
Develop and demonstrate an understanding of SCADA best practices, standards, and operating procedures.
Demonstrate commitment to the Dexcent and Client teams success.
Prepare and maintain documentation as per Dexcent and Client standards.
Comply with all relevant change management procedures.
Proactively support the Dexcent safety program and initiatives; maintaining compliance with all safety policies and procedures (including Client site specific programs), and ensuring utilization of safe work practices on Client sites and in the office.
Maintain a positive attitude and communication style with Clients, vendors and team members in all circumstances.
Other duties and special projects as assigned by Dexcent or Client Supervisor.
At Dexcent we recognize that people are our most important asset. We appreciate the diverse experience, knowledge, creativity, and personality that each person brings to our organization, our culture, and our success. If this sounds like the right career opportunity for you, apply today!

Job Description:
nnovativ provides technology staffing and Digital Transformation Services for private and public sector organizations. We are currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst for our client in the Public Sector domain. We value our professionals by providing comprehensive benefits and the opportunity for growth. This is a 12 month Contract position with a possibility of extension.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid 3 Days from Office)
Role: Technical Business Analyst
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Experience leading and conducting business analysis for business projects to assess clients' business problems or opportunities, document the technical business requirements to meet the functional requirements.
Experience developing context diagrams, use cases and use case models.
Experience developing process maps, stakeholder maps and assessments.
Experience creating systems diagrams
Experience writing business cases and conducting options analysis

Avnan is seeking an experienced Supply Chain Analyst to join our Supply Chain department. Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, the Supply Chain Analyst will be responsible for ensuring on time delivery, inventory optimization, and customer satisfaction in order to achieve the corporate objectives.

The Supply Chain Analyst will work directly with customers, overseas and local manufacturers, to coordinate supply. Along with working on day-to-day supply chain planning activities, the Analyst will ensure that Avnans customers are provided with the information they require to be successful.

Additionally, the Supply Chain Analyst will participate and drive supply chain solutions that will provide value to Avnans customers business.

Responsibilities:

Account & Relationship Management
Analyze forecasted flows, operational capacity, and stakeholder alignment to provide recommendations for new customers.
Collaborate with Finance, Sales, Customers, and Engineering to improve profitability and data accuracy for quoting.
Drive customer-focused cost reductions and improvements in customer satisfaction.
Manage customer-level costing and pricing to maintain target gross profit.
Maintain a productive relationship with suppliers working toward a healthy partnership

On-Time Delivery:
Take ownership of meeting on-time delivery and customer commit dates.
Address issues proactively and minimize disruptions.
Coordinate and communicate customer action plans with supply/factories and logistics teams.
Log customer delays and analyze trends for root causes

Forecast and Inventory:
Interact with sales, customers, and finance to understand demand forecast drivers.
Review historical sales trends, analyze product data, and prepare accurate forecasts.
Identify problematic areas and suggest improvements based on data analysis.
Optimize shipping modes and schedules to achieve cost-effective solutions.
Review component and finished goods inventory levels, adjusting them to match current demand.
Develop inventory strategies for existing items, new products, and product phase-outs.

System and Data Accuracy:
Create and maintain accuracy in finished goods purchase orders.
Ensure accuracy in quote and cost management processes.
Create and maintain accuracy in job-related activities, including verifying supplier invoices and inventory consumption.

Continuous Improvements:
Plan and execute supply chain optimization projects to reduce costs, improve performance, and enhance customer satisfaction.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and report on supply chain performance.
Continuously work towards improving KPIs and implementing best practices.

About You:

Our ideal candidate possesses the following qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Supply Chain, Material Management, Logistics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3-5 years' experience in Forecasting, Planning, Purchasing, Inventory Control, or other Supply Chain roles.
CSCP, CPIM, CLTD, CSMA, CITT or P.Log completed or scheduled to be completed.
Proficiency in Supply Chain concepts, with APICS CPIM or equivalent certification being a plus.
Knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma, Continuous Improvement, or equivalent methodologies.
Experience working in electronics manufacturing, EMS, ODM, or OEM is an asset.

Note: "This is a remote position with the possibility of transitioning to a hybrid/in-office setup in the future. Candidates located within the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) will be given preference. Please note that relocation costs will not be covered."

Skills and Credentials:

The ideal candidate for the Supply Chain Analyst role should also possess:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to interpret complex data and drive actionable insights.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks effectively.
Understanding SCM and ERP systems.
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office applications (Excel).
Basic understanding of electronic components familiar with manufacturing.

Join our team and contribute to our commitment to delivering exceptional supply chain performance and financial excellence.

About Avnan

Avnan is an award-winning global electronics engineering company that works in partnership with original equipment manufacturers to deliver best-in-class customized product design solutions, supply chain logistics management, and manufacturing.

Headquartered in Canada for over 25 years, Avnan leverages its global network of manufacturing partners along with its engineering expertise to provide a single point of accountability for electronic product solutions that is cost-effective, high quality, and simplifies operational logistics. Avnan operates in a wide variety of industries including consumer appliances, and commercial and residential building systems managing the process from design to assembly and final delivery.

At Avnan, youll have the opportunity to work on a variety of different projects. Youll become a part of our close-knit team, with the opportunity to see how your work directly impacts our business and our customers business. We believe in promoting a progressive, forward-looking, growth mindset setting high standards for quality, and providing our teams with the support to achieve their performance goals.

Our flexible work arrangements allow you to enjoy a work-life balance that ensures you are at your most productive. With our focus on diversity, you are exposed to various types of culture and work styles providing you with the opportunity for personal growth and professional development.

We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer and are committed to building a work environment that is both diverse and inclusive. You will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, creed, disability, or age.

Senior Asset Management Analyst

Aypa Power, a Blackstone portfolio company, is a leading developer, owner, and operator of utility-scale energy storage and hybrid renewable projects that power our communities and cities. Our mission is to responsibly decarbonize the grid and make North American energy markets more affordable, sustainable, and efficient. Aypa is well-capitalized and uniquely positioned to lean forward on projects with well-suited deal structures to meet our customers needs. We have been at the forefront of energy storage development since our first energy storage project came online in 2018. As a leader in our industry, we now have over 22 GW of utility-scale energy storage and hybrid renewable energy projects in development and 33 projects in operation or construction across North America.

The Senior Asset Management Analyst supports the Company's management of Ontario battery energy storage systems, focusing on data analytics, financial analysis, ISO regulations, and customer support. They are responsible for the day-to-day operations of the energy storage portfolio. Aypa is a growing and dynamic Company seeking experienced candidates to bring best practices to the position. Excellent communication skills are crucial, as the Senior Asset Management Analyst will work closely with our customers to build positive relationships and promptly respond to inquiries. The role is well-suited for engineering, economics, environmental science, or data analytics professionals interested in the renewable energy industry. The position offers a dynamic and exciting environment for detail-oriented individuals with a strategic mindset capable of addressing risks and opportunities.

Responsibilities:

Lead the data analytics strategy to determine asset optimization and energy arbitrage opportunities.
Create quantitative analysis and run advanced pricing and economic models (Excel/Python) to assess energy storage projects under various market conditions.
Day-to-day operational support of Aypa Powers Ontario BESS fleet.
Reporting  monitor and track asset performance and energy market reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Document internal processes and suggest improvements to support Capacity Auction and Operating Reserve market rules.
Liaise with customers to build and preserve positive relationships and maintain required ICI registration.
Collect asset-specific information and interface with the IESO to enable participation in the Capacity Auction and Operating Reserve markets and ensure assets are kept in good standing.
Support the Capacity Auction process from enrolling capacity auction participants to submitting offers into the auction, registering contributors to resources that have been awarded capacity, and submitting bids into the energy market.
Responding to IESO Capacity Auction Audits.
Participating in other IESO or utility-related programs.
Work with the operations, maintenance, and engineering teams to understand and help resolve operational issues that affect financial performance.
Support the Ontario team in maintaining compliance and ensuring payments relating to the operations of the BESS projects.
Maintain relationships and correspondence with clients and third parties regarding metering, billing, and settlements.
Coordinate with the accounting and treasury teams to ensure project invoices and other payments are approved and processed on time.
Support with internal or external reporting responsibilities.
Other duties as assigned or required.

Key Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in engineering, mathematics, computer science, economics, or other quantitative disciplines is strongly preferred. However, consideration will be given to candidates with less quantitative educational backgrounds who can demonstrate significant data analysis and Excel modeling skills.
A minimum of two to three (2-3) years of experience in renewable energy and/or energy storage development, design, construction, behind-the-meter generation /energy storage, and/or operations/asset management would be considered an asset.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.
Outstanding writing and technical communication skills.
Experience with financial or other Excel modeling would be considered an asset.
Familiarity with commercial and industrial facilities and their operations would be considered an asset.
Experience with IESO or other North American energy markets would be a strong asset.
Experience using programming languages like R or Python to perform statistical analyses would be considered an asset.
Experience with MySQL, Matlab, or MS BI would be considered an asset.

Compensation and Location:

Salary: A base salary commensurate with experience.
Bonus: An annual bonus will be awarded based on both individual performance as well as the overall success of the business.
Benefits: Aypa offers an attractive benefits package with Aypa offers an attractive benefits package with RRSP matching, unlimited vacation, and other health/wellness benefits.
Location: The ability to work in Canada is a requirement. Preference for Toronto, ON, but the workplace location is flexible, provided the candidate can travel as required.

At Aypa, we nurture and support a highly diverse team and actively seek to advance fair and inclusive practices in all aspects of what we do. We hire passionate, dedicated, and forward-thinking individuals from different backgrounds and value unique perspectives and experiences. With a focus on belonging, we are committed to providing an inclusive environment for all.

Your primary responsibilities will include data integration with internal information systems, third-party data providers, and other platforms to build a robust data pipeline encompassing various data types such as sales, marketing, and demographic data. Proficiency in Python for automation, data processing, and data analysis, as well as experience with Data Visualization BI Tools like Tableau or Power BI, will be essential assets in this role. Additionally, you should be able to evaluate current processes and suggest any appropriate improvements to increase efficiency, reduce loss, and enhance the customer experience, collaborating with Client Relations manager, eCommerce Operations, and eCommerce Sales Planning team.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Data Management
Develop and maintain data pipelines, ETL processes, and data integrations using Microsoft SQL Server (SSIS).
Perform database administration tasks, including monitoring, optimizing, and ensuring data integrity within the Microsoft SQL Server environment.
Create and optimize data models to facilitate efficient data retrieval and analysis.
Integrate data from internal systems, third-party data providers, and other platforms to build a comprehensive data pipeline.
Process and transform data using Python to automate tasks and data pipeline.
Ensure data quality and consistency through data profiling, cleansing, and validation techniques
Data Analytics
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights to drive business decisions.
Use Google Analytics 360 (GA360) to track and analyze website traffic, conversion rates, user behavior, and other key metrics. Ability to set up custom reports, create segments, and implement advanced features like Enhanced Ecommerce tracking.
Use Adobe Marketing Cloud: Adobe Analytics to measure and optimize marketing campaigns, track customer journeys, and analyze user behavior. Familiarity with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) for content management and Adobe Target for A/B testing and personalization.
Use Python to perform data consolidation, explorative analysis and generate insights
Data Visualization
Use Data Visualization BI Tools like Tableau or Power BI to develop visually appealing and interactive dashboards and reports
Design reports/dashboard/charts to show trends in customer purchase and evaluate changes in the online retail market
Business Process and Project Management
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and design scalable data solutions that support business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop reporting mechanisms to track and measure them, providing the deep analysis of data and then determining the best way to represent it visually to managers and stakeholders.
Document data integration processes, data models, and system configurations.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in business intelligence, data engineering, and ecommerce to drive innovation and process improvements
KNOWLDEGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Developer or similar role, preferably in the ecommerce industry.
2+ years experience with data engineering principles and data integration techniques across various systems and platforms.
2+ year experience with Python for automation, data processing, and data analysis tasks.
2+ year experience with Data Visualization BI Tools like Tableau or Power BI to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft SQL Server, including database administration, T-SQL, ETL (SSIS), and data modeling.
Understanding of eCommerce KPIs, sales funnels, and customer journey mapping.
Experience with A/B testing and experimentation methodologies to optimize website performance and user experience.
Microsoft SQL Server related certificate or other equivalent data management related certificates is an asset.
Knowledge of data privacy and security regulations, especially regarding customer data in the eCommerce industry.
Awareness of emerging trends and technologies in eCommerce, digital marketing, and data analytics.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong organizational and time management skills to meet project deadlines.

Purpose of Job

The AML/ATF department within Compliance is responsible for managing the Banks AML/ATF risk through implementing and monitoring effective controls. The Senior Data Analyst role is a multi-faceted one. Responsibilities may include ensuring our organization's adherence to regulatory standards through advanced data analysis, modelling, mining, and automation techniques. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to provide valuable insights, drive process efficiencies, and contribute to enhancing our compliance strategies. The environment is often fast-paced and requires effective time management of multiple tasks and projects.
The Work!
Rule Implementation, Testing, Validation and Documentation: Develop and maintain advanced data rules that help identify suspicious activities and patterns related to money laundering. Create predictive rules that enhance risk assessment and detection capabilities. Conduct rigorous testing and validation of rules to ensure accuracy and reliability. Create and maintain detailed documentation for all rules, including data sources, methodologies, assumptions, and rule parameters.
Tools Development: Create and enhance tools, scripts, and applications to facilitate data analysis, reporting, and compliance monitoring. Develop user-friendly interfaces and solutions to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Automation: Design, implement, and maintain automated workflows and data pipelines for efficient data collection, processing, analysis, and quality control checks. Implement automation solutions to streamline AML compliance procedures.
Reporting: Generate comprehensive reports and dashboards to communicate findings, trends, and compliance-related insights to stakeholders. Develop visualizations that effectively convey complex data in a clear and actionable manner.
Job Complexities & Thinking Challenges!
The position requires the incumbent to be a self-starter and make sound decisions as efficiently as possible to ensure that data models are developed and implemented as per the Banks internal policies and regulatory requirements.
Ability to work independently and perform under pressure and within tight time constraints.
The incumbent must have a solid understanding of the internal Bank systems, strong attention to detail and record management skills.
Effectively manage assigned responsibilities and communication with the Business Units.
Accountability!
Responsible for internal tools development and analytics to support model development and implementation in a timely manner.
Responsible for analysis, documentation, development, operationalization, and integration of AML data models.
Maintain a current understanding of money laundering and terrorist financing issues, including policies, procedures, regulations, industry best practices, criminal typologies and developing trends to provide support and direction to business units.
Let's talk about you!
Bachelors degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
4+ years of proven industry experience as a Data Analyst, focusing on AML compliance or the financial services industry preferred.
3+ years of extensive experience in SQLs, NoSQLs, or MongoDB
Strong expertise in data modelling, data mining, and statistical analysis techniques.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools such as Python, SQL and data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Preferred experience with Microsoft Power Platform applications (Power App, Power Automate, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and implementing automation solutions using programming/scripting languages.
Preferred knowledge of AML regulations, financial crime risk assessment, and compliance procedures.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Preferred experience with machine learning techniques and tools
Strong communication skills, including presenting technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented and self-motivated individual who can work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical thinking and decision-making abilities
High proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office applications (i.e., Advanced Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word).
