Job Description:
n! biomachines (formerly The Cultivated B Canada based in Burlington is focused on the development and production of bioreactors and advanced machinery for cellular agriculture and precision fermentation. Our integrated Research and Development center within the same facility is an Ontario hub for innovation in bioprocess design and optimization, plant-based engineering, food technology and scaled alternative protein production.

We are a subsidiary of The Cultivated B. GmbH in Germany which is focused on scalable alternative protein production and cellular agriculture technologies.

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Business Development Manager who is primarily responsible for building key customer relationships with new and existing clients. The Business Development Manager will work with staff from various departments to increase sales opportunities and maximize revenue. This role will manage existing clients to ensure ongoing satisfaction and retain business; and will strategize to ensure continual opportunities for business growth.

Duties
Liaise with senior management in order to determine organizational strategy and initiatives
Consult with and present to senior management on business trends in order to develop new services, products, and distribution channels
Ensure cross functional development of company(s) growth path and story (in alignment with management, finance, and legal functions)
Produce scenario based business case calculations for the global group of companies
Regularly analyze and calculate existing and future business and growth plans
Conduct quantitative and qualitative market, stakeholder and competitor analysis including but not limited to balance sheet and Profit & Loss analysis
Use knowledge of the market and competitors to identify and develop the companys unique selling propositions and differentiators
Conduct scenario-based go-to-market & market entry analysis
Prepare management reporting and reporting for board meetings including ad hoc reporting to the CxOs and investor reports
Calculate and forecast financial top and bottom line KPIs (revenue, GMV, GP, EBIT/EBITDA, etc.)
International collaboration with German Headquarters (within different time zones)
BA/Masters in economics/business, marketing, mathematics, or related field
5+ years of relevant job experience with a proven understanding of the industry and area of service
Working experience in engineering, biotechnology, or food industry an asset
Proven track record in business case modelling and financial forecasting
Knowledge of relevant data sources, vendors, and tools for business analysis (Pitchbook, Vertical IQ, Gardner, Bloomberg, Reuters, Capital IQ, Refinitiv, etc)
A self-starter with excellent organizational, strategic, planning, and implementation skills
High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and reasoning to identify underlying principles, reasons, and facts
Excellent attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and relationship management skills
A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills
Ability to respond appropriately in high-pressure situations with a calm and steady demeanor
Ability to create realistic schedules and meet deadlines under stress and interruptions
High level of integrity, confidentially, and accountability
Proficient in English, both written and verbal

Full-time employment

Career development opportunities

Description
Deliver business analysis work packages on concurrent projects to ensure project deliverables meet requirements, including:
 Lead and conduct business analysis in order to assess and prioritize clients business problems/opportunities and document the business requirements in such a way that technology solutions can be delivered iteratively.
 Apply data mining and data scripting techniques to enable data analysis and reporting solutions that are appropriate for business problem solving.
 Apply process re-engineering concepts to promote business improvements through evidence-focused and cost-effective service delivery approaches.
 Work across system development teams to coordinate and document data interface use cases, data standards, and ETL specifications.
 Conduct business modeling; use case modeling; conceptual and logical data modeling; process and data flow modeling; use case surveys; business rules definition and non-functional requirements definitions for assigned projects.
 Lead and conduct business analysis at varying levels of detail, appropriate to the project phase and/or release plan, aligning with agile methodologies as well as the OPS Unified Project Management Methodology, Enterprise Architecture and Gating Process.
Performance measures:
 Develop performance measures for business analysis evaluation and conducts follow-up as required.
 Support QA activities
New client requests:
 Lead analysis of new client requests and support the forming of emerging priorities, including
 Lead and conduct business analysis to understand and capture requirements
 Develop strategies, prepares business cases and cost-benefit analysis, and conducts feasibility studies for business I&IT initiatives.
Support the units efforts to improve BA maturity.
BA strategy:
 Develop strategies, prepares business cases and cost-benefit analysis, and conducts feasibility studies for business I&IT initiatives.
 Support the units efforts to improve BA maturity.

Business Analysis Skills - 35%

 Experience with gathering data requirements and writing report specifications

 Experience in working with large scale, complex IT projects delivering mission critical IT solutions, including desktop applications, web/mobile applications, telephony, radio, etc.
 Demonstrated experience in bridging the business/IT communication gap to successfully deliver on IT implementations
 Demonstrated experience in working closely with QA teams to ensure the IT product can meet business needs
 Demonstrated experience with enterprise architecture and gating process
 Experience working on concurrent projects
Analytical and Communication Skills - 20%

 Experience in capturing, and analyzing complex and sometimes competing business requirements to develop a set of technical recommendations
 Experience in capturing and translating complex business processes and procedures into technology workflows, features and configurations
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal and negotiation skills
Public Safety Experience - 10%
 Experience with data related projects (Data analytics, ETL, Data Visualization, Business Intelligence)
 Experience developing and implementing dashboard projects.

 Experience with telephony and radio technologies such as IP based telephony, Avaya, P25

At Secure Digital Markets (SDM), you can build a career in a fast-paced and pioneering industry! Secure Digital Markets is a digital asset brokerage, offering robust liquidity solutions that enable our clients to maximize their portfolio and participate in digital currency markets with greater sophistication. This is an exciting time to join our growing team.

What We Offer

We have an exciting opportunity for a B2B Marketing Specialist to join our team! The specialist will become part of Secure Digital Markets Marketing & Sales Teams and help develop and support the marketing and sales team initiatives.

This role is best suited for someone who has B2B marketing experience, with a particular focus in Web3/Financial services. The successful candidate in this role will have a data-driven approach to marketing, and has a comprehensive background in lead-generation via marketing, SEO, and E-mail Marketing.

While were ideally looking for someone who is passionate and knowledgeable about crypto, but if you believe you are a great match for the rest of what were looking for, wed love to have a chat!

Responsibilities & Expectations
Based out of our Downtown Toronto office, you will have direct contact with all team members at the firm to help us propel our social media strategy forward, and have the opportunity to take ownership, develop and innovate many of the processes within the marketing team of SDM.

Key Responsibilities:
Search Engine Optimization (SEO):
Conduct keyword research and analysis to optimize website content and improve organic search rankings.
Monitor and analyze website performance using SEO tools and make data-driven recommendations to enhance visibility and user experience.
Implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to increase organic traffic and drive lead generation.
Email Marketing:
Develop and execute email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, drive engagement, and convert prospects into customers.
Analyze email performance metrics, such as open rates, click-through rates, and conversions, to optimize campaigns and deliver targeted content.
Segment email lists and tailor content to align with lead generation goals, ensuring the right message reaches the right audience.
Lead Generation and Prospecting:
Identify and target potential B2B clients within the cryptocurrency and finance space.
Implement new lead generation strategies to acquire new leads and qualify prospects through various marketing channels.
Collaborate with the sales team to ensure seamless lead handoff and develop a lead nurturing strategy to move prospects through the sales funnel.
Marketing Analytics:
Utilize marketing analytics tools to track and measure the performance of marketing campaigns, providing valuable insights and actionable recommendations to improve ROI and drive strategic decision-making.
Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) related to lead generation, regularly reporting on progress and suggesting adjustments based on data analysis.
Collaboration and Reporting:

About Secure Digital Markets

Secure Digital Markets bridges the gap between institutional capital and digital assets by providing flexible and curated liquidity solutions to our customers.

Catering to institutional money looking for a way into the digital asset space, we understand your business and provide custom solutions to fit it.

Whether youre an institution, trader, family office, exchange, fund, or mining group, we can provide you with everything from auto-liquidation to a direct feed of liquidity right to your API.
SDM is one of the first electronic, off-exchange digital asset liquidity providers in North America, operates through an electronic communication network (ECN), and offers deep liquidity to its clients with around-the-clock service.

Why Secure Digital Markets (SDM) ?

The number one quality we value is teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting long term career possibilities are available for the driven energetic team member that joins our team.

Joining SDM today means joining a team of ambitious and caring individuals. Become a key part of our growth by applying today.

As Senior Analyst - Digital Analytics, you will drive cross business customer retention, acquisition, and engagement by using your knowledge in advanced analytics to develop statistical analysis, derive actionable insights and deliver accurate reporting from customer data. Youll work collaboratively, leveraging your experience in product analytics, lifecycle marketing, and business process to deliver the high-impact customer insights and recommendations that will grow our business. You will also get the opportunity to build and own growth analytics data products and models. If you thrive at the intersection of data and product, and are passionate about customers, this is the place for you.

**Please note, this role is Hybrid - 3 days in office and 2 days remote**
What You'll Do
Support the strategy, development, execution, and measurement of data-driven marketing campaigns, personalization initiatives and product launches in multiple digital channels across a variety of businesses.
Leverage a diverse set of technical tools to derive deep and actionable insights from transactional, digital, and loyalty data to inform customer growth strategies.
Deep dive into customer data across a large number of owned & digital channels to support and drive growth product planning.
Scope, develop, and maintain analytical dashboards & reports that contain actionable metrics to monitor business performance and inform strategic decision-making.
Partner with external teams to help guide, develop, and build predictive models that contribute to customer growth strategy.
Forecast, track, and analyze experiment performance to maximize digital conversions and incremental opportunities.
Automate and scale processes to improve analytical throughput.
Be a part of an agile growth analytics team with regular sprint cycles and ceremonies.
Does This Sound Like You
Undergraduate degree in a technical discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, etc.) or related experience in a technical field
3+ years of hands-on experience in an analytical role and proven ability to work with relevant tools (SQL, Excel, BigQuery, Python/R, Snowplow/Omniture/GA etc.)
Ability to generate meaningful customer insights from large volumes of complex data.
Experience using data analysis and modeling to better understand customer mindsets using transactional and behavioural data sets.
Proven experience owning and/or contributing to advanced analytics projects and models (ex. attribution & propensity modeling, decision trees, segmentation, time series analysis etc.)
Comfortable building compelling dashboards with data visualization tools (Looker, Data Studio, PowerBI, Tableau or similar)
Previous experience working with digital analytics data to understand customer journey and derive actionable insights for business planning.
Hands-on experience with statistical analysis (Experimental Design, Hypothesis Testing, ANOVA, GLM, etc.)
Naturally curious, always looking for the why and not afraid to dive deep to get answers.
Effective communication skills, and collaborative mindset
Experience with automation of processes or working with data pipelines is an asset.
Experience in retail analytics (CRM (Customer Relationship Management), Loyalty, etc.) is an asset.
How youll succeed

At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. Were able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Data and Systems Analyst - Workforce Analytics

We are looking for a Data Analyst with a focus on technology and systems to join our Workforce Analytics team!

Why pursue this opportunity?
Apply an Analytical Lense - have the opportunity to digest data and take an analytical approach to determining insights and recommendations.

Rapidly Transforming Business - We are a medium-sized Canadian company in a stable industry which is rapidly transforming.

What youll be working on:
Responsible for designing, developing and implementing a data architecture aligned with business processes that standardizes data collection, storage, transformation, distribution and usage of data.

Develop data pipelines between multiple systems to centralize data and facilitate ongoing sustainable data analysis, reporting and visualizations.

Integrate technical functionality, ensuring data accessibility, accuracy and security
Understand and apply security and confidentiality parameters to data assets to ensure appropriate accessibility and shareability
Apply data quality measurements across the data architecture, and integrate quality levels into metric and report generation. Maintain solutions that strengthen our data quality, accuracy and data integrity.
Own the data dictionary for all workforce data, working closely with the Data Governance team to ensure accurate and consistent definition, collection and storage of relevant data
Lead process improvement initiatives to fix low quality data, including implementing appropriate controls to ensure data quality is maintained once heightened
Collaborate with stakeholders in other departments to identify business needs and convert them into data and system requirements. Lead/support the implementation of solutions including alignment with IT systems and management of the flow of data across the organization.
Stay up to date with analytics technologies and proactively optimize, and propose new solutions.
Design and analyze data to identify trends to uncover solutions and opportunities, communicate findings using visualizations and other means.

3+ years of proven understanding of data platforms, with a knowledge of the underlying data and systems architecture
3+ years of experience developing data pipelines, architectures and data models
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with proven ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Mix of skills developed via some combination of education & experience in:
Data Science/Analytics/Visualization,
Process Design & Systems Thinking,
Digital Development Programming,
Project Management,
Business Analytics,
or other related work or educational programs
Ability and willingness to learn new systems and platforms
Fast learning / clear critical thinking skills

Reporting into Director of Business Intelligence. This is a 100% permanently remote role with National travel on a quarterly basis. Acting as a main conduit between our Data Analysts and Operations teams working with both internal and external stakeholders.

Translating Data to Business Goals; Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, patterns, and insights relevant to business objectives.
Project Coordination; Communicate between technical and non technical teams. Supporting and developing KPI's, creating action steps, and reporting on performance evaluation working with leadership to drive changes.
Customer Facing; Creating and maintaining strong interpersonal relationships with external Clients. Assisting them in evaluating data, executing plans, and reporting on key metrics.
What you'll need to succeed:
3-5 years experience as an Analyst, Logistics specialist, or Project Coordinator.

Ability to adapt communication style acting as main liaison between highly technical and non-technical teams both internally and externally creating strong interpersonal relationships.
Solution oriented mindset with the ability to drive continuous improvement while demonstrating a sense of urgency and handling multiple priorities at once.

OVERVIEW:
From corrugated packaging, paper bags, retail displays, pre-print, supply and inventory management, paper mills and recycling, Atlantic is strategically positioned to provide customers with a total packaging solution.

THE OPPORTUNITY:
The Senior Business Analyst, is an integral team member of Atlantics Transformation Management Office responsible for leveraging technology to revolutionize our core capabilities to maximize business outcomes. This role will join a growing team that will contribute to the digital delivery portfolio within Atlantic. Our technology projects underpin Atlantics digital strategy, which is focused on systems, data, and automation.
As a Functional Lead, this role will be a lead and key facilitator within the project team and internal/external collaborators, leading business process development and automations, translating business needs to requirements, explaining technical concepts to non-technical users and acting as a bridge between the functional areas and the technical team.
Location: Scarborough, Ontario (currently hybrid)

What you will be doing:
Act as the Functional lead on key IT transformation projects from conception to implementation.
Partner with Business Process Owners to lead business functional teams and project workstreams to ensure effective business transformation for all initiatives (roles, processes, organization) to drive the realization of identified business outcomes. Focus on process adoption, integration of new capabilities with ways of working, and drives associated systems usage. Ensure Business and IT is aware of key business changes and issues. Certify milestone and business outcomes accomplishments.
Form strong, trust-based relationships with assigned business and functional leaders to ensure involvement and engagement in business / functional planning.
Be involved and engaged proactively for consultation, challenge thinking, push back and escalate issues as needed, to be regarded as Business IT Go-To person and Business strategic partner.
Lead elicitation, analysis, validation, and documentation of business requirements and processes.
Translate business requirements into a conceptual system design (including but not limited to business requirements document, high-level use cases, prototypes/mockups).
Support the design, construction, and implementation phases by working closely with solution architects and/or 3rd. party systems integrators and reviewing design documents and ensuring requirements are met.
Lead QA and testing strategy, creation of test plans and test cases to ensure requirements are met, coordinating, and supporting business functional teams and project workstreams on testing initiatives, and reviewing defects and working with teams to determine the priority of fix and/or
manual work around.
Lead change management and transition of projects to business-as-usual activities.
Travel within North America will be required.

What you will be doing:
University Degree in Business, Information Technology, or related major.
Certification in Business Analysis (CBAP, PBA).
10+ years experience leading ERP and ancillary technology implementations, preferably in Manufacturing.
Experience in business analysis, including elicitation and management of business requirements.
Extensive experience in business analysis, and implementing business process modelling and improvement, data modelling, prototyping, and systems integrations.
Experience working with different delivery methodologies (i.e., Waterfall, Agile, SAFE), with a focus on agile and iterative value creation in a customer-centricity environment.
Experience with CRM, ERP, MES, Supply Chain, and Financial Systems.
Experience with Enterprise Architecture and Data Governance would be an asset.
Ability to communicate fluently in French would be an asset.

Atlantic Packaging is dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment where all colleagues and customers feel valued and supported. We are committed to developing our team to reflect the diversity of our communities in which we live and work and seek applicants with a wide range of abilities. If you require accommodation, please contact HR@atlantic.ca

Senior Business Systems Analyst
Location: This is a hybrid position (3 days per week in office from 1 of our office locations below and 2 days remote).
Office Locations:
Burlington location @ 3215 North Service Road, Burlington, ON, L7N 3G2 (near hwy. 403 QEW and Guelph Line)
OR
North York location @ 243 Consumers Rd, North York, ON M2J 4W8 (near hwy. 404 and hwy. 401)
Starting April 2025, this role will be relocated to our Brampton location @ 1 Presidents Choice Cir, Brampton, ON L6Y 5S5 (near hwy. 407 and Mississauga Rd)

Summary:
Lifemark Health Group is seeking an enthusiastic Senior Business Systems Analyst to join our dynamic Application Services Team for a permanent full-time position. This position reports to the Business Systems Analyst Manager and works closely with the business stakeholders, external partners and internal IT team to identify business needs, define system requirements and implement solutions that align with the business strategic initiatives.
As a Senior Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for managing applications & projects using waterfall and agile delivery approaches to meet the business needs, expectations and ensure delivery of valuable products/features to the business.
In addition to possessing the technical training and knowledge to succeed with the identified Accountabilities, you will also be responsible for coordinating, implementing, and managing the development and maintenance of business applications that support and service the Lifemark Health Group.
About You
You are an individual with a blend of business analysis, project management and QA skills. You can tackle complex projects and help stakeholders to make informed decisions. You know how to get into the appropriate details to ensure clarity of requirements and reach consensus among stakeholders. You are able to formulate test plans to ensure that the right things has been developed in the right way. You can manage commitments and deadlines for large projects.
Your Key Accountabilities
Collaborate with support/technical staff, applications development, and the data owners/subject matter experts during various phases of project lifecycle
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with project team and stakeholders
Obtain and define estimates and level of effort
Source 3rd party software and analyze buy versus build options
Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path
Track project milestones and deliverables
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential risks, and develop contingency plans and gap analysis
Develop communications documents [Project Plan, Project status, Meetings Summary, Training guide, User Manuals etc.]
Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations such as System Approaches, Outline high-level flow, Release notes etc.
Facilitate workshops to gather requirements from various stakeholders and building consensus on requirements and process
Document requirements and conducting review sessions with stakeholders to validate requirements
Translate requirements into design specifications by creating wireframes, use cases and system requirements specifications
Conduct walk-through sessions with development team to review requirements, wireframes/screen mock-ups to ensure requirements are clearly communicated and understood prior to commencement of development activities
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Gather volume forecast information in order to identify and support infrastructure needs
Develop test plans, test cases and execute these to ensure system is functioning as expected
Conduct testing and support the user acceptance testing process to ensure requirements are met and all gaps are addressed prior to implementation
Document, track and manage all issues identified by stakeholders to ensure they are addressed and resolved
Ensure brand management compliance for all consumer facing technologies and electronic materials
Ensure compliance with security and privacy requirements (build and manage a remediation plan)
Collaborate on requirements documentation, planning and integration/implementation support with 3rd party vendors/customers/ consultants/service providers with whom our company may develop ongoing business relationships
Participate in RFP/RFQ activities with regards to technology-based service delivery or reporting
Actively research, evaluate and promote appropriate technology products, services, and improvements to drive enhanced marketing effectiveness, accelerate operational efficiencies, deliver client service excellence, and support solid financial management.
Your Tech Skills & Qualifications
A degree in Information Technology or related program
Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in systems development within the Information Technology capacity
Experience with system integrations
Experience in healthcare and insurance domain (an asset)
Strong Microsoft Office skills required (OUTLOOK, WORD, EXCEL, POWERPOINT)
Strong project management skills (Microsoft Project Online an asset)
Strong UML activity flow diagram skills (VISIO an asset)
Experience with work tracking systems, such as Azure DevOps (i.e. JIRA, Confluence) an asset
Your Soft Skills
Ability to build strong relationship with business units leaders, SMEs and IT Teams
Effectively communicate project expectations to team members in a timely and clear fashion
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills
Self-starter, quick learner with a positive, collaborative and team-base attitude
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills to guide and assist team members on issues related to the selection of software development, deployment and support of business applications.
Our Perks
You will be issued a company laptop, headset and a home office monitor, keyboard and mouse.
Have access to a yearly education re-imbursement fund
Shopper Drug Mart discount
Contribute to an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) with employer matching percentage
Have paid vacation days as well as wellness days
Have a choice to enroll in our Health & Dental Flex Life Benefits (or in lieu contribute to your RRSPs)
Access to employee assistance program
Who We Are
Lifemark Health Group is a market leader in customized healthcare solutions. As one of the largest and most comprehensive providers in Canada, we continue to grow exponentially. With that growth, is a vision to be the most innovative healthcare providers in community rehabilitation, workplace health and wellness and medical assessment services. Lifemark was acquired by Loblaw Companies on May 10, 2022.
Lifemark welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Lifemark promotes equal employment opportunities for all job applicants, including those self-identifying as a member of the following groups: Indigenous peoples, Newcomers to Canada, and Visible minorities.
Please take some time to visit our corporate site at www.lifemarkhealthgroup.ca
Benefits:
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Life insurance
Paid vacation

Project Leadership and Strategic Planning

Caseware is one of Canada's original Fintech companies, having led the global audit and accounting software industry for over 30 years, with more than 500,000 users across 130 countries and available in 16 different languages. While you might not have heard of us (yet) over 36,000 accounting and audit professionals list Caseware as a skill on their LinkedIn profiles!

As a key member of the Global Revenue Operations Team within Casewares Commercial organization, reporting to the Director, Global Revenue Operations, the Senior RevOps Analyst is responsible for driving data-driven decision-making processes across departments. This position involves analyzing large datasets, designing and implementing BI solutions, and providing actionable recommendations to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, proficiency in SQL and BI tools, and a track record of delivering impactful BI solutions. Join us to play a key role in empowering businesses with actionable insights.

Saurabh Sanganee - Director, RevOps

Mohsin Ejaz - Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

About Caseware

Caseware's cutting-edge software products are meticulously designed for accounting firms, corporations, and governments. Our teams are continually collaborating, innovating, and building upon our existing suite of products. With a customer-focused mindset, we are building technology that is shaping what the future of audits, financial reporting, and financial data analytics will look like.

About Us
The Ontario Cannabis Store provides safe, responsible access to recreational cannabis for adults 19 and older. We operate the provincial online store for recreational cannabis in Ontario and are the exclusive provincial wholesaler of authorized private retail stores.

Working at the OCS is a unique opportunity to be part of an agile start-up in a ground-breaking new industry. Were a diverse team passionate about delivering a great customer experience, working together with mutual respect and building value out of our differences. Were an inclusive organization that understands that delivering great results comes out of ensuring every voice is heard.

About the Role
Were looking for a Senior Business Transformation Analyst to join our Strategic Planning & Transformation team! The Senior Business Transformation Analyst is an advocate for change and plays a critical role in bridging the gap between the Business and IT.

As a Senior BTA, you will have a proven track record in defining, analyzing, and documenting user requirements, procedures, and challenges. You will work through uncertainty to effectively solve problems to develop new solutions and identify value propositions that address the needs of the business to drive growth and meet strategic priorities. You will also work in the ambiguous environments, while being able to see the bigger picture and identify dependencies across initiatives at any given time.

About Your Day

Conduct analysis of existing documentation
Document current processes through participation in and/or facilitate brainstorming sessions or workshops with stakeholders
Ideate and facilitate discussion to document the conceptual target state processes in order to address gaps and pain points identified in the current state
Perform research and conduct data gathering exercises to support options and recommendations
Collaborate cross functionally to develop options and recommendations to meet a business objective
Gather requirements and document detailed business requirements, use cases and user stories
Elicit, document, validate and prioritize functional and non-functional system requirements in collaboration with business clients, end users and project stakeholders
Collaborate with stakeholders cross functionally to develop a case for change taking into consideration people, process, technology
Develop high-level rough order of magnitude cost estimates for project execution
Ability to assess various option across a defined set of criteria
Monitor the business case and seek ways for value creation / optimization
Conduct presentations regarding assessment findings/recommendations, project status and current issues
Ensure projects are delivered on time, on budget and within quality targets
Support implementation on business process knowledge transfer
Ability to mentor and train junior analysts through methodology and approach
Creates a safe place for junior analysts to learn and grow
Motivates and inspires others to achieve results
Regards and recognizes great performance
About You
Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Commerce, Engineering, or related field
8+ years experience in a similar role
Proficient (or strong knowledge) of the Business Analysis and Business Architecture Frameworks, Change Management Principles, and Project Management
Experience in writing use cases and business requirements documents
Experience developing processes flows using BPMN 2.0 Standards
Experience in management consulting and business transformation is an asset
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CPAB) is preferred
LucidChart experience is an asset
Analytical, facilitation and writing skills
Excellent communication and client presentation skills
Goal orientation and ability to work independently
Strong leadership and collaborative skills

Job Description:
Company Description

Work with Us. Change the World.
At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Job Description

AECOM is seeking a Recruiting Management System Support Analyst to assist in the support and maintenance of Recruiting and Talent applications and their interfaces across AECOM. Coordinating with AECOM business stakeholders and 3rd party resources (including vendor and outsourced teams), and working under the Application Support Senior Manager, this position will assist in support tasks and activities required for business as usual operations. In addition, this position will assist with requirements gathering, solutions design, configuration, development, and testing for AECOMs Recruiting and Applicant Tracking System, all interfaces, and related integrations.
This will be a remote / virtual position that can be based from a variety of locations in the US or Canada.
Primary Responsibilities
Serve as a go-to systems analyst (SME) for business partners across our global operations for SmartRecruiters Recruiting Management system and its integrations with Workday HCM.
Analyze business requirements and functional change requests, negotiate priorities and timeframes.
Identify omissions and errors in requirements and recommend optimum approach or alternative solutions.
Identify and evaluate the impact of proposed or requested changes.
Present information on technically complex subjects in an easily understandable manner to all audience levels.
Prepare various testing documentation (unit testing, user acceptance, etc.); perform testing on systems configuration, development, and integration changes.
Ensure business acceptance / sign offs are obtained and documented.
Develop and document training materials, coordinate training or knowledge transfer sessions.
Proactively monitor systems interfaces and integrations, identify issues, identify and action resolution.
Develop and perform system change audits; identify and ensure corrective actions are made.
Maintain system related requirements and technical documentation.
Monitor and assist with impact analysis with up/down stream systems.
Identify, recommend, and track opportunities for process and operational improvements.
Keep current with the latest versions of applications development software, techniques, and practices.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:
BA/BS plus at least 4 years of relevant Talent Management or Applicant Tracking System experience with at least 2 of those years in an application support role or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education.
Extensive hands-on experience in configuring SaaS applications.
Experience in supporting system interfaces including ETL and integrations.
Experience designing and documenting business process workflows, business requirements documents, and test cases.
Knowledge and demonstrated use of the principles, practices, and techniques used in information technology design and development.
Ability to work autonomously under broad supervision is a must.
Highly analytical with ability to ask further investigating questions.
Strong data analysis skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Human Resources, Management Information Systems, or IT related fields.
Experience with SmartRecruiters, or similar applicant tracking or recruiting management systems
Experience with Workday HCM preferred.
Strong understanding of recruiting management processes, the modern HR environment, and its challenges.
Ability to troubleshoot hardware and software problems.
Experience in implementing and managing data cleansing and migration projects.
Experience in working across large projects or directly managing small to medium projects.
Knowledge and experience with common programming languages.
Ability to succinctly paraphrase and articulate complex issues.
Experience supporting global organizations with multiple business groups requiring foreign country localizations.
Self-motivating with ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities.

Additional Information
Relocation assistance is not available for this position.
Sponsorship for relevant country work authorization is not available, now or in the future.
Offered rate of compensation will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The salary range for this position typically is $65,000 - -$100,000. Please note that this role can be based anywhere in Canada and compensation data will vary in each location.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion  a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. Were the worlds trusted global infrastructure firm, and were in this together  your growth and success are ours too.

Who We Are
SWTCH is pioneering EV charging solutions for multifamily and commercial properties across North America.
Founded in 2016 by entrepreneurs, investors, and energy professionals, SWTCH had a vision of enabling communities to realize the social, economic, and environmental benefits of widespread EV adoption. Since then, its EV charging and energy management solutions have been installed in hundreds of multifamily buildings, 50 percent of which are classified as low-to-moderate income. By leveraging the latest technology available, SWTCH is making EV charging possible for all buildings.
With a growing base of clients, SWTCH is currently looking for opportunities to deepen our market penetration across North America.
Job Opportunity
SWTCH is seeking a highly analytical, detail-oriented, and dynamic individual to join our team as a Business Operations Analyst. Reporting to the Head of Operations, and working closely with leaders across the operations function, you will play a key role in supporting the Head of Operations in strategic initiatives, providing actionable insights to drive decision-making, and analyzing and optimizing operational processes. The ideal candidate will possess strong problem-solving skills, strong analytical skills, exceptional communication abilities, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities
Help develop and implement strategic initiatives to drive operational excellence and support business growth.
Analyze business processes and systems, and conduct data analysis using Excel, SQL and other tools data to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations.
Prepare presentations and reports to communicate findings, recommendations, and initiative updates to stakeholders.
Manage operational improvements by collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement improvements, and evaluating the effectiveness of implemented changes, adjusting as needed to achieve desired outcomes.
Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the effectiveness of business operations.
Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion and professionalism.
Support ad-hoc analysis and special projects as needed.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Engineering, or related field.
2+ years of experience in business analysis, operations, or consulting roles.
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, SQL, and data visualization.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels and across functions.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.
Experience in an EV charging/SaaS/software environment.
Passion for EV space, decarbonizing transportation, cleantech/sustainability.
Benefits
Business Impact - As a core member of the operations team, you have the opportunity to take a lead role and make a significant impact on the culture and values of the company.
Environmental Impact - We are a clean energy company with a mission to reduce carbon emissions globally to ensure a clean and sustainable future.
Diversity - People develop their talents and skills in different ways. We value different paths and experiences. If you think you meet the qualifications we are seeking, take a chance and express.

Boralex is a major player in renewable energy specializing in four sectors of activity: wind, solar, hydroelectricity, and storage.

We have been based in Kingsey Falls, Quebec, Canada, for 30 years and have since expanded our horizons and established our business in the United States, France, and the United Kingdom.

OUR PURPOSE

On our planet where electricity is central to fighting climate change, we have a responsibility to produce it sustainably for future generations.

OUR MISSION

At Boralex, we provide renewable and affordable energy for all, creating value to share with our partners.

OUR VISION

To achieve our missions, we rely on the best of our strengths.

Thanks to our fearlessness, our discipline, our expertise, and our diversity, we continue to be an industry leader.

And we do it with pleasure.

YOUR PROFILE
You take pride in your attention to detail, your intellectual rigour and diligence, and your interest in questioning established opinions and in finding areas for improvements and optimization. You are comfortable with searching information, analysing, and summarizing data, making presentations and presenting your observations and recommendations. You can work on several projects at once, and you would like to work for a major player in renewable energy with strong human values.
YOUR CHALLENGE
Reporting to the Director, Procurement, North America you will support Boralexs procurement of key equipment (e.g., wind turbines, solar modules, invertors, batteries) and services (e.g., engineering, contractors) required in support of the execution of Boralex renewable energy and storage projects. In particular, you will manage and analyze commercial and technical information in order to assure implementation of the best practices in supply chain management and RES projects execution.
Working closely with various groups within Boralex, you are someone who stands out for your analytical and synthetical thinking, and great presentation skills. As part of Boralex' procurement activities, you will have the following responsibilities:
Evaluate and report on commercial and technological industry trends.
Identify and quantify supply chain constraints, risks and opportunities.
Participate in conducting due diligence reviews of current and potential suppliers.
Participate in preparation and management of RFPs in line with Boralex standards.
Together with procurement managers conduct deep analysis of vendors proposals, assuring the accurate comparison of final cost of ownership.
Perform sensitivity analysis, identify risks and opportunities, make recommendation to the procurement managers.
Track key indices, aggregate different forecasts and support to provide recommendation for CAPEX and OPEX assumptions.
Analyze key markets regulation and track changes.
Organize and maintain Boralexs information library of equipment and contacts.
Prepare presentations and reports to management.
Other duties and assignments needed for the procurement function efficient performance.
NB This position may include occasional travel in North America and abroad. Candidates with location close to one of the Boralex offices in North America (Montreal, Toronto, New York) will get preference.
YOUR SKILLS
Bachelors degree in finance. Additional degree in engineering, business administration or equivalent is an asset.
More than five years of relevant experience
Experience at least in one of the following: investment banking. consultant companies, audit companies, strategic or commercial departments of large OEMs, electric power industry, preferably with renewable and/or storage projects.
Experience in searching, analyzing, synthesizing, and evaluating information and data.
Strong experience working with Excel spreadsheets and database applications.
Bilingualism (French and English) is an asset.
Intellectual rigour, diligence, teamwork, and proactivity are all highly valued.
AT BORALEX WE OFFER

Boralex fosters a culture of sustainable performance in its day-to-day activities.

We are committed to operating in a manner that is consistent with our business objectives. We are taking action for growth and long-term profitability by making our stakeholders satisfaction a priority. Therefore, continuous improvement is at the core of our practices and drives us to set clear, ambitious and quantifiable goals.

Our strength lies in our teams synergy and diversity. Through autonomy, trial and error and our collaborators empowerment, our teams embody a culture of sustainable performance. Our human relationships are based on transparency, inclusion and caring. That work environment enables us to enjoy working together every day. Each and every day, we make sure everyone can grow and contribute to Boralexs mission.

Contribute to the growth of a company thats actively involved in energy transition.
Add your talent to an agile work team.
Expand your knowledge through continuous learning.
Keep fit with a membership allowance at a sports centre of your choice.Spend more time with your family thanks to a flexible and independent schedule.
Plan your life beyond your career thanks to a pension plan to which Boralex contributes.
Boralex, beyond renewable energy! Be the source of our energy!

Your Impact
Reporting to the Manager, Program Accounting, the Program Accounting Analyst is accountable for analyzing project expenditures from activation to completion. This will include working with multiple stakeholders to analyze actuals, and provide meaningful insights, ensuring compliance with OCIs use of funds policies. In addition, the Program Accounting Analyst will be responsible for other functions including account reconciliations, analysis, process improvements and regular interaction with internal and external stakeholders, providing intelligent information and data to support informed decision making.

Your Contribution
Analyze and review incoming project expenditure claim requests for accuracy before payment is made.
Review submitted budgets and ensures compliance with eligible OCI expenses guidelines.
Analyze program commitments and expenditures.
Participate in pre-close and post-close analysis and provide meaningful insight to activity, trends, unusual and significant transactions
Ensure revenue is recognized in accordance with GAAP; expenses (including accruals) are accurately recorded and complete; and reconciliations are properly prepared and supported
Analyze complex financial data sets, translating them into clear and easy to understand reports for stakeholders.
Respond to all project related financials inquiries from internal and external contacts.
Generate and analyze project related reports to enhance decision making.
Monitor process workflow and assist colleagues as needed to balance workload.
Regularly analyze and review operational and financial processes to identify areas for improvement and efficiency.
Assists the Director, Program Accounting with the preparation of audit binders.
Collaborate with various operational functions and provide backup support; assist with other projects and duties as required.
Track and reconcile project actual expenditure reported in Management Information System (MIS) with NetSuite.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Your Attributes
Minimum level of education required is formal post-secondary education in finance or accounting, preferably a University degree.
Working towards an accounting designation.
Minimum 5 years of related experience in financial accounting, data analysis, financial reporting and compliance.
Excellent analytical skills and general understanding of accounting concepts.
Strong attention to detail is a must with demonstrated ability to perform tasks accurately and in a timely manner.
Strong customer service skills required with the ability to resolve discrepancies in a professional and respectful manner.
Knowledge of NetSuite or similar ERP systems.
Strong capabilities with Microsoft Office including Excel, Word and Outlook and Powerpoint.
Demonstrated team player with the ability to work collaboratively within functional team, and across departments.
Ability to work independently to complete tasks within given deadlines.
Occasional overtime as required with occasional events to attend outside of normal business hours.

OCI is committed to creating a diverse and equitable environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About Introhive
Introhive is an AI-powered SaaS platform designed to help organizations realize the full value of their relationships and underutilized data across their business to increase revenues, employee productivity and to improve customer experience management.

Weve grown a lot since we began our journey in 2012, but our core mission remains the same  help B2B organizations capture and deliver Customer Intelligence to teams, when and where it matters most to find, win, and grow more business.

Introhive is the fastest growing B2B customer intelligence platform, recognized as a category leader in sales intelligence and data quality management software by G2 Crowd, a top 10 fastest growing technology company in Deloittes Fast 50 Awards three years in a row, and the MarTech 2020 Breakthrough Award winner for Best CRM Innovation.

Leading brands in Technology, Commercial Real Estate, Financial Services, Accounting, Legal and Consulting trust Introhive for sales enablement and relationship intelligence.

The Opportunity

As the HRIS & Total Rewards Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our HR Technology platforms and ensuring the effective design and implementation of our total rewards program. You will collaborate closely with HR leadership and cross-functional teams to streamline processes, analyze data, and enhance the employee experience.

Responsibilities
Manage and administer our HRIS platform, ensuring data accuracy, system integrity, and compliance with regulatory and payroll requirements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance HRIS functionality, streamline processes, and drive efficiency in HR operations.
Lead the design, implementation, and administration of total rewards programs, including compensation, benefits, and recognition initiatives.
Conduct regular audits and analyses to assess the effectiveness and competitiveness of our total rewards offerings, making recommendations for improvements as needed.
Serve as a subject matter expert on HR technology trends and best practices, providing guidance and support to HR stakeholders.
Partner with HR leadership to develop and deliver insightful analytics and reports to inform strategic decision-making related to total rewards and HRIS initiatives.
Support the annual compensation planning cycle, including merit increases, bonus payouts, and salary benchmarking activities.
Participate in cross-functional projects and initiatives as assigned, contributing expertise and insights to support the achievement of HR and organizational objectives.
Stay current on industry trends, best practices, and legislative changes related to compensation and benefits, and proactively recommend adjustments or enhancements to programs as needed.
Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and company policies related to compensation and benefits administration.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; advanced certification (e.g., Certified Compensation Professional, Certified Employee Benefits Specialist) preferred.
6 to 8 years of experience in HRIS administration, preferably with expertise in platforms such as BambooHR, UKG Ultipro, Workday, or similar systems.
Experience in SaaS is an asset.
Experience with transformation and scaling companies is highly desirable.
Proven experience in total rewards administration, including compensation, benefits, and recognition programs, with knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and compliance requirements in both Canada and the US.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and data integrity.
Ability to thrive in a fast-change, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.

Why Introhive?
We are one TEAM! We attract the best and brightest, and we empower them. We value each other and do what it takes to make each other successful. We treat our customers and partners the same way. We embrace the power of unity, diversity, and collaboration in all that we do.

Job Description:
Company Description

Work smart, have fun and make an impact!
Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world.
EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology.
We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.
Why apply to EcoVadis? Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people.
Feel valued for your contribution.Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page. If you have questions about the company or open roles you can chat with an insider.


Job Description

The marketing operations team drives and delivers operational excellence, digital strategy, process design, execution, and martech support for the marketing team. This team leverages marketing and web technologies to enhance customer experiences, nurture the demand funnel, and drive tangible business results.
As a strategic operations team member, you will be responsible for supporting operational excellence and performance evaluation of digital marketing initiatives including SEO, website user journey, integrated campaigns, and lead quality.
The ideal candidate is passionate about analytics and performance insights for digital marketing functions. The Senior Marketing Operations Analyst role is crucial to the companys success during our hypergrowth and due to increasing brand awareness.
As an important member of the EcoVadis marketing team, you will work collaboratively and cross-functionally to evaluate the performance of EcoVadis digital marketing strategies and to recommend opportunities for innovation and optimization.
The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial startup environment. You are a data-driven marketing leader with a passion for martech tools, analytics and operational excellence
Responsibilities will include:
Perform demand and lead generation modeling to determine the most effective and successful integrated campaign strategies from the perspective of channels, personas, account-based marketing (ABM), retargeting and nurture campaigns.
Plan annual digital ads budgets based upon pipeline targets
Evaluate and execute SEO best practices for web, content, and ads with keyword analysis
Utilize EcoVadis data tools for analytics and insights
Perform market research, maintaining an awareness of industry trends
Experiment with new marketing channels and technologies
Manage marketing operations projects with diverse teams across the organization from project initiation to completion, working closely with multiple stakeholders
Be a role model of EcoVadis Core Values, and coach and encourage others to model these values
Embody an attitude of ownership and collaboration while delivering results

Qualifications
Have 3 to 5 years of experience developing and executing on digital marketing tactics in a B2B enterprise environment
Are reporting- and metrics-driven with demonstrated knowledge of testing and measurement to analyze ROI and evolve the strategy
Have the ability to generate reports and translate data into actionable insights
Have project management experience
Utilize strong interpersonal and influencing skills and have keen attention to detail
Possess digital ads experience with Demandbase, Google & LinkedIn
Have demonstrable experience working with digital marketing tools, including marketing automation, lead scoring software, ABM, and other demand ops tools, such as :
HubSpot
Salesforce
Analytics tools like Looker studio, DataBricks, Tableau
Demandbase for ABM and advertising
CMS platforms (Uberflip, Wordpress or similar)
LinkedIn Campaign Manager
Google Ads (SEM, Display, Video)
Google Analytics
AHrefs
Google Tag Manager

Additional Information
Beginning: April 2024
Full-time position (After probation period)
Location: Toronto
In return for your expertise and energy, we offer:
Casual and very friendly work environment
Opportunity to work in a truly international atmosphere
Base salary + variable compensation plan
GRSP and TFSA matching program available
Health, Wellness, and Dental Benefits
Life Insurance, Critical Illness, Accidental death, long-term disability insurance
Flexi-time
Home office allowance program
Work from home & work from anywhere policy
Employee referral bonus policy
Paid employee volunteer day
Access to online learning library
Free virtual Yoga/Pilates
Virtual and in-person team building events
Don't fit all the criteria but still think youd be a good candidate? Please apply anyway to give our hiring team the opportunity to assess your skills and to learn more about what you could bring to EcoVadis. Were interested in hiring capable people, regardless of professional and educational background.
Can the hiring process be adjusted to suit my needs? Yes. We want everyone going through the hiring process with EcoVadis to feel confident that you are able to demonstrate your full potential. We welcome applications from disabled people, people with long-term health conditions, and neurodiverse candidates. If you need any adjustments, including the provision of interview questions, please let the hiring team know.
Our teams strength comes from everyones uniqueness and is founded upon mutual respect. EcoVadis commits to equity, inclusion and reducing bias in our hiring processes. EcoVadis does not accept any form of discrimination based on color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, beliefs, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, parental status, or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique. In your application, we encourage you to remove personal information such as: photographs, marital status, number of children, religion, gender, residential postal code, university graduation date, past medical or parental leave(s) taken, nationality (instead, please state if you are legally eligible to work in the job region/country), university name (instead, please state any degrees obtained and the study major).

Job Description:
Aviso Wealth:
At Aviso Wealth, we are dedicated to improving the financial well-being of Canadians. As a leading wealth management organization, we are committed to leadership, innovation, partnership, responsibility, and community. Working with talented and energetic professionals who exemplify our values every day, you will quickly notice that our people and dynamic oneaviso culture sets us apart. If you are looking for interesting and challenging work, at a company committed to its people, find out more about what Aviso Wealth has to offer at www.aviso.ca.
The Opportunity:
Were looking for a VP, Data Management & Business Intelligence to join our IT team.
Your role will be required to regularly perform essential duties on behalf of the company from your assigned Aviso office. Your role is considered medium flexibility, requiring you to work onsite 1-3 days per week at our office at 151 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON.
Reporting to the SVP, Chief Technology & Digital Officer the VP, Data Management & Business Intelligence is responsible for a unified, reliable, and timely source of data that supports consistent historical, operational, and predictive analytics across the Aviso. The VP, Data Management & Business Intelligence will lead efforts to structure data in a way that enables a single source of truth, ensuring data consistency, accuracy, and reliability. Additionally, this role will also implement a structure to support & service the data requirements of our business partners and to champion the further adoption of data analytics & data science.
Who you are:
Service  You consider both internal and external stakeholders and demonstrate intent of understanding and putting the clients needs first. You advocate service excellence and work to deliver solutions that meet the needs. You proactively develop strategic partnerships that allow Aviso Wealth to become a trusted advisor and partner
Execution  You are committed to achieving your goals and to succeed. This includes focusing on getting things done, as well as recognizing and taking advantage of opportunities as they arise. You are consistently looking for ways to improve your personal best and see value in continuous improvement. You take accountability for your actions and learn from mistakes
Collaboration  You work collaboratively with others with the common goal of driving positive results. Making meaningful contributions to your team to achieve organizational goals is a priority. You proactively encourage collaboration, build trust and inclusion, and work to establish effective relationships both inside and outside of the organization
Leadership  You lead your team and provide regular direction, guidance, coaching, and motivation, all while striving for peak performance. You assist them in overcoming obstacles through additional resources, removal of roadblocks, and providing the level of support required for their success. You delegate and deliver feedback based on the in-depth understanding of your individual team members
What your day looks like:
Develop a strong partnership with business stakeholders to assess current and develop future program strategy, while leveraging new technologies to meet business needs
Define a enterprise data management strategy encompassing a multi-year roadmap aligned to corporate objectives
Establish a structure & service model to effectively & seamlessly provide data reporting services to our business partners (internal & external)
Develop relationships with senior leadership stakeholders across the business to understand their opportunities & challenges
Proactively provide recommendations and solutions to business partners
Define and manage the analytical vision, priorities and strategy, and owning goals, outcomes and key results of the company working with other divisions and stakeholders for data engineering, data management, data governance, data integrations, and enterprise reporting
Drive the implementation of advanced analytics techniques, including machine learning and predictive modeling, to enhance customer insights and business predictions
Lead in-depth analysis of market trends, competitor performance, and consumer preferences to inform strategic decision-making
Identify tools needed to expand data literacy & proficiency
Provide oversight for data management projects, policies, and procedures
Recommend improvements to the process both in terms of data collection, data consumption and storage
Prioritize and execute business needs around data-driven insights
Build and manage data governance and change management processes to ensure compliance
Requirements
Your experience and skills:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred
10+ years experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or a similar role, with a proven track record of managing complex reporting initiatives
Experience with modern cloud data warehouse & data lake technologies (e.g. Microsoft Fabric, Google BigQuery, etc.).
10+ years of experience leading, designing, delivering with data architecture, data platforms, or analytics solutions
Strong understanding of data architecture, governance, data management & analytics principles
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and analytics platforms
Proven experience managing cloud data platform
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex data insights effectively
Experience in driving data governance initiatives and establishing data quality standards
Ability to create and manage strategy to communicate how data can be utilized to support overall business goals and objectives
Ability to collaborate with and influence executive leadership to create and market strategy to internal teams
Proven track record of leading and developing team members in breakthrough goals and strategy
Fluent communication skills in English are required and bilingual skills in French are an asset
Benefits
Why Aviso Wealth?
At Aviso Wealth, you will find a dynamic and inclusive culture that rewards innovation and celebrates success.
Here are a few things that set us apart:
Competitive compensation package that rewards and recognizes individual contributions
Excellent health, dental and insurance benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees
Generous vacation time, fitness benefit, parental leave top-up options
Matching contributions to our retirement program
Commitment to the continuous improvement of our staff through learning & development and an education assistance program
Regular social events to foster teamwork
Equal Employment Opportunity
Aviso Wealth welcomes and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including persons with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs in all stages of the hiring process.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
No recruiters or agencies, please.
Company Overview:
Aviso is a leading wealth management and investment services supplier for the Canadian financial industry, with over $120 billion in total assets under administration and management, and over 1,000 employees. Were building a technology-enabled, client-centric wealth management ecosystem. Our clients include our partners, advisors, and investors. Were a trusted partner for nearly all credit unions across Canada, in addition to a wide range of portfolio managers, investment dealers, insurance and trust companies, and introducing brokers. Our partners depend on Aviso for specific solutions that give them a competitive edge in a rapidly evolving, highly competitive industry. Our investment dealer and mutual fund dealer and our insurance services support thousands of investment advisors. Our asset manager, NEI Investments, specializes in investing responsibly. Our online brokerage, Qtrade Direct Investing, empowers self-directed investors, and our fully automated investing service, Qtrade Guided Portfolios, serves investors who prefer a hands-off approach. Aviso Correspondent Partners provides custodial and carrying broker services to a wide range of firms. We have offices in Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal, and Winnipeg. Aviso is backed by the collective strength of our owners: the credit union Centrals, Co-operators/CUMIS, and Desjardins. Were proud to power businesses that empower investors.
A career with Aviso means being part of a group of talented, energetic professionals who live their values every day, and belonging to an organization dedicated to your success and career development. If youre looking for interesting and challenging work, at a company committed to its people, apply to join our team.
Salary
This position is posted with an expected salary range of $155,000 - -$230,000 CAD annually. Individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to each candidate and the requirements of the position.

Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated to delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.
We are currently seeking competent individuals to fulfill the role of Business Analyst to join our dynamic team for our client, one of the major banks.

Other artefacts as determined by the project
Support to Development and Test teams in following areas (but are not limited to):
 Building and testing support to development team
 Reviewing test strategy, test plan and cases
 Management of defect logs
 Testing Applications
 Supporting end-user inquiries
 Defining the integration test plan
 Defining the user acceptance test plan
 Identification and resolution of problems/issues

Technical Skills - 40%
skills and experience in reverse engineering of cobol source codes
skills and experience with documenting interface guide and XML
Mainframe experience
Significant experience designing online user experiences for complex digital solutions.
Ability to deliver a product with a balanced team (product owner, user experience designers, developers) utilizing Agile (SCRUM) delivery methodologies. Scrum master experience is preferred.
Proficient with industry-standard design tools (e.g. Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Balsamiq, InVision).
Basic Knowledge of Microsoft Azure cloud platform
Knowledge of online collaboration tools such as MIRO, Atlassian Confluence, Trello, Microsoft Office 365, Google Drive, Zoom, Slack, and Microsoft Teams
Knowledge of Backlog Management tools such as JIRA, Azure DevOps, Pivotal Tracker
Experience in applying content layout and typography design principles and techniques for a mobile-first or responsive web design.
Familiar with how to design information architectures and taxonomies, and how they relate to navigational design elements.
Knowledge and experience in current web usability and accessibility standards (e.g.WCAG 2.0 WCAG 2.1 Level A & AA) and best practices.
Knowledge and experience in usability and user-experience principles, methodologies, and techniques, including interdependencies of user interface and navigation design, accessibility, information architecture, graphic design, and user-interface design.
Knowledge of Ontario digital government standards - refer to https://www.ontario.ca/page/digital-service-standard.
People Skills - 30%
Can work effectively independently and in a team environment.
Strong communication, interpersonal, collaboration, and negotiation skills to work seamlessly in an agile cross-functional team, with clients, solution delivery vendor(s), and other stakeholders.
Excellent facilitation, presentation, time management, and problem-solving skills.
Able to build strong and trusting relationships while liaising effectively with internal and external stakeholders and solution delivery vendor(s).
Strong leadership skills to provide advice and guidance on all aspects of user experience and design, assessing user characteristics, needs, goals, and opportunities.
Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills - 30%
Knowledgeable in design thinking, user-centric mindset, and attention to detail.
Creative, analytical approach and strong understanding of interaction design principles.
Able to resolve issues in a timely manner, and provide options and recommendations.
Thrive on feedback and comfortable transforming ideas generated through user research and analysis to create elegant, effective designs for diverse audiences.
Understand business metrics and able to translate business goals and objectives into digital experiences.
Able to prioritize change requests from clients and guide the team in determining how best to address them.
Strong research skills to perform industry research, provide options and make recommendations for solution improvements.
We thank all applicants for their interest and referral. However, only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
